christ one thousande one hundred sixe lanquet ancelme sayde bee cause cleargies diuorce theyr wiues aristotle sonne nicomachus phisition borne stragera greece consuming youth ryotouslye hee scholler noble plato twentye yeares continuallye hee excelled men sharpnesse wit knowledge diuers science wherefore king philip macedonia sent sonne alexander teach saieng hee thanked god hee hadde sonne borne time man began seete follower whereof called peripatetici hee taught athens platoes death foure twentie yeares hee bannished athens supposed hee deemed well theyr goddes written hee dyed occasion hee went sea side among fisherman tolde riddle long studye hee coulde assoyle shame sorrowe hee dyed hee lyttle personage crooke backed ill shapen stutting three hundred fortie fiue yeres christ incarnation auicen abicen famous phisition suppose citie spaine called hispalis ciuile hee excellently lerned wrote arabick tongue many noble workes philosophie naturall metaphisicke comprehended obtained fame proceeding farther became bishop caesarea taught people true fayth exiled valens emperour reuoked exile flourished yeare lord dyed yeare christ wer two ye name alley beda angliae famous lerned maneng modestie vertuous life learning surnamed worshipfull bede hee wrote historye saxon apart whose hystoricall methode diuers writer since haue followed flourished yeare lord lanquet william excellent historian writer historyes anno christ also titus liuius magnus hystoriographer time ouidius naso suppose excellentest writer flourished yeres christ lyued yeares buryed patauium dyed fourth yeere tiberius caesar patauium citie italy called padua pauie nigh vnto venice also citie bithinia nowe called polmen theophilus medicus de vrinis ptholome name many famous men whereof philadelphus learned christes incarnation virgil famous port mantua noble citie lumbardie virgil borne whome flourished horace ouid salust liuius hortensius antenodorus many others men happie time iesus christ needeth haue haue cunning knowledge thing hee apprehendeth shape liknesse intellectuall may moue vnderstanding witte wisedome inasmuch hee farre bondage earthly matter insomuch hee perfect practicus vseth contemplation called speculatiuus worketh called practicus roote man lyfe separated sunder one called vita actiua life working called vita contemplatiua lyfe contemplation reasonable soule euerlasting incorruptible may die wherefore principall act deede intelligere vnderstand dependaunt bodie liueth perfectlye vnderstandeth departed bodye yea drowneth selfe bodie slowly lesse perfectly vnderstandeth withdraweth bond liking flesh easilye cleerely vnderstandeth heere call drowning either imagination fantasie liking flesh loue worldly alluring wherefore gregorye saith man made middle betweene angelles beast lower angelles higher beastes hee hath somewhat accordeth highest somewhat agreeth lowest angell spirt hath maye die beastes hath bodie must dye therefore soule reason turneth toward god adorned illuminate amended made perfect tourne affection towarde creature made darke corrupte debased though soule selfe euerlasting deadlye yet passible must suffer bonde bodie ioyned therefore liber de anima spiritu austen sayth soules liue body loue sensible thing loue bodyly lykenesse formes passe body bodilye liknesse suffer bodily paine therefore may holde bodily paine heere cleansed corruption bodie heereby knowne though soule cleane pure owne kinde taketh vncleannesse flesh sish originally infected wine licour taketh infection vessel sustie therefore departed bodie beareth selfe body filth declaring life redemption lyfe penitent cleansed newly reuined vnto god grace gather thou heereof among creature reasonable soule presenteth openly lykenesse image god hath three manner might vertues though one simple kinde also containeth selfe lykenes thing therefore soule named lykenesse thing austen saith also soule made shall endure euermore bodie bodie ca saith shuld neuer sayde made image god wor closed within bond death also perfection kindly body lims therefore mor verelye maye make bodie perfect euery part also owne kinde maye kindlye determine lyking good euill truth lye also diuers vertues maye knowe lykenesse shape diuers thing present absent knoweth thing materiall present absent hir owne natural shape knoweth vnmaterial thing hir presence austen saith also reflection self aboue self knoweth selfe philosopher saith seeing vnderstanding knoweth hir selfe also table taketh kindly illumination impression diuers thing coueteth kindlye incorporated ioyned thereto desireth kindly felowship body kindly desireth good flyeth euill though choose euill want aduisement kinde forsaketh euill gr dgeth saint austen saith soule vegetatiue desireth beto sensible desireth welto vvell resonable soule desireth bestto best therefore resteth neuer till ioyned best place reasonable soule god warde moued may rest mouing changing place rather loue desire property soule rehearsed shall suffice vertues soule ca haue circumspectlye spoken property ye soule selfe hir body remaineth see treate vertues mightie vse working ye body vertue might soule essentially giuen worke doe hir deedes body vertue giueth ye body lyfe draweth togethers openeth heart organe small wayes bodye alway giueth body hath soule feelyng skilfull mouing con saith lib also vertue hath three part one called naturall lynerthe liuer called vitall spiritall hath place heartthe hart third called animal hath place ye braynthe braine beast plant ye working partes plant beast vertue maketh chaunging turning meanes ye foure first quality yt wit hothot coldecolde wetwet drydrye heate wet worketh ye softer substance flesh beast flower say tree hot drye working generation vertue ordeyneth distinguisheth forme shape thing gendred couenably ye part vertue pearceth shall pearced holloweth shalbe hollowed smotheth rough ouersmooth maketh rough shapeth beeing obedient stretcheth selfe euery whether vpward length strength heate beareth vpwarde sheddeth euen lifter pa te vp vpon length bodyes heate hath ry kindly generally higher longe nder bodye much circumstaunces equall heere running together slendernesse length apte much heat much humour much neither lyttle working ye heat couenably measurably body euery wayes great high long broad high heate beareth vp topwarde subtill part moysture broad thicke vertue heate sheddeth sad part moisture needeth euery side vniteth one part another moisture maketh kindly thing smooth softe moystnesse shed vtter part thing filleth voyde place thereof maketh euen plaine maketh smooth soft yet happeneth sometime maketh rough case hot humour cold fleeteth commeth together one place hot humor beare vp vttermost part ye thing colde humour beare downwarde vttermost partes contrarye humour worke contrariousnesse vneuennesse roughnes ye vtter part body also moysture body temperate needeth helpeth working soule body also humour spirites rule body bread conserued therein also vertues spirit worke effect lyms body sensitiue motiue ministration seruice humour appeareth vertue sight meane christiall humour worketh sight eye also vertue taaft beemeth neue betweene sauors meane humour spittle substauntiall moysture destroyed corrupted body working soule let body part thereof much moysture yt maye ruled kinde moysture cause matter rotting corruption breedeth body full euill passion sicknes seen apoplexra lass natural seelyng euill superfluitie moisture occupieth al chamber dennes braine spirit called spirites animalis maye passe sinewes feelyng make body feele moue taketh soule working body also taketh body feeling mouing bringeth last stiflyng death sayth galen galen telleth reason moysture heate winter arose much moystnes bred bodyes knitting fleame aire spring time colde drye beginning closeth small hole suffereth fumositie passe heate holden dissolneth bloud sodde distilled thereof may make fallowe greace perchaunce vnctuo ye thereof temperate seething crudded beeing white tourned tallowe faite also bloud altered course kinde corrupt goe stomacke nosethrilles also blouds rotteth anye member taken skill kinde tourneth venyine scaba hetherto speaketh constantine lib lib saith veynes vessells bloud thereof followeth bloud last meat beastes haue bloud also bloud friend nature beast hath bloud fedde thing accordeth bloud seene flyes wormes sit flesh sucke bloud take thereof feeding beast fed meate leane euill disposition fed therewith wareth good disposition effect foode meate bloud ye meate made clerre good body whole euill body sicke also default moystureas vvhen man great heate ouer much drink danteth povvers likevvise horse vvhose grease molte colde vvater suffocateth choked earthly bloud congea th hastely soone therefore euery beast yt hath subtill bloud cleane hot hath better wit beast cleane bloud subtill hot mouing according wit derstanding also beast yt hath bloud fearfull beast hath bloud therefore hee hath cleane bloud hot lyght little moued dread also yt bloud bull congealeth cruddeth itily ye bloud beast bloud beastes congealeth lesse except bloud hart hare beast lyke yt bloud congealeth aristotle saith lib se bloud bull cruddeth swiftly excesse heate drinesse bull bloud dronken rawe slayeth venyme sayd philosopher dranke ye bloud bull slew himselfethemistocles athens also aristotle li saith bloud hotter ye right side lefte side therfore strength hot bloud side right hand generally ready able cholar medled bloud soone knowen kind phisitions galen saith super aphorls also ther superfluous bloud ye body breedeth wonderful euills men except ye sooner voyded kinde phisicke fareth bloud called sanguis menstrualis bloud wome great moysture default heate holden beyond due time cause occasion full great griefes sickenesse sometime stiffeleth ye principall member sometime causeth dropsie sometime phrensie open disease corrupt bloud long held shut sent forth diuers place bodye plavnly contayned lib palsionarum galen therfore peril best remedy voyd corrupt bloud quickly meruayle bloud thus corrupted grieue bodye seeing also chaungeth wonderfully inserteth bodyesmestruall bloud poyson lib cap isidore saith touch bloud menstruall fruite groweth dryeth burnt hearbes dye tree loose fruite yron fret rust brasse mettall wareth blacke hound eate thereof ware mad thing called glutinum aspalti hard yt may delaide water fire yt bloud menstrualis touch glutinum aspalti falleth isidore saith bloud bred woman bodyes superfluitie moysture feeblenesse heate therefore shuld grieue kind gendred mother poumpe expulsed put due manner cleanseth caseth body mother disposeth maketh able conceiue therefore aristotle saith lib menstrum fine mensis mulieribus maxime viget et ideo tune vtiliter expellitur sanguis talis quia sicut dicit isid lib sanguis menstrualis non habet certam temporis reuolutionem sed maiore parte accedit diminutione lunae hoc est rectum quia corpus animaliu sunt tune temporis frigidiora alteratur sanguis efficitur ex eo superfluitas menstrualis quae si tune expellitur talis euacuatio laudabilis est naturalis quia si vitra tempus vel propter grossiciem sanguinis vel propter altitudinem matricis vel propter defectum expulsiue virtutis retincatur multis molestijs periculosis corpus mulieris aggrauatur quod quidem geueraliser est verum quarto decimo anno v que ad quinquagenum quia iuuenculis meatus sunt angusti virtu debilis quinquagelimo veroanno antea sanguis minoratur fi gescie calor destiuit tepescit vnde istae duae aetates talus immundicia sunt immune scilicet senectus vetularis iuuentus puellaris retmet ramen natura sanguinem menstrualem post mulierum impregnationem ad nutrimentum foetus conceptus conseruationem vnde arist li menstrum est fanguis non purus sed indiget digestione operatiua hic sanguis mixtus cum spermate cibus est animali vnde mulier post conceptionem frequenter patiens fluxum menstrualem solet facere abortiuum aut enim debiliatur foetus aut moritur hoc propter nutrimenti subtractionem vnde retentio sanguinis menstrualis signum est impregnationis ex iam dictum causa quod autem superfluit de sanguine menstruali detrahitur ad mammilla vt inde lac generatur materia enim lactis est sanguis decoctus mammillis vt dicit aristo lib lac inquit est sanguis digestus non corruptus item oportet vt fluxus sanguinis menstrualis actualiter sit corpore antequa muher impregnetur sicut dicit aristo li con sicut oportet arbore primo florere qua fructus facere item quodo venit talis fluxus naturaliter semper accidit aetate lunae aetati etiam mulieris conuenenti item aues animalia non patiuntur talem fluxum quia talis superfluitas transit plumas pilos vt dicit arist ite dicit ruffus mulieres nimis se exercentes sepius mouentes non multu menstruant sed quae quiescunt multu comedunt suauiter que viuunt tale multa purgatione indigent item quando sanguis talis vel frigidare vel crassirie os venarum constrinengte debito modo non exit ad exeundum alias vias querit vt vena nariu u emorroidarum quas si clausas inuenerit ad alia membra se diffundit grauem naturae infert passionem nam tale vt dicit viatico const defectum appetitus patiuntur nam cibaria bona abhorrent puluerem vero carbonum laterum appetunt similium nam sanguis retentus maliciosum fumuin terrestrem ponticum conuertitur quo rapto ad orificium stomachi appetitus rationalis subuertitur irrationalis generatur vnde omnia talia corpus sunt maximis morbis apparata pof fleame cap ihohannicus saith eame humour halfe sedde working vnperfect heate colde matter moyst kinde gendred aristotle lib saith fleame vndissolued superfluitie meate ye matter bloud fleame bee diuers seething lesse fleame made bloud stregth working heate returning bloud tourneth neuer fleame cholar chaungeth melancholy againward saith auicen fleme humour kindlye colde moyst wearish kinde sendeth humor member lymmes made pure body nourished humour defied note fleme vnkindly kindly kindly fleame colde moyst white color fleeting substance sauour somewhat sweete tast eyther wearish vnsauourie bred lyuer place heate apte tourned chaunged bloude chaunge full made body sustayned thereby though fleame selfe thicke vnsauery strength heate chaungeth yet taketh lyknesse sauour bloude sweete appeareth fleame called sweete fleame neerenesse lykenesse fleame hath bloud fleame needefull lymmes bodye therfore prouident kinde made fleame passe bloude veynes bodye neede profite constantine sayeth bloud fayleth heate dissolueth fleame taketh heede feede member lymmes thereby fleame nobler cholera melancholia may ruled breeding bloude benefite bloude lymmes bodye preuayle bee fedde also presence fleame needfull bloud yt feruour strength bloud may tempered fleeting fleame thicknes bloud may kept temper yt bloud may borne feeding member vnkindly fleames sower colde drye minglyng melancholy salte hot drye infection red cholera sweete meddlyng bloud glassie called lykenesse coulour glasse fleame far heat therefore thicker manner flemes bread red yeolow cholar two manner choler notable thirde manner cholera called prassiua virida greene colour bitter sharpe hearbe named marubium horehoud blacke archangel seagirdle blade faci porrus moysture thereof dryed draweth whitenes ashen colour moyst bodye heate breedeth first blacknesse moysture destroyed breedeth manner whitenesse fareth tree wood burning first turne coales ash colde contrariwise moyst body breedeth whitenesse drye body blacknesse last manner choler worse venemous venemous qualytie whereof breedeth body euill passion pestilence death herisipila noli tangere c kindly cholera passe ye bound kinde maketh humour subtill comforteth digestion cleanseth congealings corruption maketh body stretch length breadth thicknesse breedeth boldnes hardinesse mouing lyghtnesse stirreth wrath desire reuenge also prouoketh ye work venus helpeth vertue expulsiue cleereth thicke matter maketh mooue middle vtter part chaungeth vtter partes coulour citrine blacke cholaricke men generally wrathful hardie vnmeeke light vnstable vnmercifull body long slender leane colour brown haire black crispe hard stiffe touch hotte pulse strong swifte vryne thin substaunce subtill colour faire shining cleere cholar corrupt anye parte bodye breedeth euill passion bodye passion generall signes token constantine sayeth pantegni liber ca corrupt cholar haue masterie body skinne yeolowe either citrine also default vertue appetite bitternesse felt mouth sweete thing seeme bitter sauouey vnsauoury pricking burning stomack hot fume puncheth nippeth sinewes stomacke high colour sore head ach waking changing minde fearefull sight sleepe men dreame fire lyghtening dreadfull burning ayre caused fierye smoake chaungeth stronglye brayne vertue imaginatiue spoken cholar spice thereof sufficeth pof melancholy cap melancholy humour boystous thicke bred troubled congealyngs bloud hath name melon blacke calor humoure wherevpon called melancholia blacke humour phisitions cholera nigra blacke cholar coulour thereof declineth toward blacknes melancholy kindlye vnkindly kindly melancholy colde drye bred bloud lee wine substance wherof thicke earthy sauour therof betweene sweete ower brackish manner melancholy diuided two partes one abideth bloud setteleth therewith member neede helpe needeth meddeled bloude make bloude apte couenable feede melancholye member thickeneth bloude leete digestion cleernesse thinnesse second parte sent splene neede also helpe needeth cleansing bodie splene helpe flowe mouth stomacke make strong thicke make itch wake hunger desire feeding parte melanchloy superfluitie bloud passeth splene goeth splene needeth feeding splene redde cholera helpeth stomacke put superfluitie downward either inwarde melancholy helpeth vertue appetite aboue called dreg bloud verely cholera fleame soketh seperated bloud thicknesse vryne dregges yrour nothing sweeteth neither commeth fleame clamminesse thereof lykewise cholera substitie cleerenesse thereof therfore called dregges cholera neither fleame vnkindlye melancholy dreg groundes thing burning ash falleth meanes heat working ouermuch ye substaunce fleme burneth ouermuch burning turneth burned cholera humour first subtill watrye burnt made salte troubled thicke draweth sowrenesse ward bloud bee burnt tourned ash ash thereof salte lyttle sweetenesse kind melancholy burnt burning ash therof sower vineger fall vpon earth boyleth smel thereof heauie sower vineger ye flyes shun voyde horrible sauor thereof sowrest part thereof worst substaunce thereof bee boystous thicke melancholy burnt ash thereof lesse sower lyttle sharpnesse falleth vpon earth boyleth lesse grieueth member lesse malytious venem neyther ayeth soone first blacke cholera c e kind hath aptly euill deedlye analyti breedeth euills incurable canker lepry burning fleame bloud kinde melancholy vnkinde worst melancholy bread thing bloud bred fleame cholera bloud strong heate cholar melancholy burning infecteth kindly humour worst humour happely bread coa saith li pri ca humour hauing masterie bodye bee signes token first colour skinne chaungeth blacke bloo sower sauour sharpe carthye felt mouth qualytie humor patient faint fearfull heart without cause haue passion fearefull without cause oft sory melancholy humour yt constraineth closeth heart aske heauie folkes scare wherefore orye haue none aunswere suppose shoulde dye sodaine vyolence dread emnitie man loue desire death wherfore li passion galen saith wonder though suffer choleram nigram sorie haue suspition death nothing dredfull outward body darknesse obscure thing heleth brayne melancholy fleme patient must needes dread beareth cause shoulde dread therefore dreameth dredfull darke dreames ill see stinking san r bred passio melancholia also commeth madnesse disposition melancholy haue lyking laugh alway sorrowfull thing make sorow dolor ioyful thing also holde peace speake speake much ill also principally taketh bloud nourish humour cristalline maketh white able turne soone substance humour cristalline conuenient cleane pure humour receiue vnpure feeding doe ye red bloud defied whited made also humour albugineus thicknesse gathereth togethers comforteth spirit sight three part ye eie though called humour yet properly humor soft fleeting humour haue much thicknes themselues humour haue called tela aranea called subtilnesse therof may passable spirit bread commeth subtill part curtill called rethina curtil set betweene christalline humour albugineus keepeth fret togethers curtil tela aranea ioyned inner part rethina maketh ye first roundnes two curtills close humor christalline within followeth curtill called vuea grapie hath name like coulour blacke grape wise counsaile kinde haue spoke composition eie white cleere sheddeth spirit sight therefore needeth haue therwith curtill vuea grapy gather light ye eie blacknesse thereof blacknesse coulour gathereth sight also rume full hole spunge conteineth thrids sinewes consta tine saith cleanse purge humour christalline fro superfluous moisture curtell vuea grapie ioyned farther part head ye curtel secundina inner part sul like bright horne bright cleere ye spirit sight brightnes cleernesse thereof reason somewhat thicknesse therof helpeth somwhat spirit sight gather ye sight also strength therof sadnes defendeth inner curtells lesse strong vtter griefes curtell cornea hornie ioyned ye inner curtell called sclirotica hard maketh another roundnesse two curtells cornea vtter sclirotica inner conteine close within themselues rounde humour vitreus glassie last vtter part eye without set curtell coniunctiua commeth downe braine panne couereth eie remaineth corner eien bindeth holdeth abide due stedfastnesse disposition eies cha eie disposed perfectly bred spirit sight brought manner formost part ye braine come two hollowe sinewes called optici fixe themselues ye substance humor christalline two hollow sinewes bee pight ye eien come either ouerthwart either crosse wise ioined point maketh kind wisely yt one eie closed let spirit sight may come ther perfectly deede blacke eye art seeing comforted ioyning vertue sight fareth shooter close one eie shoote euen also spirit vitalis therefore ioyned together susteining may bee strong therefore also come meete together bounde touch one thing seeme twaine fall eyther eye sunder sawe owne image therefore needeth vertue sight conteined one limme one well vertue springeth ye black eie saith authour perspectiue fareth set theyr finger vnder eyen blacke one eye borne downewarde blacke eie vpwarde spirite sight departed dealed one thing seemeth twaine cause light commeth one eie vpward downwarde beame light yt commeth either eie touching vttermost part thing seene setteth space aire betweene seeth two body yet one neuerthelesse euery squint looker seeth though eies vneuen steepely beame passeth right line vttermost partes thing seene said afore ye third booke chapter sight well disposed eye considered touching perperfect composition part said afore also touching scituation challengeth highest place dignitie subtiltie namely neerenes hath soule sayth isidore aristotle also touching due proportion quantitie eie ought strained far neither lifted vp high betokneth disturbace discretio neither deep ye betokeneth default matter vertue ye mene worthy praised li aristotle saith deep sight seeth far moued lightned ere come ye lim light departed neither deled beame ye sight passeth forth right thing seene shewed sight also considered diuers mouings ought moue meanly ye eie much mouing betokeneth excesse heate betokeneth also vnstedfastnes thought mutablenesse affection moue slowly betokeneth contrary disposition excesse colde obstinatnesse thought meane mouing praised signifieth easie perceiuing minde thing perceiued due fastning therfore aristotle saith li closing eye must meanely swifte great opening little closing betokeneth shamefastnesse folly saith li opening slowly betokeneth default vertue compaction matter sinewes obedient ye working spiritaddition fareth yt haue lethargia forgetfulnesse impediment cometh colde rume ouer moistered impatience doth lie hinder part head braine pan also eies considered properly touching perfection working eie apprehendeth well lightly without againe smiting deemeth seeth betokeneth good disposition fareth eien egles speedely behold see sun roundnes working eie deemed considered sharp dim hath subtile sight seeth well far neere sight much seeth farre subtill hath full discerning thing seene eie litle sight aristotle saith li shall see well farre thicke spirit seeth much farre bignesse perfectly thicke little spirit subtil seeth nigh perfectly far scarcitie ye spirit sight seeth perfectly yt reason subtilty therof little sight thicke seeth far scarcitie therof seeth perfectly ye thicknes therof thicker troubled spirit yt man hath feebler vneasier sight also eye deemed chaunging colour li aristotle saith eien beginning breeding greene coulour chaunge black either yeolow either anye meane coulour seemely thereto ther much humour little spirit sight disturbed happe blacke coulour therein strengthened little humour feeble spirit sight coulour shalbe yeolow aristotle saith yeolownes eien mouing feeblenesse humour meane spirit te porate cause according whitenesse blacknes coulour diuerse ye eien black sharpe sight day reson gathering togethers light humour lim ye sight night dim sight light night feeble humour night kindly heauy mouing aristotle saith yeolow eie contrariwise feeble sight day strong night matter yeolownesse brighter selfe ioyned daye light darke therefore ye spirit sight light remaining feebled ye deede fight night spirit sight eie holpe cleerenes conteined within little humour day light passeth abideth eie vertue seeing deeming deale darknesse fareth cat also eie knowen disposition part eye lid browes eye lid yt helers couerers eyen full flesh within superfluitie humour hinder sight eye lid cause little mouing put thick aire liber primo aristotle sayth place teares followeth corner eie much fleshieof fleshie eye fareth eie kite signifieth wilynesse euill fortune seeke property eie treatise sight sayd composition ffectese dooings eyen sufficient time pthe blacke eie chap liber chap isidore sayth blacke eye wherein vertue sight called pupilla latine final image seene therein small child bee called pupilli blacke eye called cleane pure puella little maid childe phisitions say image see eyen bee seene eyen ye shal diea secret knovve sick shall die three dayes afore sayd image bee seene certeine token death blacke hath circle yt called corona ye corona blacke eye marked bounded white part eye departed therefrom corona roundnesse thereof highteth blacke eie corona yt fayrenesse eye hetherto speaketh isidore halye saith blacke eye glasse appeareth image thing seene eye eye reumes humoures eyther helpe serue blacke eye therefore sitteth middle queene blacke eye little quantity vertue among member therfore least taketh comprehendeth thing spirit commeth braine within taketh lykenesse receyueth without lyght light taketh selfe lykenesse thing seene sendeth perseueraunce soule partes thing seene line come togethers make pirami toppewise either shield wise steeple sharpe ende blacke eye broade ende thing seene shewed afore sight looke blacke eye perceiueth hath discouering coulours shape thinges vtter part hath lyking middle coulours figure shape lynes perspectiue expressed corrupt vttermost partes eyther least heauie faint contrariousnesse saith philosopher also seeth deemeth al thing without set afore neuer seeth selfe lynes vpon lykenesse thing seene commeth sight seeth selfe hapneth reflection rebounding beames likenesse thing seene first multiplyed reboundeth myrrour myrrour againe sight sayth authour perspectiue therefore peraduenture spirite sight hath lyking sight myrrour somwhat fortified strengthened tourned agayne selfe reflection rebounding beames also blacke eye comprehendeth thing corner whether lymmes passe blacke eye thing seene eyther come blacke eye thing seene alway ioyned middle center black ye eie wer corner corner wise yt corner touch meeting two line forsomuch lynes yt sight shapen ioyned cornered middle ye blacke eye therefore philosopher saith well properly eye se eth thing corner also among part bodye blacke eye soonest feeleth nobilytie preciousnesse complection thereof passible therefore soonest grieued hurte worst hardest daungerous healed therefore kinde hath giuen thereto curtills rimnes couerings defence may better put win without thing grieue property passion eyen blacke therof serch within special treatise li pof eye lyddes cap eye lyddes couerings eyen called latine cilium hath name celare couer hele couer eyen sauegard saith isidore lib cap eye lyddes substaunce nowie thinne easie mouing theyr continuall mouing put awaye aire keepe defende eyen without grieuing hurting aire eye lyddes called cilium latine palpebre also palpitando ofte feelyng moue alway close vnselye togethers feede busie mouing saith constantine isidore also eye lyddes warded kepte rowes hayre put anye thing fail chaunce come neere eyen eyen open sleepe quietly surelye eyen closed therein also meanly may cutting ayre quicken keepe saue sight cleere bright hetherto speake isidore cap sup constantine saith eye lyddes haue haire straight somewhat bent crooked kinde hath wisely ordayned make able stronger close themselues put mightely griefe hurt fall also growing eye lyds haue kinde certaine quantitie thereof haire spreadeth neither wareth heate head haue certaine poynted proportion therefore constantine sayth eye lyds soft neyther full poores rather harde hayre groweth thereon may hard somewhat crooked bend shoulde growe soone length hearbe yt groweth harde lande lyttle vpright hearbe yt groweth within softe lande kinde giueth eye liddes beautye bodye helpe eyen therefore libe aristotle sayth euerye beast gendereth onelye hath haire eye liddes euerye foure footed beast closeth eye ouer lidde bird steede eye lydde hath heler couer keepe sighta cotrary closing eye closeth ye eye web ordained therfore vttermost part eye kinde eye watrie moyst supercilia set aboue eye lid furnished much haire intent helpe eyen put humour sweate commeth downe head middle space betweene ye browes bare without haire named intercilium isidore saith lib browes spirite breath make perfect smellyng properlye speake instrument smellyng two holow fleshy peeces hang nosethrills scale receiue first themselues aire drawen sendeth inner part brayne teates vtter nosethrilles serue drawing aire closing within themselues making subtil lightlyer perfectlye changed likened lymmes smellyng sinewe commeth brayne entereth sayd teates nose giueth spirite feelyng ayre temperately cleanse pourge ye braine suiting place temper ye kinde heate dennes chamber braine also giue perseueraunce know smoke resolued dispearced substaunce whether smell sweetely stinke aire therefore beard needfull feature cheekes beard token vertue strength kindly heate ye cause man hath beard woman man kindly hot woman therefore man smoake matter haire increaseth woman kinde sufficeth wast smoke putteth driueth two place head beard therefore sometime woman hot moyst complection haue heards wise men colde drye complection haue lyttle beard therfore men gelded growe beard haue lost hot member breed hot humour smoake matter hayre followeth thicknesse beard signe token heate substantiall humour strength certaine assay know difference betweene men woman child grow beard though hot moyst superfluitie sumositie matter hayre passeth turneth waxing feeding child huc vsque constant aristotle sayth li ye haires bearde lyke haires head disposition thereof presenteth sheweth qualytie vapour fat humour gendred humour smokie hot drye haire well beard head shall crispe curled falleth passe two contrarye wayes earthie part moue toward neather partes heate moueth toward neather part haire curled crispie feeblenesse thereof happeneth scarcitie moysture multitude plentie earthy part great heate crispie curled vapour ful moyst hayre shall softe long humour runneth making slipperie till come haire therefore haire head beard dwell thracia thracia region europe vvhich standeth constantinople time called byzantium softe smoothe complection moyst arye dwell moyst contrariwise hapneth men haue drye brayne dwel hot region countreyes drynesse ayre dwell saith coulour hayre bearde chaungeth chaunging age therefore age beard wereth hore feeblenesse heat plentie colde sometime hayre beard falleth away withdrawing heate moysture f eth men gelded sometime corrupt humour fareth leper aristotle sayth fallyng haireas ye bay tree boxe holme others kind lyke fallyng leaues tree cause heereof withdrawing hot humour fat therefore leaues tree fat humour fall huc vsque arist lib pof iawes cap isidore sayth libro mandibulae iawesmandibula ae gingiua ae haue name mandibulae manducare cate iawes one ouer iawe ouer teeth fixed another neather iawe neather teeth rooted ouer iawe hath propertie euery beast stedfast moueth except crocodilecrocodile deformed beast bred aegipt comon riuer nilus moueth ouer iaw kinde beast holdeth neather iawe still moueth saith aristotle lib iawes made composed diuers hard bone bound knitte togethers diuers sinew string needefull centinuall mouing neede open close sayth const two milstones continually bruse grinde meate moue themselues thereto serue body meate iawes dypped heled fleshly perceils sinnewie called gingiue strength putting setting teeth depth iawes serue sinewes teeth foode slake ye coldnesse teeth isidore saith haue name gingiue gignendis dentibus gendring teeth teeth bred nourished yet made fasten teeth also needfull heale teeth ye teeth wer bare lothsome faire also beclypped ye skin lip doth kind shuld help ye teeth cheek within also defend outward griefes hapneth gummes corruptaluding themselues cut eyther let stopping shrinking else riuelyng wordes maye bee perfectlye pronounced also lyppes softe fleshie needfull temper hardnesse teeth teeth sinewes cold kinde bee much grieued ayre colde defended couering lyppes also vtter part lippes ruddye happeneth constantine sayeth subtiltie skinne lyppes casilye receiue deale ruddye qualytie sanguine beate therefore ruddinesse lyps token cleane pure complection without medling troubled bloud inner vertue contrary wise wannesse lyppes token defaulte vertue kindly heate also lyppes thinne substaunce plyaunt mouing able put cut ayre drawen darnly griue chilnesse inner part therefore lippes put themselues agaynst colde ayre pureth cleanseth maye sweeetelye profitablye bee drawen inwarde sayeth constantine aristotle liber ende sheweth lyke property saith man lyppes softe fleshie may seuered departed preseruation keping teeth equall pronounce word therefore lyppes haue trouble vse seruice tongue made taast moysture speake cap dentes dentes greeke called edentes cleauing diuiding commeth betweene sayth isid const saith teeth certaine manner plant sticked pight rootes more bone cheekes chin con saith man hath xxxii teeth sixteene set cheeke bone foure set formost part called pares pares quadrupli also teeth bee broad sharpe phisitions call forcutters able carue thing thing reteyne brus bite asunder two called camni set beside teeth named quadrupli quadrupli sharp endes able bruse grynde harde incates isidore saith called canini boundish lykenesse houndes teeth houndes sayd teeth gnaw bone stronger sharper longer rounder teeth called keruers therefore men call necke maide first teeth may kerue breake biting betake teeth ye stro ger bruse bite x either part ouer iawe set beside keruers broad great molares grinder apt grind meat thing bitten broke foreteeth mouth commeth betweene grinder saith isid ouer iawe xvi teeth foure called quadrupli pares keruers two called canini canini houndish x called molares molares grinder many set nether iawe chin touching number office teeth bee parted diuided foure manner keruers foure two aboue two beneth first seene pares foure two aboue two beneath set eyther side beside ye kerners touch called houndish foure two aboue two beneath striking called grinder xx ten aboue many beneth touch grinde alway milstones ye meate yt teeth began kerue bee pight rooted iawes somewhat forked twisted diuer slye formost called quadrupli pares foreteeth haue one little forke twist one roote canini grinder haue three forkes foure sayth constantine qualytie man woman common skil sheweth ye number teeth man hath mo teeth woman sayeth constantine isidore also teeth diuided knowen age aristotle lib saith teeth olde men beast generally black sharpe fareth hound whose age knowen teeth young hound haue white teeth sharpe olde contrarye generalitie aristotle exceptoth teeth horse ware white age also sayd needeth know beast many teeth ioyned togethers long life beast teeth set thin sunder short life also said euery foure footed beast getteth gendereth beast lyk selfe hath teeth also man foreteeth falleth youth cheeke teeth happeneth perchaunce cause feeblenesse forkes twist ye rootes contrary cause cheeke teeth fall soone generall beast fall anye tooth spring grow steede also aristotle li saith euery beast lacketh teeth ouer iawe drye earthie kinde euery beast hath teeth ye ouer saw lyke fatnes also li saith kind doth make thing best perfect therefore needeth yt matter carthie part draw beast toward ye ouer part turne teeth man haire feather beast bornes therefore beast horne maye haue teeth either iawe also li saith onely teeth among bone grow beast dureth knowen teeth ouergrowe leaning bowing side touche cause growing working grow bee soone wasted therefore teeth beast eate much haue great teeth soone brused wasted therefore kinde wisely gathereth ye teeth togethers age ende el lyfe dured thousand yeare alwaye shoulde grow teeth li saieth teeth growe within gum growe men woman twentie yere wise grow woman fortie yeares full fore ach also li sayeth sharpe teeth needefull bite first meate needeth bite rather grinde therefore growe sooner lesse lesse thing groweth heate sooner thing also heate milke maketh teeth grow soone therfore child sucke better milke haue teeth sooner also sayth foreteeth grow thin bone feeble therefore sayle soone hetherto speketh aristotle constantine saith viatico particula help teeth great helpe great hightinesse body vnderstand teeth fore sore teeth working corrupt passion teeth diuers part diuersitie openlye knowen sight chill rottennesse stinking breaking brusing hole mouldring fallyng watring part apparing hidde teeth ake sore yet seeme good case without cause aking humor come downe head eyther vp stomacke meane fumositie either el sharp humour beating gum sore ach felte leaping pricking mallyre sharpnesse humour ach come head head heauie aketh face commeth red bloud cholera commeth downe rootes teeth ach come stomacke aking paine felt stomacke ther goeth bursteth continuall belching also sometime teeth pearced hole sometime worm changed yelow colour greene blackal commeth corrupt euill humour come downe euill meates sinnewes string teeth also sometime teeth shake wag humour ye rootes teeth humdre sharp needes teeth shall haue hoales stinch matter shall breede iu wormes cause full sore ache bred eating pearce subtill sinew make teeth ake grieue sore fore humor within either without infecteth sinewes feelyng seemeth sometime sleepe great colde snow yce conserayneth sinewes teeth also sometime teeth fallout great moysture looseth striuges teeth sometime great drynesse tareth olde men whose teeth fall withdrawing moysture feeding constantine rehearseth many passion teeth shall suffice vnderstande teeth rooted sticked iawes preper ground soundation reson colde hauing masterie whiter bone hard easely hurte substaunce teeth eeleth haue powce feelyng sayth constantine therefore broken tooth aketh yet sayd tooth grieued aketh sinew feelyng roote thereof often hurt grieued teeth bound within sinewes teeth passe bound flesh feele sorenesse within themselues closed lrye scene vncomely seene except laughing ouer neather come ofte togethers touche though neather moue sometime ouer stedfast moue ordinatelye ordeinos speciallye shape voyce word speaking serue body tongue cap tongue called lingua latinlingua hath name lingere lyeke liketh meate tongue sounde speaking bindeth word weast te preth string tongue smiteth euery saith isidore tongue instrument taast speaking saith const made composed soft flesh full hoales lyke spounge sinnewie feelyng moouing ful hole sauyour may pearce come rasilyer sinnewes make taast ome many veynce full bloud therefore red colour worketh skinnes close space mouth oofe cue ouer side tongue seene nether side seene string ye fastened chinne rootes more tongue subtill sinewes laketh feelyng mouing spirites hid vnseene const saith tongue constrayned needeth insomuch maye moue diuers part therefore needeth string haue larger mouing space within mouth tongue subiect haue many passiers grieses substance therof sinewes c theet therefore viatico conssaith tongue beast seth quiet mouing vse speking cause therof commeth defalt mani ye braine stapping ye wire ye ye vertue feeling passeth somtime postume either vlains ye rise ye tongue somtime ye per default ye substance ye tongue euill coplection ye ye feeling st pered gret heat colde monsture drinesse postume wolting tongue grieuouslye swollon betokeneth encosse heate white betokecneth coldness soft betokeneth moysture drie rough betokeneth drinesse thing let vse tongue take away vse part therof tongue seemeth whole without wemme speach fayleth default commeth braine sinewes feeling stopped sometime loosing speach commeth loosing wit phrensie litargi madnesse forgetfulnes hitherto speaketh constantine viatico pantegni constantine assigneth default tongue hee sayth ryse broad blaines spread vtter skinne tongue faceth child suck euill milke blaines sometime white sometime blacke sometime happeneth postume tongue maketh greatly swollen passeth mouth postume called outlawing tongue called another postume tongue rana frogge bread frogge vnder tongue taketh awaye benimmeth vsage tongue called dumbe frogge effect deed also postume tongue full bloud whereby tongue greeued speath tast le gleamie humour haue maistery ye tongue ye sence tast corrupted chaunged sweet thing seeme bitter wearis e contrariwise sayth galen also galen sayth sometime happeneth tongue stuffeth flamereth much moisture stringes tongue may stretch spread utter part thereof much moysture fareth dronken men stamer bee soe much moisture braine therefore galen sayth kindlye stamering men much moisture braine else much moisting tongue also superfluitie moysture cause men maye readilye pronounce letter sometime sowne c l fareth child spel corrupt many letter cannot pronounce sayth galen er aphoris lpod ratteling men moyste much moysture men cause ratteling commeth stomacke maketh oft bowells slipper breedeth diarrian diarrian dialym flire wombe sayth galen also paotegi constantine saith side stringes tongue veines serue tongue spittle veines spring beginning tongue veines come flumatike moysture called spittle phisitions call veines spittle hour spittle beginning tongue wherof veines come spring white kirnell flesh breedeth spittle moysteth tongue tempereth drinesse mea intreaseth iuyce thereof shall bee sayd aristotle b saith sheep haue white vaines vnder ye tongue haue white lambes haue blacke vaines haue black lambes galyer briefly said tongue substance bloudie holow receiueth influence spirit hot moist complection slender euerlong disposition shapen swoorde formost part redde coulour set holow moist place moue easily fore speach voice know sauiours moist month emission spittle tell mouing thoughtes one instrument many kinde hath giuen man instrument according vertues hand bee many finger diuerse maye thereby holde small thing great saith making hande proporcionable many workes contrary working diuided straighted many part man may vse one part alone two mo diuerse manner palme man hande hath propertie yt neuer heary within though haire growe without handes doth chaunce handes male plentie bread commeth great humour rawe gathered ioynts therefore ioynts toe finger waxe hard made wer knotty sickness bee called longa artherica bred hand scarcely cured healed hath long indured sayde super neuer sawe neyther heard woman commeth default kinde except shee strong worke right hand much maye lesse lefte hand male haue strong sinewes brawnes either side haue stronger heat woman cause happeneth oft worke left hand right hand also pof finger chap digitus finger called digiti latine either haue name decem number tenne english tenne word decem english seemely seemely set ioyned haue among themselues number order right faire saith isidore first called pol ex thombe among hee hath vertue might second called index salutans called demonstratiuus shewer greet shew teach thing third middle finger called impudicus alsoin amis digitus called fooles finger fourth called annularis ring finger thereon ring borne also called medicus medicinalis leech doe colerium eye colerium principall medicine ye eie fift little finger called auricularis finger clawe picke eares saith isidore constantine sayth finger bee composed made euerye three bone cheined togethers foure finger cheined bounde sayde combe hande thombe ioyned inner cheining arme neather peeces knobbes finger greater broader ouer bearer stronger thing borne ought broader stedfast saith con li aristo saith moueablenes finger conuenient take hold finger proportioned slendernesse length departed sunder end warded nailes euen bending pliant couenable able diuerse work little fleshie casinesse moouing touching groping nothing bodie knoweth deemeth easily betweene thing bee touched felt end finger may hap quicke liuelinesse sinewes bend againe ouermost part finger softnesse smoothnesse skin vttermost part finger sayth constantine finger haue propertyes greater afore meate therefore ring straight finger may scarce bee taken afore meate may easily bee taken meate sayd super aphoris aristotle sayth liber water soules haue betweene theyr toe clawes skinne dwelling water foules toe clawes diuided cloaue footed dwell properlye nigh water bee fed meat groweth land foules eate fish neither liue rauine doe foules crooked toe clawes eat beast yt may hunt take liue bloud yet eat spare foules owne kind fish eate fish owne kind naile chap vuguisthe naile vttermost part finger set ouermost part thereof constantine sayth ioyned verye nighe thereto flesh skinne bound thereof bee full string nailes come vaines sinewes artery giue feeling kindly helpe nailes grow length breadth proportionate finger groweth ouer passeth touch sinewes hath feeling therefore bee cut pared without feeling sore smarting growing feeding naile like growing haire therefore growing passe endes finger sayth constantine naile bread certeine fumosities resolued heart spread finger end ye fumosities entering dried vtter aire chaunged substaunce naile sayde booke pronosticis comment bee made helpe succour finger end defend saue hardnesse else tendernesse lightly hurt grieued nailes help strengthen much ye finger naile softer boane harder flesh gristell hath deale disposition kinde horne cleere plaine vtter part thereof cleane bright horne therin seene maner brightnesse shape naile bred fumositie hart liuing dieng heart nailes openly shewed heat heart faileth nailes waxe blacke pale therefore chaunging shrinking riueling bodeth betokeneth quenching heate dieng slaieng kinde said pronosticis also aristotle li saith clawes egles waxe crooked dull sit broode vpon egges feedeth bird wing waxe white feeble egle hath propertie sitteth tree resteth beholdeth oft clawes dreadeth least waxe soft tender hath clawes steed wepons therefore least clawes hurt grieued setleth gladly vppon stone whe resteth bendeth closeth clawes yt may kept saued without harme griefe doth lion beast crooked claw also li saith ye whole footed foules drinke except fewe al foules yt haue crooked claw haue crooked bill short great neck eate flesh hunt bird eate bird owne kinde neyther pursueth neither praieth intent eate fight togethers hurt one another bill clawes teare female neasts beast foules diuerse manner clawes nailes touching disposition also dooing man nailes ence adorne hand foules bird fence arm feete beast nailes houes round whole horse long clouen swine li aristotle saith euerye beast hauing stiffe standing haire hath clouen feete swine kind setteth strength clawes nailes beast therfore li ar saith kind alway setteth strength lims member beastes vse feeth yron clawes nailes strength help side chap side called latus latine hath name latere latus lurke either hid man lyeth side hidde left side right side bodye called latine dextra sinistra ye right side able mouing left side strong couenable ye burthes charge therfore ye left side called leua latine hath ye name leuare heaue lyfte able lyfte beare thing sayth isidore side beareth shield buckler sword quiuer knife burthen right hande maye bee ready lybertie doe shall sayth isidore side speciallye strengthened bone ribbes ribbes called costa isidore saith ribbes keepe inner part body softenesse tendernes belly wisely kept saued office ye rib side ribbes made compounded many bone ioyned bound bone ioyntes ridge bone diuers gristle ioyne foresayd bone together sayeth constantine boanes haue lykenesse halfe circle ioyned togethers ioyntes ridge bone brest boane seeme make full circle saith constantine boanes fourteene saith set either side seuen seuen one side seuen bound togethers closure breast seuen tender boanes gristly kinde endes tender gristlye shapen poynt sword set vnder mouth stomacke defence thereof heart making composition ribbes breast two thirtie bone fourteen side composition brest ten behind ridge eight gristle boanes togethers sayth constantine happeneth side ofte griued somtime cause without fallyng breaking smiting sometime cause within fleeting concourse comming togethers humour place hollownesse small rib somtime postume bred therin fareth plurisie bred commeth postume ye tendernesse rybbes token therof ache side cough febris acuta speciallye knowen bloudie spittle come bloud citrinesse yeolow come cholera white spittle come fleme bloo spittle come melancholia breedeth selde melancholia contayned practica postumes rooted pight side cause sore ach stiffeling burning hath euill may rest vpon side postume therefore said pronosticis good signe sicke man febribus acutis lye side specially right side betokeneth nigh place haue postume spirituall member free haue large place open spred man breatheth better neither stomacke member grieueth neither thirsteth spirituall member also happeneth vnder small rib voyde place winde gathered closed within small skinnes rib stretching thereof bred sore pricking ache sometime happeneth place stopped made hard gathering great humour side place ha ed rent eyther made harde either shrunke eyther much heaued vp therefore sayde pronosticis hippocratis small rib without ache sore softe well compounded euery side good ake haue crampe drawen togethers fareth crampe onely great quaking leaping anye betokeneth woe sorrowe either rauing c pand speciall token febribus acutis specially sight eyen bee horrible staring inordinate sayeth commentatour mouing eyen bee ordynate great dreade rauing acutis vt dicit idem pof backe chap ridge called dorsum latinedorsum hath name hardenesse hardest part body stone strong beare suffer durable saith isidore ridge hath another name called backe therevpon lye backeward vpright earth may man doe beastes beast lye wombe eyther side therefore vnproperly sayd yt beast haue backes saith isidore maye called backe beating bearing beaten diuers manner whip onely backes beastes also back men prisoner saith remigius saith word tergum maye said teros greeke round latine ridge beast hath manner roundnesse bone body founded ridge ship keele constantine saith isidore also ye ridge beginneth nape head stretcheth neere kidneyes ridge made compounded diuers bone ioynts foure cause first foundation thereon bone set shippe keele second ye defence healyng inner partes third help succour sinewes come brain downward diuers part body giue qu k mouing feeling euery part fourth beare marrow commeth braine keep marrowe saue griefes within power ridge boane beast made compounded many bone may easilyer rise settle vp themselues bende beare strongly charge burthen ridge boanes called spondilia latine hollow marrowe ridge bone phisitions call nucha may easilyer borne come neather member make quicke mouing kinde vertue well braine marrowe ridge bone saith constantine therefore cloathed double skinne braine saith therefore marrowe ridge bone bee anye wise let either hurte vertue feeling hurt working braine hurt therefore marrowe hurt beast dyeth lightly therefore kinde maketh ridge bone hard sinewy also picked sharpe defence marrowe easie withstanding putting hurting wrong skinne ridge harder thicker skin part beast cause aforesayd ridge suffereth many griefes within without without beaten hath many griefes within suffereth shrinking sinewes much replection humour stopping veynes gate spirites sore pricking putting stopping griefes diuers goutes dropsy pof breast cap breast ouer bonie parte betweene paypes teates called pectus pectus next strength beast hath pap breast men elephant saith aristotle lib beastes haue pappes side wombe swine hound ass bine sheepe beast hath pappes wombe bringeth forth manye moe time fareth houndes swine haue teates breast fareth woman elephant gendreth neuer one saith lib fowles haue generally sharpe breastes namelye fowles praye crooked billes sharpe clawes little flesh good flight sharpe sight see decoction ye heate heart bloud maye easelyer turned kinde milke bloud commeth hollow veyne heart breast pearceth last commeth pappes hollow flesh pap bloud vertue heate tourneth substaunce hinde milke sayth right pappe woman goeth two childrena note vntimely birth wareth tender soft man childe shalbe borne time lefte pappe waxe soft female shall borne hir time pappes grow tender softe child shall borne afore time commento galen telleth cause heereof sayeth smalnesse pappe betokeneth scarsitie milke therefore childe hath due feeding hee must need dead born time also hippocrates saith ther woman superfluitie hot bloud turneth pappes betokeneth madnesse galen telleth cause thereof sayth superfluitie seruent hot bloud commeth pappes may turned milk passing great heate abundaunce therof dispearced turned sharpe smoke goeth vp head troubleth brayne breedeth madnesse also saith thou wilt make bloud menstruum woman lesse thou shalt set coppe ye papcopping boxing ye veyns come ye mother called regulas whose blowing corrupteth aire slaieth bird eng au cen constantine say pof stomacke cap stomachus stomacke doore wombe taketh meat drinke sendeth gut sayth isidore constantine saith stomacke round euenlong hollowe within rough bottome manifolde fleshly hath two mouthes one aboue another beneath rough manyfolde holde better meate taketh slipper smooth within slidernesse thereof meate passe without digesting fleshie botome comfort digestion flesh stomacke hotte also moyst ventriculus quality digestion specially strengthened bodie beast round able take receiue meate stomacke another shape three cornerd uill humour therein shuld easily gathered corruption rotting shape might corner dryed cleansed superfluity euenlong yt presse thrust spiritual member great roundnesse therof also may easilye ioyned ouer neather part stomacke specially man straight ouer part wide broad neather parte also needfull sith man goeth vpright beast meate goeth downward alway therefore neather breath widenesse stomacke profitable take therein meate drinke also sinewie haue subtilnesse feeling vertue strength appetite also compassed yt liuer haue liuer heat conco digest meat drinke liuer fiue pipe beclippeth stomacke giueth heat taketh inyee grease humour whereof bloud bred certeine veines yt phisitions call mise acas turneth grease attractiue nutritiue con ormatiue drawing nourishing comforting bloud iu humour bloud strong working heate constantine saith stomacke substauntially hot digesteth well great grose chawed meates wasteth liking meates digesteth soone likenesse desireth hotte meate may suffer hunger ye stomack cold defieth wel great meat soone grieued therwith chaungeth sowre corrupt humour dry stomack soone thirst little water sufficeth thereto water much maketh roring rolling wombe stomacke moist thirsteth desireth moist meat desireth litle hue vsque con li ca saith li cha stomack chaunce diuerse griefes euill digestio fumosities flure spuing yering blowing swelling belking come diuers cause somtime chance euill complection somtime much emptines somtime much repletion meate drinke somtime great sharpnesse biting humour somtime putrifaction heart sometime default vertue digestiue sometime qualitie ye meate punch pricke stomacke tormented pricked compelleth passe else bo gleamie stomack made slipper meate passeth easily sometime griefe stomack commeth feeblenesse vertue outputting griefe stomack commeth onely selfeeither vomiting laske also company meanes member stomacke purueiout husband body stomacke taketh feeding member serueth member therof needeth sayth constantine pipe called gula addition interiour colli fistula inner pipe conduct necke commeth fro neck stomack conueied meate drinke mouth sent stomacke vpper parte stomacke called o stomachi pof liuer cap aepar lecur eparthe liuer called epar latine lecur also hath name fire hath place therin passeth vp speedely braine commeth thence eden wittes lyins ye luler heat draweth inward sweat iuyce turneth bloud serueth bodie member therewith vse feeding called epar feedeth member lyuer place voluptuousnesse lyking fleshin temple pagan gentile lyuer sacrificed read chronicle doome endes lyuer called fibre strayght passing tougs beclyppeth stomacke giueth heate digestion meate called fibre igromancers brought altar god phoebus offered aunsweres huc vsque isidorus constantine sayth syuer member hot hollow slender set right side beast vnder stomacke helpe first digestion heate also hee loudy e colour vnpour thereof turned humour blo full great heat drale hard soone uf grieued liuer diuers men neilie parte men greater beast quantisie number part thereof double least treble quatreble ye quintreble broad hollownesse lyuer commeth veyne phisitions call porta veyne come outvena porte departed fiue small veynes entring part lyuer lyuer draweth hollownesse vapour first digestion certaine veynes boylyng kinde heate doth make digestion secondly tourneth bloudie lumpe kinde foure humor hot moyst passeth kinde bloud receiued kept veynes hot drye passeth ye kind cholera receiued properly skibbet gall cold drye passeth kind melancholy proper receit ye skibbet splene floting ratrie passeth fleame receiuer thereof king heereof followeth lyuer chiefe foundation kindly vertue gretest helper first digestion stomacke lyuer maketh perfectly second digestion stomacke hollownesse owne substaiunce departeth cleane pured vncleane vnpured sendeth feeding member excited loue bodelye lust receiueth diuers passion lyuer grieued sometime great seruent ioynts thighes stocke body therefore fleshie temper coldnesse sinewes bone defend feelyng sinewes saith constantine lib decay buttockes addition vnconstant dyet much lechetie cold sitting pof thighes cap thighes called femur latinefemora place bodye distinction difference betweene male female thigh stretch flanke chest buttockes downe knee thighes moue ioynts hollow part sayd ioynts called vertebra latine coxa ioyned axell tree thigh bend inward outward vnder aboue armes doe therefore men call suffragines saith isidore thighes made composed great bone saith constantine li hollow aboue bending afore haue two sharpness greatnesse needfull either foundation bone el beare ye great brawnes sinewes feete plyably moued also crookednesse bending vtter part needefull brawnes sinewes may haue place within shuld hurt grieued also two bone deale rounde inner side needfull crooked onely one side body crooked vneuen also hollownesse needfull inner bending roundnes peyses thereof may stedfast hollownes needfull haue entering hollownes ye leg also ye thigh couered warded flesh brawnes bone may haue helpe succour outward hurt griefes also temper coldnesse bone aboue small beneath saith footed beastes haue feete afore behinde haue side beast bloud many feete propertie kinde beast haue feete former part bodye cause thereof former hinder ioyned houed one place also ibidem saith foure footed beast kinde hath set fore feete steede handes hinder feete necessary beare wayght beast much necessary foure footed beast shuld haue foure feete body boweth kindly toward earth also moued earth beastly appetite therefore needeth haue many vndersettings vpholders beast may ably quickly moue goe stampe also therefore hinder feete needefull arist saith fore part foure footed beast large hinder part therefore rise vp moue themselues moue lyghtlye behinde hinder feete needfull contrary child ouer part child heauyer nether therfore creepe feete handes vse hand steede foure feete creeping may reare vp body ye ouer part ye body nether changeth yet youth yet youth nether part wareth ouer part wareth lesse nether part body lyttle little reareth himselfe vp end disposition foure footed beast contrary nether part first great youth ouer parte wareth areareth therefore rearing vp head foreparte horse much hinder part said token signe heereof colte toucheth owne head hinder foote commeth age cannot doe also arist li saith lesse foote beast fore parte free neither lyght mouing left hand man except elephant also sayde elephant sitting bendeth boosteth feete may bend foure feete heauinesse wayght body foldeth bendeth hinder feete man doth also sayd volatile bendeth ye hinder feete backwarde wing forward steed handes flieng thing also ther sayd ye generally beast right foot moueth left therefore sayde beastes moue first right foote shall goe step lyon camell dromedarie yet somtime beast moue first left foote fore woolfe haue feete leg longer left side therefore halt alway reare rise vpward left side toward right side also generally beastes right foote hath heate mouing strength lefte foote super aphorism galen sayth taken heereof woman goeth childe stande vpright knottie filleth occupyeth voyde place succoureth deines sinewes receiue superfluitye woseth thirde parte flesh beclippeth stomacke guttes parte medled certaine ne te cause sinewes veines wosen bring haue tallowe tallow congealeth anone taken bodye set colde ayre pinguedo adeps aruina bee one touching theyr substaunce isidore saith aruina fatnesse cleaueth skinne adeps fatnesse beclippeth guttes body beclippeth flesh bone couereth defendeth inner part stretched drawen together diuerse need body axeth also defence inner part body skinne putteth sefe forth diuerse griefes aire skinne hath kindly thinnesse sayth constantine shuld occupy body ouer measure skinne sad conteine easily part bee within also lette withstand vtter griefes men skinne nesher softer beast haue good touch feeling skinne harde thicke shell fish feele thing rough hairye skinne asse feeble appaire witte feeling groping therefore palme hand vtter skinne softer partes body rather chaunged touching skin full poores life wife without departing paye hir debt keepe loue hir afore man hath great loue wife hir sake aduentereth himselfe perills setteth hir loue afore mother loue dwelleth wife forsaketh father mother saith god man shall forsake father mother abide wifemat afore wedding yt spouse thinketh winne loue hir hee w eth giftes certofieth letter messenger diuers present giueth manye gift much good cattell promiseth much please hir putteth diuers playes game among gathering men vseth ofte deedes armes might masterie maketh gaye seemely diuers clothing araye prayed giue doe hir loue giueth doth anone might denieth petition made hir name hir loue speaketh hir pleasantly beholdeth hir cheere face pleasing glad cheere sharpe eye last alienteth hir telleth openly presence hir friendes spenseth hir ring taketh hir wife giueth hir giftes token contract wedding maketh hir charter deedes graunts gift maketh reuells feast spowsailes giueth many good giftes friend guestes comforteth gladdeth guest song pipe minstralsie musicke afterward done bringeth hir priuities chamber maketh hir fellow bed boord maketh hir lady money house meynie lesse diligent carefull hir himselfe specially louingly aduiseth hir doe amisse taketh good heed keepe hir well taketh heede hir bearing going hir speaking looking hir passing againe comming home man hath wealth hath good woman wife man hath wo hath euill parent ought rather wish awaye receiuing good little esteeming theyr person purchase highly vengeaunce god fareth fowles rauenous kind aristotle saith fowles young feede olde maye age get owne meate punished paine childhoode seruauntes bee bee called empticij taken straungers alien enimies bee bought solde held lowe vnder yoake thraldome third manner seruaunts bee bounde freelye theyr owne good moisture drinke constantine saith auicen also ther three manner diuersities drink drinke onely drinke water ye nourisheth bodie drinke drinke meat wine constantine saith beareth meate nourishing partes bodye nourisheth beateth spirit bloud comforteth kinde heate drinke medicinable taken manner waye drinke lawe rule medicine sireppes drimell decisakara constantine sayth keepe healthe heale sicknesse water needfull therefore needeth phisition bee negligent knowe condition kindes water hee may take good water beware euill water water fauourie vnsauourye sauourye water cleere substance well springeth eastwarde lyght soone hot soone colde water constantine sayth good keepe heale grieuing commeth soone meate reason cleere cleane meddeled filth hoare reason lyght easie defie soone hot soone colde subtile substaunce thou wilt knowe two water whether subtill substance better drinke wet thou linnen cloth one water another cleane linnen cloth hang drye sunne two clothes wareth soonest drye water wet subtill water next unto wholsomenesse water springeth northward set betweene east north reson springeth northward open vppon north windes tossed made subtile winter kindly hot summer cold northerne colde driueth heate inner partes fountaines lye open heate gathered within standeth colde heateth denie water ye well contrary sumer heat aire ouercometh cold driueth head well colde gathered ioyned cooleth water sayth machrobius constantine also water springeth runneth strongly swiftly mountaines vppon cleere stone grauell hath second degree wholesomnesse water great riuers saith constantine constantine saith raine water better water sauourye light cleane ipocras saith raine smoake water sonne draweth vpward kind sun draw vpward subtill therfore raine water better water defied subtiltie thereof soone putrifie yet constantine saith blamed rottennesse worthye praising subtiltie cleerenesse thereof water soone corrupt subtill grieueth rotted breedeth hoaresnesse feauers best bee rotted therefore needeth well ware rotting also constantine saith water gathered smallest rain seemeth best raine water falleth thunder best thunder mouing maketh smoake thereof cleere subtill also constantine saith drinketh oft colde water shall escape colde sicknesse namely age constantine sayth hot water washeth ye fasting stomacke purgeth cleanseth drasts meate sleme rottennesse cleanseth laxeth purgeth wombe releeueth comforteth kind oft vsed noieth grieueth softeneth stomack distroubleth letteth vertue digestion maketh bloud runne nosethrills also hotte water best fasting early namely bee onke ouer night auicen sayth olde wise men witnesse sodden water maketh small swelling peareeth entreth bodyes bee medled therewith bee dissolued departed working fire bee compelled goe downward heereto hee sayth corrupt phisitions suppose subtill breatheth passeth vpward seething great thicke subtill abideth still false substaunce water made one manner part great seething might bee nothing abide drasts alone earthly partes faceth water salt made strong seething water molten snowe haile earthlye worst except water lake marreys beware water constantine saith make spleane greate hurt humour stomacke make skinne foule vnseemely breede diuers feauers stone may bee esthewed authoritie auicen may boiled sodde librro met aristotle saith water snow molten heat commeth againe first cleernesse subtiltie foure manner water vnsauorie constantine saith salt smoketh brimstone slime mettall men saye salt water biteth fretteth guttes taxeth maketh soft wombe salt water oft dronken wasteth humour bindeth maketh wombe harde drieth bodye maketh whole scabbes itching helpeth haue dropsie bee eate dronke brimstone water doth cause colde euills heateth sinewes wasteth humour betweene skinne flesh looke afterward ye shall plainly vnderstand vertue brimstone slunye water glowie cooleth drieth stencheth running bloud bealeth emoroydes mettally water followeth booing kind mortall water passeth beuis yron stoppeth hardneth wombe comforteth member vnstoppeth splene helpeth postumes water metall brasse helpeth moisture straineth stranguria hath disease euill called stranguria pisseth oft little water mettall siluer cooleth drieth manner water much vsed freed drink helpeth onely ye vse medicine drinke meate drinke wine ehere diuersitie wine touching substaunce wine greater harder nourishing wine subtill lyttle nourishing passeth soone stomacke withdraweth cholarik head ach maketh one pisse fast wine meane temporate working without consideration wine touching substance constantine saith men shall take heede wine soure manner diuersitye time liking smell sweete sauour cleerenesse coulour time wine diuerse wine ye new wrong pressed passeth first degree heate libro de simplics medicina galen sayth wine made foure substaunces watrye airye firye earthlye longetin wa trye parte consumed wasted airye parte comforted dide wine better better also malteth harde wombe griueth breast purtenance sower bitter lesse hot wine also colour hiew heate wine diuers white lesse hot citrine hot pearceth member constantine saith breedeth cholarike bloud stomack humour bread member smoke therof commeth vnto braine thicknesse smoake wayes spirit feeling stopped thereof commeth falling euill constantine sayth disease commeth certeine time therefore galen sayth yt epilencia commeth ye wering moone betokeneth kinde thereof moyst thing moyst increaseth moone wexeth kind euill commeth waning moone colde deale moyst bee three kindes epilenci three manner place one manner euill kinde called epilepsia head commeth matter onely braine another called analepsia commeth matter stomacke hollownesse sinewes artery stomack meane boiling matter rauished braine thirde called catalepsis commeth matter vttermost partes hand eet knowne owne signes token haue bee possessed euill catalepsis feele knowe euill commeth feele manner grudging noyeng amptes dye constantine calleth head quaking iactitatio head quaking commeth default feeblenesse vertue regitiue sinewes necke bone brawnes member euill bee two contrarye moouings one vpwarde another downeward kinde worketh ouer disease neather euil laboureth beare downe member lower kinde hath forsaken gouernance meber laboureth rule set owne steed kind laboureth reare vp member therefore quaking cometh contrary moouing cause beginning default vertue ye moueth brawnes saith constantine somtime vertue faileth euill complection accidentes soule dread gathering spirit heart therefore member drawe downeward weight heauinesse kinde hath suffisaunt spirites comming togrihees rule member may act full holde member steadfastly theyr owne place therfore followeth quaking anone quaking manner disposition palsie namely sleeping follows quaking cause whereof coldnesse running hardening substaunce sinewes vertue feeling maye thir passe therby euery palsie quaking easie healepearse palsie commeth full sore ach vtter partes limme shall ake full sore shrinking commeth abstinence hath token sometime commeth passing running bloud wombe mother sometime trauaile abstinence ouer might trauayleth absteineth sometime passing heate man body hath sharpe ague sometime deepenesse ach wound sharpnesse strength medicine taken crampe commeth greate drinesse kinde wasting substantiall moysture therefore sinew shrinketh riueleth parchment put fire therefore waye spirites sinewes stopped vertue lyfe ruling let crampes deadly endure therefore said apho cramp cholarik mortall beginning hot woman milke helpeth cramy done hot thereto bee shed vpon brawn cheek vpon ridge bone necke root sinewes also water wooll oyle bound vppon place sinewes helpeth third manner crampe commeth repletion falleth oft fat men fleshlycorpole wel fed gorrells commeth shedding spreading sinewes easily holp holpe hot ointment bath sneesing laratiues constantine tracheth feauers come vpon shrinking best remedie therefore sayd aphor feauers comming vpon crampe helpeth euill cramp hath three manner lund one called epitestanus hinder sinewes shrinke haue crampe called eprocustenus sinewes toward brest shrink third called cethanus farther hinder shrinke three kindes crampes perfect cure come abstinence sayde addition foure kindes spasmos cramp first named emprosthotonos whe head drawne downward breast second named thetanos forhead whole body drawen vehemently body vnmoueable third named opisthotonos head drawn backward mouth drawne towarde eare fourth kind named spasmos doth drawe sinewes verye streight asperusly feete legges palsis chap paralisia dislolutiopalsie hurting parte man bodye minishing priuation moouing feeling commeth sometime colde constraining sometime humour stopping sometime heate wasting ruling sinewes feeling somtime wounde cutting departing sinewes cause spirite feeling cannot haue passing instrumentes feeling moouing sinewes feeling moouing bee stopped full cutte member l seth feeling mouing stopping bee full neyther passing spirites warned full commeth quaking reason matter bearing downewarde vertue ruling bearing vpwarde sayd palsie rining sinewes sometime palsie commeth another euil lesse apoplexia endeth palsie vniuersall perticular vniuersall occupyeth halfe deale sicke man perticular palsie occupieth one part hande foote matter cause bee member paralitike onely member grieued partes galen sayth hee sayth hee sometime awaye plaister sophista done vppon hande vppon necke followeth diuersitie place euill asketh manner medicine diuerse palsie commeth keruing cutting sinewes incurable may bee soone holpe also vniuersall palsie men namely old men vnneth curable young men medicine worketh swiftly effectually helpe palsie shall vse first medicinesosinc esheth lareth within without medicine drie make hard thereto first medicine drie strongly fleeting moyst partes wasted deale hard thick hardnesse worse tempered dissolued wasted therefore men shall worke wisely foresaid manner let member purged within couenable medicine without softned couenable ointment shall vse sage castorie seething wine seech medicine plato v atico constantine addition hemiplexia semiapoplexis semiapoplexia three perticular name palsie also perticular palsie doth rest perticular member tongue head arme legge consider shaking hurteth eien tender substance smoake dimmeth eien maketh smart colde winde smiting spirit sight also hot aire dissolueth departeth also great brightnes sun bright thing departeth sheddeth spirit great darknesse defoileth spirit sight vnordinate dyet continuall dronkennesse dimmeth sight fleshlye lyking ofte seruice venus corrupteth dissolueth spirites humour christallin somtime inward matter cause humour hot cold dry moist first chiefe ach smarting commeth inward thing breed postume vpon ye white eie humour ye slow come black eye make postume commeth feeblenesse eye yt receiueth plentie sharpe galen saith bolismus commeth great heate nether member whose vein draw liuer liuer draweth stomack certein vein yt called miseralce therof commeth sodeine empting stomacke commeth strong appetite hound vnmoderate knowne deepe vrine commeth soone vertue faileth thereby colde medicine grose diet helpeth haue euill token euill man hath vndue appetite eateth common yet great eating bodye amended stomacke good sauours wholesome smell good reuocat impediment yoxing chap yoxing sowne violent moouing stomacksingultus alexos ligmos arabia alsoach hicket commeth crampy disposition ye stomack commeth two cause principally great repletion abstinence wasting somtime cold maner cause ye sinew ye stomack shrinke riuell ye shronk yt bottome ye stomacke araied vpward vertue ruling gouernance laboreth settle ye bottoe bring kind place mouing vpward downward cometh noise yt called yoxing men tel el seemeth ye bottome stomak arered ye aire yt ye middle passeth voideth stregth putting ye lung meeteth wt aire passeth straight passage maketh noise called yoxing commeth repletion cometh spuing humoures meate commeth volkinges diuerse sauours superfluitie humour diverse disposition bodie ple sharpnesse perceth thirleth gnaweth member life therfore suffer withstad r ise kinde vnmightie faileth ouercome last venim hath masterie body turneth humour owne likenesse maketh venimous noyful greeuous therefore perilous touche bodyes bee infected venim euaporation springing ofte bodyes infect corrupte thinges neere also though venimme horrible enimye kinde often happeneth desired kinde himselfe sweet thing medled therewith friend kinde oft strength venimme hid vnder sweet thing sauourie therfore constantine teacheth man dreadeth uenim beware stinking bitter thing also sweete thing sauoury salte sowre ofte mallice venimme hidde vnder thing kinde desireth also constantine teacheth knowe effect whan venim taken meat drinke sayth man feeleth burning meate drinke crampe followeth therevpon anone swelling finger nailes venimous mortall thereof commeth token finger nailes made brend fumositie heart token venimme hath mastery innner part sheddeth selfe thence vtter partes farther followeth also gepeth driueleth lippes smart tingle hee feeleth heat tongue sweateth vexed straight heart eyen dim darke needeth host medicine el dyeth hastely venim taken bodye generall medicine excite spuing voyde put venemous matter aboue spuing eyther beneth clistery wine sowthistle sodde hee shall take triacle ouercommeth venim hee shall bee purged bathed needeth venim shall bleede last diet shal ordeined fed fat meates meate stoppeth veines leadeth heart venimous vapour fumositio come heart cause great nut auellanes drye figges helpe drawe consume wast venim therefore good meate also constantine saith balsamus woman milke helpeth right soone burning sore ache commeth venemous thing also sayde cause making triacle onelye destroy venimous thing doth three manner wise foredryeth wasteth venimme therein many thinges haue vertue drieng also vertue putteth venim therein bee many thing bee priuye propertyes contrary venimme also comforteth member therefore venim giueth member might strength withstand therin many thing comfort bee perill abide triacle maye bee sound galen sayth garlike shall brused sodde anone dissolution fat hen men shall giue patient iuyce drinke contrary venim swageth inward burning wonderful manner therfore garlike called tiriaca rosticorum triacle vplandish men also constantine saith without garlike iuyce hen helpeth also liber de simplici medicina sayd thing contrarie venim drawe inner part heate subtiltie theyr owne substance cocke hen slitte layd venimous biting also thinges contrarye venimme lykenesse subtiltie owne substaunce striue
