heauen say saturnus starre colde hath cold kind water set aboue tap heauen yt plece therof nigh firmament also say firmament vertue water colde cooleth roundnesse saturnus next thereto might accorde found wise neuerthelesse written iob hee maketh accorde high thing iob ver way light dwelleth place darknesse verse way light parted scattereth east winde vpon earth verse knowest thou course heauen canst thou sette rule thereof earth verse hath put wisedome thy reines hath giuen thy hearte vnderstanding therefore philosopher search inquire thinke inner point philosophy clergealy diuinely inner grounde haue another opinion meane otherwise alexander sayth water aboue heauen set colde fleeting moyst frore heauie property haue contrarinesse among themselues bee contrary either berely ordinaurie wisedome god water vpon aboue firmament noble condition owne kind se place god owne inasmuch next heauenly kinde propertie kinde cleerenesse brightnesse properly kindly found kinde water cause thereof hath likenesse accordeth celum imperium god seat also firmament therefore lord hath set water beneath vnder reason colde moyst needefull condition generation corruption set water aboue reason cleernesse needfull conseruation world therefore saith heauen called watrie christalline ablenesse mouing cleerenesse cleere christall receiueth light fulnesse lyght ouer heauen called celum moueablenesse moued moueth next heauen thereto said heauen moueth forth heauen next thereto therefore heauen moueth nether mouable thing saueth principally nether mouable thing alexander saith part fire aire called ether euerlasting shining lyght brightnesse anaxagoras saith name ether name fire aristotle sayth troweth burning commeth swiftenesse mouing thereof anaxagoras meaneth thing burneth called name ether alarcianu saith ether place departed nether worlde vnseene comparison yt nether suffereth many manner diuersitie chaunging ethere place day euerlasting night commeth day light wonder shadowe earth cause night commeth high place place called ether li metheororum arist saith ether nought el kinde one element none foure element thing aboue ye roundnes ye moone kinde departed kinde nether element therfore ether neither heauie light thinne thick may departed thirling holing another bodie corruption alteration may come enter kind called ether neither part thereof came composition element corruption shoulde come therein yet anaxagoras saith ether aire set fire saith sometime cometh downward hid within earth subtiltie thereof ruled vpward downward therfore commeth earth shaking vertue ether closed inner partes earth aristotle sayth saieng erronious subtill thing moueth downward also though moued downwarde yet make working macrobius sayth shining ether vnder roundnesse heauen blaseth shineth roundnesse worlde contayneth selfe roundnesse seuen planet moue agaynst mooing firmament neather parte aire swiftnesse mouing setteth fire ouer part matter elementall setting fire roundnesse fire gendred bred sayd libro de coelo mundo sine ether set fire matter set fire taketh chaunging neather thing though neather thing take chaunging thereof pof sphere heauen cap sphaerathe sphere heauen isido sayth certaine kinde shapen round moueth round middle thereof euen space time one poynt philosopher tell sphere hath neither end beginning therefore mouing thereof soone knowen beginneth endeth shape according heauen shape sphere simplicitie therof conteining receiuing also likenes accord isido saith also alphrag sayth sphere round vttermost part heauenly body fired starres contayned sphere goeth vppon two pole one thereof north goeth neuer downe v called polus articus north pole polus antarticus south pole neuer seene v farre v el earth betweene v betweene two pole betweene two endes ye world sphere heuen moueth turneth round mouing ther starres pight therein borne rauished aboutdravven east west againe west east mouing day night space soure twentie houres sphere heuen moueth great swiftnes planet met letted swifte mouing thereof made moderate shape world shoulde fall therefore alphraganus saith seauen roundnesse planet vnder sphere euery one meeting crossing roundnesse planet passe couenable meeting meete come ramishing stemament withstandeth tarieth swistnes thereof body sphere mooueth slont middle lyne named axis axis certaine line vnderstoode stretcheth straight midle bal thing one pole another line vnderstood heuen roundnes heuen moueth wheele moueth axi tree endes line named axis called cardinales coeli pight foresaid pole called cardinales moue ye hollownesse pole sharpe corner doore moueth herre cardinales hollowe crooked inward isid saith halfe ye sphere called emisperium parte seene v desaulte sight seemeth toucheth earth circle sight stretcheth endeth called orizon end sight sayth isid knowe thou heereof shortly sphere heauen bright substance shineth euen middle thereof earth roundnesse thereof farre middle poynt earth therfore substance thing full great heauen seeme full little sight far sphere containeth nether thing ordaineth informeth cause effectiue generation liuing rauisheth draweth merchandise faire fortune rent tribute substaunce rich king knight foot men heereof speaketh albumasar fourth degree aquarius signe ariseth called leo leauenth degree starre called stella regia starre called lampades goe downe chaunge aire thereafter capricornus head aquarius ariseth fable meane signe aquarius ye butler god giueth water therefore holdeth potte therefore saide sol aquario time aire made thicke hath much water b ead raine time isidore sayth signe pisces chap misael sayth signe called pisces watrie colde meane night signe house iupiter exaltation venus degree thereof venus lorde circle sunne also circle commeth circle venus ouer parte circle circle sunne nether part thereof ouer part circle better seene lesse hid sunne sometime shineth sun sometime shineth sunne going downe giueth thing lyfe forme shape sayth sunne quantitie working cleerenesse starres heauen hath plentie sadnesse lyght also might multitude effect dooings also euennesse mouing moueth alway forth right owne circle holdeth alwaye middle vnder circle called zodiacus circle passeth straight ye middle lyne zodiacus passeth neuer boundes markes circle zodiacus therefore mouing owne circle euen lyke space called signes euerye signes containe xxx degree euery degree lx minute euery minute lx second sunne passeth one poynt circle commeth againe poynt passeth twelue signes passing called circle aire passeth fully degree kindly daye daye night albumasar accounteth passeth lix minute viii second lviii last minute remaine two second lii passed much lacketh sunne passeth ful degree one naturall daye thimeo saith manner god master thing maketh warely wisely deere light call sunne whose brightenesse shining heauen nether thing lightned measure hath life libro de elementis aristotle saith sunne hath owne light star moone receiue light sun glasse set candle receiueth lyght candle therefore marcianus saith sunne passing middle circle departed signes sendeth himselfe twelue beames ouer bodyes nether lightened vertues property sun speaketh dionisius libro de diuinis nominibus cap saith manner sunne hath owne one manner shining light inlighteneth many essencias quality thing seene felt bee diuers lyght sun renueth feedeth maketh plenteous encreaseth chaungeth setteth place planteth renueth ministereth thing word propertie sunne knowen owne kinde owne effect owne substance hath simplicitie hath substanciall composition part vnlike contrary part foure element haue thing made element hath manner simplicitie manner kinde lykenesse accord therefore hath euerlasting substaunce without corruption compowning co trary thing well corruption aristotle saith simplycitie sunne hath lyghtnesse substaunce thicknesse boystousnes naturall partes cause well heauinesse lyghtnesse body sunne hath ablenesse moouing light bodyes doe moue easely sunne swifte subtiltie substaunce ablenesse mouing hath actualti vertue working simple thing kindly might hath diuers working dooings therfore couenably dionisius saith sunne lyght euen like shining light sayleth neuer though seeme sometime light taken away v earth moone set betweene v also hath vertue renewing openeth poores hole ye earth bringeth foorth hid more rootes cloatheth reneweth ouerpart earth hearbes twigges flower entering vertue sunne pearreth inner part earth winter time like old thing fordryed withered earth euery yeare renewed greene thing faire also hath vertue nourishing sunne beame commeth inner part more rootes seedes dissolueth departeth moysture earth owne heate lyke vertue drawing vertue seedes more rootes therfore draweth moysture tourneth feeding norishing thing spring ye earth also hath vertue keepe saue thing nether world element contrarye rach contrary destroy themselues except reco ciled saued influence vertue eauen kept due beeing alexander saith also hath vertue make perfect thing elemental heat beginneth work generation body heate sunne perfecteth bringeth forth due full ende alexander saith also hath vertue distination making knowing colour thing kindes shape thing vnknowen darknesse vndistinguished presence lyght brightnes sun knowen distinguished sunner also hath vertue vnitie accord aud himselfe also accident himselfe ioyneth reconcileth accordeth planet owne effectes doings also accordeth togethers element contrary wherefore marcianus saith macrobius also sun middle among planet make harmonie accord heauen sunne owne circle maketh thing middle string maketh instrument musike also accident heate ioyneth thing one kinde dissolueth departeth thing diuers kindes matter asketh workketh gathereth departeth also hath vertue plentiful vertuousnes giueth vertue generation nether thing bring forth thing diuers kindes ari saith man sunne gendereth man nothing bringeth foorthe srulte groweth sun beame reacheth thereto also hath vertue comforting sun ariseth circle called orizont vertues beastes made stronger euen till sun come middle ye heauen increase passing west ward downward farnesse body feebled vertues fall asleepe fareth flower open sunne rising close sun going downe alexander sayeth also hath vertue chaunging orday ning distincting time passing downwarde south signes maketh dayes shorte rising vp north signes daye long also changeth day ye sun shining vpon earth maketh day disposition ye sun diuersthe horse phoebus red white yeolovv blacke gules arg nt sabella pyrois fuous ae hon philegon name ye day diuers first ye sun red dawning shineth morrow tide noone hot pale euen therefore feigned yt foure horse first redde second bright thirde burning fourth louing earth beda sayeth also beda sayeth sunne speekled hid vnder cloud betokeneth rainy daye redde pale betokeneth day tempest seemeth hoarish middle shine ye middle sende beames towarde south betokeneth tempest moyst windie pale falleth among blacke clowdes betokeneth northerne winde beda saith also hath vertue comfort nether thing isidore sayeth farnesse nighnesse sunne men face beast body disposed strength heat therefore marcianus saith constellation sunne men fayre nimble id wift therefore fa e paynted feather chiteish face therefore called phoebus farre also peholomous saith sun maketh man corpulent great body faire face welt coloured great eyen maketh man able work gold owne exhaltation workes brasse disposeth abating also hath vertue cleansing purging spreding beames clenseth cleereth ayre disperkleth sheddeth dryeth away pestilent aire also though hot himselfe yet hath vertue beating eeming burning commeth contraction rebounding meeting beames mouing ouer par body namely body beames come vpon bee shewer cleane bright sayd science perspectiue also hath vertue drawing heate draweth sea fumositie vapor maketh thick turneth clowdes made thicke clowdie dissolueth sheddeth hayle raine snowe therefore marcianus saith sayd fable sunne fast occean vapor drawen vp urned nourishing feeding thereof therefore men tell strong heate commeth strong rayne great drawing vapour strong impression beames heate wombe hollownesse clowde aristotle sayth also hath vertue giuing lyfe seene knowen nothing may lyue sun beame may reach therfore ptholemeus saith cooke sunne signe called leo house raineth ariete reigne passeth libra vnder contained spicerye winning faires fortune betokeneth spirite soule coulour white red trustic true full endeth course three hundred dayes lxvi sixe houres also among planettes disposeth beast boldnesse liuelinesse though quantitie swift mouing greatnesse swiftnesse mouing vnseene though eight time great ye earththe sun time big earth macrobius saith highnesse place vnneth seemeth two foote quantitie without comparison seemeth knowen seemeth arising downe going farre v seemeth ye point south nigh v knowen beholding sight beguyled openlye declared moouing mooueth swifter arrowe neuerthelesse seemeth moueth great cleerenes passing quantitie swiftnesse mouing escapeth sight sayde sufficeth time pof moone cap moone called luna luna decor noctis bona dea berecynthya duana one ye light vnderstand principall lyke sunne greatnesse fairnesse isid saith said exameron moone fairnesse night mother humour minister lady sea measure time follower sunne changer aire hath light hir selfe borroweth taketh plentie sunne taketh forme shape figure sun far neere sunne also moone lacking lightnesse hir selfe taketh lyght well sunne therefore sayd elementor aristo moone alway halfe shired sunne receiueth light reboundeth towarde earth hath kinde like shewer hath proper colour taketh lyght another neerer sunne looseth lyght earthward cleerenesse ee eth neather side towarde heauen therefore shining vpward euer side therefore coniunct sunne sendeth light earth side heuen vpward fully shining sunne shining toward earth nothing towarde heauen beda sayeth macrobius also also moone chaingeth figure shape sheweth towarde earth diuers face lyght showeth hir selfe shaped bow wise circle round sight men moynoydus dictotomos amphitricos pancilenos moynoydos new seemeth horned dictotomos halfe full eight dayes olde amphitricos doubt full roundnesse eleuen twelue dayes olde pansilenos shineth ful fourteene dayes olde also moone sheweth hir selfe three state sunne coniunction next sunne aside passeth froward sun afore sun goeth first froward sun hee seemeth horne bowe alway horne tourned eastward commeth coniunction receiueth figure shape horne alway turned west ward side turned ward sun seemeth alway voyde side toward sun full lyght moone increaseth humour priuye passing kinde floude ebbe increased multiplyed hir waning marrow ye bone braine head humoures body made lesse wexing increasing hir increased therefore thing hath compassion default moone also draweth hir water sea stone adamas draweth yron moone moueth draweth hir occean sea therefore rising moone sea swelleth increaseth floweth east ebbeth decreaseth west againward moone goeth sea floweth west ebbeth east moone hath lyght lesse sea stretcheth withdraweth flowing ebbing marcobius sayth lib ciceronis sea occean increasing moone holdeth maner first day moone full wont highest decreaseth waneth second daye withdraweth seuenth day againe increaseth springeth seuen dayes yt fourteenth daye spring highest alway new moone spring sea highest also full moone also moone gathereth deawe aire printeth vertue hir moysture aire chaungeth ayre manner vnseene breedeth gendereth deaw vtter part thereof see ye cleere moone summer time plentie deaw seene vpon grasse hearbs also among planet moone ful endeth hir course short time hir circle short therefore space seauen twentie day eight houres passeth signes circle called zodiacus ptholomeus sayth therefore ptholomeus speaketh manner moone sayth vnder moone cancer hir house raigueth cancer passing hir raigne libra cold planet passing moyst female night planet abideth euery signe two dayes sixe houres halfe full endeth course seuen twentie dayes viii houres among starres called erratice moone passeth vncertaine vnstedfast mouing shortnes course passeth walketh vnder sun behinde sunne sunne passeth south lowest circle moone passeth north lower circle moone vpright boate hath horne vpwarde vnder sun hath horne boowing toward earth wayneth areared beda sayeth also moone betweene v sun ofte eclypse default ye sun default may neuer fall kind coniunction sunne moone moone chaungeth coniunction lyne called linea eclyptica middle lyne circle called zodiacus eclipse falleth alway ye sunne head dragon moone tayle againward heereof speaketh albumasar libro de motibus planetarum saith moone meeteth sunne passeth euen betweene v sunne maketh v haue default sunne beames capite cauda draconis head tayle dragon caput cauda draconis shalbe sayd heereafter also earth betweene sun moone moone lacketh lyght eclipsed heereof speaketh marcianus lib de astro saith manner moone going vpward downward falleth sun line hir xxx dayes olde vnder sunne darkneth taketh away light sunne maketh darknesse earth maketh default euery moneth alway line euen straight lyne betweene sunne earth default falleth moone moone sunne fifteene dayes olde sunne vnder earth maketh shadow greatnesse earth stretcheth lyne straight afore sunne moone commeth line hir light taken away shadow earth euen set betweene sunne moone moone clipsed euery month full line clipse shadowe euen betweene sunne therfore light euery month taken away also somtime moone containeth selfe manner darknesse dimnes commeth qualytie owne body kindly darke hath lyght himselfe sunne men meane darknesse commeth shadow earth rebounded maner dimme spleke body moone dimmeth deale lyght nigh earth moone taketh manner hoare filth marcianus sayth passeth vp higher circle bright cleane seemeth wemmed speckle smotching marcianus saith also moone signifieth betokeneth chaunging time weather beda saith moone redde golde beginning betokeneth windes ther black speck ouer corner luemmes betokeneth raine beginning month red middle betokeneth faire wether cleere full moone night rowing moone lyght spranckleth care tempest shall come short time beda sayth also ye harmonie heauen moone maketh heauiest sowne deepest bace marciano sayth circle moone heauie sowne sharp sowne sphere heauen yt commeth ordinate sowne sherking mouing circle roundnesse heauen saith thereof commeth sweete melody accord also moone giueth plenteousnesse seedes earth ra yng ouer seedeth profiteth deaw falleth body moone saith therfore fable called proserpina procerpipina vvife pluto daughter iupiter take sometim moone nation call moone goddesse seedes throwen earth also called diana goddesse wood groues giueth light wilde beast gather meate night woodes groues therfore nation cal moone goddesse hunter hunting ofre wood groues diana daughter iupiter flieng company men hir cha life also taken moone therefore painted goddesse bowe hir hande hunter vse bowes also though moone bee colde moyst yet taketh heate nighnesse circle sunne heate drinesse sunne passing coldnesse moysture tempered shoulde comming downe toward earth make winter euery month macrobius saith also albumasar saith moone cleanseth aire continuall mouing maketh ayre cleere thinne mouing sphere moone ayre corrupt thicknesse infection come outdrawing night vapour moysture great corruption shoulde e thereof also astronomer tell among planet moone ulyng hath power ouer disposition man body ptholemeus sayth libro de iudicijs astrorum moone contained sicknes losse feare dread bomage therefore chaunging man body vertue moone worketh principally falleth swiftnesse mouing hee nigh v also priuie power might kindly moone therefore phisition knoweth perfectly chaunging sicknesse know effectes working moone man bodye therefore hippocrates principio pronosticoruin speaketh moone sayth manner certaine starre heuen phisition must take heede vnderstand purueyaunce thereof wonderfull dreadfull galen commento de diebus creticis saith phisition must take heede aduise certaine thing fayleth deceiueth thing astronomer aegypt taught coniunction bodye moone starres fortunate commeth dreadfull sicknesse good end contrary planet falleth contrary yt euill ende therefore phisition perfectly wise ware hippocrates learning shall behold first moone full light humour increase men marowe also increasing sea worldly thing sicke man falleth bedde needeth see knowe moone passeth coniunction sicknesse encreaseth till moone come degree opposition afore sunne full moone euill planet euill signe hard aspect yt hoose mar viii signe meaning moone haue aspect mar called lord yt signe named scorpio death dread moone good planet good house signe hath aspect lord house lyfe mar lord aries first signe hope life men shall see doeme sayd booke hippocrates made hath name de iudicajs infirmitacis secundum luuam pof certaine property moone cap also moone hath property full good well substance effect hath substanciall darknesse yt hath light himselfe planet haue vnstable starre passeth partes zodiacus moone doth also euill willed starres grieuous taketh euill qualyties griefes ptholomeus saith moone euill planet euill also moone sitting betweene v sunne taketh v cleere lyght sunne moone commeth shadowe earth leeseth lyght fairenesse perfection also nigh fat ayre earth taketh fowle leke vnseemelye shaddowe armed man moone ayre infect ayre marcianus saith also farther moone goeth frowarde sunne light taketh cleerenesse side towarde earth fayleth abateth light side toward heauen also hath many euill effectes doinge ptholomeus saith moone maketh man vnstable changeable vvill working remouing place place maketh man euill disposed disordered eyen maketh man one eye maketh looke squint pearle one eye hee sayth heereto man whose complection constellation yt moone hath masterie shall without default wem eye happeneth reason yt passing moysture ye moone nigh eyen disposeth humor eyen euil shrewde qualitie also benimous head hath exaltation three degree gemini abating three degree sagittarius againward taile hath exaltation third degree sagittarij falleth thirde degree gemini heere must take heed moone coniunct head sun taile nigh degree coniunction degree thence within alway eclipse shall lesse head taile commeth nere father degree coniunction hath speciall place eclipse sun wise shall helde eclipse moone moone commeth anye signe taile sun head signe euen afore shall eclipse moone againewerd sun taile signe moone head signe euen afore shall ye eclipse ye moone commeth degree eclipse shall gneral must come ye head taile yt degree nigh degree thence within eclipse shall fall coniunction sunne moone must signe degree minute degree heereof followeth though moone ioyned sunne chaungeth euery moneth maketh eclispe alway come alwaie togethers vnder line eclipse yt moone chaungeth neither hath coniunction alway yt degree neither head taile meet alway yt coniunction oppsition sunne moone starre cometa chap cometa starre beclipped burning gleames beda doth say sodeinly bred betokeneth changing king token pestilence war wind great heate sometime seemeth yt star beset blasing beames moue mouing planet somtime seemeth pight moueable alwaye beda saith seene certaine place heauen passe diuerse part yt zodiac planet seemeth yt yt circle called laclens galaxia spread beames toward north neuer towarde west therefore seene west side seene short space time seauen day sometime seene space day beda telleth whereof yt star called cometa commeth gendered whether bee planettes starres bee pight alway seene firmament north side saith heereof foloweth starre seene birth christ cometa passed moued east south toward west moue starres called stella comete chrisostomus saith pof fixed starres cap stellae called starres haue name stando standing though moue alwaye yet alway seemeth stande isido sayth called sidera haue name considerando taking heede astonomers take heede giue iudgements dontes knowe shall befall also hee called astra haue name austros anastros opposition body starres pight firmament nayles roundnesse wheele troth namely great isido sayth alphraganus saith star lyght gathred roudnesse sphere therefore gathering lyght substaunce body starre quantitie fairenesse cleerenesse also might vertue also calleth starres lyght bright bodyes giue men beastes night dark comfort lyght ornate hight ouer parte worlde farre foorth may steed sunne whome receiue lyght continuall sending beames cleanse pourge aire vertue corruption pestilence taken away neather worlde also vertue star element contrary conciled accorded lightened euerlasting shining starres heate thing nourished saued plato beda sayeth starres firie kinde manye men olde time sayd heauen lyght ornament thereof fierie kinde aristotle philosopher meane vnderstand heuen fift element distinguished foure element kinde propertie saye starres hee colde hot substaunce heauen hot working effect heauen continuall euerlasting uing heateth thing vpon moueth heauen starres heate coole nether thing mouing rebounding beames heate breede vertue heate vtter parte body afore whereof starres made certaine pure simple kinde corrupt lenthing shape bright also round figure sad sound hollowe hoaly vtter part plaine rough corued place highest mouing swifte quantitie great huge though lyttle farnesse place number tale onelye knoweth many numbreth telleth starres might working star vertueus among body starres grauer change saue nether thing starres sending theyr beames lyghten darkenesse night full ende theyr course sphere circle moue one swifenesse tune swiftlye hide theyr lyght presence sunne receiue lyght theyr comming rising chaunge ayre many maner wise make tempest faire weather cleere beda sayth also chaunging coulour sprincklyng beames betoken nowe good happes nowe euill astronomer tell also gracious shipmen shewe waye middle sea starres coniunct nigh togethes giue lyght bee fayre bright fareth seuen starres stare circle called galaxia watlingstrete though shew greate fairenesse company gathering togethers also bright cleere coniunct else yet take heede himselfe seeme faire cause thereof marcianus saith passing brightnesse one shining taketh away default another one lacketh faileth another cleere amendeth fulfilloth also fairnesse place starres seene men vnlyke greate seeme lesse albumasar saith euen starres straight ouer head lesse soeme quantitie little sight againeward farther bee place arising downe going greate seeme generally sight also seeme great quantitie downe going rising beda sayth point called ceneta capitis nostri point aboue heauen ouer head sayd thing ceneth head hee aboue streight ouer head ceneth called straight setting ouer head reason therof cause hee saith vapour come vp earth suffer beames come straight euen eien therefore eie deceiued sight eie weeneth taketh himselfe beset aire lightened sun beame algazel sayth fight deceiued sight candle seene without let eie whole bleare eie seene without likenesse shape manner rainebowe eie deceiued weeneth alway see another thing light seeth weeneth another thing rather eie auicen saith capitulo de obscuriefare isus seeke sight also marcianus sayth starres passe circle harmony tune accord musike found among starres wright neather body make discord melodye ouer bodyes neither melodie middle bodyes againewarde sharpnesse sowne bodyes destroy sowne neather heauie body marcianus saith aristotle saith libro de coelo mundo star matter bodye heauen bee pight therefore bee kindlye cleere bright heauen goe starres haue lyght theyr owne moone though starres haue lyght owne yet perfection light receiue supplyment helpe sunne starres communicate part theyr lyght one maketh another cleere goodnesse one stretcheth goodnesse another saide libro le coniunctionibus planetarum also starres conteined owne proper circle place therfore though circle one meete sometime circle another entreth therein forsake therfore owne circle place let meete doe wrong none also marcianus sayth starres arise sooner go sooner downe starreo arise later goe later downe arise together goe downe ot diuersitie rising going downe salleth commeth vneuennesse circle bee seene going downe arising highnesse lownesse bodye heauen starres arise goe downe diuerse time also starres chaunge distinguish time yeares monethes dayes aristotle sayth libro de proprietatibus elemento chaunging tune chaunging starres diuers signes aboue seauen climate country chaunge moone euery xxviii dayes shall hee onelye knoweth maker time conteineth might power moment time polus chap beda sayth polus right lyttle starre ouer part heauen called two polis one called articus bovealis alwaye shineth v neuer goeth downe sight alwaye hee aboue v bee hath name polus pollendo shining shineth alwaye worlde polus called antarticus wit south raine star afore north starre called polus articus alway vnseene v betweene two polis betweene endes world firmamet moueth alway two polus moue neuer theyr owne place yet bee borne rounde circle sphere line called axis stretcheth middle point earth pole pole axis swiftnesse firmament rauished mooueth line yt called axis material rather certeine intellectuall line stretcheth pole pole euen streight line drawen euen streight one point another ne called axis middle world firmament passeth endlesse rauishing pole starre higest place swift moouing least quantitie sight though bee full greate huge himselfe hee profitable effect place starre place stroedes boundes starres circle heauen knowen therefore astronomer beholde starre starre described short circle hee farre place wee bee hee hideth hugenesse quantitye vnmoueablenesse place doth certifie men certeinly yt behold take heede thereof therefore hee called stella mari starre sea leadeth sea men saile haue shippe men craft place tho middle heauen knowen going aboute certeine starres hee called arcthurus starre called pelus distinguished star arcthurus like therto commonlye called charlemaynes waine starre hath name polus articus arcthurus nigh thereto beda sayth arcthurus chap arcthurus signe made seuen starres set line called axis goeth himselfe isidore sayth circle seuen starres goeth waine called among latines septentrio septentriones also commonlye called english charlemaines waine septentriones seue starres vvhich seene charles waine vrsa maior goeth downe seauen star full night pole highest starre circle called artophilax followeth signe called visa olde men called circle sometime boetem nigh signe named waine signe many men behold arated many star among yt signe arcthurus yt properlye starre sette behinde taile signe called visa maior beare therefore constellation arcthurus hath name starre isidore saith hath worthely name arcthurus artando binding knitting first part thereof cold ariseth reason farre heate sun cold hole pore earth bee constrained bound stopped seauen starres appeare beames light bright forme shape foure first bee ordeined quadrangle foure side three followe bee disposed halfe circle bee set vnder pole line called axis therefore alwaye winde rounde pole middle point gregorie saith always starres winde tourne round lyne called axis beare doth stake therefore circle called beare macrobius saith alway circle windeth round goeth neuer sight gregorye sayth three starres goe vpwarde foure goe downewarde againeward foure goe vpwarde three goe downewarde gregorie sayth among high circle circle arcthurus highest next tempestes orion dimme breedeth bringeth foorth windes tempestes orion hath name rising hugenesse water isidore sayth rising hee gendereth dreedeth tempestes changeth ayre disposed shapen armed man stretching feete armes length longitude stretcheth nigh breadth latitude three signes marcianus sayth hee shineth signe called taurus hee sayth orion constellation notable hugnesse also fairenesse also dispesition vertue stretcheth signe called aries signe yt called gemini marcianus saith also maketh brightnesse three signes faire cleere saith shapen order starres knight giroe swoorde speaketh beames hee sheweth cleerenesse neather thing hee ariseth againe iuly sun ascendeth gemini higher circle earth hath distemperance aire hot qualitie hyades chap star mentio hyades called situle also plenteously bee well sprong raine constellation hyades hath many full cleere star set ariseth sixteenth degree signe called cancer distronble ayre arising albumasar saith addition romanes call starres starres pliades heat aire tempered raine springing time time earth arraied fairenesse flower marcianus saiththe chief star called maia ye name maia mother mercurius cause said juno loued ye cordesse maia seined one star pliades shee mercurius mother thus meaneth sayning poet marcianus saith albumasar saith plyades seauen starres doe arise degree signe called taurus starres called hyades distrouble ayre theyr moouing pliades seauen starres marriners vse trieng coast poettes seigne seuen daughter licurgus atlas canicula chap canicula full seruent starre ariseth degree signe called taurus albumasar sayth arising thereof great disturbaunce ayre weather starre dayes bee called dy caniculares haue name dayes sull perillous let bloud take laxatiue medicine passing distemperaunce ayre heate therefore aphorism hippocrates sayth starre canis starre vnder starre canis laxatiue medicine noieth growethforbeate take purgatios sayde commento rising starre rising anono rising thereof perillous giue laxatiue drinkes ayre hotte drie commeth hotte signe hot starre sunne star canicula signe called leo little medicine bodie made hot drie therevpon happely shuld come feauer also medicine shuld wose passe work lesse hole pore open wide reason heate aire galen saith strong heate without forth draweth strength vertue medicine therefore hot water contrarye laxation heate aire strong time also inner vertue feeble made feeble drinking letting bloud canicular day begin fifteenth balends august end ye nonis septembris euen fiftie sayd light chap lumenas basilius saith light kinde partes lyke authours speake diuerslye lyght bee deede whether bee substaunce accident aristotle sayth lyght bodye streaming bodye damascenus saith light hath substaunce owne austen sayth super genesim ad litteram lyght bodylye substaunce simple kinde bodyes multiplied increased diuerse matter working moueable passinglye thirling pearcing least letting breeding highlye accordeth reconcileth thing bee diuerse contrarye conuertible grounde beginning highest naturall motion perfectible gladde communicatiue therfore bodyes nothing profitable light nothing conuenient conenable nothing sayre nothing swifte nothing subtill nothing inpassible wemlesse nothing vertuous found light also lux lumen light english latine difference betweene two nounes lumen flowing streaming floweth substance light lux sustantiall well vpon lumen grounded light selfe accident need self wer accident thing accident selfe hath cause beeing forme obiect light aire wers accident shuld haue cause forme aire may bee also light chaungeth subiect knowne light first east afterward west east light gendereth light nexte thereto forth euen west accident chaungeth subiecte worketh without subiect ther heereby seemeth light accident also light accident ayre aire sodeinly moue ye wind east west mouing light sodein aire moueth sodeinly anye element also nothing worthy noble light accident lesse worthy substance seemeth yt light accident aire much lesse worthy lesse noble light light body hard know vnderstand manner light aire cleere bodie christall two bodyes maye place neuerthelesse inconuenient impossible set lyght bodylye substaunce one another body see water ash ioyned meddeled togethers sauing bodie place conteining either distinguished part eyther conteined within owne vtter parte manner wise euer meddeled togethers ash water water abideth corporalnesse ioyning continuing togethers partes ash body also meddeling ioyning togethers bee two body place water hath owne place ash owne place light may bee aire euerye body sauing corporalitie either contuniaunce theyr substantial part light entering inner partes ayre christalline hath owne place beclipping aboute vtter partes place distinguisheth light substaunce bodie whome ioyned though may simplicitie substaunce bee felt seene yet wonder many lyghtes bee brought one place lyghtes meddeled together though bee ioyned vnited yet neuerthelesse substantiall forme light saued forme euery diuerse though none materiall cause formall dionisius teacheth openly li de diuinis nominibas saith manner lightes saith hee lampes bee house bee one whole lyght gathered togethers bee common yet haue prime distinction betweene themselues distinguished sunder one distinction distinguished vnity wee see manye lampes light one light one claerenesse commeth theyr lightes shineth without knowing distinction man thinke sequester light one lyght another ayre bee together sight one another bee altogether shining lyght seemeth one without distinction one lampe bee withdrawen taketh awaye anye thing others light leaueth owne light sayd perfect rutie vniuersallye meddeled confusion anye parte vnitie much bodylye ayre materiall light l ue vsque diomsius wordes denis seacheth openlye light bee ioyned togethers substantiall propertie saued accident property taketh comming going also denis sayth light called lux latine substance selfe thereof commeth beaming manner shining body alwaye lux light shineth selfe neverthelesse shineth alway sindeth body matter disposed able lightned austen saith substance heuen light hath first place body neuertheles heuen lightneth darknesse night alway light shineth inuisibly darknesse shineth alwaye sightlye therefore euery creature feeleth vertue light vertue lyght worketh vnseeingly feeling moouing beast sayde libro fontis vitae also libro de ludicijs astrorum albumasar saith hippocras taught yt life star tempered thicknes ayre night bodyes soules destroied neuerthelesse certain ye light star seene night impression working light knowen toe sea ebbeth floweth respect moone part thereof whether moone lighten aire also though thinkes hole den earth bee lightned yet vertue light worketh seene care mettall thing gendred bred deepe within ye earth shortly speak presence light needfull euery body yt medled contrary elementes ioyned also light sheddeth self highest heauen yt called coelum imperium euen ye middle world one substance simple roote yet variable diuersitie body receiue whether sun ouer bodyes neather wherein one substaunce vertue working light though vertue lightening therein first gendering light made first daye basilius saith aboue sun lightes starres made fourth daythe light luneth darknesse iohn therfore sun starres bearer first light taking bodylesse lyght bee suffisaunt euerlasting lightening without losse owne substaunce therefore light stretcheth euery place persecteth dispoleth bodyes lesse moare roo e fundament shining one substaunce none lower bodyes conteyned accidentallye conteineth bodyes formall comparison though materiall selfe place steede therefore light materiall maye haue diuerse partes diuerse place forntall hath indeede diuerse partes diuerse place matter may haue power forme hath effect deed heereof followeth openly lyght kinde bodyes hath least matter forme lyght neere kinde fourme matter therefore matter least steede point forme euery place steede euerye thing mooneth owne forme aristotle sayeth therefore nobler extendeth hiss matter algazel sayth wherefore forme light noble bodilye formes stretcheth spreadeth matter therfore onepoint light shining suffisaunt selfe lighten worlde noblenesse matter adualnesse forme algazel saith light one simple vniforme essence though body light bee diuerse distinguished sonder though seeme one act gathered lyke yet one lightening commeth substaunce another though seeme sight ioyned one lyghtening light inconuenient set two bodyes together one place one bee subtile formall wer complement perfection teri vnperfect two bodye blessedfull bodyes shall bli heauen maye place steede neither ay materiall w e bodye v full another blissefull may bee togethers steebe place without inconuenience saith austen openly basilius sayth light moueable moueth selfe without ceasing gendereth light line forthright roundnesse aboute mooueth sheddeth selfe partes touching selfe moneth sodeinly light able work pearceth commeth innest part euerye thing without lette tarrieng sight gendereth thing bee diuerse vnlyke ioyneth accordeth contraryes bee element middle bodyes also outcasting stretching onercasting breaking rebounding beames light bringeth forth thing keepeth saueth beeing disolueth vndoeth theyr calcidius sayth super meum also lyght gonerueth ruleth lyfe thing multiplyeth selfe gendering lyght gendereth lyght lyght gendered gendereth lyght commeth lyghteneth forth instaunt one point product filleth world lyght shining also lyght sheweth selfe thing heauen incomparison vtter parte moyst bodye cleere light worketh diuerse effect austen sorth light putteth darknesse vndoeth cleyngnesse discomfortes destroyeth false waiting spicing lyght commeth surette bringeth forth gladde merrye kinde shape bringeth fourme fayrenesse thing without light bodyes tenidius hidde vnknowne doe awaye lyght sayth daiuascene thing vnknowne abide darknesse ambrose saith masilius lyght fayrenesse euery creature seene grace whereof sight beholding maketh member partes worde wortye pleased basinus saith aboue heauen peaceable wel ng place lld sa te ensample shewing trinitie lyght without diminishing selfe sheweth shoddeth light receiued ouer parte darke bodie doth drowne deep selfe therein touching ye likenesse sight touching might vertue isidore saith lyght hath manye propertyes worthy praysed substance vertue working nothing sound cleere pure substance thereof therefore though passe vilenesse filth defiled nothing actuall deede vertue therof nothing found profitable bodyes working thereof shining chap shining springing streaming substaunce light commeth light without mingling nature duteth long light commeth austen saith saue fyre soone shining therefore fyre euerlasting shining euerlasting also shining commeth light without diminishing light without dryling cleannesse lyght without discontinuance thereofezecli effectiue working nourishing increasing ture cause materiall therefore springing time bloud gendered needfull nourishing body springing time passe owne kinde breedeth many sickness euills therefore sayde aphor winter drye springing time haruest moyst rainge needes summer bredde feauers blearinesse eyen flixe namely moyst kinde commentour saith winter daye humour coldnesse withheld made sharpe time colde dry need men sicke summer woman goe childe bring foorth haue dead borne child whereof galen commento telleth cause sayth body woman goe child winter hot moyst tender wany sad therefore colde ayre springing time commeth sodainly inner partes woman grieueth hurteth childe coldnesse drinesse flaieng quality childe slaine child slaine greeueth string breaketh need woman hath dead borne child also springing time openeth earth hath bene long closed bounde colde bringeth forth more rootes hearbes hidde earth hyghteth earth reneweth floures hearbs exciteth birdes fowles het ering loue time time gladnesse loue springing time thing seemeth glad earth wexeth greene tree burgen spred medowes bring forth floures heauen shineth sea resteth quiet fowles sing make neasts thing seemed dead constantine saith summer hot drye breedeth cholerum summer sun course highest straight ouer head printethful strong working bodyes lyke doth neather thinges therefore dissolueth wasteth superfluityes hee gathered winter summer passe temperatenesse wether ofte gendereth hot sicknesse drye constantine saith sunne maketh dayes long nightes short ripeth fruite flower great heate maketh digestion humour fruite tourneth good digestion incorporeth ioyneth fruite fordrieth wasteth superfluity full maketh caues pit earth heate wasteth dryeth moyst part drynesse wringeth ioyneth togethers carthie rough hard clinkerie full pit hoales working summer subtiltie heate commeth hollow part beast dryeth wasteth humour betweene skinne flesh sheddeth maketh beast swifte destroyeth wasteth superfluitie comforted shadow thing shorte middle summer pof haruest cap haruest called autumnus hath name augendo increasing time namely corne fruit augmented plenteously gathered barnes trauayle ye yeare corne fruites bee gathered brought barnes therefore comparison betweene haruest nourished iunos fable plenteousnesse isidore saith additio cere kindred iuno daughter saturne ops called also isi wife osiris king aegypt greekes suppose first inuent sowing wheate barley growe wilde among hearbes also first make lawes whereby iustice shuld equally ministred men violence wrong feare taken awaye herodotus writeth aegyptians affirms cere bacchus heare chiefe rule hell plentie riot forgetfulnesse diet abuseth benefit surfetteth body damneth soule cere betokeneth encrease graine called dea frugum frugalitie commeth earth seede saturne sayd deuourer child per antethesis earth yeeldeth increase doth receiue hir againe bacchus first greece found manner planting wine secrete pressing wine called liber pater adage father libertie vino veritas men dronk disclose wine wit superfluous bankets riotous excesse called conuiuia bacchanalia dronken feast haruest maketh men busely occupied gathering corne fruite spoyleth fieldes corne spoyleth tree fruit drinesse coldnes slayeth burgenings leaues tree maketh fall earth barren bare draweth vertue budding springing also haruest colde dry breedeth humour melancholike colde drie haruest beginneth sunne entereth commeth first part signe called libra sunne right line called linea equinoctialis like farre north ye south haruest time hath three month serue constant saith first beginneth sunne libra lasteth xvii daye september xviii daye october sunne beginneth withdrawe middaye second month sunne scorpione lasteth seuenteenth daye october xviii daye nouember third month whe sunne sagittario lasteth xvii daye nouember xviii daye december constant sayth haruest qualitie contrarie springing time therefore time breedeth many euill sickness thereof speaketh hippocras apho sayth haruest falleth sharp sicknesse deadly upon place galen sayth haruest pestilenciall time euill manye thing first chaunging time hot cold also commeth summer findeth many hot humour full hot heat summer colde haruest smiteth againe humor inner part suffer passe body humor rot breede full euill sickness quartanes feuers vnneth curable haruest cold dry inordinat therfore haruest great drines doth consume wast substanciall moysture maketh body feeble faint diuersitie chaunging aire pore hole body sodainly opened sodainly shut hot fumosities withheld vertue maye put multitude sharpenesse matter commeth deadly sicknes euills also haruest time noyfull grieuous haue tisike coldnes drines therof fordrieth renteth ye lung wer pampin floure vine therfore grieueth sore haue tisike pof winter cap winter called hierns hath name eundo going either passing winter time sunne goeth passeth shorter circle summer time therfore maketh shorter dayes longer night isidore saith constantine saith winter beginneth sunne signe called capricornus end descention lowing sunne middaye beginneth little little passe vpward north also winter hath three month yt serue first beginneth capricorno lasteth eighteenth daye december vnto seauenteenth day ianuarie second ye sun aquario lasteth seauenteenth daye januarie xvi day februarie third moneth sunne signe called pisces lasteth xvi daye februarie eighteenth day march winter colde moist nourisheth steame winter coldnesse hath masterie moysture great binding freesing aire water great farnesse sunne farnesse commeth great coldnesse winter time winter contrary summer therfore thing liueth springeth benefite summer fadeth dyeth hard cruelnesse winter foores signes summer gone destroyed brought nought winter time winter time snow greatnesse water multiplied winter time pathes wayes made slipperie fennie pore earth chin constrained frore made hard cold frost ice winter al body haue longer shadowes sumer pore earth closed therefore vtter partes body colde within hot part flye coldnesse haue mastrie gathered ioyned togethers therefore water deepe pit well felt hot winter summer kinde heate slyeth coldnesse hath mastrie gathered ioyned togethers therefore water deepe pit well felt hot winter summer kinde heate flyeth coldnesse contrary thereto draweth inner partes earth closeth selfe veynes deepe pittes welles therefore reason presence heate water freeseth also sharpnes winter maketh men sluggard slowe working coldnesse constrayneth sinewes shrink deale wherefore member stretch work easely doe summer also coldnesse winter pore cloased kinde heate draweth inward comforteth vertues feelyng wherefore appetite awaked meat drinke needeth time therefore hippocras sayth aphor winter time kinde bellyes hot longer sleepe time therefore time winter men shall take meate heate great strong neede nourishing also winter passeth owne quality diuers sickness euills breed spirituall kinde deale seemeth fire middle meane betweene seene thing vnseene inasmuch nigheth nether thinges bodilesse inasmuch nigheth ouer part bodelye also hath kinde actual strong working element therefore called vnmesured vertue working increaseth without ende matter fire worketh endlesse long matter sufficeth fire faileth worketh alway also hath full priuie kinde therefore called hid sensibly seene hee called vnseene vnknowen fire perceiued without matter subiect matter fire worketh also fire beginning substaunce vnneth wit maye know also hath vertue kind mouable element therefore receiuing taking chaunging matter worketh hee receiueth taketh forfaiteth wasteth tourneth owne lykenesse fire receiueth taketh receiued taken thing worketh spent wasted withdraweth leapeth turneth againe therefore called leaping tourning againe also hath vertue kinde commune spred himselfe without dimunition decreasing therfore said taketh neither receiueth despite villany minishing decreasing part soone broken another substaunce nothing founde moysture part cleaue held together gregory saith onely earthly part leuen abide mastry drinesse oft soone set fire yt kinled soone queched sooner therin nothing found seene fire blacknesse blacknesse coale defileth smotcheth berayeth thing toucheth also fire cole hath sharpe fire mightie working thirling percing therefore sharpnesse coale therfore good helpeth washing clothes also hath vertue gnawing biting drieng con saith also ash hot keepeth saueth fire ra ted therin cold quencheth destroieth fire raked therin also great blowing heauenly kinde neather part nigh sphere water earth troubly great thick compact moyst earthy vapour corpulent longeth earthy party parte aire bringeth foorth selfe diuers kindes thing isidore saith aire strongly moued maketh windes lightning thundring drawing together maketh cloudes thicke rainy congealed maketh snow hayle disparckled cleer weather isidore saith beda also hath thicknesse cleerenesse element constantine sayth aire simple element substauncially moyst hot owne kinde substaunce moyst kinde roundnes sphere nigheth thereto hot therfore propertie either qualitie aire stretcheth kindly ouer parte earth water sphere fire subtiltie substaunce thinnesse aire cleere bright cleerenesse receiueth influence vertue heauen impression printing lyght sunne giueth breathe men beast breathing men beastes proper dwellyng place fowles birdes creature soule may ly e ene without aire substanciall lightnesse aire kindly mouable also chaungeable maye bee turned contrary quality substaunce giue lyfe body ayre bee pure meane quality temperate profiteth keeping sauing life corrupt distempered aire grieueth body corrupteth constantine saith farther aire earth neerer heauen cleane pure like cleannesse heauen neerer earth colde fat lyke qualytie earth vapour drawen earth inner part ayre diuers contrarye thing gathered ayre great thicke ayre strongly sunne printeth therin heate beames rebounding smiting togethers breaking beames sunne rebounding sunne beames moyst aire thicke diuers coulours gendered therein sayde lib meth doth rayne bowe impression thicknesse aire commeth three manner cause vapoures meddle earthie greater part ayre coldnes freeseth colde part ayre generation new aire taking selfe medling thereof putting first aire aire made thick philosopher saith thicknes subtilnes aire commeth contrarye cause wasting vapour come vp strong heate make ayre thinne cleere generation firie partes gendred part aire ye least thinnesse moysture made certaine working strength heate aire turned firie kinde substance thereof qualitie aire chaungeth many manner wise saith first nighnesse sunne vertues sunne aire made hot sun nigheth v ward made cold passeth farre v also chaunging rising downe going starres starres well planet cause aire changeth qualyties sunne starre breedeth cold saturnus colde signe bredde strong colde aire sun hot planet mar cause passing heate aire vnderstoode perceiued also chaunging aire commeth diuers disposition place stead earth north side ayre colde drye south winde hot moyst westerne winde colde moyst east winde hot drye also highnesse lownesse earth mountaines hilles ayre colde valleyes hot const telleth cause thereof pantegni saith northerne winde commeth high place high circle passeth freelye without impediment commeth place stirreth moueth airy thing maketh subtill maketh colde subtill thing high mouing made colde valleyes lowe place ayre abideth resteth hot crobius telleth sheweth another reason sayth commeth gendring beames lyght multiplyed valleyes thickenesse vapour thicker valleyes mountaines hilles therefore snow melteth sooner vallies hill valleyes heale gendered sunne beames mountaines accordeth aristotle lib met cap saith multiplication lyght beames comming earth middle poynt cause heate also rebounding gathering lyght beames sharpenesse corner also abiding cause thereof also chaunging ayre commeth nighnesse sea nigh north sea aire colde drye colde vapor dry commeth sea heate feebled hath lyttle masterie therefore north sea little salt sea called ponticum frost contrary south sea cause contrarye also chaunging ayre commeth nighnesse carrion marryse corruption thereof aire infect rotted made pestilentiall rotted infection aire commeth oft ende summer haruest owne kinde aire thin cleane therefore chaungeable therefore corruption falleth therein meddeling euill fumositie commeth vp rottingnesse carrion marryse corrupt thing ioh sayth therefore sayd ayre generall sufficeth time pof fire parpendicular cap must speake impression gendred aire first impression gendered come hot vapour dry impression called ignis perpendicularis impression sometime seene ayre seemeth fire nought el impression gendred hot vapour drye drawen vp first part aire breadth neather part length ouer parte figure shape flame shaped shielde kindeled fire mouing heauen seconde called ignis longus long fire impression gendered hotte vapour drye ouermost parte ayre without breadth openlye knowen comparison length set fire flame mouing firmament vertue fire impression called dragon spowting fire third impression named candela gendred hot vapour drye ouer parte aire little length bredth euen lyke much fire mouing heuen seemeth round shape burning flame fourth impression aristotle calleth aslub double one moouing vpward another downwarde impression gendered subtill vapour hot drye ouermost part ayre great length breadth proportioned togethers strongly set flame heated fire mouing firmament mooueth vpward subtilnesse matter strength burning flame another impression called aslub descendens gendered hot vapour dry thicke euenly length bredth gendred ye ouer part ye middle region aire set burning flame fire mouing heauen moueth downward cold heauinesse great matter thicke aristotle saith impression people weene starres fall night downe heauen flye vpward heauen additio concerning wonderful operation fire reported holy scripture sidrach misach abednagon cast hot burning ouen fire harme yet vsed owne kinde burne vp formentors also consumed sacrifice prophet elia mallice false prophet aal consumed captaines ouer fifty voyce eliah lorde god appearing moses seene bush fire yet bush burnt poliderus virgilius eyght booke history englande maketh mention emma mother edwarde seconde king englande beeing vn usllye accused goodwyn manye attempted iniuryes ceased accuse hir adulterye bishop winchester king therewith greatlye disquieted queene open view cast hir selfe great fire hir entrance ther cried lowde voyce burning flame might consume hir body culpable faultes whereof wrongfullye accused hauing ended talke passed fire good safetie great astonishing king beholder guendolena gratianus chronicle reporteth ye wife henry emperour ye almaines tryed hir accusation like sort also written policarpus whome romane emperour verus persecuted martirs cast fire fire vanished away wicked tirants could preuaile fire slew holy people sword weapon whose bloud cryeth vengeance tiranny manye hidden vertues fire wonderfull operation breedeth kindly heate body nurse
