middle earth ayre incorporate aire heauenlye vertue beda saith winde nought el aire moued shuffed fumosities smoakes come vp earth shoueth putteth ayre winde gendered saith topicis aristotle repriueth description thing described generallye shewed description euery ayre moued winde needeth full strong shouing putting great deale aire put shufte long time el winde therefore constan defineth winde manner winde cold vapor drye resolued departed earth water heate incorporation putting oouing aire strongly men put cause winde clowdes aire moue thrust heauinesse waight shooueth hether thether mouing putting shaking clowdes commeth winde tell winde gendred beating together armes sea foure part land south arme ye sea beateth striueth north sea moueth eastward mouing thereof aire moued therof commeth winde called subsolanus southeast wind beateth striueth west commeth winde called zephirus west wind againward east arme west arme beate striue south commeth winde called auster north commeth winde named boreas middle ebbing flowing sea say side windes gendred yet men tell beda saith den earth commeth wind manner aire slipperie kinde therefore entreth commeth dennes earth passeth thereof part inforeeth come h stuffing strife aire moued therof commeth wind therfore e lia regio called kingdome windes countrie full den vnder ye earth aristotle alloweth first reason generation windes metheorum saith two kindes vapour dra en heate vp earth one moyst matter raine water either lesse thinne vapour drye matter windes whereof soeuer wind gendred know winde mouable resting shufting aire maketh therin mouing shufting also winde maketh tempest stormes sea ayre also winde moderate contrarious shipmen leadeth speedeth theyr wayes againeward winde bee contrarious vnmoderate hee bringeth perill dread tarryeth letteth way speed also subtilnesse violence winde perceth commeth inner partes sea reareth vp great tempest great waues sea stretcheth maketh spred contrary country part also north winde colde drye purgeth cleanseth raine driueth away clowdes mistes bringeth cleerenesse faire wether againward south winde hot moyst doth contrary deedes maketh aire thicke troubly breedeth darknesse beda sayeth also winde findeth resisting let sheweth might stronger sheweth strength violence throweth house tree withstandeth ouerthroweth therfore called venius isidore sayth mightie vyolent might strength much onely breaketh vp stone renteth vp tree also disturbleth heauen earth maketh great tempest sea sayth also winde clenseth superfluity humour wipeth slippernesse vncleannesse wayes made slipper fowle great raines made cleane fayre blowing winde also temperate blast winde quickneth kindeleth fire flame blaste bee swifte strong quencheth fire flame also arising winde vnseene hid gathering part vapour gathered earth winde wexeth sheweth selfe therefore libro meth said windes feeble arise earth strong afterwardes multitude vapor therafter gathered great multitude ayre also winde moueth slonte vapour commeth first vpward blencheth afterwarde mooueth rounde circle earth therfore mouing passeth aslonte rounde also strong blast winde beareth vp strawe small chaffe sparckleth powder ash bloweth stretcheth bladder entring also winde entreth commeth hollownesse part earth many hoales winde gendereth earth shaking cloased hollownesse earth shaken shuft put wombe earth thereof commeth earth shaking aristotle sayth winde openeth hole earth beast bodyes commeth inner part earth subtilnesse owne substaunce entereth cloased therin also winde commeth watry party maketh water arise ouer part thervpon also winde maketh ouer parte water holly vneuen water euen plaine aboue moued blast shouing putting winde isidore saith also windie vapor resolued strength heat meat drinke humor breedeth bodyes many passion euils winde closed stomacke inner partes gut breedeth gnawing full grieuous many euil passion sickness dropsie gowte manner euills also eares winde maketh whistling whorling ringing winde letteth infecteth spirite wit hearing pof winde orientall subsolane cap windes twelue foure called cardinales chife winde eight collateral side windes first cardinall windes called subsolanus men meane among men called eurus east winde ariseth east vnder circle called paraellelus equinoctialis sometime great patting shouing aire commeth passing beating earth water airie matter thereof commeth winde called subsolanus east wind ariseth commeth forth vnder sunne commeth foorth vnder circle called toerida zona vnder sunne moueth alwaye winde hath two windes collateralle wit vol urnus north east winde toward south winde called eurus southeast winde verse sune subsolanus vulturnus eurus coy vnderstand three windes east windes windes hot drye hot bidelong vnder sunne drye far ye east sea full far v therfore ere east winde come v hath moist humour cleane wasted away heate sunne euen east winde emperate heate turneth east northeast wind drieth thing tourneth east southeast winde gendreth clowdes constantine saith east windes wholsome beginning ye day come aire subtill temperate saith ayre east land country cleere pure also dry temperate betweene cold moyst therefore winde maketh water cleere good sauour therefore east windes keepe saue body health temperatenesse quality also east landes country plentie fruites flower northe west countryes also diuers requies conne eastward cater east sea better wholsome cleere meeting east windes beating rebounding sun arising water made cleere cleane second cardinall chiefe wind fanomus west winde ariseth west ouer ye circle yt called parallelas equinoctialis euennesse day night winde hath beside two windes one called circius west northwest wind called zephirus ye west southwest winde contamed verse circius occalo zep fanomus sl ot vnderstande three windes blow west west winde called p mu nourisheth feedeth thing gendred isidore sayth resolueth vnbindeth winter bringeth forth grasse hearbes tures west winde temperath cold moyst colde sunne abideth little west commeth v taketh heate nne beames western windes wholsome temperate ende day sun ye west purifieth cleanseth windes west country land haue perfectly temperate heate humor therefore water chaungable troublous beginning day digested sunne beames beginning day east land windes colde hot euen const saith third cardinall chiefe winde ffer southerne winde ariseth vnder south star e called polus iticus cause first wind winde hath two windes beside one eastward called nothus southeast winde westward called affric south southeast winde contained verse ar die medio nothus haeirt affricus austro meaning heereof yt three windes blow south south winde called ausser hee hath ye name hauiendo drawing draweth water southerne winde hot moyst maketh lightning grose aire thick norisheth myst heate openeth pore multiplieth bringeth forth much raine moisture isid saith breedeth tempest ye sea bloweth vpwarde beda saith also openeth pore bodyes letteth vertue feelyng maketh heauinesse bodie ipocras sayth southerne windes saith greeue hearing dim greeue head slow also vnbinding southerne wind vnbind humour moue inner part outwarde cause heuinesse wit feeling corrupt destroye heat maketh men fall sicknesse breed gout falling euill itch ague also southern wind riseth circle place nigh star called polus antarticus therein maye man dwell coldnesse thereof therfore kindly cold dry touching owne arising north winde bloweth contrary line called axis southern wind passeth torrida zona hot taketh heate yt cometh toward south wher plenty water place full vapour dewther getteth moisture among v hot moist bloweth yt aire ful ye foresaid vapor falleth raine putteth shooueth aire large countrie streight country therfore maketh aire thicke thereof come clowdes clowdes betweene v sun sunne beames bee thereby dimmed isidore sayth southerne winde hath many noble propertyes softe wind maketh soft hot moist giueth v raine dew openeth pore ye earth bringeth forth hearbes grasse seed nourisheth f edeth maketh growe spring reneweth parte earth chaungeth foules birdes olde penne feather dissolueth body colde humoures thicke exciteth come body sweat euoporation fumositie superfluity humor bringeth dennes earth creeping beastes earthlye wormes fourth cardinall chiefe winde called borias northerne winde ariseth vnder starre called polus articus shipmans starre commeth cause foresayd winde commeth hath side two windes one called aquilo west northwest winde east called chorus north northwest winde windes conteined verse borias aquilo veniunt et chorus ab alto meaning thereof three windes blowe north northern winde called borias hath name certaine mountaines bee called iperbore blowe thicke mountaines isidore sayth southerne winde prouince affrica called affricus hee bloweth countrey also north winde called septentuonalis bloweth parte north line called axis riseth watrie place bee frore bounde bee farr circle sunne blowe high mountaines come v place vapour may dissolued great freesing therefore northerne winde maketh ayre bright cleere beareth downe putteth pestilence commeth southerne winde isidore sayth great strength coldnesse northern winde constrayneth bindeth ouer parte earth water chaungeth tourneth kinde ise kinde christall hardnesse lesse three windes colde drye make bodyes harde open pore purifie humoures cleere spirites wittes helpe vertue digestion comforteth vertue holding maketh pestilential aire wholsome increaseth vertue generation therefore libr aristotle sayth conceiuing childe winde bee north child shall male againeward winde south childe shall female also libro cap constantine sayth northerne winde constraineth euill humour holdeth letteth shall fall come member neuerthelesse hee breedeth cough drynesse breast maketh bodyes earth rough clinkereth coldnesse drynesse maketh sinewes constrained smiteth maketh straight therefore hee greeueth member letteth working greeueth corrupteth blossomes flowres fruite smiteth vine burgen blowe spoyleth heardes tree greyues dryeth vtter inner humoures therefore noifull haue tisick drinesse renteth lung maketh pimple whelkes galen sayth winde colde drye commeth straight country large country maketh ayre subtill thinne cleere drye freeseth moist part earth water ioyneth vtter partes therefore called aquilo quasi aqua ligan hee bindeth water isidore saith clowdes chap clowd animpression made ayre middle many vapour gathered bread one body middle region ayre thickened togethers coldnesse place cloud commonly matter snow raine hatle clowde gendered manner heat heauen owne vertue draweth right subtile vapourable part water earth wasteth subtill partes thereof maketh deale thick ourneth clowde ayre thereof speaketh isidore sayth clowd thicknesse ayre gathered together drawing vapour fumosityes earth sea also lyghtnesse ayre putting shouing windes substance clowd moueth hither thither cloud kindly hollow many hole spoung therfore receiueth soone impression ener body therfore entring incomming sunne beames cloude representeth sheweth diuerse formes shape coulours doth rainbowe else certaine dewe clowde substaunce diuersly shapen colour gendered sun beames clowde hollow within figuration shape sphere heauen nigh clowde rounde without aside clowde hath certeine form shape propried clowde commeth aside halfe nigh another eyther confirmeth himselfe figure shape beda sayth also lightnesse owne substaunce clowde moneth vpward moneth swiftly slowly lesse putte winde also subtile pure vapoures bee clowde compownded shining bright impression sunne beames clowde receiueth clowd cleere passeth bee substaunce thereof gathered ayre fumosityes hee greate thicke clowde thicke darke taketh awaye v lyght sunne taketh sight bee set betweene v sunne also clowde sette betweene v sunne swageth bateth heate thereof therefore presence clowde pleasing reaping men trauaile strong heat sunne also clowde heate sunne resolued departed raine maketh earth plenteous bring foorth hearbes grasse seedes shedding raine also clowde full nigh mother thing gendered ayre certayne common matter diuerse thinges hee sendeth earth owne substaunce knowen reineth nowe hee hayleth nowe hee snoweth nowe lyghteneth nowe hee thundereth also clowd gathered water sea brought vp afore sunne benefit heat heauen tourneth fal nesse bitternesse freshnesse clowde commeth water sea neuerthelesse hee parred sunne hath neither smacke sauour sea also cloud profitable earth resolues fallen raine hee full greeuous noifull tourneth windethat cloud neerer vnto ye earth vnto heauen gendereth groan tempest sea lande also cloude hangeth high ayre seemeth ioyned next heauen neuerthelesse without comparison neerer earth heauen also meeting comming together clowdes setteth oft ayre fire ingendereth lightening thundering also sometime wind hollownesse cloudes commeth odeine breaking partes clowde departing part cloude maketh greate nd thunder also corrupte vapoures bee drawne vp ditch carteins corrupt thinges theyr incooporation substaunce clowdes nowhere shall great corruption pestilence infection also neerer clowde earth farther heauen quantitie sheweth sight beholde therefore greatest clowde nigh heauen seemeth least yt least selfe seemeth hee n h earth beda sayth also oft clowde gendered onelye drye vapour windy deceiuable signifieth betokeneth raine paieth nought winde whirling winde also rainy clowdes fall irily earth fall bee noyfull bround falt dropying meale giue great profit fruites growe also oft clowde bespringeth earth dropping wasteth himselfe ah bespringing hee bespringeth thing moysteth owne dissolution hee bringeth himselfe nought gregory sayththe violent meeting ye cloudes ye strong windes also one clowde contrary another hee cause tempest motion ayre contrarynesse mee ing clowdes commeth contrarye parting shoouing windes therefore beating clowdes commeth great moouing aire rainebow cap rainebowe impression gendered hollowe clowde dewie disposed raine endlesse many outters shining mirrour shapen bow sheueth diuerse coulours gendered beames sun moone seld gendered beames moone twice fiftie yeeres aristo saith also rainebowe called heauenly bow watry cloudof renuing rainebowe thirled sunne beames part thereof marcianus saith called bowe lyknesse crooked bowe sheweth round backe high parte clowdes beareth stretcheth manner horne corner earthward isidore saith bow manner thing belong perteine generation thereof shape figuration thereof vertue working thereof touching generation thereof considered substance thereof gendered shining rebounding beames light heauie clowde rainye also alwaye hath respect sunne full face ne euen afore bow hath respect therto also bowe ariseth circle wise earth euen heauen toucheth earth lin horse heauen backe hee stretcheth downeward ariseth roundnesse figure shape rounde circle cleere mirrour coulour marrye manner wise diuerse singularly singular rainbow cleerenesse b seene diuerse formes kindes shape contrary therefore bow seemeth couloured beda saith taketh coulour foure elementes therein mirrour shineth figure shape kindes element fire taketh redde coulour ouermost part earth greene neathermost aire manner browne coulour water somedeale bliew middle beda sayth coulours bee ordeyned togethers sette order aristotle saith libro meth first redde coulour commeth lyght beame toucheth vtter part roundnesse clowde middle colour somdeale bliew qualitie asketh hath mastry vapour middle clowd nethermost seemeth greene coulour neather part clowde vapour earthy coulours bee principall forasmuch philosopher saith yt painter may paint neither feigne coulours rainbow aristotle sayth cause rainbowe smiting againe rebounding beames lyght turne againe contrary vapour clowde brightnesse shining water shineth ouer parte tourneth againe himselfe rainebow seene sun beame day moone beame night sight thereof lette troubling ayre feeblenesse sight darknesse thicknesse clowde withstandeth letteth shyning beames rainbowe seene rainy time resolued superfluitie vapour straighted clowdes thereof commeth lyttle dewing shineth beame afore rainebowe shapen taketh thereof diuerse coulours diuerse vapour beame shineth aristotle saith touching vertue thereof working bow set afore sunne tempereth swageth strong heat thereof resolution thereof departing tourning raine dewe rainebow quickeneth despringeth neather thinges maketh plenteous shape thereof figure many diuerse coulours highteth ouer thinges maketh fayre seemelye betokeneth greate moysture ayre therefore beda sayth maister storyes fortye yeere dome rainebowe shall bee seene shall token drieng default element sayththat rainbovve shall seene yeares ye dome rainebow betokeneth peace accord betweene god world sheweth informeth bringeth minde god dome water passed also certifieth v sunne presence rainebowe sheweth side sun heauen rainebow neuer side heauen sun alway sunne east rainebow seene west againeward sunne south rainebow seene north rainebowe neuer seene south high middaye beda saith philosopher telleth cause thereof high middaye sunne euen middle world beame thereof shineth like therefore shineth one side another therefore point middaye rainebowe seene side aristotle sayth full seldome seene night ye full moone beda sayth falleth twice fiftye yeares aristotle sayth dew chap dew impression gendered colde vapour moist gathered bodye clowde neather parte middle space ayre meeting lyttle colde aristotle saith dew southerne winde bloweth dewe lyttle raine raine much dew southerne wind moisture gendreth nourisheth dewe northerne winde drynesse licketh vp dewe thrusteth togethers bindeth strong cold also moone imprinteth moisture earth cause gendring dew therein ambrose sayth calleth moone mother dew therefore night vertue yt moone aire dew ariseth vp priuelye commeth downe last seene sheddeth falleth lostly ouermost part grasse hearbs rising downe comming dew giueth vertue strength tree hearbes grasse thing yt heat day dryed wasted bowed downewardes night dew apparaileth restoreth maketh stand vpward also top hearbs grasse dew gathereth selfe drop though would vpward generation alway ascendeth hangeth selfe ouermost part leaues grasse also dew susteineth ye strength sun dissolued falleth anon working ye sun beames vanisheth away forsaketh vertue yt printed aire presence shedding yt aire leaueth openly effect vertue grasse hearbes seedes though dew bee manner airy substance subtil outward neuerthelesse wonderful manner strong working vertue moistureth earth maketh ple tious maketh floure pith marrowe increase corne grainessappe increase fatteth bringeth forth broad oyster shell fish sea mamely dew springing time night springing time oyster open themselues dew receiue dew commeth betweene two shels holdeth keepeth dewe holden kept feedeth flesh maketh fat incorporation inner part fish breedeth full precious gemme stone called margarita noble margarite iscommon pearles white quality sayd li gemarum also birdes rauens whitlewe feather ere blacke dewe feedeth susteyneth gregory sayth also dewe cooleth tempereth aire made hot heat day made cleere thin heate day dewe incorporation maketh temperatly sad thick albumasar sayth also dew withstandeth beareth strength venim venimous beast venim may shed night much day therefore adder serpent lurking among grasse hurt men passe little flowres grasse hearbes dewed also though dew seeme selfe sauoured water werish neuerthelesse might effect dooing sweete cause honny manna hearbs flowres cou try greece hony gendred flowres commeth dew heauen also manna hearbs said plato also dew gendred corrupt aire corrupt corruption place corrupteth thing dew insedeth tender flowres corrupteth greene corne eared gregory sayth corruption called erugo rubigo robigo blast vine corne also glose saith super primum ioelis ther said yt life brugus rubigo shall fret left caterpiller grashopper shal eate canker shall also consume residue ioe ver bruc broode long flyes destroy corne grasse hieronimus saith rubigo tender corne smitten burnt noifull dew care stalkes turned red foule blacke coulour mischiefe wasteth destroieth altogether stubble heyso far forth profitable neither meate doung men meane yt rubigo mildew raine chap raine impression commeth much colde vapour moist gathered cloude vapour quantitie substance ye matter dew commeth cooleth moysteth matter doth suuiosities drawen water earth strength heate heauen drawn nethermost part middle space ye aire coldenesse place bee made thick heat dissoluing departing moisture therof wasting fumosities resolued fallen turne reine shower saith raine called pluuia hath ye name pluralitate pluralitie drop isi saith falleth commeth downe dropmeale also rain called imber hath name imbuendo springeth tempereth earth maketh beare fruite land earth besprong raine barren farther dow raine gendred ye earth neerer heuen ye softly raine commeth downe ye small drop ye nigher clowd earth raine falleth swiftlyer commonlye greater drop also wind blowe vp sea gather much humour outer partes water bearing vp aire last rne matter raine ther much matter watry clowd clowd thick impression beames strong vpon clowd great gathering beames rebounding therof co meth strong heat last vertue yt heat clowd dissolued falleth turneth strong raine oft yt strong heat cometh strong raine beda saith also sometime great generation heate gathering beames rebounding therof ye clowds yt vapour wer burnt strong burning heat turneth red cholar therefore sometime people thinke yt raineth bloudeuery red cholar ha falleth blud suppose aristotle sayth raine water full constraining binding therefore restraineth hindeth flure womb constantine sayth raine water subtill light substaunce hath airinesse lightnesse ayre water therefore seene chaungeable turneth soone contrary quality therfore taketh corruption rotteth soone constant saith fresh sweet water abideth cleernes vertue raine temperate quality quantity agreeable ye time profitable infinit thing raine maketh lande beare fruit ioyneth together many chinnes therin aswageth tempereth strength heat cleereth aire ceaseth stinteth windes fatteth fish helpeth comforteth drye complection constantine sayth raine bee euill distemperate quality discording place time greeuous noyfull many thing maketh deepnesse vncleannesse slippernesse way path bringeth forth much vnprofitable hearbes grasse corrupteth destroyeth fruites sade quencheth seed natu heat maketh darknesse thicknes aire taketh v sunne beames gathereth mist clowdes letteth work labouring men farrieth letteth riping corne fruit exciteth ruine running fluxe increseth strengtheneth al moist euills cause hunger famine cause corruption morein beast sheepe corrupt showres corrupt grasse hearbes pasture whereof commeth needful corruption beast constantine saith drop chap drop moyst vapour departed dealed full small partes droppes bee greate dayes bee hotte partes clowdes bee departed gathered colde aristotle sayth heat ayre colde come thereto freesing water vapour strong therefore libro animalum aristotle saith fisher cast hotte water instrument takles may sooner frore sinke sooner neerer drop earth great againward littlenesse thereof ye roundnesse caused long bideth aire farre earth aristotle saith moist soft cleere bright doth moyst seedes grasse hearbes slaketh heate burning aire cleanseth purgeth ayre though droppe bee soft substaunce yet thirleth stone oft falling seeke within libro hoare frost chap hoare frost aristotle sayth vapour frosen else impression gendered colde vapour moyst gathered bodye clowde frore middle space aire coldnesse place time part heate aristotle sayth therefore hoare frost hardnes commeth coldnesse place time gendered coldnesse draweth gathereth together part vapour maketh substaunce hoare frost harde full great coldnesse hoare frost white maketh hearbes flower vppon falleth wyther burneth vanisheth awaye lyttle beame sunne tourneth againe dewe hoare frost nought else dew frosen beda sayth dewe commeth downe earth taketh colde night white kinde hard colde turneth selfe vtter part substaunce ye hoare frost saith haile chap haile freesing drop raine strength coldnesse wind aire aristotle saith impression gendered cold vapour moyst chased driuen colde inner part clowde mastrye heat haile gendered clowdes farre earth saith therefore cause generation therof vapour receiued hollownesse clowd vapour made thicke coldnesse ye ayre moyst part voide flye heate aire come togethers inner part clowde finding vapor gather part therof congealeth freeseth substance haile therefore ofter haile summer winter lightly strong heat letteth gendring hayle dissolueth departeth vapour suffereth part therof gathered togethers doth passing colde winter heate ayre colde flye put selfe within clowde haile small round commeth highest place aristotle sayth cause smalnesse roundnesse tarrieng abiding aire long time long trendeling commeth roundnesse littlenesse commeth heat aire wasteth resolueth watrye partes thereof haile gendered place nighe earth contrary falleth contrary cause haile hoist ousnesse winde violently shoneth putteth heate dissolueth falleth downe swiftly earth spreadeth vpon earth salt haile greeueth much corne fruites flower falleth ofter day night cause heate day driueth coldnesse inner partes clowde also northerne winde colde drie freeseth constraineth dew yt commeth downe aire tourneth substance haile beda saith snowe chap snowe impression gendered colde vapour moyste lowest parte middle space ayre frore bodye clowde meane coldenesse comparison hoare frost meddeling heate parte heate beeing closed substaunce thereof ouercome anone colde thereabout dryeth substaunce thereof softeneth taketh whitenesse coulour mastrye colde last stretching spreading part clowde coldnesse feebled heat matter broke broade partes splentes shelles feeblenesse vertue breaketh aristotle sayth snow gendred cold clowd colde haile gendered witnesseth softnesse snowe heate meddeled clowdes letteth partes therof may made thick stronglye gathered together snow harde dry water coldnesse constraining binding softer haile meddeling heate wombe clowde white mastrye coldnesse vtter parte thereof little heate snowe melteth water chaungeth soone hardnesse whitenesse abiding snowe vppon lande lande fatted coldnesse closeth pore earth heate gathered inward more rootes hearbs seedes inner humour drawen moore rootes gathered togethers glewe therby land fatted snow slayeth destroyeth wade superfluitie thereof nourisheth feedeth good hearbes maketh ranke also snow presence couereth hideth stinking place doung hilles way path letteth spreading wayfaring men tarryeth high sea snowe falleth seldome beda sayth cause thereof fumosities exalations thereof continually shuft sparkled wind blow therein mowe thicked turned snow resolued tourned raine mist also snow noyfull wilde beastes hideth couereth lees pasture sheweth discouereth theyr hauntes steppe snow time soone taken hu e snow oft high place mountaines abideth endureth longer time mountaines hilles valleyes low place hilles cold wind freely strong valeyes also valleyes low place hot hill high place gendering rebounding sunne beames therefore snow mountaines valleyes also snow melted strength heate moisteth ltneth earth maketh hard constraineth constraining coldnesse molt gregory saith also snow softnesse lightnesse substance maketh sound noyse falling earth falleth priuely softly priuy place ye aire setteth himselfe vpon earth spreadeth like snow swiftnesse fairenesse comforteth eyen behold therin men behold long dispearpleth appaireth spirit sight also snow water potentiall actual coldnesse refraineth bindeth fluxe wombe smiteth shrinketh stoppeth sinewes drinke snow water continually breedeth mestrual superfluitye great botch vnder chinne maketh member aston ed though sleepe soone gendereth stone ye bladder feedeth forth cold dropsie constantine sayth mist chap mist impression made resolution falling clowds fallen reiny water arist saith vapour resolued fallen shed spred part aire breed gender must ye neerer mist ye earth thicke darke cold found high ye earth cleere nigh sun therfore colde darke mist smitten beames sunne falleth downe turneth againe matter tame vanisheth falleth aire purged betokeneth faire weather cleere sometime mist corrupt vapour gendered ful greeuous corrupteth veynes burgen breedeth beast diuerse sickness euilles mist friend theeues euill doer hideth spiers waiting myst letteth wayefaring men pilgrimes greate mistes way vnknowen vncerteine mist withdraweth v light beames sun star therefore full heauy perilous shipmen beda sayth darke mist couereth sea occupyeth sternman doubteth cannot know whetherward shall stir ship right thunder chap impression bee gathered aire double vapour first thunder impression gendered watry substaunce clowde moouing shaking hether thether hotte vapour drye flyeth contrary beset constrained euery side smitte himselfe thereby sette fire flame quencheth himselfe last clowd breaketh cloud aristotle sayth thunder gendered beating smiting together clowdes sayth clowdes bee mooued shuft contrarye windes clowdes smite togethers theyr violent breaking commeth greate stroke noise aire called thunder among olde men thunder called tonitruus tonitruum hath name dread feare noise feareth men heare isidore sayth tonus sonus one sometime smiteth thing hard seemeth renteth cleueth heauen storme ful strong wind commeth clowdes whirling winde storme increaseth seeketh passage cleaueth breaketh clowde falleth greate reefe strong breaketh part clowde commeth eares men beastes horrible dreadfull breaking noyse wonder though bladder light yet maketh greate noise sound strongly blowen afterwarde violentlye broken thunder commeth lightning sightening sooner seene cleere bright thunder commeth later eares ye wit sight subtil perseuerance hearing therefore first sheweth light brightnesse shining yt commeth ere heare noise sound yt commeth afterward man seeth sooner ye stroke man heweth tree heareth noise stroke huc vsque isid reason isid maketh cause thunder accordeth somwhat philosopher yt saith thunder spirit windes receiued bosome clowds breaketh vertue moouing renteth partes clowde maketh great quaking noise sound thunder therefore heereto hee sayth thunder sound space aire runneth therewith libro meth aristotle saith thunder nought else quenching fire clowde dry vapour arreareth setteth fire flame heate aire closed clowde sodeinly quenched quenching noise thunder gendered firie hot yron quenched water maketh greate boyling noyse oft thunder commeth lightening hee greeueth much beda sayth scorcheth fruit corne commeth without raine commeth raine hee doth good sayth thunder mouing beateth smiteth thing stirreth braine feareth wit distroubleth stirreth co umpeth wine tunsegereth vvines se ieth beer ale aristotle sayth come breeding time foules greeueth egges maketh woman trauaile childe ofte haue dead borne child smiteth roe throweth high tower destroyeth high tree wringeth grounde alwaye hee greeueth oft strongly high place lowe beda sayth maketh manner winding rounde voice smiteth ayre manner running euen maketh sowndeth somewhat manner rowling hurling wheeles c isidoras sayth manner wise round sown noyse commeth roundenesse clowdes vapour winde cause thunder diuerslye wagged shapen mooueth vpwarde downewarde nowe forwarde nowe backwarde hollownesse clowdes coruscation cap aristotle sayth word coruscacio betokeneth diuerse manner lightening lyghtening properly called coruscatio manner lightning seene aire sodainelye appearing shewing subtill vapour set fire shewing passeth vanisheth awaye ayre without comming downe earth another manner lyghtening called fulgur fulguratio also subtile fire thicke greate lyghtening called coruscacio commeth downe earth pearceth thirleth grasse hearbes softe thinges philosopher tell rehearsed te cio phisice algazelis additiolightening doth also melte yron burneth lawne silke scorcheth steshe swelleth bodyes beast men among tree laurell least blasted fulmine chap lightening called fulmen vapour sette fire fast sadde falleth downe great swiftnesse strength lightening called fulgur lyghtening smiteth thirleth burneth thing toucheth multiplyeth cleaueth breaketh bodilye thing withstandeth isidore sayeth fulgurare ferire smite one saith manner lyghtening fulgur compownded subtill part element hath therof might strength pearcing thirling therefore isidore calleth manner lyghtening stroke darte heauen gendered bread greate vapoure compownded diuerse contrarie thing vapour arreared drawen vp set fire flame great strength fire shuft putte beating shoouing putting clowdes commeth downe greate violence hollownesse clowds wer firye stone lyghtening beaten together stone seene bright running ayre force strength burning flame though bee firye kinde yet violence moouing kinde fire hee compelled come mooue downeward beda saith comming downe hee setteth fire burneth hath name fulgur therefore isidore sayth also hee peareceth thirleth cleaueth renteth hee called fulmen hee sayth also burneth gendreth therwith full euill stench smoak falleth oft vppon high place strong summer strong winter lyghtenings seld pbirdes bee called aues deuie without way isidore sayth wayes ayre bee distingued certaine bird mouing wingslimited diuided diuide departe aire anone flight aire closeth selfe leaneth signe token passage flight foules bee called volucres haue name volare flye birdes flye wing isidore saith therefore bee called alites alates mouing rearing vp selues wing flye without wingslift vp mount loft areare themselues earth vp aire without ye benefit wing else bird called ale hath name alendo feeding fedde feedeth birdes foules heauen giueth meate flesh isidore sayth condition property birdes foules knowen many thing theyr substance complection substance bird foules made two middle element betweene two element heauie light composition making ayre water hath mastrye therefore haue lesse earthly heauinesse lightnesse ayre beastes goe land swimme water lightnesse substance born vp aire isidore saith aire closed hollownesse penne feather maketh birde lyght disposeth maketh able helpeth mooue vpwarde therefore birdes haue hollownesse pen multitude feather lesse flesh easily reare themselues flye vpward fareth fowles praye bee discharged weight flesh flye high wonderfull sharpe sight full bolde hardie aristotle saith li also condition birdes knowne generation haue seminall vertue kind pight vertue thereof kindlye moued increase kinde deede generation keepe kind order said aristotle li bird saith foules bring forth bird lay egges though cannot bee seene scarcitye beginning generation birde sayde commeth white meate yolke ten day generation birde full shapen part part openly distinguished knowen head greater body egge shell broken head shoulde founde bowed vppon right thigh wing spread vpon head generation member perfectlye made liniation shape member shell breaketh sometime eighteenth daye twentye day fareth hennes chicken come shell aliue beeing full shape sometime twaine one shell among twinnes come one shell one lesse wonderfullye shapen sayth liber among beast bee order generation birdes foules bee honest kinde order kinde male seeke female businesse loue found fight putte perill bee ioyned onely couenant wedding loue nourish feede onely birdes gette kindlye deeme knowe betweene sexe sexe male female except fewe whome kinde goeth kinde aristotle sheweth ensample partridge forgetteth sexe vnderstande distinction male female sayth male leapeth vpon male female vppon female egges come treading come bird bee winde egges take euill sauour treading euill stench also sayd culuour cocke old may tread onely bill leapeth vppon another culuour cock bird foules gendering keep couenable time springing time generation commeth birdes crie sing male drawe companye female desire loue wooe beckes voyce build neasts laye egges bring forth birdes birdes gendered feede nourishe bring vp office generation full ended cease song departe come together till time generation commeth againe also birdes fowles bee knowen place dwel birdes foules seemeth loue company dwelling nigh men hennes goose sparrow storkes swalowes dreade flye afearde conuersation men fowles woodes mountaines riuers marreyes theyr diuerse complections seek challenge diuerse manner place inhabitie colde moyst kinde vse marries riuers gathering meate making neasts sitting broode bring vp nourish vp theyr birdes cootes wilde mallard swannes whome aristotle saith kinde ordeineth wisely haue broade closed hollow feete needfull swimming maye breadth theyr foo e better put shooue water backwarde water shooued backwarde stretch themselues forward rowing also haue broad bill gather grasse rootes cutte bite couenable long neckes take vp meate calilier deep water also seek meat deepnesse birdes fowles bee hot drie kinde dwell mountaines high rockes stone birdes foules liue pray eagle fawlcons arist saith kinde giueth crooked clawes strong foot sinewy crooked billes sharpe holde strongly theyr praye drawe eare flesh easily bird fowles haue little flesh many feather full bold hardy may ye swifter mouing stronger flight aristotle sayth also haue long tailes subtill thinne rule themselues flight helme ruleth stirreth shippe aristotle sayth libro penno foules loue desart place wilderness may dwell anye theyr fellow put owne birdes anone maye flye beate billes driue theyr neast suffer liue theyr companye aristotle sayth fowles praye haue diuerse manner dooing taking praye take theyr praye slyeng aire reeseth neuer pray vppon ground contrary wise take theyr praye ground neuer greeue theyr pray ayre certaine wilde fowles culuours knowe well diuers fowles taking praye therefore see pray taker ayre flye ground see pray taker grounde flye sodeinly vp aire perill ground sure safe aire sayth also wood foules vse dwell wood thicke toppes tree bee milde birdes sing summer time sweet note wood tree thirstils nightingale sing speciallye time loue make theyr neastes shrubbes bush sit busilye abroode vpon egges loue theyr birdes bring vp birdes bee loue namely field vse bee therein gette meate eate continually fruite earth crane goose wild tame foules loue dwell togethers grounde aire go flie heardes loue owne kinde make king among bee obedient flye order araie fight somtime full strongly among theselues rent wounde pull ofte billes fighting reconciled flie togethers leaue therefore companie haue foreknowledge tempest weather see commeth gather crye ordeine father mother insomuch knoweth birdes serue helpe ambrose sayth also propertyes birdes foules bee knowen disposition member aristotle sayth decimo tercio foules accorde foules haue billes founde beastes diuerse disposition haue short billes broade theyr lyfe quite milde bill able take meate nigh haue long billes sharpe take theyr meate deepe place haue sharpe bill crooked shape needefull eate hale drawe rent rawe flesh foules haue property euerye foule hath two feete man disposition feete legges diuersitye found feete clouefooted foules bee strong sharpe bee able according pray hunting feete water foules close hollow broad bee able swimme foules long feete haue long neck flye stretching theyr neckes necke bee small feeble hee beareth downe flyeng generall euery foule hath shorte eecke hath shorte thighes againeward euery foule hath nauil whe bread foule wareth nauill hidde seene continued gut vaine within also property foules may knowen swift slow breeding bird culuour breedeth tenne time one yeere laye many egges hen lay oft hen couluoures hennes laye many egges die soone aristotle saith lib foules crooked clawes eat flesh laye seldome egges lay yeare except swallowes onely among foules eate flesh laye egges twice yeere foules waxe sicke sit abroode vppon egges fareth henne eagle sayd li eagle sore greeued wing waxe white clawes goule feeble many property foules long recken row heere needeth onely knowe among kinde beastes generally foules pure lyght noble substance swift mouing sharpe light flesh good digestion good sauour turning feeding wholsome also foules full busie making neasts breeding feeding theyr bird said generall shal suffice time eagle chap perteineth speake bird foules perticular first eagle hath principalitye among fowles among manner kind diuerse fowles eagle liberall free heart plinius saith pray taketh except great hunger shee eateth alone putteth forth common fowles follow first taketh owne portion parte therfore oft fowles follow eagle hope trust haue part hir pray pray taken sufficient self king taketh heed comint hee taketh bird next giueth among serueth therewith setteth neast two precious stone hee called achates one male female sayde maye bring foorth birdes without stone layeth neast precious stone called achates keepe birdes venimous biting creeping worm plinius saith ye eagle called aquila hath name sharpnesse eien isidor sayth hath strong sharp cleere sight sayde shee borne flieth vp aire houeth aboue sea high vnneth shee seene man sight great highnesse shee seeth smal fish swimme sea falleth downe anone stone taketh sodeinely fish draweth prays taken sodeinelye cliffe birde hotte drye kinde desireth prays ryght strong bolde hardye passing strength boldnesse birdes strength e wing feete bill hee hath sinewye wing little flesh therfore flight hee may well awaye trauaile comparison greatnesse bodie hath little flesh therefore hee hath much strength vertue also hee hath many feather therfore conteineth much lightnesse among fowles eagle vertue sight mightye strong eagle spirit sight temperate sharpe act deede seeing beholding sunne roundnesse circle without anye blemishing eyen sharpenesse sight rebounded againe cleernesse light sunne neither dispearpled ambrose sayth also ambrose sayth aristotle libro ther one maner eagle calleth almachor ful sharpe sight shee taketh owne birdes claw maketh looke euen sunne ere wing bee full growen except looke stiflye steadfastly sunne shee beateth setteth euen sunne eie birdes watereth looking sunne shee slaieth though went kind else driueth neast dispiseth setteth birde beholdeth setteth eie steadfastly vppon sun feedeth loueth owne birde lyke kinde though sette sight neuer straight steadfast sunne yet casteth eie waite espie praye gregorye sayth aristotle libro sayth cloue footed birdes neede sharpe sight see meate right farre place therfore eagle flieth higher fouler therfore buildeth neast ful high rockes maketh neast sure defendeth highnesse place grego sayth eagle dwelleth sure safe high place neuerthelesse meate shee looketh seeth lowe place flyeth highest vpward commeth sodeinlye hir bird aristotle toucheth li gregory toucheth super iob said eagle hir young bird newly hatcht vnmightie take receiue defie great meat ye mother sucketh bloud fleeting humour pray holdeth mouth putteth bloud humour mouthes birdes feedeth lyght meat till bee strong able receiue take stronger meate heereto austen saith plinie also age eagle hath darknesse dimnesse eien heauinesse wing disaduantage taught kinde seeke well springing water flyeth vp asre farre may till full hot heat aire trauaile flight heate pore opened feather chased falleth sodeinlye well feather bee chaunged dimnesse eien wiped away purged taketh againe might strength also sayth eagle ageth bill wareth hard crooked vnneth may take meate disaduantage findeth remedy seeketh stone smiteth beateth stronglye bill cutteth charge bill receiueth meate might strength becommeth young againe plinius saith eagle fitteth rock tree setteth sight eyen cleernesse sunne casteth eien looketh hether thether espie pray else beholdeth owne clawes alway gall full medicinable done collirijs sharpeth sight helpeth dimnesse disease eien dioscorides saith constantine also hath propertyes lesse worthy praysed birde passing heate drynesse therefore bolde hardie wrathfull strong wrath body great drinesse arist sayth libro decimo sexto eagle enimy innocent bird foules pursueth clawes taketh birde smiteth head bell hath lowing voyce generally fearing fowles sight hering eagle foules kinde dreade also foules pray therefore plinius saith gentle fawlcon foules vnneth take prayes yt day heare eagle perchance commeth great dreade generally foules haue dread eagle taketh pray onely aire dread lesse ye eagle taketh praye ground least eagle yt taketh praye water foules dread ye eagle foules yt haue liuing conuersation water alonely eagle goeth much kind noblenesse eagle take pray aire earth eagle dreadeth vultur aristot li saith eagle amachel dwelleth abideth nigh sea fast beside greate lake pond fedde birdes bee nigh sea come water happen see vulture comming afearde flye water vulture hath rightsharpe sight flyeth alwaye place flush water ayre land vulture taketh anone eagle long water stifled ye eagle hath one foote close whole foote gander therwith ruleth selfe water commeth praye foote cloue foote full sharpe clawes taketh hir pray ye eagle fethers haue priuie fretting vertue plinius saith sayth yt eagle feather done set among feather wing bird corumpteth fretteth thema vvoderfull true secret approuedly tryed string made wolues guttes done put lute harpe among string made sheepes gut abide fellowes also eagle hath claw steed sworde therfore sitteth stone closeth clawes hideth within fleshe hee hurt neither smite stone aristotle saith li foule crooked clawes bideth long vppon tree vpon stone kinde clawes contrary two thinges also right cruell owne bird theyr eien closed sun supposeth owne bird theyr eyen closed sunne also teach compell take praye birdes beateth woundeth hir bill plinius saith goshauke chap gosehauke royall fouleacciptre kinde eagle goshauke armed boldnesse clawes much kinde taketh quantitie body rewardeth boldnesse heart isidore saith sayth shee couetous foule take foules taking fowles pray called accipiter rapter rauisher also basilius exameron sayth haukes cruell bird take meat flegge ripe beate driue neast eagle doth hir bird shee doubteth least hardy comforteth exciteth bee bolde hardye take pray least bee full age shoulde dull idle accustome themselues seeking meate bolde hardye courage beda sayth ambrose also hawkes bee theeues aire onelye earth onely eagle bee diuerse aristotle sayth sixt booke first manner hawkes take onelye flyeng birdes seconde manner hawkes smite reese birdes sit earth doues know knowe diuersitye eagle sayde accipiter hot fowle dry poore charge flesh addressed diuersitie penne feather fairenesse fethers like stridge pere thereto boldnesse heart shee flyeth nowe vp aire swiftly high man see falleth sodeinly downe vpon pray breast sharpe couered little flesh thereof aristotle speaketh sayth lib sharpe breast better shee flight full broad breast moue much aire shoulde slowe flight breast fleshie sharpe feeble couered much flesh said strength ye breast clawes hir bil ye soone taketh braine praie gall medicinable profitable medled colbrijs medicine eien sharpeth sight eien destroieth wasteth white speekles eien doth dirt also gosehauke hath propertie gregory saith age shee feeleth selfe grieued heauines waight feather spreadeth winges beames sun winde south sodeine weather resoluing heate pore opened pore opened smiteth flappeth winges dooing olde feather leape newe growe new fethers maketh better state able flight two kindes fowles tame wild tame taketh wilde fowles taketh owne lorde wild taketh tame foules accipiter disdaynous kinde shee fayle anye happe praye ryseth daye vnneth come lord hande must haue ordinate diet neyther scarse full much meate waxeth fat waxeth ramayous slowe disdayneth come reclaime meat scarce fayleth seeble vnmightye take praye also eyen birdes shoulde ofte siled closed hidde shee bate oft hand beareth seeth birde desireth take also legges must fastened ge shall flye freely euery birde borne lefte hand maye take righte hand fed therewith accipitres fame hawkes kepte mewes may discharged olde fethers hard renewed fairnesse youth also men giue meate manner flesh deale venemous may sooner change feather smoake grieueth hawkes doeth harme beda saith therfore mewes must far smoakie place body grieued bitternesse smoake fethers infect blacknesse smoake fed fresh flesh bloudye men vse giue eate ye hart foules take aliue strong mightie take pray beloued theyr lord borne handes set pearches stroken breast tayle made plaine smoothe norished great businesse diligence dead men holde vnprofitable nothing worth eaten rather throwen dounghills alieto cap hali etusas glose saith super deutro alietus fawcon one bird coueteth praye right bolde hardie assaileth birdes foules much greater reeseth smiteth breast feete men meane alietus little bird taketh small bird thereof speaketh auctour aurora saith sparrowe hauke hobbie merlin obtinet exiguas alietus corpore vires sunt aues minimae praeda cibusque suus saye alietus hath small vertues strength body small bird meate praye men meane bird assaileth onelye feeble birdes vnmightie heereby seemeth alietus little sparrow hawke one called musket french el called sperhawke bee cap isidore saith bee called ape gendred without feature knit themselues together feete isidore euery one bee bringeth foorth two passeth double plenteousnes increase bee make among king ordayne among common people though put set vnder king yet free loue king make kinde loue defend full great defence holde honour worship perish spilt king king great worship none dare goe theyr house get meate except king passe take principalytie flight bee choose king worthy noble hightnesse fairnesse cleere mildnesse chiefe vertue king though theyr king haue sting yet vseth wreake kindly huge bee lighter greater bee lyghter lesse bee also bee vnobedient king deeme themselues theyr owne dome dye wound theyr owne sting swarme bee none idle fight battayle field bee busie meate watch comming shower behold concourse meeting deawes make wexe flower make cels round square wonderfull binding ioyning euennesse yet neuerthelesse among diuers workes none doeth aspye wayte take others trauayle neither taketh wrongfullye neither stealeth meate seeketh gathereth owne flight trauayle among hearbes flower good couenable bee haue sting shedde venyme among honny anye thing ouersetteth put lyues kinde reuenge defence theyr house also though feeble strength body yet full strong might vertue cunning bee diuers bring hiue thing need araye hony sprayes flower tree hearbes namely thing deale gleymie glewie bameth therewith hiue noyful beast entering hiue bee large make narrow straight gather honny first begin make house king shall dwell make house bee keepe hiue take waxe floures gather forseete gather middle feete ouer ioynts hinder feete flye therewith heauinesse bee knowen bee flyeth taketh heede diuersitie flower leaueth one flower another findeth therein needfull turneth againe hir owne place charged gather honny matter honny maye lyghtly distinguish feelyng haunt much gladly leaues flower olyue abide therevpon long time thicknesse leaues king may flye company bee beare rector liue male one partie female another partie dead male female one house rectours female much female ye bee hath storg sting ye male many male wtout sting flye though would sting sting yet may rector two manner one blacke red better good little bee round thicke selfe small middle though girded meanly rough bee diuers feeding fedde flower garden manner bee fedde flower mountaines fedde tree mountaines lesse stronger may better away trauayle also bee sit vpon hiues sucke superfluitie honie combes said thereof spider gendred superfluitie bee dye little honnie house forsake come house fight take away honnie therefore seene ofte sitting hole readie arayed withstand defend shorter bee fight longer strong sight eate much hony busie themselues driue hiues make honie labour also king seene without hiues alone haue great company bee king middle passeth three dayes passing ye young bee bee come flye hiues departe themselues company euery king goeth one companie happeneth one part bee set bee remaine goe another king forsake theyr first king goe king hath number king whome forsake doeth followe kill also bee sting dye right soone sting sting drawe place stung ye sting may come except gutte come therewith rectours bee sting seldome bee dye hiue bee drawe beast cleanly beastes therefore cleanse flieng hiue stinking sauour grieueth full sore likwise doeth winde also therefore great winde wardene bee shall couer mouth hiue winde come bee hiues stinke wise forsake hiues hap bee abide therein shall take sicknesse stench rest much sick throw put idle bee company hot place according winter time colde summer time man leueth much hony worke much thereafter leaueth little wexe slow worke hony therefore warden shall leaue hony multitude lesse lacke honny ease warden shall feede figges sweete meates least shoulde dye gather together striue within hiue token depart thence forsake hiue therefore warden must powre sweete wine hiue abide still huc vsque aristoteles liber si e also liber sayth bee make noyse styeng spreading drawing wing e falleth betweene wing bodyes also hinder feete bee longer theyr fore foot going may soone arise earth whe flye saith lib also sometimes bee haue sicknesse aristotle calleth ka roys l euill commeth little wormes gendered hiue commeth corrupt hunnie combes worm waxen make web like web spider hath mastry ouer hiue therefore hunny waxeth corrupt bee waxe sicke die also li hee sayth bee gendered seruice venus yeeres dropping many bee bread cleanseth spirituall member bee eat wormwood bitter hearbes make hunnie lesse sweet yet hunnie cleanseth stopping splene openeth liuer helpeth haue dropsie helpeth biting madde dogge look hunny tracttau de liquoribus propertyes bee shall ye finde littera tractatu de animalibus secundum pth et auicennam owle chap owle called bubo hath name sound voice isidore sayth wilde birde charged feather alwaye holde slouth feeble flye dwelleth graues daye night chinnes diuinours tell betoken euill owle seene citie signifieth destruction wast isidore saith aristotle saith li chough fighteth owle feeble sight midday seeth clearely night daye ye cause chough taketh owles egges eateth daye owle eateth choughes egges night owle stronger night day chough stronger day night fowles flye owle day pul therfore owle fowlars take bird fowles fighting bird fighting beast meat dwelling place crieng owle night betokeneth death diuinors coniecture deeme owle fed dirt vncleane thing hated bird haunteth temple night haue hir fill oyle lampes namely fethers beake seemeth lyke fowles pray vnlike boldnesse vertue bird fowles assayle owle lyeth vpright defendeth hir selfe hir beake hir feete hunt ate mouse reremice flye night hide thins wall daye additio kinde owles bee many gesner tearmeth solitarie one called tachmas greedines night rauener foure kind co mon first reddish browne full fethers greatest called asse owle fethers sticke vp side head like horne seconde graye somewhat whitish breasted finely spotted hath shriking voyce third kinde lesser browne colour birder make stales take small bird fourth least breedeth stonie rockes ash coloured read gesner pof culuer doue chap culuers called columbe haue name colore ye neck necke feather sprong many diuers colour isid saith culuers milde bird meeke haunt loue company men haue conuersation multiplieng olde time men called venerias lecherous vse ofte neasts conceiue billing loue use much lecherie therefore culuer called columba colens lumbos tilling landes reynes isid sayth culuers lay time haue birdes dwelling hot meate ready haue better birdes haruest springing time summer plentie meate isid saith li arist speaking kinde culuers saith culuer lecherous birde kisse bill treading old male may tread yet ceaseth bill often female leapeth vpon female male lacketh kissing billing cast semen manner treading sometime come egges egges come birdes winde egges birdes like culuers lay springing time twice thrice lay two egges lay third time second laieng corrupt destroyed also li saith part culuers haue two birdes male female first bird male time one bird hatcht commeth shell one daye morrowe male sitteth brood day female night first egge filleth selfe sheddeth twentie day first culuer pearceth shell dealeth male female heateth bird one time female busie birdes male laieth egges ten time one yeare sometime xi time xii aegypt male treadeth female one yeare also lib sayeth culuer hath birdes anone male ruleth birdes female tarie ouer long ere shee come byrdes sorenesse birth male smiteth beateth hir compelleth hir sit hir selfe vpon birdes birdes wex male goeth sucketh salte earth giueth putteth mouth birdes make haue talent meate male put bird neast treadeth also culuers haue propertie turtells haue areare lyfte vp head drinke ere haue dronke inough generally liue breed fifteene yeares huc vsque arist property culuers vsuall notably knowen glose toucheth vppon sentence oculus tui columbarum cant sayd culuer hath gall hurteth woundeth bill owne pere moreouer maketh neast dennes hole stone feedeth others bird draweth companye culuers wander straye abideth nigh riuers eateth best greynes hath groning steede song flye flockes loue companye defende themselues wing bill eate carraines vncleane thing culuer feedeth two bird culuer sitting riuers seeth shadow goshawke comming seene seeth goshawke flyeth inner place hoale hideth selfe sayeth glose vpon foresayd sentence constantine sayth viatico bloud culuer medicinable sayd bloud drawen vnder right wing dropped hot swageth slaketh ach bleared eyen hath burning dirt throweth neast custometh teacheth hir birdes likewise cast aristotle saiththe propertie doues culuer messenger peace ensample simplenes cleane kinde plenteous young follower meeknesse friend companye forgetter wrong feathered plentuous kinde founde therefore rough sooted doues breede well nigh euerye month culuer kindly fearfull seldome safetie shee hole stone resteth time culuer forgetfull therefore birdes borne awaye forgetteth hir harme damage leaueth therefore build breede place ierome sayth also nicely curious sitting tree beholdeth looketh toward part fly bendeth hir necke taking aduisement oft taketh aduisement flight ere taketh hir flight arrowe flyeth thorough hir body therefore fayleth hir purpose long doe performed due time gregory sayth also sayd dietis perticularibus culuer flesh hard digest gleymie therefore giueth great nourishing thicke namely flesh young culuers begin flye mouing trauayle looseth much heauinesse flesh made light able digest elder ye harder worse digest worse nourishing giueth body also sometime culuour found faught beguile despise wilde culuours leadeth net deceiue stilye goeth fowler net suffreth selfe caught wrapped therein draweth toward meate wer liknes friendship feeding draweth grin destruction also ambrose sayth aegypt syria culuer taught beare letter messenger one prouince another loueth kindly place dwelling wher first fed nourished neuer farre borne farre country alway returne home againe restored freedome oft culuer letter craftely bound vnder one wing let go flieth vp aire ceaseth neuer till come ye first place bred sometime way enemy know thereof letteth arrowe letter beareth wounded slaine beareth letter without perill ofte letter borne cause occasion death additio doues likewise diuers sortes stockdoue woodcoyst house doue turtle doue common flesh doues contrarye body grieued goute cause ache bone heate bloud ripen postumate humoures flesh splitted hot layd anye part bodye draweth humour phisition pof curlewe chap curlewes called cotumices haue name sownd voyce certaine birdes greekes call ortigias wer first seene lande called ortigia isidore saith birdes haue certaine time comming make lead flockes dread gossehawke see goshauk arise earth therefore called ortigometra also bird haue guide leader crane haue dread goshauke busie comforte leader leader ware warned perill harme taken gossehawkethe curlevv hath ye falling euill onely birdes haue ye falling euill man hath sparowes also passe sea wearie fall downe vpon water rest vppon one wing maketh sayle wing best meate venemous seede graines cause olde time men forbad eating hearbe called eleborus curlewes meate another beast eateth great quantitie perillous poyson beast haue broad wide veynes ye smoke passeth strength hearbe heart sodainly cooled dead curlewes haue straight veynes heart therfore venemous smoke hath passage bideth stomacke defied made subtill grieueth call common speach coturnices crebros veloci cursu swifte running runneth vpon earth swiftly birdes loue birdes owne kinde therefore euerie cry come together ambrose saith additio coturnix thought feede venemous seedes therefore wholsome pof storke chap storke water fowle purgeth hir selfe owne bill seeleth hir selfe griened much meate taketh sea water hir bill putteth hir harder hole hir guttes water suitneth hardnesse ye meat biting gut causeth put superfluity also bird easeth egs adder serpentes beareth best meate hir birdes isidore saith bird called siconia sicannia smiteth flappeth bill maketh noyse cane great reed saith also messenger springing time hir comming betokeneth noueltie time enemie adder serpent beateth slayeth hir bill sometime swalloweth deuoureth haunteth loueth company men therefore make theyr neasts house men dwell leane lightly first neaste except compelled ere go country winter fill neasts earth draw twigges thornes neasts fenne tempest winde breake throw downe winter hir comming againe springing time occupieth place defendeth neast would occupy female liueth male accompanieth page duplicate another seruice venus keepeth truely hir neast office generation male espieth wise yt female hath broke spousehood shall dwell beateth striketh hir bill slaieth hir may aristo saith male treadeth female neast sitting brood male female chaunge time loue bird keepe right great affection busie sitting vppon fethers fall male trauayleth meate female sitteth neast againward male commeth home female flyeth meate male sitteth neast ambrose saieth storkes flye ouer sea flockes flye together hot country passing crowes flye passe wer leading storkes withstand might fowles yt hate storkes sayd exameron though storkes eate venemous beast frog adder serpent yet neuerthelesse venime ouercommeth neither chaungeth kinde feeding nourishing venimous men beast vertue heate hath mastrie within mallice venime quenched also birdes haught haue feete legges bill full blacke swan haue ye blacknesse passeth away lyttle lyttle olde redde haue leg feete bill additioa storke shape like vnto heron biggeriall white sauing top wing bill leg red naturally enimie ye serpent killeth olde young feedeth prouideth meate breed germany house top said euery third brood put forth one youg honour house whereon breede pof crow cap crow bird long lyfe called cornix among latines name greeke diuinoures tell taketh heede spiengs awaitings teacheth showeth wayes warneth shall fall full vnlawfull beleeue god sheweth priuie counsaile crowes isidore saith among manye diuinations diuinors meane crowes betoken rayne greding crieng corax corax vearse meaneth nunc plenum cornix plumam vocat improba voce vnderstande nowe crowe calleth rayne eleinge voyce iangling bird vnmilde grieuous men dwell sayth eateth vncleane meates venomous lyueth right long age fethers wexe white flesh within longer liue blacke hateth fore ouer beast fighteth sparhawke gossehawke isidore saith busie greedy contrary eagle bird pray dreadeth touch eagle crieng pursueth eagle hath alway profit hir greedinesse somtime eagle hath made though gaue force sodainly smiteth crow bill slayeth hir commeth neerer eagle shee shuld exameron said ye crow crowes rule lead storkes come rout flye storkes defend fight bird fowles hate storkes take vppon battell bird vpon owns perill open proofe therof time ye storkes passe ye country crowes seene place thers wont also come againe e wound voice blood wel knowen signes toke shew yt haue ben strog fighting also said yt mildnes bird wonderfull old crowes age naked bare couering fethers ye young nowes hide couer fethers gather meate feede sometime olde feeble young crowes vnderset reare vp wing comfort vse flie bring member diseased state againe rauen chap rauen called coruus corax also hath name sowne throte isido sayth rauen beholdeth mouth hir bird yane giueth meate ere know see likenesse hir owne blacknesse hir owne colour fethers begin wexe blacke afterward feedeth wt hir might strength isidore saith sayd rauens birdes fed deaw heauen time haue blacke feather benefite age ye time fed vsuall meate carren stinking thing benefit deaw heuen austen saith ye rauens dead carrens goe priuie place isid saith crieng fowle hath diuers sowne voice among fowles onely rauen hath changings voyce fulgentius saith guilefull bird taketh away thing thee shly layeth hydeth priuie place also vncleane bird sitteth vpon carrens asketh taketh meate venemous vncleane thing diuinours meane rauen hath manner vertue meaning betokening diuination therefore among nation rauen among foules hallowed appollo marcius saith aristotle li speaking rauen saith onely female sitteth broode twentye dayes egges male bringeth hir meate haue manie byrdes sitteth broode twentye dayes many throw away bird fowles haue many bird throwe awaye also li sayth blacke rauen fighteth asse bul flieth vpon grieueth smiteth bill smiteth theyr eyen also sayd blacke rauen friend foxe therfore fighteth brocke badger small beastes helpe foxe also ther sayd rauens fight stronglye smite together theyr weapon bill clees wing ouercome obedient conquerour huc v que aristot also onely rauen layeth egges breedeth middle heate summer kind fowles ther sayd rauen laieth egges breedeth middle heate summer nigh ripe fruite pof swanne chap swan called cignus latin olor greeke white feather man findeth black swan olor greeke vnderstand white isid saith swan called cignus hath name canendo singing faineth sweetnes sweet song accord voice singeth sweetly hath long neck diuersly bent make diuers note sayd country called hiperbores harper harping swan birdes flye neasts sing full merely isidore saith marcius ambrose say shipmen trowe betokeneth good meete swan perill shipwracke alway swan meriest bird diuinations shipmen desire bird doppeth downe waues therefore hallowed apollo marcius sayth strength wing swan louea fond fayning svvanne singeth vvho hath naturall voice birdes haue hee seeketh female pleaseth hir beclipping necke draweth hir ward ioyneth neck female necke binding neckes together treading female smileth male flieth male batheth ofte treding doth female also ere take meate shall dye feather pight brayne singeth vsage beast steede groning swan singeth ambrose saith swan hath white fethers without mingling blacknesse colour hath blacke flesh hard digested hath bill manner bounching distinguisheth sight smell tast bill full blacke within inwarde full thicke swan putteth downe head water seeketh meate cutteth though nourished among fish yet eateth also bread meate throwen withdraweth giueth place fish followeth seeketh gathereth meale hearbes grasse rootes hath blacke feete close hole broad full able swim swimming vseth one foote steede oare foote steede stirrer ruleth himselfe therewith dwelleth lake pondes maketh neast nigh water vpon fewe stickes throwen togethers swan sitteth broode bringeth forth birdes feedeth busily bringeth vp couereth defendeth winges bill hissing man come toward signet swan putteth hir selfe among birdes prepareth make resistaunce ceaseth defend hir birdes birde great wayght heauinesse much flesh bodie therefore shee loueth rest flyeth seldome wilde swan flye strong flight neckes strayght forwarde feete straight backwarde great bodye fat tame swan nourished fed nigh place thereas men inhabite marcius saith pof gnat chap gnat little flie called culex hath name aculeo sting sucketh bloud hath mouth pipe like prick therewith pearceth flesh suck bloud accounted among volatile bee though haue body worme many feete hee hath wing flyeth therewith gendred rotted corrupt vapour carrens corrupt place marreyes continual flapping wing maketh noyse aire though hurred sitteth gladly vpon carraines botch scabbes sore full noyfull scabbed horse sore backed grieueth sleeping men noyse biting waketh rest flyeth night pearceth bileth member vpon sitteth draweth toward lyght gladly seeth lyght vnwarely falleth candle fire coueting see lyght burneth himselfe ofte best feeding swallowes gnat taken best beloued meate swalowes flye aire hunt fly called sciniphes vnderstand small fly noyfull sting scines greeke musca latine flye english therof commeth scinomia houndes flye fly land aegypt smitten isidore sayth scinomia worst kinde flyes greater bodye broader wombes flyes lesse flight full tender cleaue fast member beast smite wooll haire bristle beast namely hound flye hideth hir selfe sucketh drinketh bloud insomuch gnaweth flesh maketh swell botch pimple fareth eares old hound eares flyes gnawe make swell full sore wonder though flyes stinke right foule fedde corrupt meates humour pof cicada chap manner grassehopper called cicada hath name canendo singing full little throte maketh right sweet melodie shapeth wonderfull song said exameron additio falsely applied grassehopper maketh chirring noyse quicke moouing hinder long thighes scale side like edge knife glasse drawen fro maketh noise setteth teeth edge haue diligently tried bartholome heerin deceiued want experience cicada middle heate midday tree breake heate cleere aire draweth cleerely singeth also man poure oyle vpon cicada dyeth anone poores stopped may draw breath men forthwith poure vpon vineger anone releeued strength vineger openeth hole poores stopped binding oyle ambrose saith addition kinde grashopper consume greene thing one god plague sinne phenix chap phenix bird one kinde wide worlde therfore ignorant men wonder therof among ye arabian bird phenix bred called singularis alone isid saith philosopher speketh bird saith phenix bird without make liueth iii hundred v hundred yeares ye yeares passed feeleth hir owne default feeblenesse maketh nest right sweete smelling stickes full daye summer ye westerne winde bloweth stickes neast set fire burning heate sun burneth strongly bird phenix commeth wilfully burning neast burnt ash among burning stickes within three day litle worme gendered ash waxeth little litle taketh feather shapen turned bird ambrose saith exameron humor ash phoenix ariseth new bird waxeth space time clothed fethers wing restored kinde bird fairest bird like pecocke feather loueth wildernes gathereth meate cleane grain fruit alanus speaketh bird saith highest bishoppe onias builded temple citie heliopoly aegypt likenes ye temple hierusalem first daye easter gathered much sweete smelling woode set fire vppon alter offer sacrifice men sight birde came sodeinly fell middle fire burnt anone ash fire sacrifice ash abode busily kept saued commandement priest within three day ash bred little worme tooke shape bird last flew wildernesse crane chap crane called grus hath name owne voice cryeth voice isid saith bird grease winges strong flight flieth high aire see countryes toward drawe saide exameron bird loueth bird kind liuing company together haue king among flie order ruled ambrose saith leader company compelleth company flie aright crieng blaming voice hap yt waxe hoarse another crane commeth taketh office fall earth cryeng rest sit grounde keepe saue ordein watch may rest surely waker stand vpon one foote holdeth little stone foote high earth may waked falling stone hap sleepe aristotle saith also youth crane coloured like ash longer liue blacker anye goe amisse company crye seeke fellowes lost also crane knowe fawcon ye goshawke commeth turne vpward bils defend themselues well may sharpnesse bill additiothe crane indie colour redde plat head crane east india white bodied red headed greenish sebastian munster writeth yt crane fight samoyes shorte dwarffe like people c pof cocke chap cocke called gallos hath name gelding among fowles onely cocke gelded men old time called gallos kerned isidore saith plinius li cap speaketh cocke sayth cock flesh raw layde hot vpon biting serpent doth awaye venime braine good taken drink man noynted wt grea iuyce shall sure panther lyon bone cock hen medled gold molte destroy wast golde henne boanes venemous golde wonder also cocke hot drye complection therefore full bolde hardie fighteth boldly hen aduersaries assayleth reeseth teareth woundeth bill spore hath mastry croweth presently ere croweth beateth himselfe wing make able sing vseth late night crowe cleerely strongly morrow tide shapeth tight voice song ambrose saith cocke beareth redde combe head steede crowne beeing left looseth hardinesse slowe cowardlye assayle aduersary loueth ieolouslye hennes findeth meate calleth hennes together certaine voyce spareth owne meate feede therewith setteth next rooste hen fat tender leueth hir best desireth haue hir presence morrow tide flyeth get meate first layeth side hir side certayne token beckes long ache wooeth prayeth hir treading fighteth hir speciallye though iealous bill spore chaseth driueth away cockes come nigh hennes fighting smiteth ground bill reareth vp feather necke make bold hardy mooueth feather tayle vpwarde downward maye ably come battaile breedeth precious stone called aflect e like stone named calceduneus manye haue written heart say bu fer e capr ence cock beareth stone stone men trow lion dreadeth abhorreth specially cocke white lyon dreadeth white cocke plinius sayth cocke hee searcheth meate bill feete setayeth ouertourneth strawe duste hee findeth grayne hee calleth cackeleth hen also cocke dreadeth eagle gossehawke take theyr pray ground sowles pray spye wayte bird goe grounde cocke right sharpe sight therefore looketh downwarde one eye search meate vpwarde ayre eye might beware comming eagle goshauke set one come farre anon crieth hen flieth away hideth himselfe house among stone hedge saith also right aged cocke laieth egges last ende egges small full round wanne yeolow venimous worme sitteth brood canicular day bee bred growe cockatrice beda sayth constantine speaketh cock saith young cockes harde defie lesse moyst hennes also flesh cockes deale euill sauoures sauour wasteth away sod gut old cocke throwen away cocke stopped full gardeine saffron polipodie sodde fiue pound water till water nigh wasteda restatitiue medicine cocke profitable haue euil called cholera passi purgeth gleamie flumatike humour helpeth melancholy putteth great ventosity ye stomack abateth ach sore helpeth swelling ach wosen helpeth long feauer etike hee sayth capon chap capon cocke made female caruing away gendering stone changed co plection beast gelded looseth boldnesse voice song knoweth difference betweene houres night beateth himselfe wing araieth himselfe fighting sitteth broode vppon egges owne henne taketh vppon office female feedeth chickins bee owne leadeth clocketh hen calleth chickins together clocking wt hoarce voice accompanyeth hennes eateth meate feedeth fasted fatteth capon coward heart cocke moist flesh soft feather somtime foot broken compell sit broad vpon egges spur either made blunt else fall fat foot bound togethers head hangeth downe toward ground borne foot faires market constantine speaketh gelded cocke saith flesh grided cockes couenable fleshe fowles breedeth noble nourishing better bloud theyr braine better profitable braine foules henne chap henne called gallina hath name gallo cocke lyonnesse hath name lyon sorrowe chicken looseth feather feedeth chicken selfe shee findeth meate shee clocketh calleth chicken together defend chicken shee putteth selues stronger hir selfe also shee fighteth man defence ye
