burieng gripe coulour dark oker ba e breast purple coulour wing browne white talent blacke beak turning doth eagle higher lion hinder foot clouen stagge able carrie awaye waight two men stagge like beast fawlcon chap faulcon called herodius royall fowle desireth praye vseth sit hand beareth bolde birde hardye gosehauke hath little flesh comparison bodye hath many feather therefore lyght flye little thing beareth downewarde much beareth vpward gregory sayth therefore right lyke estridge boldnesse strength also much like thereto diuers feather coulours faulcon full bolde hardy sharpest breast strong clawes hurteth pray rising theron breast bill clawes greate hearted fayle pray first flyght reefe second taketh wreake himselfe wilde vnneth day seeketh praye hee tame shame flyeth aboute ayre vnneth commeth lordes handes holdeth himselfe ouercome put kind taketh foule flyeth gregorie saith foule bird commonly called falco fulica also glose sayth super spalmum among birdes fowles fowles haue little affection take little heede birdes said exameron office businesse feedeth owne bird seruice taketh feedeth bird eagle throweth neast vnknowne flyeth voideth carrion toucheth stinking flesh strong hunger may well awaye trauaile absteineth abideth till maye finde couenable praye seeketh gregorye saith additio hawkes pray onely pastime prince next idle person set inch pleasure ell thrift bestow hauks hound would suffice twice many poore men sometime taking one pray vi ye charge much wonne stand twentie markes according olde prouerbe gentleman pleasure gentle fauoureth poore profit common wealth lasciuiously spendeth one yeere parent got referre prudent swallow chap swallow called hirundo arundo ab aere hath name ayre hee taketh meate sitting flyeng ayre isidore saith crieng fowle flyeth euen hether thether sometime busie making neastes feeding bird saith also making neasts swallow cunning vnneth man wit sufficient make matter worke swallow maketh shapeth claye onely bill moreouer swallowe full feather lyghtest swiftest flight foules therefore fowles reeseth distroubleth swallow neither swallow pray birdes flieth ouer sea hot countryes countryes abideth winter men suppose also keepe certain time comming going againe comming token springing time witnesse faire summer resplendishing weather ambrose saith libro sexto aristotle sayth speaking swallowe li wilde fowle treadeth laieth egges yeare except swallowe layeth egges twice yere somtime first egges broke coldnesse winter latter egges complete bring forth bird also sayd birdes eate flesh lay egges twice yeere except swallowe hath sometime birdes twice yeare also sayd yt man put young swallowes eien yet eien come agayne shee fetcheth hearbe called celidonia baumeth eien bird iuyce thereof eien restored againe macro saith proued addition toke effect yet founde stone straunge coulours also swallow wombe two stone sound one whitish called female red called male hee vertuous white stone bee called celidonij bee precious stone namelye taken bird ere touch ground sayde lapida e vertues described constanine saith bloud drawen vnder right wing medicinable eyen bloud doue durt full hot full gnawing therefore greeueth eien swallowe techeth bird throw durt ye neast two manner swallowes great body haue blacke ridge red breast white wombes loue men companye make neasts men house bee lesse bodye haue blacke breast make neasts hole chin roches rockes fast water kindes make neasts earth clay theyr tayles bee forked payre sheeres called martines addition good eate also saide among swallowes one manner kinde fowles dread kinde yea ye eagle goshauke dread flie ye swallow enimie dare fall pray see ye swallow dreade biting peraduenture venimous plinius sayth swallowes fight agaynst sparrowes come neasts driue biting scratching additio called sea swallowe big bodied thrush short legged meruailous swiftnesse blacke sauing th toward legges gray kaladrius chap philosopher saith birde called kaladrius white coulour hath parte blacknesse neather part leg cleanseth purgeth dimnesse eyen kinde man helde great sicknesse birde kaladrius turneth away face sick without doubt man shall die sicke man shal escape bird kaladrius setteth sight beholdeth fauning pleasing bird bird called calandra singeth thrustle glose saith deut said calaudreon another calundre c additio gesner sayth calandra small bird like larke supposed woode larke doctor turnar singing anye man feete lyeng sick made tame may heereafter better knowne larus cap bird called larus inhabiteth somtime water somtime land therfore aurora written latus est fluminis habitator et incola terrae nunc natat vt pisces nunc volat inslar auis vnderstand larus dwelleth riuers lande swimmeth fishe also flyeth bird addition taken sea cobbe birdes kinde gesner locusta chap locusta hath name hath long legges shaft speare therefore greekes call hastagion isidore sayth wormes called locust haue king yet passe forth ordinatly companyes sayde prouerbiorum eate eateth lesse bee seene summer hidde winter hinder leg longer fore leg glose sayth super ioel first hee young hee athalabus afterwarde wing bee growen made locusta greeueth youth athelabus age locusta hath square mouth sting steede taile crooked solding legges eate burgenings tree hearbes gnawe gendered southerne winde excited flight die northerne wind leaping areare themselues rearing fall fatted flower almons also worme locusta part wombe therefore hath neuer meate inough hath one gut alwaye full filth vncleannesse alway hungred liueth findeth anye thing greene gnaweth cesaeth little colde falleth dead quickeneth againe heate ye sun dirt wormes gendered additio straunge kinde flie hath long hinder legges grashopper burneth corne touching deuoureth residue india three foote length people country doe eate cooper coote chap coote called mergulus hath name oft dopping plunging oft putting downe head water dopping vnder hee sheweth signes token weather comming tempest sea flyeth crieng shoare betokeneth certeinly full strong tempest sea cootes flie crieng shore isidore sayth coot maketh neast close root reed vpon stickes feedeth nourisheth bird wonderfull affection loue kinde anone hatcht follow dam dread flie vp diuers waues sea hunt gather water wormes fish fill womb winter scarcitie mouing fat summer freedome flight poore flesh fatnesse pursued rauishing bird flie water deliuered manner plunging diuing addition coote blacke legges grey flesh grose kite cap kite weake flight stregth therefore called miluus quasi molliter volans wer weakly flieng borne vp aboue aire light feather hooueth vnmouable flieng seemeth vnneth moueth aire softe touching bird may well away trauaile therefore taketh cuckoes vpon shoulder beareth least faile space long wayes bringeth ye country spaine many secret nature knowen yet doubtful isid saith rauishing foule hardy among small bird coward fearefull among great birdes dreadeth lie waite take wilde birdes dreadeth lye waite take tame birdes lyeth oft waite take chickins findeth vnware saieth eateth carrion vncleane thing little meate fill tho womb fleeth ayre taken sparhauke faintnesse towardnesse hee ouercome birde lesse youth seemeth difference betweene kite birdes praye longer hee liueth sheweth kinde vnkinde manner kite taketh bird beginning afterward eateth gut beast taketh vnneth afterwardflyesthe bussard wherof kind one haunteth vvarrens park co mon small wormes aristotle saith dieth hunger last cruell fowle bird sorry seeth fat make leane beateth bill withdraweth meate hath voice plaining moane messenger hunger hee hungereth hee seeketh meate weeping voyce plaining moane night crowe cap night crowe called nicticorax hath name loueth night flyeth seeketh meale night crieth seeking crye hatefull odious birdes isidore sayth birde flyeth lyght maye see sunne haunteth dwelleth burial place dead men make neasts wall place chinnes hoales eate egges doues chough fight also birde called noctua sharply seeing night night maye see shining sunne commeth sight dim iland creta hath birde hee commeth thether land dyeth anon isidore saith additio kinde owle dogge footed couered haire eye glistering ise death hee vseth straunge whoup another kinde night rauen blacke bignesse doue flat headed groweth three long feather like coppe lapwing bill gray vsing sharpe voice whose vnaccustomed appearaunce betokeneth mortalitye prayeth mouse weesells like miredromble chap miredromble called onacrocalus bird maketh noyse winter hath small chin iawes hee taketh first meate sendeth second wombe hath two wombes one onelye hee taketh meate onely seetheth defieth first taken steed crop throat isidore saith greeke onacrocalus called birde long bill two manner kindes one water foule foule desart dwelleth water bird great gluttonye putteth bill downe water maketh greate noise enimie namely eeles pray hee taketh swalloweth sodeinly sedeth wombe cheweth moueth iawes held meate mouth bird resteth cliffe turneth vpward bellye saue reese goshauke maye manner safelye rest sleepe isidore sayth additioof kindes cormorant diuerse whereof one called onocrotalus bigge swan putting head water brayeth like asse water fowles diuerse sortes heere omitted hinderance author mallard ducke bitter wigen teale puffin barnacle bargander gulles twite wilde goose sheldrake many others pellican chap pellican birde called porphitio leui deut birde aegypt dwelleth desart beside riuer nilus accounted among vncleane birdes lawe leuit two manner pellicans one dwelleth water eateth fish dwelleth land loueth wildernesse eateth venimous beast lisardes pellican eateth plungeth water foote hath plunged water puteth mouth soot hand pellican popiniay among foules vse foote steed hand also pellican glose speaketh super psalmum plinius saith manner pellican loueth much child child bee haught begin waxe hoare smite father mother face wherfore mother smiteth againe slaieth thirde daye mother smiteth selfe side bloud runneth sheddeth hot bloud vppon body child vertue bloud birdes dead quicken againe glose vpon place psalmepsa factus sum sicut pellicanus sayd pellican slayeth birdes bill maketh sorrowe three dayes sheddeth hot bloud vppon maketh aliue againe yt manner magister iacobus de vitriaco li de mirabilibua orientalium regionum telleth another cause death pellicanes birdes hee sayth aegypt bird yt called pellicanus birde greate wing leane swalloweth passeth forth anone behinde hee hath right slipper gut therefore hee maye holde meate till incorporate serpent hateth kindlye birde wherfore mother passeth neast get meate serpent climeth tree stingeth infecteth birdes commeth agayne shee maketh sorrowe three dayes birdes sayde sayth shee smiteth selfe breast bringeth bloud vppon reareth death lyfe greate bleeding mother waxeth feeble birdes bee compelled passe neast gette themselues meate kinde loue feede mother feeble vnkinde care mother mother taketh good heede thereto commeth strength nourisheth loueth birdes fedde need putteth away birdes vnworthye vnkinde suffereth dwel liue partridge chap partridge called perdix hath name owne voice isidore saith vncleane bird male lepeth vp treadeth male strong liking lechery forgetteth sexe distinction male female isidore sayth guilefull one stealeth egges sitteth abrood fraude hath fruite birdes bee haught heare voice owne mother forsake brooded egges kept owne birdes tourne followe theyr owne mother naturall isidore sayth ambrose also partridge trauaileth layeng brooding lyke foules doe arist saith fowles sayth breed gender lightly partridge ye mother partridge flieth hunter till birdes flowen bird flowen shee damme flyeth calleth birdes young partridge soone hatcht follows damme seeke meat partridge hath fethers much flesh therefore feeble flight flight riseth little ground falleth oft ground little also ye partridge dreadeth ye sparhauk flieth long hee seeth sparhauke aire riseth fro ye earth aire noise ringing little bell flyeth vppon ground falleth net grinne ere ware plinius lib ca saith partridge gull euen weight honnie cleereth much sight therefore shall bee kept siluer boxe theyr eyen hony sod brasen vessell helpe heale pimple eien additio phesant also delicate foule beautie ow ell w dainty goodwille ile eiery welar many smaller sort bed property landes pecocke chap pecocke called p e hath name sounde voice flesh harde vnneth rotteth full hard soothing isidore saith aristotle sayth pecocke liueth twentie yeare hath chicken end three yeeres wing bee couloured pehen sitteth abroode thirtye dayes little soone shelles cloue hath chicken yeare layeth twelue egges lesse pecocke leeseth fethers first tree leeseth leaues fethers grow first leaues begin grow tree aristotle saith pecock bird loueth young male searcheth female seeketh egges breake may occupy lecherie female dreadeth hideth busily egges least pecocke might soone find arist sayth pecocke hath vnstedfast euill shapen head head serpent crest hath simple pace small necke areared blew breast taile ful bewty distinguished high wonderful fairenesse hath foulest foot riueled wondereth fairenesse fethers areareth vp circle head looketh foot seeth foulenesse feete lyke wer ashamed letteth fethers fall sodeinlye taile downeward though tooke heed fairenesse fethers hath horrible voice one sayth hath voice feend head serpent pace theefe lib cap plinius sayth yt pecock hath enuie man profit swalloweth owne durt full medicinable sold found sparrowes cap sparrowes bee small birdes bee called passerci patuitate littlenesse isid saith sparrowe vnstedfast bird voice iangling maketh theyr neasts nigh dwelling habitation men full hot bird lecherous flesh oft taken meat exciteth carnall lust constantine sayth sparrowes laye many egges full busie bring vp birdes feede maketh neast hay fethers keepeth neast cleane without durt therefore shee throweth durt birdes neast compelleth birdes throwe durt neast feede birdes spider wormes flyes eate venimous seedes henbane without hurt haue sometime leper falling euill female liueth longer male male iealous wife fighteth oft aristotle saith sparrow dreadeth weesell hateth crieth warneth ye weesell commeth waiteth biteth billeth haue neasts swallowes loue owne kinde birdes sparrowes leaue hap gather feed nourish theyr owne happeneth one taken grinne manner wise crieth help multitude sparrowes gathered togethers deliuer taken speede hast might additio proueth heate sooner wasted inner vertue cause gout leprosie hastours death estridge cap estridge called strucio hath name word greeke isidore saith hath bodie beast fethers sense also hath two feete bill foule weight heauinesse body flieth foules aire laieth egges foules neglecteth brood egges egges raken grauel brought forth heat nourishing dust isid saith aristotle speaketh strucio saith strucio making like foule point like foure footed beast hee flieth vp aire wing couenable flight making therof thin making selfe deale shape bird hath many fethers neather part body hath two feete foule cloue footed foure footed beast cause thereof greatnesse body likned foure footed beast foule hot swalloweth defieth wasteth yron auicen saith kinde wise ware thing graunteth strucio propertie lay greatest egges hardest shell occupied generation heat may temperate heat vehement shoulde cause die sooner property estridge gre toucheth super lob sayde fethers strucio like colour fethers ye gentle fawlcon vertue fethers haue likenesse lacketh swiftnesse flight spreadeth wing flie yet riseth vp fro earth clothed thinne fethers made heauy great body time come shall laye egges heaue vp eye behold star called virgilie pliades laye egges constellation ariseth seene ye month iune see star theyd digge grauell laye egges couer hide sande haue lefte forget anone layed come neuer againe thereto grauel chased heat sunne heateth egges hidde breedeth bird therein bringeth foorth shell broke birdes come first mother gathereth nourisheth birde shee despised egge shee knoweth come egge therefore sayd iob hee made harde owne child though owne palso estridge hateth horse kinde contrary horse may see ye horse without feare horse coe raiseth vp wing enimye compelleth horse flie beating wing additio fethers estridge plumage made prince noble weare hat cap furniture turtle chap turtle hath name voice simple birde culuour chast farre vnlyke culuour turtle chast birde hath name condition followeth chastity leeseth make seekth copanye goeth alone hath minde fellowship yt lost groneth alwaye loueth chooseth solitarye place flyeth much company men neuerthelesse commeth downe orchard garden feelds men eateth wherby liueth hath meate hee passeth againe high hill priuie place wood hee commeth springing time warneth nouelty time groning voyce winter leeseth fethers hee hideth hollowe stockes summer springing time fethers spring againe hee commeth hoale hee hid seeketh couenable place steede breede among thick boughes tree harde stickes knottie shee maketh neast layeth egges therein sitteth abroode hath birdes feedeth nourisheth aristotle sayth turtle layeth egges twice springing time thirde time first egges bee corrupt turtle laye breede fifteene yeare lyght vppon slinking thing neyther vppon carrion meate eateth carrion meate birdes seeketh cleane grain gathereth cleane place liueth thereby bird sing groneth birdes bee hot moist culuour birdes constantine sayth witnesseth heauinesse flight beginneth flie flesh made hot lyght better defie also bloud right wing medicinable bloud swallowe culuour doue vulture chap uolture hath name slowe flight isidore sayth plenteousnesse much flesh hee lacketh swiftnesse flight men tell treding medled yt conceiueth conceiued gendereth gendered without ioyning treading tell live hundred yeeres isidore sayth birde cruell owne birdes kite shee seeth birdes fatte shee beateth feete bill make leane sore beating biting plinius saith also sayth birde wit smelling best therefore smelling sauoureth carrion bee farre beyonde sea againeward therefore uulture followeth hoast hee maye feed himselfe carrion men horse therefore diuinour sayth many uulturs come flie together betokeneth battaile know battaile shall bee priuie wit kinde aristotle speaketh uulture saith fighteth gentle falwcon slyeth hee hath ouercome dieth eateth rawe flesh therefore fighteth foules meate hee hunteth middaye night resteth still sunne rising time hee ageth ouer bill waxeth long cr oked ouer nether dyeth last hunger aristotle sayth men saye errour olde time uulture sometime man cruell pilgrimes therefore hee hath paine bill dieth hunger lawfull beleeue saith meat leaueth reliefe hee leaueth foules eagle doth layeth neast feede bird getteth ligthly meate theyr neasts high mountaines thick woodes seeth fowle flye birdes beateth away feedeth bird till may flye driueth neast suffreth come nigh place also lib de almacar sayth ther manner water foule dreadeth uulture therefore flyeth water uulture flyeth farre thence sharpe sight waiseth foule cometh water taketh foule may also uulture much stinking foule vncleane flesh hard euill sauour heauye smell therefore profitable man meate carrion lighteth lyghtly ground alighted vnueth riseth againe fro ground gregory sayth hee flyeth high seeth carrion bee full lowe loue carrion commeth downe high country aire grounde sayth beast setteth vpon beateth wing winde riseth ground flyeth aire helpe winde owne strength heereto lib ca plinius saith among foules uulture contrary serpent fethers burnt smell thereof driueth awaye serpent heart thereof maketh man siker safe brareth among serpent wilde beastes heart bound lion skinne wolfe skin driueth away feends fethers bounde lefte foote woman trauaileth childe deliuereth swiftly must taken away lightlye least entrayles followe come ointment made uultures grease oile called oleum myrti waxe helpeth sinewes beast also right foot bound left foote healeth aketh left foote also healeth right foote tongue plucked yron hanged man necke new cloth maketh man gracious get desireth sayde boanes burnt ash medled celidonia giuen beastes healeth theyr euills huc vsque plinius cap saith bloud uultures hearbe yt called cabeon el cameleonte celdra healeth leper additio worke water called aqua equa euen resteth neuer mouing till ouerside therof euen isid saith li also const saith water colde element moist subtill earth bright cleane held owne markes bond water shuld shed fall naught except stopped held mark bond owne exameron basilius describeth ye property water general saith among element water profitable water maketh heauen te perate earth plenteous incorporateth ye aire vapour maketh page duplicate page duplicate thicke stieth vp high chalengeth heauen water cause al bred springeth breedeth corne fruit bringeth forth tree hearbs grasse wipeth filth washeth awaye foulenesse giueth drinke man beast water ioyneth ye earth pearceth filleth nourisheth heat heauen tempereth al ye nether thing neather thing te pered mouing burne wasted stregth heat water dronke beast leadeth forth meat feeding liuing flesh giueth spirit breath fish aire giueth beast ioyning bodie soule shed inner part earth ioyneth ye part therof strength great drines ye earth shuld fal pouder partes ioyned together moisture water also passing inward way ye earth taketh changing likenesse coulour sauour place passeth therfore water seemeth salt sweet fresh cleere troublous thicke thin water hath determinate quality colour sauour ye intent shuld able take easily coulours sauours therefore ye cleane pure ye water ye dark dim seemeth ye sun beames come therein giue colour hew moueth ye middle toward vtter roundnes stinteth till vtter partes thereof made euen part therof like far middle point ye earth also taketh light sun beames reboundeth againeward toward heauen hath ye vtter part mirrour sheweth kinde working light rebounded likenesse image thing seene therin face looke therin knowen seene therin mirrour also sheddeth abroad beames thirleth substaunce thereof spreadeth largely breadth therefore maketh thing seene therin seeme themselues generall property water many thou maist find exameron many diuerse water saith water springeth cometh aire raine water heuenly water profitable thing grow earth water spring walme ye inner part ye earth well water pit water water passeth runeth earth water riuers water beclippeth feed earth ye roundnesse thereof sea occean middle earth mother generall head spring water constantine sayth raine water selfe bright cleere thin light sauourie cleerenesse therof sheweth none thing meddeled therewith lightnesse sauourynes sheweth subtill substance thereof among al water best plenteousnesse ye earth namely falleth thunder mouing thunder smiteth vapour maketh water subtill cleere pure cleane water medled snow molten snow worse good fasting smiteth stomake riueth togethers breedeth cough setteth teeth edge constantine saith diuersitie water diuerse qualitie working thereof seeke lib drinke chap yee shall finde plainely declared open raine water well water best namely spring stone fall downe high well wel head spring liuing water springeth runneth continually priuie veines earth therefore well called fons fouens nourishing fundens shedding isidore sayth hath priuie comming veines earth hath springing rising daye wayes stone well multiplyeth water communicatiueth himselfe hee hideth himselfe nothing communicatiueth parteth himselfe well pilgrimes straungers men countrye also cleanseth himselfe thing well water runneth sad stone cleere cleanseth filth hoare also also well renueth himselfe altreth thing helpeth alwaye renueth water giueth benefice renuing altring thing plunge theselues welles glose sayth super psa also abateth thirst cooleth refresheth wayfairing men heate giueth thirst drink contrary heate drinesse also well maketh place plenteous yt bee nigh thereabout place nexte well commonly haue mo hearbes grasse floures fructuous tha also well middle therof springeth first vp earth casteth away selfe pouder grauell yt way well springeth walmeth vp violence mouing passeth ye earthy part departeth dealeth part part sheddeth sparpleth asunder also well cleerenesse myrrour sheweth shape likenesse thing afore therfore men looke well see therin theyr owne face well riuelyng speckes defile fairnesse seene water well also well qualytie time winter summer chaungeth owne qualitie macrobius saith winter well hot cold summer time cause therof winter heate flyeth voideth master contrary draweth inward inner part well presence heate continuall beating mouth well hot contrary summer contrary cause heate yt hath masterie aire summer coldenesse flyeth inner part wayes veynes wel therefore water springeth found cold time also highnes place ye springing water well sendeth water ye water led high pipe ye place spring water springeth well springeth ye top hill oft pipe water led ye highnes another hill led higher springing place except violence also though well little owne spring yet springeth continuallye originall cause manye great riuers riuer springeth well knowen vnknowen isidore saith also well amendeth water lake standing water quickning vertue wel litle springeth passeth great lake maketh water therin ye wholsome fish yt therin ye better point state also well taketh receiueth heat vertue sauor way veines ye earth yt passeth isid saith therfore well hot colde smelling brimstone ye diuers quality earth passeth isid saith li italy well water thereof ofte healeth sore eyen also affrica well water thereof maketh voyce well sownding singing also boetia two welles one maketh good minde maketh forgetfulnesse also aethiopia well red colour drinketh thereof shall anone wood mad also cecilia two well one thereof maketh female barren maketh barren able conceiue also idumea well chaungeth colour foure time yeare three moneths seemeth troublous tempered powder three month red bloud three month green three month manner blue men countrie call well iobs well also siloa foote mount sion well runneth alway certaine day houres also sardinia hot well helpe eyen reproue theeues euill maketh knowen blindnes also saith yt egipt well ye burning brondes quenched quenched bronds kindled also among garamantes well cold day may dronk hot night may touched huc vsque isidore heereof followeth well hath sauor kinde owne ground ground sweete pure water shall also sweete pure againward also ground brimstonie slimie water shall sauour brimstone slime well spring corrupt vicious runneth vicious corrupt additio englande water cure lame diseased bathe side pit water soone found substance water likened complection riuer water pit nigh another deeper pit draweth water pit lesse deepnesse gathereth water selfe taketh sauour earth ground therefore water shewed salt fresh also pit water ofte taketh corruption moued therefore make pit water cleane pure needeth oft moued drawen neerer pit water veyne earth colde fresh commonly water found also winter seldome neuer pit water freeseth presence colde aire winter time heate contrary colde put inner part pit therefore water therof changed hot vapor suffered freese founde hot winter summer also deepnesse place pit water got difficultie vnneth caught drawen without great triall crafte pof riuer cap riuer called flunius hath name affluendo running isidore saith euerlasting running runneth continually ceasseth runne head thereof stopped turned let know riuer euerlasting running deepnesse place winding turning mouing ofte riuer runneth ful long space country land also ye head knowen ye well spring finall end whetherward runneth maner springing euery riuer commeth originally sea priuie wayes springeth well head passe oft sea way passage knowen glose sayth super eccle pri sayd riuers runne sea ierome sayth thus philosopher tell sweete water runne sea consumpt wasted heate sunne el foode nourishing saltnesse sea ecclesiastes maker water sayeth come agayne priuie veynes earth well heades commeth mother sea walmeth springeth well heades also considered riuer corpes mouing betweene beginning ende also sauour sweetnesse riuer water driued end clensed veynes wels passeth spoiled saltnesse taketh fauour able dronke turneth sweeetnes isidore saith also sight faire cleernes thereof considered substance thereof taketh lyght cleere myrrour image thing obiect thereto seene water riuers also touching substaunce riuer cleannesse purenesse considered course thereof downward swift swiftnes vertuous beareth downe let findeth course nothing withstandeth rauishing thereof swiftnesse beareth forth course throwen therein el driueth ye brinke brimme moueth beareth shippes laden putteth foorth course moueth turneth full swiftly full heauie wheeles violence strength taketh himselfe hoare filth throwen therein swiftnesse moouing departeth disperpleth filth hoare riuer clenseth selfe place passeth reneweth water lake pond commeth keepeth corruption feedeth nourisheth fish diuers kindes clenseth doth away stench euill sauour changeth ye quality fish lake march also touching effect riuer hath many profitable thing couenable vse men warneth nothing benefice co muneth men much selfe serueth euen lyke men beast lesse cleanseth doth away filth vncleannesse body cloathing refresheth cooleth hot feedeth drinke thirst moysteth maketh plenteous place nigh thereto influence humour moysteth rootes feedes maketh great fat fareth aegypt seedes lye sowen garden fieldes take moysture riuer nilus rabanus saith super deut cap course city wardeth strengtheneth dwelling place bringeth city victualls merchaundises maketh men rich gathereth together heapes grauel earth maketh ilards also couenable place succour strength constantine speaketh riuer water saith riuer water best runneth eastwardthose spring vvhose current tovvard ye rising sunne wholsomest vvaters springeth commeth high mountaines riuer water runneth west warde lesse worthy also sayth farther riuere city cleane pure couenable feeding fish also filth hoare city cast riuers washing bathing siex thing riuer water sometime taketh corruption saith riuer water good runneth swiftly strogly vpon smal stone grauelly ground vpon clay ground sad sauory cleere taketh sauour coulour ground passeth therefore well name property riuers diuers glose saith per gen though riuers haue co mon head spring sea yet neuerthelesse place springeth vp country passeth taketh sauour colour name though riuer taketh self many water streames run thereto yet long proper well springeth lake leseth soone first name corporeth ioyneth himselfe water runneth therto name substance therefore though riuer little small beginneth spring first well yet ye farther passeth fro head spring wexeth running comming water streames doth danubio riuer germany yt called downow ye comon speach wherof isi li speaketh saith yt riuer springeth cometh ye hils germany ye west side litle well runneth eastward taketh selfe lx riuers falleth sea named pontitu mouth alwaies alike riuer profitable hee passeth bond brinke border brim sometime great raine melting snow water ariseth passeth chanell brimmes ofte destroyeth drowneth playnes countrie nigh riuers two manner kindes isidore sayth one called lyuing riuer whereof virgil saieth donec flumine viuo abluero c maner riuer called torrens water commeth swift reese passeth called torrens increaseth great raine fadeth drye weather greekes gaue thereto name winter increaseth gaue thereto name summer falleth dryeth course water full swifte strong therefore ouerthroweth beareth downe meeteth selfe swifte strong mouing runneth breketh earth diggesh maketh dennes therein gathereth strawe stone heape leaueth behinde marke token destroyeth way drowneth thing nigh therto falleth sea p amnis riuer cap amnis riuer arayed sette wood groues tree bush isidore saieth hath name amnis amenitate mirth place mery ther grow medicinable hearbes great plentie wilde fowles nestle breed ye course streame thereof wilde beastes take drink coole themselues burning heate nigh thereto lees pasture great plentie long verdure faire greene riuers holy writ maketh speciall mention phison gion tigris dorix euphrates iordan phison riuer called ganges also isidore saith lib hath name ganges king called gangantes riuer commeth paradise passeth lande eiulatha countrey inde called phison yt vnderstand fellowship taketh selfe ten riuers also phison vnderstand changing mouth chaungeth qualitie hath paradise three manner wise master saieth historijs colour cleere dimme wher troubly quantitie wher little wher huge great wide straight feeling colde hot riuer much golden grauell manye precious stone also cliffes brimmes thereof grow tree hearbes sweete smellyng medicinable amnus riuer iland dolica arabia addition pof riuer gion cap riuer gion called nilus also riuer mesopotamia commeth paradise called ioyning earth earthye troubly carthic slimie wosie ariseth far athlante passeth land aethiopia commeth downe aegypt moysteth playnes thereof super amos saith vpon word defluit quasi riuus aegypti riuer nylus disposition god moysteth aegypt yeare heapes grauell close mouth therof falleth inth sea moysting lande heapes grauell diuide fall away nilus turneth againe owne chanell passeth sea swallowed sea last riuer nilus feedeth norisheth many manner creeping venemous beast noyfull grieuous crocodile little beast called enidros isidore li ca saith beast enidros little beast hath name enidros dwelleth water namelye riuer called nilus little beast findeth crocodile sleeping walloweth wrappeth himselfe first senne wose commeth mouth crocodile goeth wombe renteth gut slayeth yeth also sup eccelesi glose saith gion riuer nilus troubly draweth much slime wose slyme wo e beareth course maketh land ouerpasseth full plenteous corne fruite additio gyon called nylus famous great riuer running thorough aethiopia aegypt supposed bee one riuers paradise called holye scripture gehon signifieth breast slowing foorth creature nourished milke soyle ouerflowing valleyes albeit seemeth vnlykelye forasmuch genesis written gehon inuironeth aethiopia mention made passeth aegypt albeit ye aegypt riuer nilus nigh moses wrote booke genesis aethiope also nilus famous vertue water thereof ouerflowing countrey aegypt made ye ground wonderfull fertill many yeares without labouring ye earth brought forth abundaunce sundry graines plant delectable profitable also beastes sundry kindes without forme generation especially riuer came deepenesse cubites likewise exceeded eight cubites succeeded much famine scarcitie cooper dictionarie nilus famous riuer world time sunne tropico cancri vntill come vnto equinoctiall line libra againe huge aboundaunce water doeth ouerflowe downes playne countryes aegypt altitude deepenesse floude aegyptians foresee plentye scarcitye fruites come polidore virgil first booke xv chapter pof tigris riuer ca tigris riuer me commeth paradise passeth foorth assyries isid saith passeth red sea many turning winding hath name tigris strong reese swiftnesse beast called tigris runneth great swiftnesse iosephus sayth tigris ariseth armenia well euphrates ariseth called tigl th tigris risieth ellan arrow vnderstand sharp straight runneth straightly sharply arrow therefore ye language persia tigris swift arrowe one additio mightie riuer runneth toward ye east side assyria gen ca pof euphrates riuer cap evphrates riuer mesopotamia commeth paradise copious gem precious stone runneth middle babilon riuer hath name plenteousnesse hebrue euphrata meane fruitfull runneth place mesopotamia moisteth land like nilus doth aegipt salustius certaine authoritie sayth tigris euphrates spring well armenia passe forth diuers place betweene two space lande manye mile land two riuers beclippeth called mesopotamia huc vsque isid lib cap pof riuer dorix chap glose super eccle saith dorix riuer hath another name called ar xi ar psi riuer armenia riseth commeth hist euphrates hath yt name sweetnesse might ouercommeth throweth downe thing waye isidore saith libro alexander would passe ouer made bridge theron riuer arose great strength violence brake despi ously ye bridge riuer ariseth lyttle head euphrates runneth thence sea called mare caspuim isidore saith called dorix among greekes part lande countrey riuer runneth language called lingna dorica glose saith super ecclesiasticum riuer seemeth arme tigris el euphrates el eyther springeth riseth well armenia therefore sayd hath plentie precious stone wel sauoring hearbs couenable medicine dorix vnderstoode medicine generation also saith commeth paradise mouing tigris euphrates pof iordane cap iordane riuer iurie hath name two wels one tailed dan isidore sayth li ariseth vnder ye hil mount libani departeth araby iurie passeth many winding iericho runneth dead sea therein swallowed wasted wheate ripe oft ripeth palestine springing time riuer ofte ariseth time falleth much raine melting snowe sayd histor glosa super iosu sayde iordane filleth drinkes brimmes chanell reaping time c ecclesiasti sayd riuer hath many priueledges first departeth country right beleeuing men country misbeleeuing men departeth iurie araby second departed himselfe presence child israel made way passage goe lande behest arke lord sayd iosua third washed cleansed naaman syria leprosie reg cap fourth diuiding selfe bare witnesse holinesse elia eliseus obedient commandements appeareth reg fifth agaynst kinde water hid bottome yron fell therein cast vpward areared prophet kinde lost might take read sixt worthy halowed touching cleane flesh lord meane thereof lord gaue vertue ghostly gendering water ordained sacrament saluation mankinde water sayde luc seauenthat ye baptisme christ iordane iohn baptist worthy see heauen open heare voyce father vnderstoode mysterie trinitie christening lord additio iordane faire riuer iudea deuideth galile residue iudea falleth red sea pof riuer albana pharphar cap riuers rehearsed holye writabanah albana pharphar riuers syria runne passe damaske course passing thereof garden damaske watered moysted made plenteous multiplication diuers tree corne hearbes grasse riuers written regum additio damascus famous citie siria supposed first euer inhabited riuer gazan cap gazan riuer medes hath another name called idapsis also hath name one yt king medes riseth ye east receiued ye red sea upon riuer two lynages halfe taken prisoner salmanassar king assyria held bond wer led brought among assyrian compelled abide exiled sayd reg cap two mages wer helde thraldome nabuchodonosor vpon riuer chobar helde babilon long time sayd ezech chobar riuer babilonia sheddeth himselfe marreise babilonia riseth tigris euphrates turneth againe riuer chobar one ierome saith super ezech part brim plentie willowes sodge saith vpon place esa vltra torrentem salicis duceris called riuer riuer babylon vpon ye riuer god people made ioye wepte made moane written water babylon sate downe wepte psa remembred thee sion many riuers right famous shall speake time haue mention bible additio idaspes riuer running parthia indie last falleth great riuer indus riuer found much golde precious stone lake chap lake receiuing priuy water water taken helde medled waues ebbing flowing isidore sayth li greekes call lake limum ponde well fall riuers riuers runne sea lake standely place floweth therefore called lacus place water isidore sayth water taketh springing running thereto passeth thereof place fish lake constantine sayth good riuer fish wose slime hee maketh fish breedeth therein smell slime fish lake breedeth superfluitie hearbes grasse nourisheth frogges many wormes running water commeth lake maketh water fresh keepeth corruption ofte great comming water lake pond broke hath bene long time therein nourished sodainly destroyed lake water thick riuer water worse drinke drinke oft taken gendreth breedeth many euills body said li drinke lake water taketh diuers vertues place ground gathered isidore sheweth ensample li ca diuersitie water sayth aethiopia lake wherein body washed shineth though annoynted oyle also affrica lake maketh good voyce able sing also italia lake noyeth greatly drinke thereof also water reatins hoofes cl beast made hard said lake called affaltides lake iurie nothing may sinke hath lyfe soule also euen pond nothing fleeteth sinketh drowned also concidie lake three daye bitter ofte fresh sweete isid telleth foresayd booke diuersitie pit water lake water commeth diuers qualitie veynes earth ground water passeth el kinde disposition ground water gathered pof lake asphalti ca lake called lacus asphalti also called dead sea greatnesse deepnesse breedeth receiueth nothing hath lyfe therfore hath neither fish foules whensoeuer thou woldest haue drowned therin thing hath lyfe crast gin anone plungeth commeth vp though strongly thrust downward anone smitten vpward moueth winde glewe withstandeth winde stormes glew water nt therin may ship row sayle thing hath life sinketh ground sustaineth kinde bee glewed lanterne without light sinketh therein telleth lanterne light fleeteth aboue place called lacus asphalti place glew called mare salinarum iurie betweene iericho zachan length thereof stretcheth euen zoroas arabia vii c lxxx furlong length bredth thereof stretcheth c furlong v que vicina sodomorum huc v que isid lib ca de lacu stagnis master saith historijs ca de subuersione sodomoru sine lake casteth vp blacke clot glewe therefore called lacus asphaltides brim thereof tree grow apple wherof greene till ripe ye cut ripe ye shall finde ash within thereof iosephus saith fabula terrae sodomorum fidem c sayd glosa super pe ca super locum illum ciuitates sodomorum cinerem redigens seruare voluit dominus regionem contra positam speciem pressione pene growe faire apple make men see haue liking eate one take fade fall ash smoke though burning additio asphaltites asphaltum lake syria called mare mortuum therein lime mixt wt brimstone called bitumen asphaltum wherein liuely thing drowne suppose place stood city sodoma gomorrha pof lake tiberiadis ca lake called tiberiadis lacus hath name towne called tiberiadis somtime herod builded worship tiberius emperour lake pond greatest healthful wholsome lake iury speedfull cause health stretcheth lx furlong isidore saith lib additio tiberias citie galilee iesus passed ouer sea gallilee sea tiberias fed foules barly loaues fish iohn pof pond genesar cap pond called genesar said greatest lake iudea stretcheth c lx furlong length lx bredth crispe water calme strong winde crispe themselues genesar word greeke gendering calme wether selfe lake yt stretch great space long moued ofte blowing winde wether therefore ye water therof ye fresh sweete able dronke huc v que isid lake greatnesse oft called sea gospell sea seemeth great water commeth iordan glose saith super io ca hebrues vse call gathering water sea therefore oft called sea additio genezareth great mere pond ye land promission called also mare tyberiadis whereon christ walked dry land called peter comforting disciple thought bene spirite math mar pond cap pond called piscina water gathered feeding fish though oft gathering water without fish called piscina contrary meaning isi saith goodnesse pond needeth sadnes ground also needeth cleannes water runneth commeth therto continuall running comming wheras ground fennie mirie ther well sauored fish may norished wher fresh water runneth cometh standing water soone corrupt therfore renew refresh pond fresh water led brought gutter conduit pipe head pondes strengthned wt bank wall water shuld passe soone also pondes haue streames water moyst garden orchard also neere pond tree hearbes fruitfull pof riuus lake cap lake called riuus hath name rigando wetting moisting isidore saith well lake stremes led wet moyst garden lake hath kind effect welspring head well running lake come riuers lake anselme sayth lake washeth cleanseth oft vncleannesse maketh earth plenteous giueth drinke beast foules nourisheth saueth greennesse vertues hearbes flower draweth small stone grauell pof fluctu wallowing cap sea vvaueswallowing sea called fluctus hath name flutu blowing blast putting shouing windes water moued shuft ouer part therof mooueth alway called vnda waue hath name vnda eundo going passing continually moueth resteth neuer isi sayth li wallowings sea smiteth together shoueth putteth vpward downwarde oft smiting together gendreth himselfe medleth himselfe grauell diuers particle ground bereth vpward putteth shoueth fish amendeth maketh better swiftnes mouing comming windie aire wallowing sea ariseth swelleth moueth vpward downward swift putting shouing wind moueth shoueth aire smiting together breedeth winde beareth vp ship putteth cliffes brim beareth holdeth straight maketh sound noise alway mouing may rest eyther faileth ful moueth sheddeth himselfe whoorlepits cap whoorlpit called gurgis deep place riuer hath name gutture throat isid saith swalloweth water yt come thereto throweth vp againe deepenesse moueth rounde whirling rebounding therfore swimmer oft perished also fish hide themselues whoorlepooles vnneth taken come whoorlepoole pof streames chap streame taketh ye first course straight continuall water riuer commeth well head leaueth chanell way beginneth run well head runneth continually within boundes chanel til come sea diggeth wasteth owne ground couenable row saile feedeth nourisheth great fish comonly streame hath fresh water cleane ground runneth swiftlye part ye riuer therfore draweth beareth forth ship boates full swiftly bundels tree wood therefore hath name trames traho trahis transmitto transmittis bring send hee draweth swiftly thing set therin bringeth ouer fresh streame owne course swift swift beareth forth draweth thing alluuione cap manner running water hath two name latine one alluuio ni name alluuies priuie still rising water hath name abluendo drawing washing washeth earth passeth breaketh thereof wasteth therefore vnderhoaling vndercreeping wasting vnder brimmes bee hoaled hollow water called alluuio iob said vndercreeping priuy running water earth wasted lyttle little strong running course passeth priuie hollownes brim cliffes perillouslye destroyeth wasteth sadnesse thereof part brim outward seemeth sure sad without destroying wasting thereof seene within therefore foote slideth sooner treadeth therein inward sadnesse wasted priuie hollownesse hid vnknowen seneca saith deepnesse cap abyssus deepnesse water vnseene thereof come spring well riuers deepnes come water turne againe thereto priuy way mother water isidore saith li therefore abyssus said abuisus vnseene sight deepnesse thereof may seene abyssus sayd sine abisso without cleerenesse farnesse well lyght without hightinesse fairnesse lyght iohn damascene sayth abissus nought el much water ende deepnesse thereof vnseene shining light stretcheth reacheth ende therof el abissus said wer sine base bottomlesse ground thereof seene eye therefore primordiall first matter beginning world ye beginning distinguished certaine forme called abyssus austen would meane therfore li confessionum saith abyssus bodely thing god made bee matter bodely thing matter forme shape without order without light abyssus thing materia prima first matter austen saith li de symbolis saith name abissus holye writ called approued matter made nought first taker receiuer shape ordinate gift god therof thing hath shape forme shoulde bee shaped formed matter named water fleeting running mouing also taketh receiueth manner formes shape likewise called earth kindly stedfastnes sadnesse subiect generation corruption called abyssus vnshapefulnesse distinguished forme shape called water ablenesse take vpon forme shape ablenesse might take manner forme shape qualitie aust saith also abissus yt deepnesse water hath selfe dimnesse deepnesse receiueth water lycour runneth thereto hath neuer inough taketh neuer much water may take maye neuer stopped laued emptied comunicable sea cap sea called mare gathering water fresh salt isid saith lib hath properly name mare water therof bitter sayd innermore sayd sea called eqoor hath ye name equalitie euennes euen plaine though wallowing waues sea wallowe arise mountaines hils yet ye tempest ceaseth sea plaine againe saith psa thou rulest raging sea addition thou stillest waues therof arise ver also sea called pelagus pellens vndas putting water waues sea continuall moouing putting waues stormes also saith though ye sea receiueth water wels riuers yet great comming water sea neuer ye sea great water run therto seene el bitter water destroyeth wasteth running water clowdes draw much water winde beareth thereof away sunne dryeth sweetnes water dryed clensed turneth priuie hole commeth oft head wels riuers huc vsque isidorus li ambrose sayth basilius exameron sea gathering water multiplyed diuers place name continuation one sea alway mouing sounding foming followeth kinde moone flowing reflowing whose vertue influence led sea head receipt riuers fountaine shower thing whereby people farre sunder may come together sea helpeth neede succour perills speedeth passenger shortnesse wayes furthereth profite winning traffike trauaylyng men also libro metheororum aristotle sayth sea head wel water dispersed sea cause sea bitter salt two vapour one moyst drye subtill watrie vapour moist thin subtill partes wasted mouing sunne thicker part abideth made hot salt bitter heate sun sweate vrine burning thing made bitter earthy part abide watry moystie partes consumed wasted bitternesse strength burning commeth saltnesse doth ash water soaketh ash salte cod li arist saith salte water sea heauie thicke fresh water sea water grose fresh water subtill thinne token thereof know egge fleeteth salte water sinketh downe fresh water ship falling fresh water sinketh deeper salte water therfore dead sea sinketh beast gendred therein drinesse hath masterie also li de animalibus saith sea water saltnesse may drawen thereof man take vessell earth new rawe closeth mouth thereof throweth emptie sea leaueth ther day night fresh water shall come therein also li metheorum sayth fresh water riseth vpward freshnesse lightnesse salt water falleth downward heauines salt abideth earth sweet thereof woseth also li de elementis sayth sea working followeth kinde moone knowen alway moone ariseth anye time daye night sea country wher moone ariseth stretcheth selfe withstandeth course riuers runne thereto shoueth beareth againe ye riuer water toward place commeth shouing violence moone lower course water beginneth wane ebbe ye moone ariseth water beginneth wexe flow yron followeth adamant stone sea foloweth course kinde moone seeke li ca also rising starre called canicula sea wexeth thick changeth colour greene blewe troublous cleere wexing moone occean holdeth order first day wexing moone copious time sea full high thereafter abateth lesseneth second day downeward day euen seuenth day sea last default ground ebbe beginneth againe spring euen till vii day moone xiiii day olde full agayne sea full highest spring beginneth breake wane vadeth vii dayes moone xxi day olde sea againe lowest ebbe yet springeth increseth vii dayes moone xxviii dayes olde sea againe highest spring alway euery month ye sea changeth foure time breaking springing twice increasing twice decreasing moone wexeth waneth alwaye sea highest strength moone full shining either toward heauen new moone el toward earth doth full moone moone profiteth falleth taking loosing hir light sea ariseth abateth ebbing flowing also li vegitabilium arist saith ground shore sea hard sad grauelly token saltnesse sea vpon grauell therin dry earthy part haue mastry salt existence water dealeth clay wose owne part therefore earth nigh sea grauellous among grauell sea oft diuers precious stone vertue bred gendred made faire clene froting grauel cast lande cliffes mouing waues ye sea yet beside property sea bee property knowen nigh men yet simple men thinke good recken heere arowe haue matter shewe hidden priuie thing simple men ensample likenes property sea cleanseth selfe throweth selfe carrens vncleane thing smiteth putteth vncleane dead strength mouing gregory saith also sea sheddeth selfe full priuie veynes deepnesse giueth alway water flowing well riuers ierome saith super eccl also ye sea bringeth forth wonderfull beastes fish wonderfullye shapen many manner formes shape ye sea bringeth forth wonderful beast wonderful thing doth ye land rabanus saith super eccl said yt passing noble wonderfull workes diuers beast c additio item psa ver lord manifold thy workes wisdome hast made ye earth full thy rich great wide sea also wherin thing creeping innumerable small great beast go ye ship leuiathan thou hast made take pastime therein waite vppon thee thou mayst giue meate due season thou giuest gather thou openest thy hand filled good thou hidest thy face troubled thou takest away breth dye turned againe dust thou lettest thy breach goe foorth shall made thou shalt renue face earth also though sea substanciallye soft running yet bringeth foorth hard thing lyfe without lyfe doth shell fish fish hard skin shell stone commonly precious sea casteth vp lande also though sea bee able neither lyking dronk touching sauor tast yet ful profitable effect saueth healeth many sickness heleth men dropsie botch pimple whelkes scabbes many euills constantine saith also though sea selfe salt bitter yet sweetnesse veynes earth passeth changeth sauour taketh freshnes sweetnes clensing drieng earth ye passeth macrobius saith aristotle also also sea neuer vnsaurryt bitter yet nourisheth feedeth full fresh fish sea hath priuye sweetnesse freshnesse sea fish sucketh taketh whereof commeth couenable feeding saueur ambrose sayth also sea mouable without rest owne mouing keepeth saueth owne substance perill corruption continuall ro ing made cleere therein kept perill corruption rotteth also though bee running standing selfe neuerthelesse stinted held thing passeth easily ouer bond cliffes sayde prouerb iere iob also bitternesse saltnes swalloweth withdraweth freshnesse well running water farther running water ye entering ye sea fresh helde also beating smiting together armes beclippeth lande breedeth gendreth contrary windes beda sayth also noifull vsed therin breedeth dread feare head ach spuing bolking withdraweth appetite meate drink also vaporation fumosities casteth vpwarde breedeth mist clowds maketh dimnesse darknesse aire taketh v ye beames sun bateth heat therof also though haue coulour owne chaungeth colour quality wind nowe whitish yeolowish white cleere black isidore saith l also sea conteineth selfe many perills little blast winde sea tempest stormes therfore sea called fretum isi saith hauing feruent strong mouing fareth sea yt called mare cicilium ye sea feruetnes mouing making noise criengscilla daungeion rock sea cicil vvhere came vvord decid scylla cariens vita scilla caribdis said scilla caribdis two perillous place sea many shippes bee soone perished scilla great high rocke sea hauing many rock head waues sea beate theron maketh horrible noise ship fall therin wise escape perill wrack caribdis called swalloweth shippes many priuy swallowes ther ye sea ful swalows wer flowing selfe whirling turning winding therfore draweth ship swalloweth drowneth thrice daye casteth vp great wallowing waues swalloweth thrice day swongeth water swalloweth casteth vpward may swallow isidore saith lib capitulo de estibus mari et fretis also sea another notable peril vneuennesse ground water ful deep one place another thereby vnneth water wade perill called cutis grauell gathered heapes cutis greeke vnderstand draught papias saith yt sea aegypt many cutis bee meddeled therewith sooth passing sea perillous priuie rockes hidde vnder water also heapes grauell drawen gathered togethers p ce shippes hassely broke another peril called bithalassum shippe laded smiteth ground hath much glow slime wose may deliuer self neither passe therof toughnesse holding slime wose hugo saith bithalassum slime ouerhid print left slime wose glose saith bithalassum meeting two sea maister historia sayth bithalassum called ye tongue ye earth straight hether thether beclipped sea called bithalassum sea departed earth betweene two part sea thalassum greeke vnderstoode sea shippe smiteth bithalassum foreshippe abideth still mooueth hinder shippe broken behinde strong swiftnesse sea falleth thereon ouertaketh maister sayth palso generally men passe sea perill aire winde sea sea many stone rockes hidde bee set beclipped greate rock passed without perill ground vneuen areared high heapes grauell nowe deepe swallowe eft passage let sea aboue troubly high wind stormes waues beting smiting togethers stormes wallowings wallowe vpward downeward perill sayle oft time ship broken drowned contrary stormes also perill commeth wether troubly dim misty ful perillous passe sea namelye shippe sodeinlye driuen perillous place perill knowen also huge great windes dread namely bee contrary windes arise perill dread breaking shippe ship moued put toward hauen blowing one wind driuen put toward peril strength another strong winde contrarye else helde long time daunger lost betweene contrary wallowings waues also perill commeth feeblenesse shippe charged perill safe saile shippe boate lyttle feeble broke clouen shippe boate safe among stormes waues wilde sea lyttlenesse thereof ouerthrowne ouerturned stormes waues ye wilde sea feeblenesse broke strong blast windes sunke drowned water commeth chin hole namely ship commeth slowlye late ye hauen namely good marriners lacke ship perill sea shippe hath vnready gouernour vnaduised manner perills manye men saile ye sea middle earth occean isidore sayth greekes latines call sea occean beclippeth ye roundnesse earth circle occean goeth spheere wee dwell hath name oceanus swiftnesse passeth goeth swiftly ye earth shineth manner coulour red greene called oceanus ceanus circle heauen isidore sayth lib sea occean beclippeth hemmes land oft commeth goeth ebbing flowing blowing windes oceanus remooueth sea bloweth vp though one sea continuaunce thereof yet coast countryes taketh diuerse name landes countryes bee next thereto french sea french men british sea briton eaddish sea hath name gades entering great sea occean opened hercules came thether set pillar trowing supposing ende earth huc vsque isid li additio sea water doth make powdered flesh fresh fresh flesh sauourie mari magno meditaraneo chap greate sea middle earth commeth west occean passeth towarde south goeth toward north called ye great sea sea little comparison thereof called ye sea middle earth passeth middle earth euen east departeth dealeth three partes earth called asia africa europa first coast called sinus iuspauicus hibericus balearicus coast passeth coast nerbon called gallicus followingly coast called ligusticus passeth ye citie geen next thereto coast called tirrenus stretcheth italy coast called siculus passeth cecilia lande crete stretcheth pamphilia aegypt coast helespontum passeth diuers turning bendeth northward last beside greece illiricum waxeth narrowe straightnesse seauen furlings passeth sea called ponticum waxeth straight maketh sea called propontides straightnesse pace made called bothorus tratius place called propontides commeth ye sea yt called ponticum place called bophorus hath name straight passage narrow way rothexen isi saith li fro thence passeth spreadeth greatest coast yt called ponticus hath behind marreis yt called paludes meotides cause many riuers fresh water come therto sea fresh mistie hath great fish fish yt called foca fish called delphinus earth though one hath diuers name bicause diuers place greate sea hath diuerse name diuers country land huc vsque isid li great coast sea called sinus hath diuers name sea middle earth one coast called ionicus hath name io king greece men athens called iones therfore sea called ionicum stretcheth fro ionia cecilia euen sea occean greatest coast caspius indicus persicus arabicus called red sea sea called red sea coloured red water waues kinde dyed taketh coulour bank red grauel sand nigh therto earth nigh sea red coulour nigh bloud therin found sharp uermilion diuers colour serue painture earth hath kind sea made red beating water waues vpon ye cliffes therfore cliffes red precious stone found small stone ground wrapped among ye grauell sea ground keepe still coulour sea departed two coast one called persicus east perses dwell west side called arabicus arabees dwell isidore saith li pelago chap pelagus bredth sea without cliffe without hauen isidore saith hath deepnesse vnstablenesse continuall moouing gendereth feedeth whale diuers wonderful fish breedeth many vapor fumosities hath therof thicknesse mist taketh many diuersities coulours diuersities windes gathereth fome smiting beating waues crieth maketh great noise crieng sea vnpeaceable perillous sayd sea drop cap drop right little part sea water raine departed violence whole called gutta standeth hangeth euesings tree wer beglewed isid saith drop falleth called stilla thereof commeth stillicidum falling drop drop whether called stilla gutta departed fro watry clowde vertue heat strength winde falleth downwarde owne heauinesse weight drop called stilla falleth gutta standeth hangeth drop hanging falling standing substaunce cleere round shape little quantity great vertue moisteth earth falleth vpon maketh plenteous fruitfull feedeth nourisheth root seed maketh grow quickneth saueth greenenesse tree hearbes grasse feedeth nourisheth fish sea maketh oyster fat breedeth pearl precious stone isidore saith namely drop dewe though drop soft yet oft falling pearceth thing right hard verse sayth gutta cauit lapidem non vi sed sepe cadendo drop pearceth stone strength oft falling foame cap foame called spuma hath name foamed skimmed isidore saith gendered corruption water therefore shoulde thing sod water bee skimmed purged foame foame commeth gendered winde closed ouer part water moued maner mouing therfore lightnesse aire closed therein water foameth foame fleeteth aboue water foame soone gendered beating together water waues soone departed sparyled sometime foame sea gathered among stone feruent working heate sunne falleth thereon made hard turneth sometime pomise sometime spunge additio pomise stone commonly blacke gray hollowe like hunny combe spunge soft hollowe much like lung beast serue diuerse purpose fish chap fish called pisces hath name pascendo feeding isidore sath libro cap fish licketh earth watry beach get meate nourishing also bee called reptilia creeping swimming seeme creepe swimming creepe though sinke downe bottome wherof speaketh ambrose exameron sayth betweene fish water greate nighnesse kinred without water may long liue liue long onelye breathing without drawing water haue manner lykenesse kinde creeping fish swimmeth shrinking drawing together bodye hee draweth gathereth himselfe lesse length anone stretcheth himselfe againe intendeth passe forth water dilligence hee putteth water backwarde passeth selfe forward therefore vseth fin swimming soule vseth fethers flieng wise swimming fish moueth fin ye hinder part downeward armes ore clippeth water holdeth stretcheth himselfe forward bird moueth fethers vpward gathereth aire compelleth passe backward large stretching windes violent putting aire backward body moueth forward kindes fish bee diuerse many manner wise diuersitie place bee gendered meate fedde coulour shape distinguished substaunce compounded vertue worke diuerslye place gendered greate diuersitie dwelling abiding builde onely water sometime dwelleth land somtime water manner fish isidore sayth called antiphidia dubia latine vseth goe land swim water holdeth office kinde fish called foce cocodrilli castores hippotami water horse fish haue name land beastes sea houndes wolues bite vnreasonable swallowing deuouring hurteth sore isidore saythas torteises crabbes among abide onely water abide onelye sea riuers pond fresh water meane betweene two manner fisheslopsters creifishes turne come fresh water salt water get meatea sturgeon salmon fish come salt water fresh haue liking freshnesse thereof fatted againe warde fish abideth seathe seal lampray tench carpe likevvise hadocke blinde ye fresh vvater cunger thertly die nowe fresh water many riuer fish may tast saltnesse sea catcheth salt water hee dyeth sodeinelye tourneth wombe fleeteth aboue water token death manner fish sea fresh water fish bred sea hath harde scale thicke drinesse salt water riuer fish haue subtill scale soft backe bone backe bone fish bee needfull restraine flesh thereof fleeting kinde softnesse thereof auicen teacheth choose good fish kinde place wherein nourished sedde liber cap sayth manner choice fish place dwelleth abide stony place bee best sweetest fresh running water corruption slime wose standing lake welles small pittes runne riuers well hee sayth sea fish bee good bee subtill bee best bee nourished deepe sea else fish abide water bee vnheeled blastes winde bloweth water somtime fro better bee serued water strongly mooued continually laboured bee better bee standing water sea fish better riuer fish riuer fish better lake fish namely farre riuer sea haue rest rottennesse filth washed neither cleansed riuer co meth therein sea therefore fish euill sauoured soone rotten also sea fish riuer fish better north sea east sea south sea strong blast winde water moued cleansed made subtill therefore fish water mooueth trauaileth cleansed superfluitie also kinde fish diuersity onely diuersitie place may dwell also diuerse place generation gendered layeng eggesrovv melt shedding pesen gendering together male female shedding sperme heereof aristotle speaketh li sayth falleth kinde fish lay egges pesen female layeth egges pesen male commeth sheddeth milke vpon egges egges pesen bee touched milke male shall fish touched milke shall fish female layeth many egges pesen swalloweth part also many bee spilt slime wose none thereof bee saued bee layde place milke male shedde saued bee many fish gendred fish keep saue euennesse make owne kinde aristotle sayth saith neuer fish founde made generation fish kinde also fish loue frye feede nourish long time aristotle sayth fish feede keepe young except frogges also sayde riuer fish fish marrcis shedde theyr pesen ofter fish commonly parte cast shed pesen milke fiue moneths fish bring foorth fish one yeare small fish bring forth broode place wherein little water fast rootes tree cane reedes also saith part pesen lost female sheddeth pesen swimming male present seede pesen fish shapen also eat fish bird also saidfeles grovve devv may aire fish gendered without egges pesen without generation male female gendered slime wose grauell rottennesse yt vpon water also sayd time generation male female fish swim tother slocke swim theyr make many bee sick breede therefore time taken also sayd fish gender froting wombe grauell also li iorath de animalibus said fish yt called effimeron bred without generation betweene male femaleephemeron beast riuer hyppanis hath liued three houres day dieth fish called murena lampraythis likely fourtie th spaune like conceiueth adder hee calleth loue hissing isidore saith lib cap greekes saith call fish yt called murena stairmam holdeth himselfe circle tell fish female conceiueth serpent therefore fisher call hissing whisteling taketh wise unneth dyeth though shee bee smit staffe smit rod dieth anone certaine soule fish ye taile say vnneth slain though smit head smit taile taile bee smitte dyeth anone sayde contrary serpent head bee broke brused cut ye serpent dieth anone taile smitten liueth long time also iorath sayth serpent doth awaye venim ere gender lampray deed generation done taketh venim againe therfore conceiuing lampraye taketh venim serpent gendereth serpent kinde onely owne kinde saith additiothe adder venimous body spearme snake also fish conceiue dew onely without peson without milk oisters shell fish heereof iorath speaketh saith fish called elich come water night coceiue land morrowe dew bring forth broode waning moone shell voide also fish stirred conceiue breed rising downe going starres iorath sayth isidore also speaketh fish bee called australis sayth fish kinde arise star bee called pliades begin goe downe seene till pliades arise againe though fish gender gendered yet manner kinde cleane fish haue gendering stone kinde serpent kind yt hath foot also haue pap milke except ye dolphin hath milke giueth child sucke little aristotle sayth lib isidore libro cap sayth dolphin bee called symphones also haue name followe man voice come together flock voice simphonie hauing liking harmonie sea nothing swifte dolphin bee oft startle ouerleape ship whose leaping plaieng wauce sea betokeneth tempest riuer nilus kinde dolphin ridge thoothed sawe cutteth tender wombes crocodile slayeth isidore sayth also fish kinde diuers manner foode nourishing libro auicen saith fish eateth good hearbes grasse root plant bee better eate filth throwen city watry place exameron sayde also fish bee diuerse eating eate fedde others fish lesse more meate greater eat lesse eateth one eaten last aristotle sayth libro sayth fish called carabo ouercommeth greate fish eateth another called multipes ouercommeth carabo eateth also hee sayth fish fedde dung durt fenne carabo therfore heanie much fen found fish eate fish haue strong teeth manner fish greekes call phagion isidore saith fish hath hard teeth eateth oyster sea therefore called dentrix fish strongly toothed hath name greatnesse strength teeth exameron sayd fish haue lesse tooth n e thicker sharp may soone cut meate take swallowe anone least meate hold mouth borne away strength water also fish seeke theyr meate froting grauell isidore sayth lib sayth sea swine commonly called suyllus hee seeketh meat froteth vnder water ground swine hath manner mouth throat gathereth meate pitcheth ye snowte grauell also lib aristotle sayth parte fish eate fishe eat time breeding except fish fuscaleon generally fish bee gluttenous couet much meate namely fish called habatue therefore wombe stretcheth fasting ofte hee bloweth wombe maketh stare throweth fish wombe stretcheth mouth hath stomacke also fish diuersitie time place meate fish seeke theyr meate onelye water night vpon land hippotamus water horse hath name lyke horse ridge mane isidore saith abideth water day eateth corne night bread riuer nilus isidore sayth aristotle sayth libro generally fish trauayle day night midnight therefore aristotle sayth bee hunted sun rise fisher set theyr net time fish see full well see light increaseth night seeke theyr meate smelling haue lyking thing good sauour therefore liber sayd kindes fish smell heare therefore commeth ofter new tackle set olde commeth lightly olde tackle newe bee oft beguiled smell iorath sayth hee sayeth great fish sea called belua casteth water iawes vapour good smell fish feele smell follow enter come iawes following smel swalloweth sed also saith fish called faste ye water taketh mouth wareth sweete small fish follow go mouth taketh sodeinly swalloweth anone also hee saith dolphin know smel dead man yt sea eate euer dolphin kinde dead man hath eaten therof eateth anone hee keepeth defendeth fro eating biting fish shoueth bringeth cliffe owne wroting aristotle sayth plinius also also li aristotle saith fish liueth cleere running water fall vpon stinking thing vpon thing good sauour doe bird fowles water winter fish die sea seeke heate nigh land seeke meate doth contrary summer flye heat deep sea therfore winter hunted nigh land summer deep sea immoderate heat greeueth fish item eodem li saith yt fish die heat star ariseth called canicula also great colde graueth sore namelye haue stone head crab stone head runneth freeseth fish dyeth soone palso kinde fish hath diuersitie shape disposition quality quantitie kinde great huge fish great body huge mountaines hill isi saith whale swallowed ionas prophet wombe great might called hell prophet saith wombe hell heard ther fish small yt vnneth taken hook isi saith li asforus litle fish litlenesse may taken book said yt enchirius fish vnneth halfe foote long hath name herendo cleauing though full little body neuertheles vertue cleaueth ye ship holdeth still steadfastly sea though ship grounde therein though windes blowe waues arise strongly woode stormes ship may mooue neyther passe fish holdeth still shippe craft onely cleauing ye ship latines call fish moron strength maketh ship stand said additioas touching strange fish whose smalnesse wt vertue staieng ship doth passe man reason grecian cal ethneis latines remora doth stay ship opianus aelian write delighteth ye high sea length cubit halfe yard browne coulour like vnto eele diuerse opinion fish authours agree yt manifest truth kind ther wherof one fish stayed galley caius caesar plinie meruailing sayth oh strnunge wonderfull thing windes blowing furious tempest raging notwithstanding violence tame yet doth small fish holde steadie ship whereto fastened greate secrete nature ordinaunce god moreouer trauailing coastes america later trauailers reporte haue felt strength vertue kinde fish also exameron said fish knoweth feeleth tempest winde weather bee great commeth taketh great stone holdeth fast thereby anker least smitten away throwen waues sea saueth himselfe strength helpeth saue himselfe heauinesse weight owne made stedfast stable comming tempest storme ship men see beware ouer set vnwarilye tempest stormes ambrose saith beda also also li aristotle saith female fish long male fish haue harde fish male harde also aboue female harde behinde beneath also lib auicen sayth fish best haue full grease bodyes neither harde fish drye whome great fatnesse much griffle whome euill smell euill sauour sweete sauour conuenient couenable fat superfluitie fatnesse sowrenesse stinketh anon cometh water fish somewhat harde bee better bee salted among fish harde fish best least soft fish diuersitie knowen substaunce qualitye saith generally fish cold moist yet bee hotter comparison complection fish namely salte therefore fresh breede watrye fleame softe sinewes according right hot stomackes salted according stomacke also medicine head salte fish burnt healeth biting madde dogge stinging scorpion rooteth vp dead flesh botch helpeth rotted festured botch also iuyce euerye fish helpeth venim dronken venimous stinginges hath many effectes sayde sayde theyr qualitye substaunce shall suffice place palso fish bee diuerse sharpnesse feeling sleyght witte many warye wonderfully sleight wily scape ware gin fisher isidore saith lib saith manner fish called mugil full nimble swist disposed swimme ware grin pearceth beset fisher turneth sodeinly backward ouerleapeth net swiftly seemeth present flieth bird mugil sea fish scaled fish swiftest coulour white hauing great belly greedinesse vnsatiable full lyeth still one place beeing afrayde hideth head whole body also hidden desirous others kinde fisher hauing gotten male fish sort fastned line craft female resorte vnto taken lykewise doth male greekes called cestrei plotae cephali also lyke wise sayd fish called estaurus among fish onelye fish cheweth kudde sayd fish right wittye knoweth hee entered within daunger fisher ginne hee reeseth foorth headlong neyther putteth head betweene rowles gunne beateth fast tayle beginneth make away breaking renting roddes pasieth backwarde happen another fish kinde seeth trauaileth break busieth helpe taketh tayle mouth helpeth hee maye drawe deliuer ginne yet sayth cunger hath manye wile wittye wylye getting meate hee seeth meate hooke hee dreadeth hooke biteth baite holdeth hooke sinnes letteth passe till hee haue gnawen meate palso crabbe enimye oyster hee liueth fish thereof wonderfull witte hee may open harde shell oyster hee spyeth awayteth oyster openeth crabbe lyeth waite taketh little stone putteth betweene shelles oyster maye close himselfe closing let crabbe eateth gnaweth fish oyster oyster bee called oilica haue name shelles defend warde softe fish within greekes call oyster fish shell called ostrium newter gender fish thereof meate wtin shels called ostrea feminine gender shell fish bee called conche conchilia also th moone falleth fish bee voide waxing moone increaseth humoure humoure vanisheth moone vanisheth therefore shell fish ware moone wareth bee voyde moone waneth shell fish bee pearles bread thereof speaketh plinius write thing night shell fish come cliffes conceiue pearles dewe heauen therefore shell fish called conchile margarete herelie theyr fish precious stone pight precious time conceiue whelpes deede generation betweene male female whale also whale balena al one balene anou great huge called belue ab emittendo outcasting shedding water throwe water higher greate fish sea balen vnderstoode casting whale called cete hugenesse bodye isidore sayth libro also libro iorath sayde whale hath great plentye spearme hee gendereth female superfluitye thereof fleeteth aboue smell odour smell vapour goe whale mouth bee deceyued eaten also sayth fish earthly matter hath mastrye watrye therefore hee soone great fatte age greatnesse bodye ridge powder earth gathered digged together hearbes small tree bush grow thereon great fish seemeth ilande shippe men come vnwarily thereby vnneth scape without perill hee throweth much water mouth vpon shippe ouerturneth somtime drowneth also hee faste hee smit fisher dartes feeleth wounde passeth fatnesse inner fish wounded easily take hee may suffer bitternesse salt water therefore draweth shoare warde also hee huge quantitie taken countrey better takingof whale flesh commeth train oile vvhich rich merchandise also loueth whelpes wonderfull loue leadeth sea long time hapneth whelpes bee let heapes grauell defaut water hee taketh much water mouth throweth vppon deliuereth wise perill bringeth againe deepe sea defende hee putteth al thing hee meeleth bee noyfull setteth alway betweene himselfe sunne safer side strong tempest ariseth whelpes bee tender young swalloweth vp vnto owne wombe tempest gone faire weather come casteth vp whole sound sayth also iorath sayth whale fishteth fish serpentes kind venimous plural number isi saith saith earth called terra hath ye name ouer part que teratur yt trode called humus also hath ye name sea moist ioyned thereto called tellus take fruit therof called ops heapeth fruit called arida able cared tilled distinguished fro water owne drines moist hath moisture water yt nigh therto isi saith basilius ex describeth ye property ye earth saith manner earth ye lowest body middle like far part heauen therfore wise men call ye middle heauen amog al body earth corpulent hath least subtilty simplicitie foundation ye world colde drie kind least quantitie co parison heauen though selfe qualitie obscure selfe darke round shape abiding together glew water whole earth resteth though part thereof moue often habitation body haue life called stoole god owne foote esa saith lord heauen seate earth footstole mat say vnto sweare neither heauen god seate yet earth footstoole fairenesse element least ye body ye world ye working ye might god least seene therein therfore said yt god toucheth ye earth lowest foot comparison greatnesse fairenesse heauen seemeth highnesse wisdome god sheweth least ye body earth though earth lowest comparison ye body heauen yet neuerthelesse taketh influence ye light heauen therfore plenteous mother al bringeth sorth many diuers contrary kind yt ye middle heauen taketh euery side influence effect heauen ye seemeth lacke
