substaunce earth also called ops rich earth better rich also earth euerye creature liue hath rich meate liuelode also called vesta goddesse either standeth stedfast clothed wt tree hearbs grasse saith ye earth taketh colour seedes leaues grasse wither fade winter wether springing time summer clothed hid grasse hearbes floures spoyled thereof haruest winter signe token great plentie great female image made called alma mater ye high mother ye image crowned wt tower set chaire lion followed wer subiect hir hare key ye one hand taber timbrell hand hir charemen brandished swordes bare hande fayned cockes followed good wife sate chaire ye earth called mother bringeth forth many thing breedeth meate foode thing el dye called mater alma high mother feedeth beast nourisher element isid saith said beareth hir head crowne wt tower ye earth adorned many great city borough bee builded therevpon borne chaire wheeles ye earth hangeth aire moueth sustained therein sitteth moouing chaire though thing moue sayd onely earth mooueth lyon mylde subiect image earth vnderstand euery kinde though neuer sie ce cruell time eath shall ouercome subiect earth beareth key hir hand betokeneth ye earth cloased winter opened springing time fruit may grow sp g said ye cock serue ye earth sheweth birdes fod le eed seedes earth therefore fowles neede follow earth lyght downe finde therein seedes sound noyse betokeneth tillyng field noise instrument culture shar e mattockes brasse olde time earth filled instrument brasse yron found isidore saith hir seruaunts segned girt sword betokeneth ofte defende winne earth lande warre battaile swordes drawen therein maner many property earth described mystike meaning fable sayd rehearsed isidore though earth among element stable sayd rehearsed yet effect dooing passible element also though colde substance yet conteineth selfe firie vapour come therof doth hil named aetna vulcanus sayth also though earth bee blacke vnseemly without yet within containeth many precious thing imprinting influence heuen ye inner veynes ye earth gendred precious stone noble mettall vertue ye earth hid within likeness without also ye earth beclipped sea beset beate armes thereof priuy way thirled moisture sea least earth partes thereof fall powder masterie drinesse beda sayeth also though whole earth founde sad substaunce thereof yet euery part thereof moueth kindly towarde middle point meddeling firie airie part earth part thereof hollow dim spoungie smokie windie vapor commeth hollownesse thereof shaketh moueth part earth breedeth earth quaking ari saith lib metheor colde winde saith moued wombe earth maketh mouing yt called earth quaking followeth noyse sound commeth diuers beating froting aire body together therein noise sound commeth diuers shaking mouing windes hid earth thereof token resteth till ye earth cleaue winde voyce issueth c aristotle saieth also place strong concourse running ye sea mouing waues place much thinnesse earth strong earth shaking fell hercules time ilandes earth began rise bene hill place cloue came great wind destroied great citie whereof remaineth remembraunce day also sayth eueth shaking commeth maner dimnesse hideth sunne clowdes earth shaking dureth reason darke vapor great earth quake commeth token sheweth comming long clowde straight line seene heauen going downe sun said somtime earth quake commeth eclipse moone ye heat sunne commeth ayre make cleere wast vapor cause earth shaking also li de vegitabitibus aristotle saith earth shaking grauely place place many dennes within hardnes without place hill mountaines place hard sad without vapour issueth passeth little little much vapour gathereth together yt strong inough mooue earth place hollow full dennes hole within sad hard without part vapour gathered together strong shaking sometime cleaneth enteth earth place full hole falleth lightly earth shaking reason vapor passe continually neither place full harde sadde maye much vapour enter straightnesse place partes falleth place hollowe within harde sadde without huc vsque aristot also earth element whole earth lyke substaunce part therof qualitie ye earth diuersly disposed diuers part chaungeth complection kinde medlyng qualyties element one manner disposition chaungeth colour sauour diuersitie commeth many manner cause many manner wise sometime highnesse lownesse high place aboue low beneath ouer place hot neather macrobius saith printing sun beames strong low place tha high aire thicke valleyes mountaines therefore valleyes gathering sun beames hurtling smiting great aire thitke mountaines hill aire thin cleere therefore beames sparpled fast helde together lesse heate gendred also diuers taking sunne beames taketh strong sunne beames plenteous fruitfull land far sunne beames lesse able beare fruite corne also diuersitie kinde wind land eastern wind bloweth continually temperate hot meane betweene moyst dry constant saith therefore land full plenteous bearing flower fruite corne couenable habitation mankinde therefore westerne winde longeth coldenes moysture maketh land lesse temperate therefore westerne winde lesse plenteous northern winde drieth cooleth land yet reson cleane aire maketh subtil pure north men high stature faire shape outward aire pore stopped kinde heate helde within vertue whereof stature great shape body faire seemelye sothern winde hot moyst maketh land bleweth continually troubly hot thicke sad therfore men south land contrary men north lande stature shape therefore men land bold hardy wrathfull angry neither great angler boaster constantine sayth also quality property earth diuers nigh sea far thence land yt nigh south sea hot moyst land nigh north sea hot vapour moyst commeth south sea heateth land nigh thereto contrary north sea therfore sea called mare ponticum fresher lesse salt sea coldnesse hath masterie therein therfore cold vapour commeth therof cooleth land yt nigh therto also land changeth diuers working trauell men land delued eared ouerturned vertue therein medled part thereof laud amended made able beare manye manner corne fruite land lyeth long idle resteth pa reth worse beare corne fruite also good lande bedewed rained fasteth amendeth grauelly land stony worse hard p hill cap hill high swellyng rearing earth land onely foote touching land el hill called mountaines passe vpwarde aboue deale lande aristotle saith also libro de proprietatibus elementorum aristotle saith men haue sayd earth first made round plaine mountaines vallyes therin shaped round ye euer body cause mountaines valleyes nought el mouing water dig weare soft part earth hard part maye digged made mountaines place wer digged deepe wer made sea riuers also libro metheororum arist saith somtime mountaines made strong earth shaking somtime earth lifted vp made mountaine great raine water commeth hallownes made valley also sayeth comming going sea weareth breaketh lande place maketh hill sometime sea healed lande bare alway softe part thereof let hard abide threw mud together wered drye sea passed tourned hilles also mountaines hard sad reared ward earth toward heauen grounded earth sometime full hollownesse dennes voydnesse draweth sucketh water hollownesse full water runneth springeth well head cause euerlasting springing running knowen mountaines hollownesse den draw sucke humor moisture send therof alway also mountaines containe noble mettal noble mettal mined veynes mountaines also mountaines eare fruit sweete smelling thing cleannesse aire hath mastry top hill fruit groweth hils pure sweet fruit grow valleyes also hill receiue sooner sunne beames vallyes hold longer time also hilles gender exhalation smoke vapour gendring therof ye aire come clowdes vpon top high hill thereof commeth rayne seldome top mount olympius arist saith cleernesse aire scarciue vapour vapour spended wasted ere maye come toppe hill also hill set windes stormes valleyes cold hath mastry hill snow lyeth hils frosen colde winde therein therefore snow lyeth abideth longer hill valleyes doth mount caucasus libano high hilles alway white white snowe isidore saith also hill ofter smitten lightning valleyes isidor saith therefore hill called monte pirenei haue name fire lightning fire called pir greek also hill called ceraunci haue name oft smiting lightning lightening called ceraunos greeke isidore saith also hill high best place stand looke wait spie comming enemy men go vp top hill waite warne perills see farre also hill sound sad strong kinde therefore able place buylde castle tower dwelling abiding hill sure valleyes namely may mined hardnesse sadnesse ground high hard take waye vpward also hill plentie hearbs grasse lease according pasture sheepe beast hearbs leese mountaines wholsome better defieng beast grasse hearbs grow valleyes though bee generally ranke fat humor feeding norisheth hearbs grasse subtill pure humour plaines valleyes therefore heate heuen defieth moysture turneth sooner changeth substaunce hearbes grasse subtilnesse humour cleernesse also aire also hill higher tree thicker bush valleyes therefore mountaines accord wilde beast fowles breed dwell therein therfore wilde beast hunted hunter valleyes flye mountaines safe pof hill ararath cap ararath highest hill armenia therein no ship rested floude isidore saieth yet day timber shippe seene mountaine hill hath many name iosephus speaketh hil sayeth manner place no ship armenian call egressorium yet men countrie shew timber left ye ship iosephus saieth berosus caldeus maketh minde shippe manner sayd ship came armenia yet part hill cardiens thereof falleth glew men vse cleanse also iosephus egypcius man slus damescenus hist libro write manner armenia great hil named bari sayd time great floud many fled saued therein one came ship top hill timber kept long time also mountaines armenia called ceraunei highnesse ofte beating riuers riuer named cerannus greeke isidore sayeth hill begin betweene armenia hiberia isidore saith port caspis stretcheth well riuer tigris beginneth isidore sayth pof hill bethel cap hils bethel iurye nigh ierusalem house lord builded salomon time hils bethel haue plentie wood tree hearbs grasse full sweete smelling thing therefore hart roe young olde therein additio bethel signifieth house god bethel name also citie coast tribe beniamin ephraim distant hierusalem three mile first called luza iacob place saw lord standing vppon ladder called bethel place bethel hieroboam set vp shaking accordeth meaning name vnderstande olde swollowe also hill cursing banning theron men prayed wickedly trespassed helde hill dispraising despite vnworthy lynages came seruing woman set vpon syon temple therefore hebrewes prophet sayde deawe hermon commeth downe mount syon might letter sayth mount syon high mount hermon also farre sunder cause said deawe mount hermon came downe mount sion psa grasse fatnesse beast wer sedde mount hermon offered sacrifice ierusalem increasing fire altar therefore hermon vnderstande lyght areared glose sayeth super psalmum lyght increased altar fire voyce dole sorow woe therefore many deeme place paine soules pained therin affirme seemeth gregory dialogue thereof maketh minde additio aetna otherwise called ye mount gibello cycill whereof saint augustin hath made oft mention meruailous hil foote whereof little towne name wood tree diuers kindes planted toppe thereof barraine ground mixt ash winter time couered snowe containeth circuit twentie furlong inuyroned banke ash height wall middle also rounde hill colour matter wherin two great hoales fashioned like vnto two cuppes called crateres doe rise sometime sundrye great flame fire sometime horrible smoke sometime blowen burning stone infinit number moreouer sayd fire appeareth hearde within grounde terrible noyse roaring also meruaile smoke fire abundaunt feruent yet round toppe sayd hill alwayes seene snowe hoare frost plyme writeth fire appeareth alwaye night hill hecla ile iseland toppe whereof cast foorth blacke graye pommice stone wherout issueth hideous flame sea either good pasture fruite hearbs grasse hill libano cap mon lihani highest mount prouince called prouincia phenicis mountaine prophet make mention hath name libanus thus gathered ther isidore saith farther parte toward east called aurilibanus isid saith also libanus called whitenesse white snowe winter summer alway snow ther neuer clene molten alway summer diuers place therof snow found libanus head well spring riuers wels ierome sayth foote thereof springeth two wels ior dan come togethers make riuer iordane libanus mount much sweete smelling ther growen hearbs sweet odor smell also tree beare frankencense whose chosen gum ye phisitions call olibarum hieronimus saith also mount suffisance plentie plentie deaw raine commeth ther full oft ther commeth plentie beast leese pasture best fruite ripe therefore mount labars pasture therof beast fed norished offered temple also mount passing highnesse raba u sayth super reg mon libanus passed mountaines land therefore shipmen came tirus ful farre sayling sea might see hill know highnes ther hauen drawe saith also mount influence fayleth continual springing euerlasting moysture though drye without yet hath within noble veynes water doth pit springing water runne alway strength mount called libanus salomon meaneth cant quasi puteus aquarum also mount trust suretie resteth mount libanus strong safe maner venimous beast serpent hearbs grasse tree growe driue thence odour smell cedar grow ther driue away manner venemous beast creeping wormes suffer liue ierome sayth also hil fairnesse nurth wonderfull highnes cedar greene tree continuall greennes hearbs grasse sweetnesse song bird plentie riuers wels make mount libanus merrye lyking also mount medicine health growe sweete smelling spice helpe remedie medicine manye endlesse sickness euills cedar palmes cipres oliues licour resin chiefe medicine euils harmes diuers sickness also mount gladnesse mirth hilles liban growe plentie best vine make men glad merry hill oliuet cap mount oliuet mount iurye nigh ierusalem name plentie oliues growe therein therefore austen super iohn calleth mount lyght mount fatnesse feeding mount medicine curation helpe sayth great plentie olyues growe therein ye fruit vnctueus shining liking isidore sayth oyle oliues riseth bitternesse roote feeding lyght medicine wound refreshing feeding hungry foote mount oliuet runneth brooke called torrentem cedron betweene drink thereof mount orthard lord oft time entered prayer rest first taken garden called gethseman sayd ioh foote hill fast brooke torrentem cedron sometime lyttle towne called gethsemany yet time wer orchard towne austen sayth ofte lord vsed place orchard mount ye east side temple therefore beshined sun rising morew side light shining temple euen tide night therefore worthelye called mount light receiued light heauen temple also gaue plenty oyle matter lyght aust sayth mount litle street called bethphage longed priest side hill citie called bethania citie martha lazarus mary glose sayth super math mount lord ascended vp heauen shal appeare day dome mount sayde actes ferte glose mount salomon builded temple high place sayd regum cap therefore called mount oliuet mount forgiuenes mercie called mount offence trespasse said reg mount salomon offended trespassed owne god pof hill olympo cap olympus mount macedonia full high sayde clowdes ther vnder virgil saith olympus passeth clowdes called olympus olalampus vnderstand wer heuen mount departeth macedonia thracia high passeth stormes passion ye aire therfore philosopher went vp see course place starres might line except spounges water make aire thick throwing sprinkling water master saith histori additio olympus mountaine hill greece betweene lalia macedonia aboue yt appereth clowde therefore among poet vsurped heauen plutarchus viti milij sayeth tenne furlonges heyght furlonge taken yght parte mile mile thousand pace hill measure mile quarter high vpright great height take pace hercules sayd doubled hill vpright might two english mile halfe ye furlong persian cal parasaugam conteineth space sixe mile quarter surlong amounteth mile hill oreb chap oreb mout madian ierome saith nigh arabia desart ioyned desart sarasines called pharao mount oreb sion one ierome saith mount moses sawe many sight exo therein sawe bush burne wasted burning heard lord speake commaunded many thing shall rehersed mount sinay hill pernassus cap mount pernassus thess lia isidore sayth nigh boetia ye mount hath two top arcared high vnto heauen top apollo liber bacchus worshipped sometime mirth place great plantie wine vine hill riphei chap high mountaines bee head germanie called monte riphei isidorus saith haue name continuall blast strong reesing winde tempestes ripheus greeke vnderstoode strong blast called alpes vnderstood mountaines toppes way high feete downes lower mountaines high mountaines snowe alway manye clowdes heades spring welles greate riuers beastes fierce wilde manye manner birdes fowles winges shine night isidore sayth high cragges cap high cragges highest mountaines sadde strong passing high top mountaines receiue always rooses tempestes showres raine therefore earth full washed aboue harder partes mountaines made harde turned stone made endlesse many cragges though cragges bee neuer hard rough sharp without yet within e somewhat spungeous hollowe therefore eft humour bee drawne hered therin breake spring windes watere come hollownesse denues cragges hee sometime cause earth soo ing sometime violence strength shaking cragges breake faile bird fowles egles uul ar come toppes cragges also cliffes sea bee soone wasted cragges leaping strong reeses stormes waues smite harde cragges couenable place defence strength bee found cragges den neasts fowles beast bee made crag loppes cragges bee wrapped beclipped mistes clowdes sunne rising toppes cragges bee shined beames sunne cragges bee called rupes bee hard break without strength yron cragges bee mooued also deepe veines cragges precious stone diuerse kindes mettall oft digged drawne also high strouting partes cragges called scopuli haue name scopin spie maite cragges right farre place perceiued espied hill sephara cap sephara mount ye east iurye ierome sayth nigh thereto dwelled child lethan sonne hember iosephus sayth came sephora place salomon shippe came merchaundise chaffer commonly three yere place land tharsis hauen sea thence salomon seruauntes brought golde siluer ape pecockes elephant teeth saide reg hill segor cap segor lyttle mount called balo also nigh sodoma hierome sayth mount citie builded saued ye prayer loth grow vine balme apple palmes token old plentie vpon dead sea therein afterward set succour defence romanes thereof speaketh esa whereon glose sayth called heighfer held fast liking lechery twice smitten fell downe third time earth shaking shuld haue stood strong abid sinned deliuerance hill sinay cap sinay mount oreb parte thereof arabia prouince madian mount speaketh iesephus li secundo ant quitatum saith sinay high mount noble worthy pasture beareth best hearbes grasse supposed ye god dwelled therfore durst man keepe sheepe shepheardes durst presume walke moses came towarde mount sawe wonderfull sight hee sawe fire burnt bush wasted neyther appaired greenenesse neyther flowres thereof neyther spray bare fruite though flame swift full strong mighty fire lord spake moses also libro sayth moses went vp sinay high hill country highnesse greatnesse high strouting crag onely harde men come thereto also maye bee seene without trauaile therefore saide lorde dwelled mount dreadful men man durst come thereto foote mount hebrewes pight tent worthy see god fire clowd heare speake personallye mount called mon sinay mout dwelling lord oft conuning angel mount light burning flame mout clowdes darknesse inourd raine dew mount pasture seeding mount wisdome lore mount lorde taught moses people gaue lawe mount forgiuenesse mercy foresayde mount gift hearde graunted people mount righteousnesse menassing threatening dreadfull saw mount lightening seeming blasing mount trumpes trumping mount friendship truice lawe lord ioyned knit people euerlasting truice mount purenesse cleannes mount gladnes solace nursh none might come mout cleane body soule also cleane lorde eate dranke ioy mirth mount forgiuenesse mildnesse pitie mount sacrifice prayer sacrifice lorde heard lord pleased mercie prayer moses additio sina sinai mountaine desart arabia called also oreb solinus called casies iustinus calleth synaeus citie one side mount sion temple middle betweene towre lower citie strength towre shuld defend citie therfore oft holy writ calleth ierusalem daughter sion mother defendeth daughter daughter subted mother lower citie subiect temple also towre among mountain mount sion great authoritie worthinesse onely citie ierusalem onelye iurye name syon also holye church gathered iews nation name mount sion oft prophesies called sion place mount syon founded ioye earth side northpsa citie greate king mount sion full high full excellent great strong stedfast full plenteous fayre merrye trustye sure rich ioyfull perfect rightfull holye mount lore teaching written esay sion shall come lawe mount prophesie reuelation hill selmon chap selmon mount lignage ephraim nigh coastes linage manasse abimelech hill saron chap saron sayde esaye saron mount betweene mount thabor ponde tiberiades mount land country hath name called sarona yet day ierome saith also country land cesaria palestina vnto towne called ioppe called sarona neere mount plenteous field fruit grasse corne glose rehearseth saith super esay hill seon chap deutronomij sayde mount seon parte mount galaad stretcheth desart ouer written par mount citie sabalte resteth reliques saint iohn baptyll ierome saith samaria built sometime mount thereafter land name citye called samaria mount citie strong hard winne therefore king assyries great host great araye warriours besieged citie three yeare continually might neuer winne strength vnneth strong hunger ierome saith io also shuld neuer haue ye citie men yt dwelled therin offended god israel trusted stedfastly forsaken law looke property mount de montibus israel fully shewed hill seyr cap mount seyr mention made holy writ mount called also mount edom also thereof treated full looke de monte edom called monte esau esau thee name hill thabor cap thabor hill middle fielde gable hierome sayth super lere cap mount wonderfull nurth highnesse distanteth ten mile diocesaria toward east march zabulon isacar neptalym among mountaines lande behest mount famous place plentie mirth strength stedfastnesse soile mount beareth vine oliues tree verye apt beare fruit ther aire wholsome ost deaw sweete raine well morning euening high tree leese leaues greene coulour winter neither summer song many diuers bird soules voice liking hearer diuersitie coulour fethers pleasant sight sweetnesse liking tast many bird soules haunt place therefore manye fowler lie lay net spring grinnes hierome sayth vpon place osee net spread vpon mount thabor c passing presence lord maketh commendable mount worthy praysed comming therto lord made mount worshipfull mount lord taught mount praiers lord abode night somtime mount lorde fedde people bodily meate ghostly top mount lorde shewed himselfe bassefull chaunged figure passingly disciple gaue reuelation owne body blisse cleerenesse euer shall last additio tabor mountaine countrie galile christ transfigured hill ziph cap ziph mount much shadowe therein dauid hidde himselfe hee absented saule beside charmela mount carmell mount nabal cormolites dwelled sometime came kinde calef ier sayth mount hath many woodes vushes tree without fruite manye laundes wilde beast roe wilde coates mount mount full deunes dry ditch hole therefore couenable place banished men theeues hide therin perillous straungers know way therin may lightly leese themselues downe chap downe little swelling arearing earth passing plaine ground reaching highnesse hill downe lower hill higher plaine called tumulus swelling lande isidore sayeth ofte foot hill down oft goe vp high hill downes called colles haue name colendo tilling tilled lesse trauaile hill men dwell sooner hill receiue sooner good aire heate sun lower land therefore fruit ripeth sooner downes also downes bedewed berained valletes therefore fruit groweth downes sweete sauourie fruit groweth valley downes meane betweene lowest plaines lande highest toppes hill therefore aire thicker greater downes hot hill small cleere valleyes downes receiue ouer body cleane noble impression influence valleyes therefore fruit hearbes grasse grow downes better wholsome grow valley place constantine saith also downes take sooner ye shining sunne beames swifter moisting clowdes valleyes also mountaines vpon down come downe brooke streames downes runne valley field valley chap ualley lowe landes set betweene mountaines isidore sayth valley receiueth beareth water commeth streames well valley moisted streames come mountaines shedding therof bee endowed flower hearbs fruit greene twigges branch shadowed rearing highnesse hill downes also vallies meeting gathering rebounding sunne beames therefore hotter impression gendered valley mountaines also snow melteth sooner valley mountaines shedding thereof place nigh wette moyst macrobius saith therefore valleyes bee deemed assaye hotte trowblye thicke vaporous men dwell valleyes bee oft time greeued hot euills moyst constantine sayth house stande valleyes bee lesse greeued weather house stand mountaines mountaines stande betweene defend valley strong reefes weather stormes also men dwell valleyes seldome greeued earth shaking cause valleyes partes grounde set thrust cleaue stronglye together therefore winde maye easilye thirle partes come grounde partes bee hollowe neyther full hoales therefore mooue wagge strength winde commeth therein aristotle sayth also filth vncleannesse commeth valleyes abideth long time aire valley sooner rising great smoakie vapour mist mountaines part valley deeper toward centre mountaines farther circumference heauen also valley great comming water sen heaped together make great marreis mire hard passe reason thereof passage ouer found greate difficultie also plenty humour grasse hearbes growe valley willowes tree without fruite growen valleyes mountaines campus chap one maner field called campus manner fielde plaine grounde lowe valleye reared high mountaines isidore saith called campus euen plaine footing therein hath name camis greeke camis vnderstoode shorte euen playne campus plain place tilled eared plough dounged durt namelye ordeined walking playeng vse deedes knighthoode nigh citye common place ordeined sight men vse communaltye appropried man assigned profit men ager field cap another fielde called ager hath name wrought therein isid sayth lib varro saith euery fielde eyther lyeth standing place beareth tree able pasture lieth leese beast beareth flower necessarie bee therefore men olde time meaned lande tilled called ager land vntilled called ru woode layes wherein milke beast name ru vplandish haue name called rustici first idle felicitye vplandish men also fielde called pascuus men diuide departe fieldes leaue field neighbour pasture lees aluuius fielde made field little little drawing ouerturning riuers artihmus field conteined certaine measure line endes thereof stretcheth mountain towres riuers field first eared called noualis fielde lyeth voyde euerye yeare renewe vertue field called noualis beareth fruit resteth without fruit also sometime field called squalidus excolidus hath name passeth tilth exconsul leaueth office consull sometime fielde called vliginosus yt vnderstood alway moist sayd moist sometime drie vligo kinde humoure land neuer passeth neuer faileth huc vsque isid lib cap field place businesse trauell sweate fielde ylled trauaile beaten digged tockes dolue turned spade opened cared culture share sowen seed raked couered rake harrowes moysted watered dew raine closed hedge thornes strained winter frost cold withered summer burning heate filled springing time haruest time fruite gathered fieldes eared againe fielde always trauailed one trauaile predium cap predium field demaine husbande ordeineth himselfe chooseth isidore saith properly place husband buildeth house dwelling place middle owne fieldes called predium olde time men held fieldes tooke battaile war name pray isidore sayth called predium preuidium purueiaunce meede cap meede hath plentie heye feede beastes called pratum latine olde romanes gaue thereto name place alway ready prest needeth trauel tilling isidore sayth place called prata alwaye readie beare grasse hey prata meedes watred moysted riuers streames well plentie humour giueth alway feeding nourishing moares rootes hearbes meedes springed hearbes grasse flowres diuers kind therefore fairenesse greene springing therein saide meedes laugh also meedes bee greene bee lyking sight sweete odour bee liking smell feeding tast sauour theyr hearbes theyr grasse hearbes flowres meedes giue honie bee breed plentie milke beast flock heale woundes remedie diuerse sickness euills desart chap desart space land called desart forsaken manye men dwell therein come therto therefore men labour dwell therein isidore saith happeneth sometime lande barren ayre temporate default well water destruction made enimies desart laboured full thornes pricking bush place creeping wormes venimous beast wilde beast lodge vanished men theeues land thirst drinesse land burning disease lande wasting horrour land misgoing erring desarte wayes bee vnknowen downes pathes worne troden growen full broome furres shrubbes bush without fruite plaines bee full grauell stone fenne cloddes let greeue trauailing men bee called desarts sowen isidore sayth place woodes mountaines bee sowen called desertes also place men dwelled sometime destroyed happe bee oft called desarts isidore saith heremo chap heremus wayles wildernesse dwell fewe excepte wilde beast fierce therfore men desire dwell wildernesse men sight company called hermites heremus declined heremus heremi hath name contrary meaning hereo here say tarry abide fewe men tarry abide therein heremus said cleaning land commonly land called heremus solitudo hard fast sadde hermites place solitarye wilde beastes walke freely abide surely place thicknesse bush many wood wild foules birdes sing sweetly also make neasts manye wilde beast foules haunt place though bee solitarye yet sometime hunter come thereto also fowler hide otten grinnes nettes also men inhabite place liue much trauaile bee greeued frost burning heate falleth vppon dewe raine hoare frost nowe snowe bee selde ouerset haply theeues hunter therfore place hermit haue much greeuaunce trauaile neuerthelesse hath vauntage commoditie rest darke caue chap darke caue called antrum hath name atro blacke therein blacke feareful darknesse isidore saith properly lurking hiding place beast dwell tennes hoales therfore place beastes lye espie waite pray antru called specus place abide waite spie hath name speculando waiting espieng ther wait espie beastly spie pray isi saith place yt called antrum colde su mer hot winter necessarily wild beast feed hide therin brood whelp stinketh sweat vapour beast ditch chap ditch called fossa hath name fodiendo deluing place made deep strength craft wit deluers mooued lande arreared aboue brinke deeper ditch within high deepe ditch harde perillous passe ouer man may soone fall therin falling harde arise come ditch gregory saith therefore also ierome saith super ez yt lion taken ditch bottome ditch sheep goat put smell thereof lyon commeth ditch pray therein helde may go thence also ditch one side place digged den therin set trap coffer ye closeth soone hard open lion seeth yt may passe ye first ditch dreadeth comming hunter goeth second ditch closed trap ordeined taken held prisoner hierome saith also ditch needfull ditch city castle strengthned enimies also place land bound mansios departed ditch ditch full water therein fish nourished creeping wormes diuers kind therfore ditch called fouea feeding nourishing liuing water ditch water nourished kept running standing water nowe come brooke therein raine well head streames springing water spring rise therein oft ditch chiefe strength succour fortress walled townes castle ditch arayed good order bredth length highnesse deepnesse place strengthened comming men passe ye ditch filling stopping boate bridge hierome sayth spelunca chap spelunca ditch hollownesse vnder earth hath name spelunca speculando waiting espieng widenesse thereof able place abide behold look hath wide mouth entring open toward light straightend within spelunca place vnder earth first shewing light entring darke troubly passing inwarde farther end hard straight rough ragged outgoing farther end going may found damascene saith namely place stone mettals digged mined hollowe ditch den vnder earth left hollow void stone mettalls voided taken thence ouer part vnderset poasts pillar may fal oft great heauines ye earth pillar ouercharged fal softnesse owne matter ground beneath moist falleth pillar fall therin destroied vtterly spilt therefore harde perillous abide mine vnder earth colde moist darke vnstable vnhelthy rough hard heauie aboue hollowe deepe beneath also place bee couenable hiding lurking wilde beast put therein filth vncleanenesse dwelling abiding serpentes beast cauerna chap cauerna earth lande digged made hollowe hath name cauando digging making hollowe part earth digged made hollowe departed asunder creeping wormes beast thrusting part voydaunce casting cauerns mouse creeping wormes take theyr dennes neasts flye therto see dread perill harme without also hollownesse tree stone sometime bird foules flie culuours turtle dread egle hawke comming aire also hedghoges connies hare hollowe stone heare houndes knowe hunter come also holow hole den earth tree bee make honny manner foules make ther neasts lurke therein also hollow den lie adder serpent hurt sting venimous biting man beast come nigh den moreouer earth hollowe full dennes shaketh oft mooueth wind come therein filleth den gendereth earth shaking therein aristotle saith finis libri xiiii pincipit libr xv de provintiis part earth diuers prouinces world generally departed somewhat helpe god shall bee shortlye added worke wee singularly intreate onely holy scripture maketh oft remembrance world cap world wide departed three isidore saith li one part called asia another europa thirde affrica three part world assigned like much old time asia stretcheth ye south east vnto north europa north vnto west affrica stretcheth west passeth ye south asia conteineth onely one part yt halfe part ye land men dwell two country contein halfe great sea co meth occean stretcheth betweene part departeth asunder therfore thou diuidest world two part east west one part asia affrica europa no sonnes departed diuided world floud among sem ofspring asiam iaphet europam cam affricam glose sayth super gene super par gregory sayeth plinius also asia chap asia taken halfe part world name asia woman helde kingdome east olde time isidore saith lib asia disposed third part world hath east rising sunne south occean stretcheth vnto sea endeth north lake marreyes called meotides floud tanay hath many prouinces region diuers nation wonderful liuing manner figure shape body wonderfully diuers heart thought theyr name place wee shall shortly set following order abc assiria chap assiria country prouince asia hath name assur sonne deserta strabo called senaetis hath south mountaine arabia soelix north mesopotamia west petrea people country haue certaine habitation dwell tent arabia soelix south lyeth betweene two sea arabicum persicum plentifull bringeth forth corne fruites twice yeare haue plentie fruite cattell except horse mule swine fowles except goose cock hen groweth kinde spice sweete gummes townes vnwalled people doe liue alwaye peace cooper thesaurus armenia chap armenia hath name armenus companion iason thessali ye whe left king iason gathered together folke yt sparpled abroad tooke armenia called owne name without eter ie euen former writer haue mentioned warlike wome america fortified ilandes commonly asseyled enemy barbarous indian aryue shore amazones barkes vesselles straunge forme whereof skinnes beast set stiffened kinde slender frame assayled enimies fight bowes arrowes woman defende like courage vsing straunge kinde crieng noyse make bulwarkes shels torteyles great strong finde ther three sort amazones alyke differing onely place dwelling auncient sort affrica among yt gorgonists yt meduse queene wer scithia neere riuer tanais since haue reigned part asia neere riuer hermodon third sort amazones wee doe troate diuers opinion called amazones common woman burne breast theyr youth apt warre ye finde straunge report medicine whether burne part without death knowing tendernesse flesh restenesse heart concerning etimologlae vowell pri atiue maz signifieth bread liue bread thing absurd time might manye lyued without bread amazones troglodifes many others like manner indian word mazo signifieth nourishes without woman milke likest true howsoeuer woman named warlike moreouer ye shall note scythian call tartarians driuen aegypt subdued greater part asia meane time scythian absenting themselues long fro theyr wiues although requested make returne regarded hoped victorie asia companye wiues cause strange diuision discouered wiues voyde hope head strong furie chose two chiefe came afterwarde affros isidore sayeth libro c affrica beginneth endes aegypt stretcheth south aethiopia vnto mount athlante beclypped north sea middle earth endeth sea gadiad lande called thirde part square corner corner maketh lxiii pace wals accounted two leages halfe also tower three thousand pace high containeth high two leages batred bredth matter thereof made vurnt tyle may departed vndound people whereof called bactri bactriani whome inhumanitye theyr parentes verye sicke olde throw vnto fierce dogges doe rent peeces deuoure woman countrey vse sumptuous apparayle sweete oyntments riche attyre seruauntes obayed reuerenced men neuer come abroad horse back riche ornamentes precious stone iewells chastitie regarde make themselues common theyr seruauntes straungers theyr husbandes large seene farre thence ditch ran riuer citie front walles hundred gate wall dwelling place shoulde defende citie place defence wonderfully strong huge though citye strong yet soone ouercome taken court artaxerxes king persia wrote hippocrates manner hystanes liuetenant hellespont gwydas witnesseth greate king artaxerxes liuetenant hystanes sendeth greeting haue heard noble phisition hippocrates see therefore thou giue much mony wil desire wt al thing necessary send shalbe great honor wt best persia c died beeing yeres age ther wer also name stocke fiue notable famous men phisicke farre passed flourished ye yere worlde munsterus discreete manner stature forth cronicle cronicarum folio hee forbad vol nptuousnesse horred graue manner onely ornament disciple hee small stature faire wel fauored great heded easily moued hasty speak saieng bee free let desire cannot haue hee desireth let desire may haue liue peaceably lyfe lette like vnto bidden feast giueth thanks yt set table grudgeth want thing horse bred coa great price whereof ioyued euery chariot euery horse valued cicles siluer amounteth penny cicle euery cicle halfe ounce ye sum li shilling euery horse notwithstanding vsed sundry cicles diuers value omit horse might greater value corsica chap corsica ilande wt many prouinces corner wise shape hath ye sea tyrenicum east side hauen ye citie rome sardinia ye south side belliares west sea ligusticum north coteyneth length c ixi thousand pace thousand breadth additio corsica iland middle sea betweene gean ile sardina called cors nowe vnder citie gean genu citie hath ben oftetimes reedified people called ianewaes romane italian dalmacia chap dalmacia prouince greece olde departing land hath name delim greatest citie prouince prouince hath macedonia east side messia north hystria west endeth sea adriaticum south isi saith li orosius saith men land mightie strong giue prayes robbing stealing manye sea theeues additio dalmatia part great country called illiria slauonia hath west croatia east bossina north great mountain albanus mon country called seruia south sea adriaticum goulfe uenice dacia chap denmarke countrie europa first occupied greeke dane sayde diuided many prouinces ilands stretcheth germania men thereof sometime fierce right great warriours therefore lordes britaine norway many ilands country li isidore saith dane came gothes suppose called dacos wer dagi men come goth nation dane come first certaine bee many seemely stature faire haire face generally faire body shape though fierce enlinies neuerthelesse kindlye milde heart pleasing innocent additio dacia country beyond hungaria doe well call denmarke name dania dane denmarke also called danomarchia people quicklye mooued reuenge wary buieng selling regarding lawes established may wise tyed purse sometime olde conquerours england people wel minded religion originall supposed come people called goth delos chap delos iland greece ye middle ilandes bee called ciclades hath name said yt floud night darke many moneths ilande lightened sunne beames land yt first shewed said hath name delos delon greke vnderstood openly shewed also lande called ortigia curlewes first seene greekes called ortigias land latone bare appollo isidore saith lib delos name iland citye also additio delos ile greece apollo diana borne one iles called cyclades dedan chap dedan country ethiopia west side isidore saith liber many elephant much abundaunce iuorie wood firre glose saith super eze europa chap evropa called thirde part worlde hath name europa daughter egenor king libia iupiter rauished europa affrica brought creta called part lande name europa isidore saith li orosius speaketh europa sayth yt country europa people therof begin ye mountaines called mo ce riphei marreis called paludes meotides east come downward toward west ye bank north occean vnto ye country called gallia belgica vnto riuer renum runneth ye occean ye country stretch riuer danubius yt called hisirius also south passeth eastward sea called pontus coast great sea li isidor sayth europa beginneth riuer tanay stretcheth westward north occean vnto end spaine east south parte thereof ariseth sea called pontus ioined great sea endeth ilandes cades first country europa nether scithia beginneth marreis meotides stretcheth betweene danubius north occean vnto germania isidore sayth lib straunge nation land specially called barbaria nation al orosius saith among first alania stretcheth marreys meotides following gothia denmarke germania gallia land britain orchades many ilandes last lesse spaine end wherof europa endeth westward ouer part europa ye south many great coutries land panonia messia tracia grecia boundings italia country ilandes thereof though part worlde lesse asia yet pere thereto number noble men plinius saith nourisheth men great bodye strong might vertue bold heart faire seemely shape men country ilands asia affrica sunne abideth long ouer men affrica burneth wasteth humour maketh short bodie blacke face crispie haire yt spirites passe poores open bee coward heart contrarie men north land coldnesse without stoppeth pore breedeth humour bodye maketh men full great colde mother whitenesse maketh white face skin ye vapour spirites smitten ward maketh hotter within bolde hardie men asia meanly disposed first land east plinius saith additio europa thirde parte world diuided asia great sea hellespontus propontis bosphorus thracius pontus euxinus hath vttermost boundes north east riuer tanais affrike diuided middle sea also name faire mayden daughter agenor king phoenicia iupiter transforming ye likenesse bul rauish poet writ forgetting kindly vertue beeing ouercome uirgins beutie setting humanitie aside vsed force violence tyrannous beast also saide iupiter carried away force ship decke whereof banner streamer wherein painted bull additioit better prince bee reproued theyr faultes beeing aliue theyr death bee reported yt concealing wickednesse time present afterwardes become ignomious shamefull theyr continuall reproch euer additioin later booke shall finde farther discourse europa forth ortelius eiulath chap eiulath prouince ouer inde beginneth east stretcheth long space landes towarde north hath name eiulath eiula oue child hebe patriarke hebrues lose sayeth super gene pri eiulath rehersed among child hebar yt came sonne lectane riuer ganges runneth land riuer hath another name called phison gene lib cap plinius lib cap praiseth riuer wonderfully saith ganges riuer inde receiueth himselfe many endlesse riuers great inough rowe saile idapsen cantabeian bisepin many neuer broader fifty furlong neither deeper pace riuer runneth lande eiulath land much gold spicerie bedelium precious stone onichius carbuncle hee sayth glose super genesis lande manye speciall country whome many elephantes sayd additioin second genesis ri er pison compasseth whole land heuilah golde gold good edelium onix stone euille heuilath cou try orient riuer pison call ganges yt commeth paradise doth runne cooper ethiopia chap ethiopia negro lande hadde first name coulour men sunne nigh roasteth toasteth isidore saith li coulour men sheweth ye strength starre continuall heat yt vnder south pole west full mountaines middle full grauel east side desart wildernes stretcheth west athlant toward east vnto end aegypt closed south ye occean north riuer nilus land many natios diuers face wonderfully horribly shapen also therin many wilde beast serpent also rinocerots beast called camelion beast manye coulours also cocatrices great dragon precious stone taken braines iacinctus chrisophrassus topasius many precious stone founde part cinamum gathered ther two ethiops one east mauritania west neere spaine numedia prouince cartage getula last course sunne south land yt called ethiopia adusta burnt fable tell yt beyond antipode men yt haue feete foot isid saith lib wordes set heere de ethiopia also saith li yt ethiopia haue ye name chus tooke beginning chus ye hebrue tongue called ethiops men came sotime fro riuer nilus dwelled beside aegypt betweene riuer nilus occean south nigh vnder sun much people esperes west side garamantes troglodites plinius speaketh li ca men ethiopia haue name blacke riuer riuer kind nilus breed reedes bull rush rise ware one time wildernesse many men wonderfully shape oft curse ye sun vtterly rising downe going behold sun curse alway heate greeueth ful sore troglodites dig den caues dwel steed house eate serpent may got noise feareful sounding voice bee like beast liue without wedding dwel woman without law bee called garamanis goe naked occupied trauaile bee called graphasants called enn j said haue head haue eye fired theyr weasts satyres haue onely shape men haue manner mankinde also ethiopia bee many wonder saith lib cap ethiops saith among foure footed beast bee brought forth without eares also elephant also haue hounde king diuine moouing doe haue three eyen forehead said kinde feigned vse principall looking sight arrowes also hunt lion panther liue flesh king hath onely one cie forehead men ethiopia liue onely honny suckles dried smoake sun liue past fortie yeares additio aethiopia great country affrike containing two region hether aethiop hether aboue aegypt hath north aegypt marmarike libia west inner libia south ethiop east red sea country ile meroe saint mathewe reported haue preached ye gospell ethiop hath north inner libia hether aethiop west south ye occean sea ye east goulfe called barbaricum country ye mountaines nilus whose brink bank crocodile breede destroiers men beast issueth aegypto chap egipt called esea egiptus danau brother reigned therein east side vnder red sea lande ioyneth siria hath libia west side great sea north side passeth inward south side stretcheth vnto ethiops isidore saith lib country vsed dew wherein falleth raine onely nilus moysteth lande tunneth maketh plenteous rising waxing hath plentie wilde beast feedeth greate deale world wheat corne fruite plenteous merchaundise chaffer filleth nigh worlde n dfull merchandise end aegypt canopia hath name canope menelaus gouernour buried huc vsque isidore li first called mepphayna sonne cham isidore saith lib land many perticular prouinces full famous city memphis ye ephasus builded iupiters sonne raphnes chiefe citie aegipt heliopoleos alexandria many isidore saith li osius saith two aegipts ouer neather ouer stretcheth east length hath north side sea arabia occean south beginneth west ye nether aegipt stretcheth eastward endeth redde sea conteyneth nation ouer aegypt many diuers desartes whome many monstrous wonderfull beast perdes tigres satire cockatrice horrible adder serpent endes aegypt ethiopia fast wel men suppose head nilus runneth aegypt bee bredde wilde beastes called cacothephas beast little body vncrafty member slowe hath full heauy head therfore beare alway downeward toward earth ordinaunce kind saluation man kinde wicked venimous ye man may behold right face die anone without remedy hath mallice serpent cockatrice hath plinius saith li cap also aegypt full many crocadiles hippotami water horse namelye water nilus additio aegyptus countrie called aegypt west bounded libia countrye called cyrenaica north sea mediterraneum part india east arabia arabian sea south thiopia country although raine seldome neuer yet ouerflowing riuer nilus made fertile hath abundance thing sauing vine bringeth sorth strange beast canopos ile entrie nilus took name canapus maister menelaus ship first night sauing one slaine wiues counsaile father ellade chap ellas elladis prouince greece europa name king hellena deucalions sonne greekes first called ellenes prouince countrye attica wherin sometime noble citie athens mother liberall artes nourysher philosopher sometime greece nothing worthye noble citie next thereto prouince achaia isidore sayeth libro one countrie ellas two prouinces boetia peloponensis first wit boetia spoken country ellas belongeth coast sea yt called hellespotus wherin many great wounders plinius saith li ca hellespotus tranges pergamcus saith many manner men called ophioges hele smiting serpent teeth groping onely hand laide drawe slayeng venimme also varro sayth yet bee whose spittle medicine stinging serpent hellespontus coast sea middle earth isid saith lib north turning going great going turning beside greece illiocum drawen straightnesse furlong xerxes king made bridge ship hee went greece warre water spreadeth maketh coast sea called propontides anone constrained tye pace coast sea hath name helles sister frixus shee fledde mallice stepdame fel ye sea drowned falling sea lande name hellespontus additio ophiogenes people hellespont heale stinging serpentes touching place eola chap eola ilande cicilia hath name sayde eolu sonne spote eolus p el faigne king wind saeolus ye king ye vvinds c signifieth violent blustering ouer bloing eola bee nine haue name hee also called vulcan fire burneth therein mount ethna sayth ilands hath owne name first called lippata second g tha high cliffes called thirde called strogile fourth de additio eola region greek asia betweene ionja odae also region conteining seauen betweene italy cicilia aeolia daughter neece aeolus also countrey neere vnto hellespont called sometime mysia franconia therof seemely faire dy strong get many child bee rich chaften generally fay ser lye face milde faire speach sad beering honest clothing peaceable owne neighbour true trustie straungers passing withyr wooll craft carftie working great parte worlde succoured helped woollen clothes principall wooll englande theyr subtill crafte bee made many noble clothes bee sent sea also land many diuerse country liddonia south femeth part liddia east side endeth hellespont north isidore saith libro two land either called frigia thore frigia hath ther smirinam hillium ye lesse riuer hernicis departeth licaonia worship account shorrse nigh men high body strong vertue statue flerce heart swifte nimble body vse yron speares steed arrowes lan plaine much leese pasture grasse hearbs without tree woode make fire rwes full glowe ou ge deni kine dried burned minde free subiect lordship nation put perill death e us r duttie rather dye bee vnder therefore sa e dignitie end suffer short bee greater among vnder liti ig g subiect iudges house themselues yere yere communnitie among loue tie punish vnchast right greuously keepe child chast vnto time full age beedded got manly child strong additio frisij people holland whereof countrey called friseland pof insulis fortunatis ca fortunate ilandes stand occean afore lefte side mauritania full nigh west departed sonder sea isidore sayth lib called ilandes plentie apple multitude byrdes much hony milke namely ile called caprana hath name goates wether full many therin wonderfull strong hound namely ile called canaria hath name huge number great mightie hound additio fortunatae insulae fortunate iles wet ye great occean sea pliny heeried solinus ptholome calleth also ye iles ye god ye wholsomnes ye aire wind blowing ther also ye plentie good fruit fertiltie ye grow thought soone iles called canaria distaunt spaine toward ye west mile ye account petrus martir iles founde number first ye yere lord french called betimlio ye co maundement katheren late king queene spaine teneriph palma found alphonsus lugo seauen iles vnder dominion king spaine notwithstanding suppose iles called fortunatae rather south called portugal insulae capitis viridis aquitania bounded mountaines pyrenaei caesar boundeth parte called celtica riuers rhene gerond agtippa describeth gallia betweene riuer rhene mountaines pyrenei occean sea mountain gebenna iura moreouer called lumbardie called gallia cisalpina pof gadis chap gades ilande ende spaine departeth affrica europe wherein hercules set wonderfull noble pillers token conquest thence commeth springing sea tirrenum well occean departed next land sixe score pace tyre came red sea occupied iland called gadis theyr language vnderstand separated gadis compassed ye sea therein groweth tree like palme gumme thereof lyke glasse maketh precious stone called ceramina isid saith li land maketh many country world rich fruite spicerie namely country west additio gades two iles part spaine beyonde granate worthinesse men time haue excelled one time rome men countrey citizen order state gentleman lesse two ilands reported grasse battling milke beast doth cast whaye haue cheese made vnlesse mixed much water written moreouer vnlesse beastes feeding often let bloud within thirtie dayes stiffeled dye fat fertilitie may seeme giue occasion fuble gerions beast hercules droue away pof grecia chap grecia hath name grecus king dwelled therein gaue thereto owne name isido saith lib prouinces thereof eyght dalmatia west epyrus helladas thessalia macedonia achaia twaine sea creta cyclades countrey wide counsaile diuells complained destruction kingdome beside many friuolous lyeng wonder touhing education birdes windes strine bringing vp committed one halima asse inclyning hir selfe downe said mahomet hic est sigillum prophetarum also three men drew bowells cleansed diuells porcion heart c mahomet coulde neyther read write himselfe testifieth alcarono azoara vtterly vnskilfull vnlearned youth great exceter gethulia cap gethulia prouince affrica hath name greek descended either greekes el men remained nation gothes isidore sayeth lib gathered great hoast sayled part libia place daye come greekes deriuation name called getuli therefore opinion among greekes nation neere kinne vnto isidore saith lib beside men dwell gelones people stretch south hesperie occean men goe straye desarte name gelon came iland gaulon beside aethiopia serpent bred may liue therein sayeth also ende affrica beastiall men called garamantes haue name garamant king sonne apollo buylded towne called garama owne name plynius speaketh saith verely departed farre company mankinde additio getae people suppose norwaye gothia say northeast scythia pertaining europe thinke ye people countreyes valachia transylu ia pof gorgones cap gorgones iles occean afore forland called vesperaserus therein dwelled woman wer called gorgones feminine said alith veloci english swifte roughnesse sharpnes body c glans name isid saith li additio gorgones monstrous woman vanquished perseus noble knight delyuered faire lady called andromada whale also slew medusa turned men stone whether hir pride hir hayres tourned adder lecherous lust brought hir louers shamelosse forgetfulnesse serpent signifieth pride lecherye shamelesse hardinesse pof gothia cap gothia prouince neather scythia europe hath name men suppose magog son iophet isidore sayth libro sayth old nation wer called gethas gotos wer sometime strong men huge body vsed dreadfull maner armor wepous men deeme child came occupied part europe asia child dane manye nation west getuli affrica amazones asia came child gothes sayth li land yet full wide hath north side norwaye denmarke compassed ye sea occean side countrey belongeth ilande called gothlandia called iland gothes gothes dwelled sometime iland beaceth well corne therein much pasture fish occupied manye manner merchaundises chaffer many manner skinnes plentie money merchaundise chaffe brought diuers landes countrayes shippes iland bee dde thence occean germanye fraunce britaine spaine additio gothi gotthi ile denmarke called gutland farre norwaye whence people first came vnto resorted great multitude people well countreyes called prussia liuonia russia tartaria diuers part called scythia making sundrie king deporulate bring subiection part europe finally destroyed rome inhabited parte italy called lumbardye lykewise subdued realmes castile arragon pof gnydo chap gnidum countrie iland asia betweene siria italia toward pamphiliam ciliclam lyeng creta sayde glose super acta aposto gnydus citie licia addition pof india chap inde countrey east asia hath name riuer indus cloased therewith west countrey stretcheth south side east north vnto mount caucasus therein manye manner men townes also ilande trabo fult precious stone elephauts therein also ilands grisa arge plenteous rich gold siluer also profitable tree neuer leese leaues indie noble riuers ganges indus hippanes adorne country inde also inde wholesome westerne winde beareth corne twice yeare therein men dyed coulour great elephant unicornes popiniayes hebeous tree called cinamom pepper reede smelleth full eete sendeth thereof precious stone berillus chrisoprassus carbuncle adamantes margarites union great lady feruentlye desire hill golde impossible come thereto dragon griphous many manner men wonderfully shapen isido saith foresaid word libro decimo quinto also among country landes world inde greatest rich mightie full people therefore plinius li ca telleth wonder might multitude indes saith inde many king hath vnder foure hundred thousand men armes sixe hundred cuneos horseman thousande elephant take wage euery daye land full rich one hath sixtie thousand foote men thousand horse men seauen hundred elephant alwaye men arayed warre battell land strong mightie rich sayd indie till earth vse chiualry vse merchaundise lead chafferthe commovveale vvell gouerned rule gouerne comminte best king iustices dome men giue principally religion learning wit wisedome among country landes inde greatest rich among landes inde wonderfull plinius saith li chap inde aboundeth wonder long space toward aethiopia inde many huge beast bred greater bound land also high tree men may shoote top arrowe sayd maketh plenty fatnesse earth temperatenesse weather aire water figge tree spred broade manye great company knight may sit meate vnder shadowe one tree also great reedes long euery peece betweene two knottes beareth sometime three men ouer ye water also men great stature passing fiue cubites height neuer spet haue neuer head ach tooth ach sore eyen bee grieued passing heate sun rather made harde sadde therewith also philosopher call gimnosophistae stande hot grauell morning till euen behold sunne without blemishing eyen also mountain men sol feete turned backward foote also eight toe one foote also ther houndes heades cloathed skinnes wilde beast barke hound speake none otherwise liue hunting fowling armed theyr nayles feeth full many aboue sixe score thousand sayth also among nation inde woman beare neuer childe child white haired anone borne satire men wonderfully shapen spoken treatise monstrous beast also ende inde rising ganges men without mouth cloathed mosse rough hairy thing gather tree liue commonly odor smell nosethrills neither eate neither drink smel odor floures wilde appples liue die anone euill odor smell liue full long seeme aged neuer dye middle age also hore youth black age plini rehearseth wonder many moe addition addition indea great rich countrie called english indv lieng south part ye world ptholomeus writeth diuided two part one called indie within riuer ganges west bounded aracosia gedrosia east hath great riuer called ganges north hill called imaus south west parte indian sea part indie wt ganges bounded west sayd riuer ganges north part scythia setica east region called sinaruni south indian sea nearchus great alexander admirall affirmed anus writeth foure month iourney ye plaines indie megasthenes saite breadth indie east west cotaineth furlong mile length fro ye north south furlong mile caesias affirmeth bee much residue asia onesicritus wrote actes alexander denieth third parte asia alwayes two summer fruites graine twice gathered windes alwayes temperate beastes fowles much greater countreyes diuers kindes name countreyes city otherwise time auncient writer bee knowen shall bee declared place mountants riuers great aboue additioof three principall riuers indie ganges indus hyphasis ganges great riuer diuideth indi called holye scripture phil one foure riuers come soorth paradise iosephus doth interpert inundation bredth therof soho writeth narrowest place eight mile brodest twentie mile ananus writeth narrowest bredth one hundred furlong eight mile many place spreadeth wide gerunde plaine high place appeareth man may discerne anye thing side shallowest place hundred foote deepe runneth seauenteene great riuers euerye one able beare shippe riuer ganges ile therein great citie called palibetia country called phrasia king whereof plyme writeth lib cap hath alwayes wage footman horsmen elephant additio indus notable riuer commeth great mountaine taurus incleaseth indie west runneth indian sea riuer runneth nineteene great famous riuers least great riuer donowe broadest strabo sayeth doe write moderately indus doe affirme breadth fiftie furlong twelue mile halfe water thereof causeth great fertilitie ouerfloweth thereof many sundry pleasant wholsome fruites doe spring without labour additio hypasis doe write hypanis arianus calleth hyphasis great riuer runneth mountaines scythia indie commeth famous riuer ganges breadth seauen furlong diodorus writeth libro streame thereof swifte man may passe euer space fiue dayes sayling water fresh commeth within foure day sailyng sea wonderfull bitter reason bitter fountayne runneth riuer great alexander finished iourney went farther indie set vp twelue altar stone euerye fiftye cubites greatnesse cooper pof hircania chap hircania prouince asia vnder mount caucasus lull wide countrey manye men diuers nation tongue isidore afterward idumea vnderstande lande edoms child idumea palestina departed certaine desarts bordets idumea strettheth vnto red sea lande strong full mountaines scituate vnder strong heat ye sun therefore people country make house caues vnder earth heepe strong heate sunne glose sayeth super abdiam additio idumea region syria ioyning aegypt bordering vpon palestine iudea chap ivry countrey townes beareth good corne fruite therein plentie veines oare rones mettall additio ptholomeus writeth two country called mysia lesse asia beyond eithinia farre ida mesopotamia cap mesopotamia hath etimelogia greeke inuironed two riuers tigris east euphrates west beginneth north betweene mount laurus caucasus south side therof babylonia chaldea isido sayth lib country asia huge land length bredth plenteous corne pasture beast fame wildeifull mettall rich additiomesopotamia countrye east lieng betweene two noble riuers tigris euphrates hath south babylomon north greate mountain called caucasus medium chap medium hath name medue king first assayled prouince modia hath kingdomes parthia wiest side inuitaned armenia north hath mountaines caspios east bersida south side country groweth tree called medira groweth none land noor countrie isidore sayeth libro country full rich moysted many riuers noble strong city town olde time king lande ouer came great babylonia emperours caldeis also men land perses sayled affrica medled themselues u baes men libia libees called mauros corrupt strange language barbarie notwithstanding mauri greeke language called blacke coulour isidore sayth libro additio medium country asia hauing north sea called hiremum west armenie assyria south persia east hirca ia parthia melos chap melos ilande ciclades rounde ilandes therefore called melos saye chap midia ilande prouince irelande standeth middle place aide hath name thing departed lande euen partes among fiue daughter kept parte ilande vse v best noble place countrye therefore mouing irish sayth therin groweth al manner tree manner tree beare aples therein ye tree life passing cold passing heate alwaye temperate weather aire middle thereof springeth well findeth water inough place well wall ordeined god hold wicked spirit fire ordeined hold wicked men good angells holde euill angells way euill spirit euill men come paradise huc vsque isidorus li cap vbi tractat de regionibus also ca super gen master story saith manner god beginning world ordeined araide place liking hearbes tree beginning world east place merrie far space land sea country dwel high reacheth almost circle moone also reson height water greate floud could come saith iohn damascene speaketh paradise saith god would make man owne image likenesse vnseene seene creature create made king prince earth thing earth hee made country lande man shoulde abide leade blissefull lyfe lande country called paradise set place liking god owne hande planted pleasure east lande higher land shineth temperate aire cleere alway full plant flourishing leaues good smell full light bright shining fairenesse ioye blisse oes er passing wit vnderstanding sensible creature kingdome god worthy image nore vnreasonable beast dwelleth onely man god owne hand worke also serabus sayth beda also paradise place set east departed country land men dwel occean mountaines betweene farre stretchet height circle moone conuenient place innocent man faire wether temperate neuer passing colde passing heate euerlasting faire weather temporate isidore saith also plentie good austen de ci tate dei ca saith might dread might sorry great plentie much good ther nothing greeued good desired offend grieue flesh soule man yt loued blisse also mirth ye place eller sairnesse damascene saith witnesseth ye euerlasting fairenesse tree flower spray tree wither leaues flowres fade also solace mirth witnesseth fairenesse fruit ther manner tree faire sight sweet eating genesis also witnesseth beautifulnesse light cleerenesse light proportioned purenes aire beda saith also noble grounde plenteous witnesseth multitude springing well sayde genesis wel sprong moisted paradise well diuided foure riuers also surenesse place witnesseth highnesse thereof toucheth circle moone beda saith isidore also vnderstand stretcheth aire quiet aboue troublous aire end bond moist erhalations vapour passing forth rising exhalation vapour listened body moone alexander expoundeth paradise reacheth fully circle moone sayde toucheth circle moone manner figuratiue speaking yt called hiperboli loqoutio yt might knowne highnesse paradise passeth yt neather earth without comparison also continuall without corruptio witnesseth long life therein ther elia enok yet aliue without corruptio master saith story nothing aliue may die wouber paradise know ireland iland dead body rot another men many die last end must borne ye iland looke ibernie literal paradise scituation thereof opinion among nation plin saith speaketh ilands fortune isi speaketh also li among ilands one yt beareth good grounde beareth al manner fruit without tilling down tree alway clothed faire greene twig spray sweete fruit good corne groweth hearbs grasse therfore errour nasion ditie secular prophet goodnes ye ground meaned yt ilands paradise yt errour foresaid ilands ye west afore ye left side mauritania occean isi saith li paradise east top highest mountaine falleth water maketh right great lake pond maketh great noise ye falling men country ye lake deafe borne passing huge noise yt corrumpteth wit hearing child basilius saith exameron wonderfully shape plini saith li therein fierre beast perdes tiger linces adder called alpedes serpent cruell sterce kinde also people harde cruell scarse vittailes holde content salt cardamonium turned home againe gathered company came againe pannonia put men dwelled first gaue name lande men called land hungaria herodotus saith prouince part messia riuer danubius lieth therby ouerfloweth pentapoli countrie march arabia palestina hath name fiue city euill men yt desroyed fire heauen land sometime plenteous country ierusalem desert buried trespasse sinne men countrey fire come downe heuen burned country ash lasteth euermore shadow likenesse thereof yet seene tree growe greene apple seeme ripe men desire eate take handes chaunge fall ash smoke yet burning hue v que isido li prouince rich destruction thereof among stone thereof saphires founde precious stoanes among earth thereof gold found iob toucheth saieng place saphire stone thereof soyle thereof golde iob afterward countrie turned dead sea called dead sea gendreth nothing aliue receiueth nothing aliue therin suffereth neither fish foules neither ship boates thing therein hath life sinketh ground lanterne light therein fleeteth aboue water sinketh ground light extinct isi saith li looke de marl mortuo tractatu marium aquarum brinke sea country nigh sodoma grow foresaid apple faire sight stinking bitter toast glose saith sup epi pet cap also another pentapolis affrica prouince libia hath name fiue city saye beruice centria apolonia polo tholomais tholomais bernices haue name greekes pentapole ioyened libia cerenensis belongeth bordets thereof isid saith li additio pentapolis countrie palestine arabia wherein ye city sodome gomor burned vengeance god sinne nature pof persia cap persia persida countrey asia counted among kingdomes parthes stretcheth downward east indes hath red sea west side toucheth medium north hath germania south ioyneth belongeth persida noblest towne incussa persida art magike first found thether nemroth gyant went confusion language taught perses worship sun men nigh country worshipped sunne called hel language isi saith li persia hath name perseus ye king came greece asia daunted ye strange nation strong warre long lasting victor last gaue name ye men subiects isi saith li ca de vocab gentium saith cirus time perses accounted vnworthy reputation among nation medis alway mightie hee saith persida full wide wealthy yt people ther noble citie called elam hath name elam sonne sem ye perses came first isidore saith first perses called elamite first name elam persida narbonens pictes englishman scot sayled thether old time dwelled gaue last name ofspring ye men land herodotus writer story telleth men came sayling countreyes britaine sailed along sea coast occean guyan obtained place country last men land without strong battaile builded called chiefe towne pictauium name pictes herodotus sayth towne called poycters called great countrey pictauia peyto laire runneth land land stretcheth along vpon sea occean hath spayne east side brittish occean ye south lesse britaine north coast gyan west lyttle prouince noble solempne diuers thing sayde grounde beareth welnigh manner corne fruite wine rich good ground breedeth solempne hauens sea noble city townes riuers well merry flews meade woodes strengthened rockes sea side fareth rochell vnneth men may come towne see straightnesse place sea men thereof meddeled w tre th men tongue manet therefore though haue first pictes men nation kindly strong body seemly shape yet french men take fierce sharpe wit nation nigh wonder isi saith li diuersitie heuen face men colour quantity body wit hart diuers therefore fair romanes sad greekes light tree guilefull french men kindlye fierce sharp maketh kind clime sayd therefore men peyto strong body faire face bolde heart guilefull deceiuable wit herodotus saith pof picardia chap picardia prouince france belgica also hath name towne castle called ponticon u herodotus saith de regionibus sayd town called pichen march lande lordship vnto brittish occean olde time supposed ad men countrie afterwarde name town lande soile beareth well corne fruite moyst
