france southward occean france west britaine england oeth picardy double ouer next france neather land yt ioyneth neere flaunders brabau called baipula country men seemly stature faire face bold heart light sharpe witted cleere vnderstanding ulde affection great boytous language tongue nation fraunce pof ramathea chap ramathea also called chanir region besides derabilum hath name citie ramatha samuel ye prophet borne hath another name called arimathia citie ioseph righteous man nichodemus annoynted lord bodye buried worshipfully glose saith super lucica citie linage ephraim iurie high mountaines therefore called ramathea say high rama high ierome saieth though land full mountaines yet heareth well corne fruite vine olyues moist well healthfull cleane pure aire full strong stedfast high place ierome sayth full couenable place stand waite espy farre ramathea called chanir olde copieaddition pof rencia cap rencia prouince rine countrey rine runneth hath name rencia nigh rine isi saith li countrey hath manye full strong city townes ground ther beareth well corne wine many place men strong hardy according germaines life manner loue theft robbery additio rhenus notable riuer germany called rheyne pof riualia chap riualia little prouince sometime strange farre g beleefe vnder beleefe christ subiect kingdome denmarke part thereof called vironia hath name virore greenesse therin grow many hearbs grasse good pasture leefe wood many place ground thereof beareth meanly corne land moyst water pond plentie fish sea lake pond many flock heards beast land ioyned scithia departed norpeges megardes onely riuer called narua herodotus saith pof rinchouia chap rinchouia little lande stretcheth citie maguncia vpon brinke riuer rine betweene mountaines vnto towne called pinguia called rinchouia riuer renum runneth thorough middle thereof though land little yet clyffe rine meruailous merry right plenteous faire goodly incredible plentifull high delight pleasure comfort dwell also passe waye pleaseth feedeth ortharde passing liking ground thereof sweet fat bringeth foorth right swiftly fruite corne right great plentie field growe apple tree diuers kindes nufs also yet notwithstanding great plentie fruite fielde groweth well good corne also diuers tree let vine little fielde grow together corne wine nut apple corbas peares many fruites hot well needfull medicine body spring grounde much good needfull mankind long rehearse pof romana prouintia cap prouince romanes varro sayth nigh containing world wide whersoeuer country land men dwell might power romanes subdued part world wide corner world wide felt sword fo ye hoast rome saith sometime part italy called romulea olde time name romulus builded citie rome gaue name men citie isi saith li sayde countrie first called saturnia name saturnus ye king ye first tought men countrie till land passing plentie called saturnus worshipped last god among starres afterwards called latini name latinus king called romani romulus inlarged fortified citie called quirites ye romulus called quirinus vsed alwaye speare called quirie language sabin isi saith lib cap de gentium noninatione pen may write full praising kingdome king thereof neither booke may containe full ye great deedes romanes hath lyking know deed read first booke machabeorurt de wonder shortly rehearsed vertues might additio romulus romane story affirme sonne mar isia yt daughter numitor berely ye son amuhus great b h purpose ranished illa darke virgin actuall haue asquartall put death king numitor h brother named amulius nature wicked fleirs cruell ving content take kingdome elder brother cast prison also murdere sonne laulus vnder colour honour made daughter il virgin vestall vnder hand perpetuall chastitie might haue issue afterward found childe mar romanes would haue men beleeue delyuered two somies amulius commaunded cast tyber theyr mother according lawe uestalls baried quicke happened time riuer tiber swollen ouer banckes men could come deepe channell wherefore charge drowning child cast land floud water sodainly falling lefte aliue founde faustulus ye king shephard brought home kept nourished wife laurensia strumpet named shepheards lupa whereof rose fable founder romane citie nourished woolfe child came afterwards age instructed faustulus stocke beginning gathered bande shepheardes killed amulius restored nursitor kingdome mount palatine brought vp began builde newe citie twinnes one age fell controuersis betweene giue name theyr newe citie contention grewe word tumult stroke vickering rhemus slaine although common opinion hee put death scornfully lept ouer newe walles citie romulus king alone peopled citie erecting sanctuarie sauegarde transgressours would come thether ordained hundred senatours called father procured wiues people rape maydens countrey resorting thether solempne gaines playes ouercame people cenina slewe king vanguished sabine people atemna receiued citie diuers valiant actes done time calling assemblye marrice called caprea great tempest sodainly gone man coulde tell thought stearne gouernment murdered priuelye senatours please people fained god named quirinus name romanes euer worshipped pof romania chap romania called newe nation romanes ne greeke saye newe since time constantine translated seate empyre rome rome constantinople citie thracia countrey region greekes called romania much say newe rome rabanus sayeth therefore vnto daye greekes call themselues greek common language rather romanos looke de gree litera g wher thou shalt finde manye thing greekes pof rodo chap rodus first ilande ilandes ciclabes east side capitoil robus first found citie first buylded citie one coldsus brasse seuentie cubites high hundred lesse colosus isidore saith li cap de vocab ciuitatum rodus iland called ciprus isidore sayth place additio time past manye christian resorted thether defend christendome saracen treason turke wan pof ruthia chap rvthia ruthenia prouince messa marche lesse asia hath countreyes romanes east side gothia north pannonia west grecia south land accordeth boemes sclauones language tongue countrey hath name parte thereof called galatia men thereof sometime called galathe sayd paule apostle sent epistle looke de galatia additio ruthem people beyonde liuonia countrey called russia pof sabea chap sabea countrey arabia hath name saba sonne thus countrey stretcheth straight length eastward toward sea persicu nigh chaldea ye north endeth ye sea arabia ye west lethiopia south land beareth frankencense giueth good smell woodes landes thereof growe mirrhe cinamom thus sweete spicerie isidore sayth libro lande rich sweete spicerie precious stone mettall birde called phenix wonder authoures recken ye region arabia shewed arabia queen saba speciallye ladye prouince neuerthelesse hir time principate affrica herodutus sayth queene aethiopia aegypt ye close saith super li reg supposed kingdomes west time additio sabaea saba countrey middle arabia toward east inuironed great rockes wherein great woode precious tree cinamom cassia bringing foorth frankencense mirrhe length woode twentie myles called schaeni comprehendeth italian mile one hundred fiftie plinius lib theophrastus lib de histo plat solinus writeth region bringeth foorth frankencense towne named atramicae eight mansion indeede containeth two hundred twentie foure mile mancio stathmos eight twentie italian myles chiefe citie realme called sabeta cooper pof samaria chap samaria isidore sayeth libro region palestina hadde name olde time chiefe towne citie thereof samaria sometime royall citie israell called sebastia hath name augustus emperour region middle betweene iudea galilea beginneth freete called eleis scituation thereof like kinde iudea hath difference thereto vertue isidore sayeth name first mount called somer mention made regum chap countrey afterwarde came men called samaritani passed assyries dwelled samaria vnderstood keeping men israel taken prisoner king assyries lefte keepe countrey isidore sayeth libro chap de vocabulis regionum plooke de eodem de samario monte littera additio samaria countrey citie syria ioining iudea chiefe citie ten tribe israell taken prisoner king syria ledde away captiues thether sent assyria panimes inhabite countrey afterwarde called samaritani mixte lawe moyses abhominable polatrye citie afterward called sebaste pof sambia chap sambia prouince messia europa set lower scithia middle countrey betweene pratenes estenes ofiliances liuenes turones wer al subiects puissance goth olde time varro telleth herodotus also dwelled cliffes occean haue forelonges coast sea afore side north saith sambia plenteous land beareth well corne hath much marreys woodes compassed many lake riuers among strange nation men seemly body bold heart passe nation crafte curious working additio read ortelius also ile called sanibria sambia appeareth olde copie pof sabaudia chap sauoye called sabaudia bold way safe old men say way old time men goodnes prince safe trauell mountaines desart countrie passe country fraunce italy alway righteousnes therfore common fame alway ye wayfaring men wer safe high way without dred spoyling robbery part pirene mountaines ther depart betweene fraunce italy looke de montibus pireneis litera p land hath another name called prouintia pof sardinia cap sardinia iland sea middle earth beside sicilia hath name one sardus begotten hercules came lybia great multitude occupied sardinia gaue thereto owne name lande seene sea affrica likenes print man foote towarde east toward west broad euen side toward south toward north therefore shipmen greece first called ithos lande seene length seauen score mile bredth fortie therein breedeth serpent neyther woolfe onely little beast called solifuga solifuga noyfull wicked men therein breedeth venyme hearbe named apium risus apium risus draweth shrinketh together ye iawes men slayeth laughing hot welles heale sicke men blindeth theeues sweare vppon water touche eyen isidore sayeth libro additio sardinia ile sea called ligusticum gean passing seauen mile corsica pof sarmata cap sarmata land strange men called sarmate haue name studie businesse armour went armed spoyled many prouinces lentulus withstood would suffer passe ouer danubius isidore sayeth li men descended well gothes gipides vse fight well horsebacke foote therefore called isidore saith additio sarmatia countreye europe bordereth north vpon sea called sarmaticum west vppon riuer vistula germanie south vpon sibenburgh dacia mysea inferior east vpon sarmatia asia riuer tanais marish meotis vnder many countreyes contayned polonia rhussia frussia lituania linonia moscouia c greater parte countrie vnder king pole pof samo chap samo iland sea aegeum iuno borne thereof sybel samia pythagoras samius first founde name philosopher isidore saith libro said earthen vessells first made iland therefore called vas samea vessells samo knowen claye ilande tough glewe therefore able make vessells isidore saith additio samos name two iles sea called aegeum one thracia therefore called samothracia lyeth ephesus pof saxonia chap saxonia prouince germania sayde nien prouince came greekes dwell part arriued ship expulsed droue thuringes dwelled occupied vnto cleue occean saxon gate wanne place many battailes strong dwell prouince daye men alwaye gretest warrior seemely shape stature high strong bodye hardie bolde heart saxonie land plenteous corne beareth well corne manner fruite full woodes mountaines full fruite leese fieldes rich beastes flockes siluer copper mettall solempne mountaines stone digged stronglye resolued fire turne substance brasse ther noble riuers famous wesera limia albia sala odera many runne thereby ouer beyond albina salt well many place best salt white sodde made therein many strong city castle townes plaines mountaines beside mountaine copper digged great hill stone thereof smell vyolets mountaines fairest marble digged namely beside riuer danubius stone called saint michael stone mountaines plentie venison wilde beast beares boares harte therefore mountaines full woodes manye manner hunting vsed many noble thing founde countrey saxon looke de germania littera g litera de alemania saxonia hath boemia polonsa east side westualia west side frisons toward occean men thuringe north frenchman south men noble strong ouercome daye herodutus sayeth additioafter time arthur king britaine ye saxon greatly molested briton helds subiection long time pof sclauia chap sclauia parte mesia containeth many region boemes paloni metani wandali ruttheni dalmate charinthi sclaues vnderstand accorde many thing touching language manner yet diuers rite vsage holde yet faith panims vsage greekes vsage latines region noble grounde beareth well corne also wine many place nation yt part haue bush cut round excepte ruthens meddeled dutchman latines sclauia double called selauonia containeth dalmatia saruia carinthia many region men sclauia dwell vpon sea high mountaines thicke woodes care till field plaines men fierce sharp vnseemly without deuotion god seruice lead life robbing sea vse take praies sea land namely dwell vpon sea lesse sclauia ye border saxony stretcheth pruse wandales boemes sclauia departed pruse diuers riuers water gothes dane arme sea occean sea departed lesse sclauia endeth cliffe thereof region beareth well corne fruite moyst riuers pond therin much wood pasture milke hony men strong body earth tiller fisher deuout god peaceable neighbor dwell sclauia medling company haue daye germaines herodotus saith sclauonia pof sparta chap sparta region besides grecia called lacedemonia another name one lacedemon sonne semele looke de lacedemonia litera l men called lacedemones spartian also isidore sayeth libro pof seres chap seret prouince east hath name town called seres cotton gathered tree silke made cotton poet syenketh men land saith ignoti facie sed vellere seres additio seres people asia hauing great plentie silke first increased silke worme called bombax also much cotten wooll called bombazi olde copie ignoti facie voce fere mille seres pof selandia chap seland land sea side compassed riuers armes sea iland hath holland east side flaunders south occean west britaine north manye ilands departed sunder armes sea ilands compassed strong heapes grauell quarry warded defended waues strength sea soile land beare wel corne bare tree saltnesse sea tree may haue deepe more rootes therefore set planted faile drye anone seland full men people rich men great stature strong body bolde heart denout god seruice easie softe among themselues beneficiall many greuous men must needes withstand wrongfull riser enemy additio zeland next adioyning england ouer ipswich brill dort midelbrough chiefest hold strongly fenced sea pof semigallia chap semigallia lyttle prouince beyond sea balticum beside cilica liuonia low asta hath name gallache dwelled therein meddeled men lande called semegalli halfe gallis come gallis men lande lande good beareth well corne rich pasture meedes men straunge vnseemelye sharpe cruell pof gallia senonensis chap gallis senonensis prouince frenchman hath germania treuerensis east side south oner burgoyne mountaines pennsnes west part fraunce called gallia engdunesis ye north gallia belgica land beareth wel corne fruit vine also therin diuers wels riuers streames galli senones sometime called zenones receiued freely harborow afterward z chaunged letter called senonens isid saith libro name citie senonensis theyr chiefe citie land full people hath manye city manye strong walled fownes riuer runneth thereby called serana additionsenones people fraunce pof siria chap siria hath name sirus abraham neuely got cethura isidore saieth libro lande endeth riuer eusrates east side great sea egipt west side stretcheth north armenia cappadocia south sea arabicum saith space thereof stretcheth great length narrowe straight bredth containeth manye prouinces comagines fenicia iudea part thereof besides saracen nabathes region full people plentifull corne fruite neate sheepe great horse ass camells rich waze sweete spicerie metall strong city castle moyst noble riuers lake pondes hath noble hauens sea namely palestine maritimie fenicis men sterne great warriours occupie diuers countreyes land diuers chaffer merchaundises therein diuers nation differ face varie language minde manner dwell desart nabathei saraceni dwell mountaynes woodes greaues full many among nation region hauing north part armenia west mesopotamia south susiana east medium also containeth phoenicia palestina babilonia pof sichima cap sichima little lande samaria middes betweene iudea galilea hath name sichem sonne emor builded therein citie called sichem named neopolis neapolis three city name one naples one affrike caris countrey thereabout called sichima isidore saith libro ierome saith super genesis portion land iacob gaue sonne ioseph ouer lot land linage ephraim ioseph buried tombe shewed vnto daye ier saith iacob got land bought money gotten great trauel gaue therefore hundred lambes said genesis ier saieth trauell iacob sayd tooke land amorteis hand bowe sword nigh terebintus tree vnder iacob bid mawnets sonnes went vp sichima lusa called bethel also saide genesis place iosephs bretheren fedde kept flockes ioseph cought found sichem dotaym spoyled solde aegyptians afterwade abimelech sonne ieroboal destroyed sichima slew men dwelled ther sowed salte countrey sayd iudie field iacobs well lorde rested wearie waye badde woman giue drinke water well sayde iohn place fertile wonderfull merry stedfast scithia chap scithia greatest region ouer part thereof asia neather europa sicilia chap sicilia sometime called scicania name sicanus king afterward called sicilia name siculus brother italus land old time called trinacria three furlong called pelorum patheum libeum trinacria gree e saye three square diuided three square land departed italy little sea afore sea affricum land beareth well fruit rich gold full den chin caues ful wind brimstone ther burneth heat mount ethna sea therof scilia caribdis shiue swallowed sinke broken country ciclopes afterward nourisher tyrant beareth well corne eared sowen seed first land chiefe citie thereof siracusa wel aracusa riuer albius nourisheth horse therein first found iland comedia riuer agath sicilia stone achates first found ye sea sicilia white corall ingendered salt called agrigentine wonderfull manner salt melteth fire sparkleth water al lande conteineth space three thousand furlong also salustius saith sicilia ioyned italy somtime ye space betweene broken consumed strength sea huc vsque isi lib ca de insulis ther al forsayd thing rehearsed plinius telleth additio sicilia noble ile first called trinacria afterward sicania ye last sicilia forme cornard therefore hath ye name trinacria one corner called pachinus extendeth toward ye part greece called peleponensius morea second corner called pelorus lieth toward italy third called lilyhens extedeth toward affrica pelarus exceedeth temperance ye earth wet may nure drieth dust ile containeth circuite solinus writeth furlong italian mile diodorus syculus writeth plinius sayth three corner distant pelorus pachinus land mile thence lilybeum mile thence pelorus mile sayth also agrippa affirmed bee circuit mile doe agree solinus diodorus may happen diuersitie furlong called sir latine stadium fertilitye ile graine beautie medowes delicatenesse dance norway sea balticum east side british occean west hils norway people north ioyneth denmark southward endeth ther suecia called gothia also good ground beareth well corne hath vine great plenty pasture mettall recompenseth defalts beside many manner rich hath sea passeth manye region landes beast wilde tame siluer oare many rich men bee full strong theyr might chiualrye daunted long time much people men bee called sweui haue name mount called sueuie standeth entering germania men dwelled first countrye mount hee sayeth also saith countrie hath danubius bauaria east side rine alsacia west high mountaines called alpes italy south franconia neather germania north sueuia double neather stretcheth toward rine ouer towarde high mountaines alpes riuer danubius either good lande best halsaite riuer rhene south mountaines alpes north frankland somtime called alemania wherof germany called almaine dutch called swaue tanatos chap tanatos little iland occean departed britaine little arme sea hath wheat field noble ground called tanatos hath name death serpent earth land carried countrye worlde slayeth serpent foorthwith isidore sayth lib additiothis supposed ile tenet kent bignesse fertill good land trapobana chap trapobana ilande inde toward south side indish occean beginneth land stretcheth seauentie mile fiftie pace length foure store fiftye thousande furlong breadth riuer runneth full margarites precious stone parte thereof full elephant beast men dwellin part thereof lande men saye two summer two winter one yeare flowres spring twice yere profitablest ilande inde springeth alway leaues bee alway greene fade neuer isidore saith lib addition taprobane addition ile indian sea dide writer supposed contrarie part worlde v therefore called worlde lieth point betweene east west quantity thereof diuersly described sundry authore strabo writeth length eight thousande furlong thousand mile plinius martianus solinus affirme legth seuen thousand furlong eight hundred lxxv mile breadth furlogs mile part extendeth beyond equinoctial line south hath northeast lesse indie nowe called samotra vnder dominion great cam gouerned foure king exquisite forme iustice notwithstanding people idolater hunt tygres elephant panther great plentie also found carbuncle saphires iacincts topaces ruby granates great number groweth sinamome canel beniamine sweete tree great abundaunce haue money golde siluer brasse waight value auncient coine romanes also found great plentie orient pearles thracia chap thracia prouince grecia tiras son iaphet came thether called land south hath macedonia ye west many diuers nation dwelled therein sometime massagete sarmate scithe many land wide large therefore many nation might conteined therin riuer hebrum springeth runneth thracia many strange nation isidore saith li additio thrace region europa north bounded land mysia east higher south ye sea aegum west bosphorus thracius propontis therein citie constantinople syria ioyning vnto arabia thessalia chap thessalia isidore saith libro prouince grecia hath name thessalus king ioyneth south side macedonia thessalia many riuers therein many town ye chiefe therof called thessalonica also mount pernassus sometime hallowed apollo thessalia country achilles thence came laphites said brake first horse bridle sate backes seemed one body horse man therefore knight thessalia scined centauri isidore saith lib cap de portentis thessalia first found shilling golde crafte vse breaking horse isidore saieth libro farther bee sayth lib moses time tell greate floud thessalia destroyed deale people lande fewe saved succour mountaines namely mount parnassus mount deucalion reigned time fledde vnto shippes receiued toppe hill pernassus nourished cherished wherefore greekes fable feigned deucation restore mankinde stone affirmeth additio thessalia region greece called also aemonia sometime pandora somtime pyrthea pelasgia homer argopelasgicon inuironed foure greate famous hilles east mountaynes pelion os north olympus west pindus south othris page duplicate page duplicate marcheth macedonia east people valiant men horsebacke inumerble battaile polihius writeth verye vniust theyr promise woman wonderfull witch tranformed men shape forme beast tenedos cha tenedos iland grecia one ciclades north side wherin citie thene builded land hath name city one thenes young man defamed haue doe stepmother fled vnto ye iland wherin found none fill gaue citie hee builded iland owne name additio tenedos ile sea aegenum mytilene hellespont farre troia thile iusula chap thile last iland occean betweene north countrey south sixe day sailing beyond britaine hath name sun sunne stinteth summer dayes begin shorten daye beyond therfore sea thereof slowly froze isidore saith lib plinius sayth ye place vninhabitable summer nothing may grow great burning heat winter freesing colde euennesse day night march sunne ariese vnto euennesse day night haruest sunne libra sunne forsaketh ilande time euennesse day night againe march sunne commeth halfe yeare day halfe night saith cap de insulis lib de solstitijs li also beda saith li de naturis rerum solinus also additio thyle ile called island old cosmographer supposed ende earthlye soile late yeres found otherwise tripolitana chap tripolitana region tripelitana name two region one fenicia hath name tripoli famous citie strong mightie defendeth succoureth countrie tripolitana affrica betweene pentapolis bizantium hath name three greate city wit osea sabine leptis greate lande hath sirtes east side trogoditas north sea adriaticum west bizantium gelulas garamantes south stretcheth occean ethiopia isidore sayth additio tiypolis countrie affrike another syria third phoenicia trogodia chap trogodia region ethiopia men thereof bee called trogodites haue name bee swift foote followe take wilde beastes running region iland wherin groweth best kinde mirre pure drop thereof found called mirre trogoditis hath name ilande growe isidore sayth lib though prouince ethiopia yet stretcheth end arabia sometime sayd belongeth arabia libro sometime ethiopia saide lib nono additio troglodyte people furthest parte affrike beyond aethiopia dwell caues doe eate flesh serpent troiana chap troiana prouince phrigia first called dardania name dardanus dardanus came greece phrigia reigned first afterwarde sonne erictonius nephew tros citie troye country name isidore saith libro troy destroyed many troians sayled diuerse country world get place expelled put many nation country dwelled stead afterwarde came mightie nation world true story diuers region land tell additio troia citie troy also countrey wherein troy stoode thuscia ca thuscia prouince italye betweene ligures territorye rome strengthened mightely stronglye diuerse mountaines strong place isidore sayth libro thuscia hath name ofte sacrifice thus incense partes burialles obsequies men olde time vsed relygigion deuotion burne offer much frankenscence namely wept made greate dole sorrowe theyr dead men burnt thus alters goddis sayde thusria craft diuination first found isidore sayth land first called aemilia olde time therein bee many solempne city noble hath citye pise west towarde liguria senos lucani florence towarde north citie arecium toward east toward south thurthon pernes assise ioyne bee valley spolitane hath sea adriaticum march anconitana east side brinke tyber rome south melan liguria west romaniola prouince padua north lande stretcheth much length east west hath lesse breadth north side south land full high mountaines place stronge touching scituation grounde beareth well corne fruite ayre good wholesome sea maketh lande rich two side many welles lake make land moist plenteous riuer arui runneth thereby adorneth plentye sweete saffron spicerye groweth maketh singularlye noble rich manye hot welles spring make kinde solemyne additio tuscia countrie italy wherin city florence sene luca pise thuringia chap thuringia prouince germania middle betweene saxon franco westualls hath beemes saxones east side francenes baua e south side sucues alsace west men rine westualls north name country meaneth thuringia harde men bee harde also cruell agaynst enymyes countrye populous men bee faire seemely stature strong bodye harde steadfast heart lande strengthened closed mountaynes full plaine within beareth wellcorne fruit without uiniardes manye strong castle townes onely mountaines also plaines riuers lake pond good aire greate plentie good pasture many ox sheepe beast mountaines diuerse mettalles mined herodutos sayeth sought left vnsearched priuy march germania thuronia chap thuronia prouince ouer france sometime accounted part gyan hath ye name ye noble citie turon thuron floure priest holy saint martin rested vpon riuer ligeris runneth thereby moisteth maketh rich many manner wise land beareth well corne fruit wine pasture therein wholsome aire many wood men body seemely shape hardy bold heart goodly deede speath sober additio turones people fraunce riuer lei vasconia chap vasconia gascoine prouince beside mountaines perenei sometime accounted vnder gyan hath name towne wastea isidore saith lib hath mountaines pirenei one side sea occean another nigh peito third side land many wood tree land mountaines many partes thereof many viniards many much sendeth plentie wine country land nigh also ilands ye sea riuer girunde departeth land tholose runneth gascoine entereth sea occean beside burdewes chiefe citie gascoine isid saith li cap de vocabilis gentium gascoines haue name towne wascia dwell long large solitude mountain pirenei called uascones uaccones changing c pompeius subdued spaine hasting come triumph hee put men mountain pirenei gathered one towne therevpon towne called vrba conuenarum isidore saith plinius herodotus telleth yt men gascoines light pliant bodye hardie bolde heart fierce hafly battaile venecia chap venecia sayd olde men prouince uenir prouince stretcheth cliffe ye sea adriaticum vnto riuer padus departeth betweene ye city country nether ouer liguns say betweene pergamenses medolanensis stretched somtime ye true writer story lombard ligures telleth coast ye foresaid sea afore nigh prouince ye citie uenice builded prouince many noble cityes isi saith li montus builded mantis daughter resia destruction thebe came italy standeth uenecia french tongue called alpina also uenecia prouince italia yt lordship many land city ye sea land olde time day might therof lordship stretcheth right far sea euen vnto grecia reacheth fro country germania subdueth theft tiranny skimmours sea theeues dalmacia sclauia represseth gouerneth ruleth rightfully ilandes hauens coast sea vnder lordshippe thereof defendeth mightely subiects enimies hold common profit ciuill vnder rightfull lawes suffereth within bound sed abide contrarye god lawe thinke wer superfluitie reckend godnesse worthines men vertue might aduisement readinesse great accorde loue righteousnesse mildnesse men uenecia knowen nigh nation saith roiall writer storie langobardes additioread ortelius concerning venice also munsterus westualia chap westualia prouince neather germania hath saronia east side thuringia bassia south king colaine west occean frisia north closed two end two noble riuers bee wesera rhenum rine toucheth north west wespera towarde east lande bookes called olde saronia preserueth keepeth selfe cleane spise fornication straightly punisheth aduiterers hath reuerence honest wedlockes although snared pamins superstition til seuentie yeare lord bonifacius writeth epistle king england land full woodes pasture apte feed beastes beare corne moisted many riuers well lipia kura many well riuers salt welles mountaines plentie mettall dare land much fruit many orchardes apple nut also wilde beast swine beast small greate men commonly seemelye high stature faire shape strong body bolde hardie heart much chiualrie wonderfull hardie bolde hardie heart alwaye prest readie armes strong cityes well walled strong castle town mountaines plaines vironia chap vironia little prouince beyonde denmarke toward east hath name uirore greene colour full hearbes grasse wood bee many well water grounde thereof heareth well corne men sometime strong fierce cruell vnseemelye subiectes kinges lawes dane lande occupied germaines dane looke littera r de riualia lande departed men nogardes catheis full great riuer called narua winlandia chap winlandia countrye besides mountaines norwaye towarde cast stretcheth vppon cliffe occean full plenteous woode hearbes grasse men countrie bee straunge somewhat wilde fierce occupie themselues witchcrafte men faile coastes also men abide default winde profer winde saylingthe samoyes bordring ye russe vse like inchatment sell winde vse make clewe thrid make diuers knot knit therin commaunde drawe clewe vnto three knottes moe lesse haue winde softs strong theyr missebeleefe seendes oue ayre arise stronge tempest softe hee draweth clewe lesse knottes sometime moue winde stronglye wretch beleeue drowned rightfull dome god vitria cap vitria little ilande british sea departed britaine little arme sea ground thereof best lande wheat therein many woodes groaues many beast wilde wels riuers moist lande ilande temperate wholesome countrie plenteous fruite sayd english men dwell therein day trevisa heere lacketh mention made whether ward land beareth britaine side britaine land men would thinke ilande wight wight commonly called insula vecca ile heere called vitria additio whether ile bee parte uitrie canuas linnen cloth made time past else beeing consumed sea nowe ile whether making glasse hadde anye originall yselondia chap yseland last region europa north deyond norwaye vttermost partes thereof alway ise srosen stretcheth vppon cliffe occean towarde north sea frore greate strong colde iseland hash ouet scithin east side norwaye south irish occean west sea farre north called irelande lande ise glasse sayed mountaines snowe frore harde ise glasse thristall found also region white beares greate right fierce breake ise glasse clawes make manye hole therein diue sea take fish vnder ise glasse drawe hoales bring cliffe liue thereby land barraine except place valley place vitheth grow oat place men dwell onelye groweth hearbes grasse tree place breede beastes wilde part men lande liue fish hunting flesh sheepe may liue old therefore men lande weare colde felles skinnes beares wilde beast looke hunting clothing maye haue come landes men full grose body strong full white giue fishing hunting additiothose goe thether fishing meruailously troubled kinde flie like gnat stinketh foule additioisland interpreted lande ise called olde writer thyle extended betweene south north almost schones longitude schone furlong parte full mountaines vntilled plaines verye fruitfull inhabitant faine driue castell feeding least shoulde ouermuch fatnesse strangle die three mountaines meruailous height top wherof reuered continuallye snowe lowet partes lyke operation mount etna flaming forth fire brimstone drie called helga mon crosis third hecla whose flame consumeth flaxe towe yet quenched water fire breaketh forth hydeous casteling lyke thunder casteth forth pomisse stone meruailous height neere vnto mountaines riuers chinkes lyke deepe raues especially foote mount hecla deepe eie canne perceiue bottome abisme appeareth shape men though drownes yet breathing foorth sound saieng must depart thence mount hecla touching fearefull noyse ise read r eden r well zeugia chap zeogia called zeugis also prouince thore carthage ituate lesse africa betweene bisantium numidis isidore sayth lib prouince stretcheth north sea siculum sayth stretcheth south country getules hither part thereof beareth well corne full serpent beast wilde wild ass wilde beastes bee found wonder beast wonderfully shapen saith additio zeugma among owne receiued hee sent seruauntes intreated shamefully slewe heerein appeareth nature discorde powre errour tyrtannye simple interteinement ueritye appearth among seuerall kindes birdes beastes fish wormes flyes flower hearbes plantes tree fruites seedes manye thing increase man god hath made cleane bodied cheerefull countenaunced swifte heare prompt speake apte learne poure beleeue hauing angelicall vertues shoulde stirre minde whilest hee taking materiall nourishment abideth vnto singular consideration vertuous exercise whereby soule tasting bodye might faith good workes feele endlesse nourishment prepared child god whilest studie subdue kingdomes ouercome theyr neighbour robbe fatherlesse widdowes rauish virginnes gouerne bee gouerned spirit terrestriall ferryes doe breede shape sinne hatch forth manye abhominable euills theyr whole race yeares spent vaine glorious beasting filthye liuing whose endes dampnation whose vellye theyr god glorye theyr shame worldlye minded earth lordes therein round worlde dwell therein man made robbe kill destroye giue continuall praising vnto god learne god bee bountifull mercifull liberall bee contented hath regardeth verye simplest creature theyr kindes shall bee onelye accuser fleshlye violence god without remission consider ioyes worlde disturbed affliction frayle weare awaye ioye fayth onely disquieted extremityes crosse persecution made perfect stormes daungerous faith effect godlye beeing fenced strength faith patience doe containe whole world tirrannie thereof nolli intelligere vt credas sed crede vt intelligas time vniuersall table neuer inough bee praysed doth diuide compasse earth three maynes first hee calleth said auncients diuided three whence diuided holye scripture mankinde tooke beginning seconde day wee call america west india thirde hee calleth south lande many fearme magelonica discouered hether vnto fewe sea coastes antiquitis hath taught compasse earth containeth aboute widest fiue thousande foure hundred germaine milesa germaine mile supposed p english mile italian mile later age affirmeth manye portion earth plinie sayeth seconde booke nature nare rather many haue written point worlde neyther worlde anye thing else vniuersallye matter glorye seate heere wee beare honour heere wee exercise empire heere wee desire rich heere mankinde falleth together eares vproare heere renewe warres euen ciuill killing one another wee make earth wider passe ouer publike furye nation wherein driue awaye borderer stealth digge vp neighbour stuffe put grounde proper good belong vnto example many region yeelde lande owner lewe purchaise rent bowelles earth bee founde anye mettalles value purchaiser shall lorde thereof much equitye maye bee taken steede thifties painfull trauaile lling sayde grounde bring foorth good corne therfore nowe good corne thiftles lorde maye take corne yet replyeth contrarye sayeth mettalles therefore right lorde tenaunt dd neuer imploye charge thing readye prouided let reason stand lawe yet sayeth guide lawe kingdome heauen math lyke vnto treasure hidde field man findeth concealeth ioye thereof goeth selleth hee hath buyeth fielde hideth treasure god vniuersall creation findeth man gifte knowledgewhere good subiects hee ther prince shall neuer lose theyr right whome due vnto whome giuen wherefore hath hee founde treasure boughte substaunce fielde therefore inheritaunce inheritance denyed treasure whye difference eyther mine shine referre equitye question vnto prudent wise worlde thinges maye bee considered glorye god hath lymited countryes farre abroade hath driuen dweller beyonde boundes small part earth taketh pleasure measure couetousnesse shee hath inlarged portion length therfore maye dead man haue thus farre hee america new worlde discouerye gloabe earth hemisphaer called america huge widenesse daye newe worlde remayne vnknowen vnmentioned auncientes euen vnto time yeare christ byrth yeare first discouered italian named christopher columbus genoa seemeth exceede point measure man meruayles dillygence auntientes describing setting foorth whole compasse gloabe earth commonditye opportunitye verye greate empire searche vnknowen countryes considered also cruell greedys infatiable desire mankinde gaping golde siluer leauing nothing vnaduentured assayed ende might obtayne thinges countryes doe wonderfullye detean diuided affric istmus betweene mare mediterraneum tetraneum gulph arabia residue occean sea compasse auncients haue manifoldly diuided day seemeth vnto may stilye diuided fiue part according vnto hir empire gouerned first part whereof ioyneth europe obayeth great duke moscouia shall limitted frosen sea riuer obil lake bitaia lyne drawen thence caspian sea istmus betweene sea pontus eurinus second shall bee obayeth great cham emperour tartar whose limit south mare caspium riuer iaxartes mountaine imaus east north occean west kingdome duke moscouia alreadye spoken third part ofspring ye ottoman doe occuple containeth land soeuer betweene pontus eurinus mare aegeum called archipelogus mare mediterianeum mare aegyptum gulph arabia persia riuer tigris mare caspium istnu seene betweene pontus eurinus forth shall comprehended kingdome persia daye gouerned sophy hath tomanus maketh almost continuall warre west kingdome great cham north east stretcheth almost farre riuer indus south washed sea daye called mare indicum time past mare rubrum red sea fifth parte shall haue rest tearme indie also called time past gouerned one alone others many small king euerye region thereof hath almost prince many also fributarie great cham neither passed ouer certaine place vpon sea coast gulph arabia commonly called cabo de lampo thou seest degree latitude north manner possessed portugall el tributarie vnto ilandes ascribed asia among innumerable chiefe creta rodus mare mediterraneum taprobana zeilan indian occean also remembraunce forefather portugal discouered ianae borneo celebes paloban mindaneo gillano moluccis full spicerie iapan found late guinea last whether ilande fastened lande antarctike euident onely among prophane writer tearme parte earth first monarch ye work assyrian persian babylonian medes greatly renowned also holy scripture famous rest berrin onely mankinde created blessed almightie god deluded corrupted enimie satan restored christ sauiour also reade well neere historie testament therein written complete asia strabo doth handle sixe bookes beginning ptholome setteth foorth three bookes likewise table attributeth vnto prouinces newe writer none hath vniuersally described marcus paulus enel ludouicus vartomannus iohn mandeuile manye fable set downe haue written much knewe worthye knowledge trauailing ouer countreyes c affrica auncients haue diuided many wayes daye iohn leo writeth diuided foure partes wit barbaria numidia libia negro thinke sea atlanticsnd middle earth sea called mediterraneo atlas countrey bordering upon aegypt inhabitant called beledi da bringeth foorth date wherevpon arabian hath none name date bearing countrey tted west sea atlantic north mount atlas toward east runneth eloaeat citie n hundred mile distaunt aegypt ye desarts lybia south side thereof lybia thirde parte called arabian toongue sarra word signifieth much desart beginneth towards east riuer nilus thence goeth westward sea atlantic numidia lyeth north side thereof southward ioyneth selfe negro name beeing taken either ye inhabitant blacke colour el riuer nigris passeth countrey hath north side libia south side aethiopian sea west kingdome gualatae east kingdome goagae consider manner knit vp africa middle lande sea mare mediterraneo sea atlantic also aethiopian sea riuer nilus whence aegypt aethiopia ascribed asia notwithstanding properly thinke good ioyne affric aethiope indeede day doth containe empire presbiter iohn new writer assigned ioined affrica thinke ptolome conuenient ought rather bee lymitted middle earth occean sea riuer shall haue forme pena insula ioyned asia istmus straight lande betweene middle earth sea gulph arabia south parte heereof heeretofore auncientes vntill yeare christ anno vasco de gama passed first daunger promentorie good hope otherwise termed bona spei aylyng abb affrica cal u parte persian arabian called zanzibar said promentorie good hope inhabitaunts blacke thinke meete speake thinke heate neerenesse sunne onely cause theyr blacknesse euident lesse hot heere sea magelan respect dissaunte heauen measure heat ye place notwithstanding sayd white attribute blacknes burning ye sunne consider spaniard italian nation south parte haue theyr body white forasmuch farre equinoctiall lyne sayd inhabitaunts promentory good hope one towarde south toward north liue vnder searcher nature thing countrey greekes called lybia latin africa without extremitie tolde beleeue iosephus called afer one ye posteritie abraham another reason name thou shalt finde iohn leo nobler delle zabacobe riuer tanais commonly called istmus fountaines wherof lyeth strayght north meanes hath forme apeni insulae lande lyke ilande maye seene map head heereof rome sometime conquerour world map doth vnfolde europe hath besides romane empire ouer whole earthwhen rome surceased ouercomer vvorld svvord violence shee practised subdue dominios bi supersticious heresie making hie chiefe capitain former tiranie kingdomes besides thou adde vnto damianos agoies doth recken spaine alone kingdomes generall haue receiued christian religion fertill beyond measure hauing natural temperature aire calme inough accounted inferiour plant kinde graine wine tree compared best region pleasant beautified goodly city townes uillages albeit lesse forme part earth yet counted better alwayes hath bene accepted men manhoode auncient writer renowned wel empire macedonian especiallye might romanes commendation thereof maye seene strabo hath well set hir foorth third book seauenth booke following looke also geographer later approued writer among haue gone describe europe volateranus sebastian munster dominic niger george rithaymerus geography peculiarly pius christopherus ancelmus cellae cherubinus stella ioannes herbaceus george meyer hath put writing manye iourneyes almost europe haue noted distaunces place hath william gra arolus done ende booke intituled de regimme iter agentium regiment wayfaring men thus much foorth ottelius india well neere writer one consent doe teach india noblest part whole globe ye earth greater countrey comprehended vnder one name called riuer indus space india according strabo pliny closed west riuer indus north hill taurus east east season west owne sea wit indian sea diuided two countryes riuer ganges running betweene one westerly called within ganges lyeth east surnamed without ganges holye scripture read one called euila seria niger testifieth marcus paulus uenice seemeth deuide three lesse middlemost saith called abasia india onely happie great store people townes almost innumerable also abundaunce thing copper lead onely excepted giue credite plinie riuers many great whose watry ouerflowing commeth passe moyst grounde force sunne approaching ingendreth bringeth foorth thing great quantitie seemeth almost fill whole worlde spice precious stoanes aboundeth countreyes worlde manye ilandes ioyning vnto heere scattered hir occean worthely man may hir worlde ilands first therein iapan called marcus paulus uenetian zipangri fewe yeares past knowen manye thinke good place speake somewhat ilande stretcheth farre abroad hath almost eleuation heauen italy heere europe hath inhabitaunts denout beeing much giuen religion learning wiseddine earnest serchers truth vse nothin prayer manner exercise church acknowledge one prince vpon whose rule becke doe depende also hath one aboue called voo whose power greatest authoritie holy thing religion perhaps one maye lykened pope emperour common people doe commit r rence saluation soules adore one god alone portrayed three head wherof notwithstanding able giue reason studie keepe downe body fasting testimonye repentaunce fence themselues signe crosse inuasions diuell doe religion also manner life seeme followe christian also worthy ilands moluccus renowned fruitefulnesse spice famous birde called manucodiata wee call bird paradise sumatra also iland knowen auncients gellius reciteth ipan macer lawyer hath also written three bookes histor e india empire turkie haue gathered reader histori graphers time worde originall increase turkish empire howe litle litle hath growen greatnesse wherin day seemeth threaten v yere christ birth one ottoman turke sonne ziclius man ba e estate began among turkes haue ai r dignitie wit skillfulnesse martiall prow e man gaue name family turkish emperor first appointed king yeares ruled bithinta cappadoeia possessed e ye many strong place ieng vpon ponticum sonne orolianes succeeded sacked prusia di cio tie rade head kingdome year reign e fighting ill successe slaine macetarians left sonne amuramasim beare rule sent greekes variance first came europe hee tooke callipolis cherronesus ouer came abyous city philipopolis hadrianapolis brought vnder subiection eru bulgaria taken v entering vppermost mysia hee dyed striken dagger yeare empire whose sonne ba zotes brother stayne set vpon greatest part thrace subdued well neere greece phoc bulgaria ouercome eberlane di without reno father taken c lepinus sonne tooke rule hand quite ouerthrowen sigismond battaile begun spoyle border emperour constantinople dyed verye floure age borne rule side yeares mahome tooke rule hand made sharpe warre vpon ldiathians subdued part sclaudnia first passed ouer riuer danubius brought mace onia thraldome came farre ionian sea remouing royall seate bithinsa placed hedrianapolis dyed yeare empire afterward amurathes second tooke vpon te rule wan epirus aetolia achaia berlia attica thesialonica citie biect uenetians succeedeth mahom te seconde destroyed athens wa constantinople assault day may antio brought vnder subiection empire trapesuntindeth took corinth subdued warre ilandes lemnus euborae mitylene ouercome capha citie gen wayes ruled yeares bagaz te second made warre enetians tooke paupactise methona dirrahium spoiled dalmatia last died poyson sonne zelimus toke rule hand ouercome alchair verie strong citie aegypt slayne sultan brought alexandela aegypt vnder empire tooke damascus soliman onely zelimus succeeded father wann belgradum seeke buda king citie hungary spoyled sirigonium well neere hungary gofe ile rhodes yeelding ouerthrewe quinq ecclesias church citie iula taken besieged zigothum died assault citie son zelimus second heire empire spoiled yeare manner vnder emperours subdued vnto themselues turkish tiranny yeares great part affrica greater part europe greatest parte asia desireth fuller knowledge history let read paulus iouius christopher richerius sene cuspinianus pncipit liber xvi de lapidibvs preciosis property earth party thereof described generall helpe god purpose plant heere somwhat ye beautie ornament therof special thing yt beautifie ye earth clene without soule without feeling thing groweth vnder grounde gendered veines earth stone coulours mettall shall first speake order lyfe soule rootes hearbes tree soule feeling men beast whome shall last speake shall shewe first order abc thing gendered earth veines thereof arena chap grauell called arena hath name drinesse thrust brused together man hande rattle make noise drinesse hardnes grauell throwne white cloth defileth isi saith li ca also grauell sea washed manner slime wose gleamie fenne aristotle saith liber de proprietatibus elementorum therefore great drinesse runneth turneth perfectly stone also li mcth saith pure earth turneth perfectly stone co tinueth breaketh therefore drines euercoming moisture suffreth earth turne sadnesse stone therefore ye grauell sand harde substaunce common earth soft stone may departed many part grauel sand colde dry small heauie weight thrust togethers though selfe small baraine defalt heat moisture mastry cold drines whe showre falleth theron breaketh sennye thing washed away wasted grauell sand pressed togethers pure sad part cleaue together also waues sea letted multitude grauel sand withstood heap thereof constrained passeth meares boundes yt god hath ordeined thereto hierome saith super le cap set grauel sand mark meare sea c also hath vniuersally kind cleansing water runneth grauell clene fresh constantine saith also hath vertue cleanse mettal cleanse alwaye rustinesse mettall gold brasse yron made bright froting grauell sand also hath vertue coole smite inward stop swage swelling fareth thimalia grauell sande shauen brused smithes stone good foresayde thing constantine saieth plainly hath vertue like oare mettall among grauell sand riuers sea founde golden grauell oft time also bright polished stone precious stone found sea cliues among grauell also grauell riuers sea bee gathered heapes contrary wind reaseth part thereof hetherwarde thetherward stoppeth taryeth oft water riuers course running sea iero saieth super amos ibi destuct sicut riuus aegypti c openly sayde water nilus lot heap grauell gathered together month riuer suffereth water nilus runne ye sea constraineth openly maketh turne againe ouerflowe plaines egipt water letted compelled turne againe heapes grauell course might runneth falleth sea said falleth deepe sea heapes departed auoyded ier saith also hard perill fall smile heapes grauell hid sea vnder water rehearsed shewed perills sea pof claye chap argilla potter clayclay called argilla tough earth glewie gleymie apte meete diuers workes potter hath name argilla arges isidore saith lib cap primo among first earthen vessells made claye said ther working heate consumeth wasteth moystie partes dryeth hardeneth earthie part claye turneth ile also ofte happeneth colde freeseth water fennie earth earth turneth stone also changing vnctuous sen stone falleth ofte heate running hardning matter saide lib metheorer unctuous fenne able chaunging turning stone burning hardning heate vnctuous thing meane betweene gleymie vaporatiue thing passeth thing breathing smoking thing vnctuous hath moisture selfe partie vaporatiue may congeale made hard heate partie gleymie may passe vapour thrusted together made thicke harde tourned stone commentour saith claye coldnesse stauncheth bloud nosea remedy stoppe bleeding clay tempred strong vineger laid temple pof alabastro chap isidore saith li ca alabaster white stonealabastrites strake diuers coulours stone oyntment boxe gospell speaketh ofluke made stone oyntment vessell made best without corruption stone breedeth thebe aegypt damascus white best commeth inde dioscucides calleth stone intomar said stone helpeth win victory mastrie also saith gendreth keepeth friendship pof golde chap golde called aurum hath name aura still wether isidor saith lib shineth aire bright kindlye shining mettall blase shined light therfore thing make shining blassing called aurarij golde blasing called obrisum shineth bright beames best coulour hebrewes call ophar greekes name chrusos thin plate golden threds cut called brathea huc v que isi cap de mettallis li metheororum parum ante fine aristotle saith golde mettall hath matter subtill brimstone red quicke siluer subtill white composition thereof sadnesse brimstone aire moysture quicke siluer therefore gold sad heauie siluer composition siluer commonly quicke siluer white brimstone saith among mettall nothing sad substaunce better compact golde therefore though bee put fire wasteth smoaking vapour neither lesseth waight wasted fire melted strong heate filth therein cleansed thereof maketh golde pure shining mettall stretcheth hammer worke golde stretcheth betweene anfield hammer without breaking renting peeces stretcheth lease golde among mettall none fayrer sight golde therefore among painter golde chiefe fairest sight darkeneth shape coulour mettall also among mettall nothing effectuall vertue golde plato describeth vertue thereof saith temperate pure mettall hath vertue comfort cleause superfluity gathered body therefore helpeth leprosie meselrio filing gold taken meate drinke medicine preserueth letteth breeding leprosie namely hideth maketh vnknowen ofte vse golde letteth tarieth breeding lepra maketh vnknowen auicen saith also filing powder iuyce borage bone heart hartea medicu helpeth sownding cardiaele passion also thin plate gold fire hot quenched wine maketh wine profitable ye euill splene many euils passion melancholike also burning made instrument gold better maner mettall keepeth ye place burnt without stinking also powder offall golde healeth spot eyen therin also golde comforteth sore lymmes though corporate therein though norisheth yet doth away sharpnesse thereof superfluity growe member cleanseth wise plat saith also hot gold doth away haire member burnt froted therewith groweth consta saith also gold smitten foundeth brasse doth siluer creketh cleaueth strecheth euen abroad except strong mettall medled therewith wise long brasse latton medled substance gold cleaueth alway vnder hammer inobedient take shape beating hammer therfore needeth superfluitie put awaye golde clensed melting made pure may able shapen wt hammer make thereof vessell couenable shape gregory saith plate golde shall medled plate siluer ioyned therto needeth beware namely three thingsthree speciall property obserued melting gold siluer powder winde moysture hereof come betweene golde siluer may ioyned together one therfore needeth meddle two mettals together full cleane place quiet ioyned due maner ioyning inseperable yt may afterward departed asunder golde maketh wise men glad spendthrift mad gold vpholdeth kingdomes golde preferred manye common wealth justice therefore put delyght therin called auri sacrum fame ye misvse thereof reported late writer golden mountaines cibana aud wonderfull rich gold king spaine hath yeerly west east indie gathered multitude slaues ordained purpose notwithstanding vsurers yt inhabit britaine doe make moe slaues free borne raising rente ingrossing landes hindring tillage quantitie ground one yeare subiect among indie three yeares vtter ouerthrowe landes good wife child pof laton chap laton called auricalcum hath name though brasse copper yet shineth gold without isid saith brasse calco greeke also laton hard brasse copper medling copper tinne auripigment mettall brought fire colour golde isid saith also hath coulour likenesse gold value also laton composed diner manner vessells faire seeme gold new first brightnesse dimmeth becommeth rustie colour smell copper first matter thereof knowen meate wine kept vessell taketh horrible sauour smell vice brasse colliria medicine eyen profitably kept vessell made sharp strength brasse plat saith pof auripigmento cap avripigmentum veine ye earth manner free stone cleaueth breaketh like golde colour called lapis arcenicus another name double redde citrine dioscorides saith hath kinde brimstone burning drieng laid brasse maketh brasse white burneth wasteth bodyes mettall except golde diosc saith plat saith auripigmentum hot drye fourth degree veine earth thereof double kinde red citrine citrine helpeth medicine hath vertue dissoluing tempering drawing cleansing helpeth tisike etike haue euill breth commeth moysture gaue thereon take smoke thereof auripigment made pisilo cracium oyntment yt doth away haire maketh fall fodde hot lime also helpeth tetars scabes place softly anoynted sope auripigment place must washt anone oyntment lye long therto fret good flesh well euill stay away shinne hath kinde slitting taruing fretting maketh soule vnseemly nailes fall better nailes may grow platea saith auripigmentum coulour called orement orpine arsenike daungerous poyson red ftretting mercury like operation pof siluer chap siluer called argentum hath name isi saith speach greeke siluer called argiron greeke wonderfully fareth though siluer white yet maketh black line streakes body scored therwith ruled therewith isi saith composition thereof quick siluer white brimstone therfore heauy gold richardus rufus sayeth two manner siluers simple compounded simple fleeting called quick siluer siluer compounded massie sad compounded quicke siluer pure cleane white brimstone burning aristotle saith pof quicke siluer chap quicke siluer watrye substaunce medled strongly subtill earthy thing maye dissolued great drines earth melteth plaine thing therfore cleaueth thing yt toucheth doth ye thing yt watry substance therof white clee ne cleere water whitnes subtil earth yt well digested also hath whitenes medling aire ye foresaid thing also quicke siluer hath propertie cruddeth selfe kindly without brimstone brimstone substaunce lead congealed fastened togethers therefore sayd quicke siluer brimstone element wit matter melting mettall made sayd openly lib metheororum also richardus rufus expoundeth openlye manner quicke siluer matter mettall therefore respect simple element vertue kinde thereof diuers men speake diuerslye meaning phisitions thereof maye knowen word quicke siluer plato sayeth hot moyst fourth degree though men deeme colde degree hot knowen effect working dissolueth pearceth carueth seemeth full colde touch men deeme amisse meane colde men meane quicke siluer made great heate veyne earth knowen false heate fire soone wasted away smoke earth gendred kept fleeting water full long kept cold vessell sound cleaueth together strong yt may nothing meddeled first quenched quenched spettle froted therewith namely powder medled spettle specially powder bone henne meddeled therewith quicke siluer passeth euaporation seething smoking smoke thereof grieuous men thereby breedeth walste quaking shaking softening sinewes taken mouth ye care thirleth slayeth member perill goates milke best dronke great quantitie continuall mouing oof patient speciallye wine good wormwood isop sod huc vsque plat called quicke siluer coniealeth matter done isi saith li also ther saith saith fleeting runnenth specialy found siluer forge drop siluer molten oft found olde dirte sinkes slime pit also made mini put cauernes yron patent shell done vnder vessell noynted therewith shall compassed burning coales quicke siluer shall drop without siluer golde latton copper may ouergilte great vertue strength though thou put stone hundred pound weight vpon quicke siluer waight two pound quicke siluer anone withstandeth weight thou doest thereon scruple gold consumeth selfe lightnesse thereof appeareth wayght nature obeyeth taken drinke slayeth weight best kepte glasse vessells pearceth boreth fretteth matter huc vique isidorus lib chap de metallis siluer white cleere sounding pure may well wrought hammer well golde keepeth saueth well balme helpeth vertue stone iaspis yt hath vertue siluer gold said lappidario melt molt fire hath colour fire neuertheles colde againe white harde though great boistous matter gold yet among mettall beareth price golde worthinesse value medicinable helpeth many euills thereof healeth wound fulfilleth place fretteth away superfluitie dead flesh letteth grow bringeth whole flesh cleanseth filth hoare body marking instrument siluer kepeth stinking comforteth feeble member layeth maketh stedfast rusteth toucheth earth taketh colour againe scoured grauell sande salt adamant chap adamas little stone inde coloured yron shineth christall passeth neuer quantitie walnut nothing ouercommeth neither yron fire also heateth neuer greekes called vertue may daunted though maye ouercome though despise fire yron good wit helpeth disease liuer fighthings sobbing bolkinges healeth moyst eien burneth hande beareth held sun maketh man great state ioyneth wil loue matrimonie additioi suppose berill none grose whetteth sharpeth yron cut carue cotis greeke say caruing isidore saith diuerse manner whetstone neede water neede oyle whet oyle maketh smooth water maketh edge right sharpe isidore sayeth lib codem capitulo whetstone hath propertie serueth another thing whet ing wasteth himselfe gregory sayeth powder whetstone helpeth well medicine hath vertue drieng smiting againe repercussiue staunching bloud constantine saith additiothe ponder whetstone good fresh wound stape bleeding pigges turde nose bleedeth greet one pricking wound stench anoyance head calce chap lime called calx stone burnt meddeling
