lime walles painting colouring wall first ground chiefe take colour sement cleaueth wet wals namelye bee plaistre stone isidore sayeth lib cap best sement made stone flint stone plaistre called gypsis stone shineth glasse also broke manye small peeces carbunculo chap carbunculus precious stone shineth fire whose shining ouercome night shineth dark place seemeth flame kindes thereof twelue worthiest shine send beames fire isidore sayth libro cap sayde carbunculus called antrax greeke gendered libia among troglodites among twelue manner kindes carbuncle antraciles best haue coulour fire bee compassed white veine haue propertie throwen fire quenched among dead coales burneth water throwen theron another kind carbuncle called scandasirus hath name place inde found maner kind within bright fire bee seene certeine droppes gold precious stone greate price without comparison respect another manner kind called signes hath name bright burning lampes precious stone called remissus carbunculus two manner kindes one beames purple coulour red silke heated sunne froting finger draweth selfe strawe leaues bookes said standeth grauing sometime graued printed waxe taketh parte waxe biting beast isidore saith among manner kindes carbuncle balagius counted red bright dioscorides sayth also sayde manner carbuncle founde veine saphire therefore neerenesse saphire balagius hath manner mist sparkeling ye fire compasseth without openly seene men take heede thereto additiothe carbuncle orient colour red lead night sparkling like coale crisoprasso chap crrisoprassus stone ethiopia hid light seene darknesse firie night goldish daye isidorus sayth therefore day hid washed awaye leeseth shining wareth pal golde another manner kinde called crisoprassus gendered inde crisoprassus like colour stone like prassius greene leeke besprong certaine drop gold said lapidario calcidonia chap calcidonius pale stone sheweth dimme coulour mean betweene beril iacinct said lapidario gendered among ye nasamos commeth gendered raine lord sayd found shining ye full ye moone isidore saith lib found three coulours lapidarye sayth kindes thereof withstandeth grauing draweth strawe selfe bee heated chafed isidore saith stone pearced borne one maketh haue mastrie cause helpeth iapes scornes feends keepeth saueth vertues dioscorides saith additio man coniecture farre true operation hidden property crisolito chap crisolitus little stone ethiopia shining golde sprinkling fire like sea coulour somewhat greene set gold borne lefte arme feareth feendes chaseth awaye sayd helpeth night frayes breades abateth euill called menlancholy doth awaye comforteth vnderstanding dioscorides sayth one manner kinde crisolitus crisolimphis coulour thereof deemed golden day firy night another manner kinde crisolitus called crisolentus coloured gold right faire sight morrowe tide day passeth coulour waxeth dimme stone maketh soonest heat set fire anone waxeth flame isidore saith li ca de gemmis aureis celidonio chap celidonio little stone precious heereof double kinde blacke redde taken swallowes mawe little vnseemly vertue lesse value stone greater passe many vertue red helpeth passion lunatike woodnesse old sorrow maketh man kinde pleasing blacke helpeth euill humour feauers wrath washed water helpeth ore eien said lapidario additioas touching stone selfe trieng olde rule finde ye maw young swallowes blacke stone bigge thistle seede another red third gray spelled blacke gaue away christallo chap christall bright stone cleere watry coulour men suppose yt snow ise made hard space many yeres therfore ye greek gaue name thereto gendered asia cipres namely north mou taines sun seruent sumer make dure long yt called christall stone set ye sun taketh fire insomuch dry tow put therto setteth tow fire vse ordeined drink worketh none thing cold thing may huc vsque isi li cap dioscorides speaketh christall saith yt hardned turned stone vertue strength cold earthly vertue coulour thereof like ise vertue therof helpeth thirst burning heat beaten pouder dronken hony filleth breast teates full milke ye milke faileth colde also dronke helpeth collica passio passion euill gut ye wombe hard stone cleere letter thing put therin seene cleerly inough christall materially made water gregory saith super pri ezech water saieth selfe fleeting stregth cold turned made stedfast christall eccle written northen wind blew made christall freese c heerof arist telleth ye cause li meth ther saith ye stony thing substance oare water matter richardus rufus saith stone oare water hath drines earth thing melt therefore frore onely coldnesse water also drynesse earth mingled therwith ye watry part earth glassie hath mastry water foresayde rolde hath victory mastry gregory reason true yt saith christall may gendered water ceraunio cap ceraunius stone like cristall infected bliewe coulour germania another spaine shineth fire stone fall place thunder sayde helpe strength lightening isidore sayth said lapidari said thundreth horribly firie aire lightneth clowds smite together stone falleth heauen beareth stone chastely shall smitten lightning house towne stone therein either hath vertue helping battailes haue mastrie warre cause strife make sweete sleepes sayd corallo chap corall gendered red sea tree long couered water anon drawen water touched aire turneth stone vnder water bough therof white soft waxe redde turne stone drawen water net isidore saith cap de gemmis rubeis followeth precious ye margarite inde among v precious coral among indes witch tell stone withstandeth lightening isidore sayeth sayde lapidario might vertue sayth zorastes wonderfull putteth lightning whirle winde tempest stormes shippes house double white redde neuer founde passing halfe foote long redde helpeth bleeding agaynst falling euill feendes guile scorne diuers wonderous dooing multiplieth fruit speedeth beginning ending cause need corneolo chap corneolus red stone dim full good precicus hanged man necke borne finger strife alayeth wrath rise stauncheth bloud runneth member maner running namely running woman haue sayde lapidario dioniso chap dionisius blacke stone browne sprong redde veines hath name ground medled water smelleth wine yet withstandeth dronkenesse great wonder stoue isidore sayth li diadoco chap diadocus pale stone bright berill apt obteine answeres feends exciteth feendes fantasy happeneth toucheth dead body sayd leeseth anone good vertues ye stone hateth squeimous thing ouercome death said lapidario ere chap brasse called e hath name shining aire isidore sayth old time ere vse yron knowen men eared land brasse fought therewith warre battaile time golde siluer forsaken golde worship age passeth vadeth changeth time thing isidore sayth wordes libro brasse copper called fa either made stone working fire stone resolued heat turneth brasse iob brasse copper made maner mettalls brimstone quick siluer hapneth ther brimstone quicke siluer brimstone earthly pure red coulour burning quicke siluer meane subtill meddeling brasse gendered arist saith isidore saith ca de ere brasse meddeled mettal chaungeth coulour vertue fareth latton brasse called conchium ioyned diuerse mettalls white siluer draweth deale browne colour seemeth golde third temperatnesse another manner brasse ther yt called coronarium beaten abroade shinne plate brasse wrought hammer died buls bloud like gold crown among posturing painting therfore called coronarium brasse yt wrought hammer called regular brasse ye onely melted called fusile brasse fusile molt brittle vnder hammer brasse well purged cleansed vice made able wrought hammer regular brasse best molt great cold brasse rusteth soone nointed wt oile also among al mettal brasse mighty huc vsque isi li16 brasse accordeth vse trump belle sounding thereof stone brasse blowen sad hard breaketh easily burnt first strog fire rocke burnt eight nine time ere perfectly drawen stone pured cleanse brasse place made tell certainly brasen vessells redde rustie bee oft stoured sand haue evill se uond smell tinned also brasse bee without tin burneth soone isidore saith cap de stanno platea sayeth brasse burnt pouder hath vertue dissoluing washing cleansing purging euill humour powder healeth woundes cleanseth dimnesse cien fretteth superfluity flesh suffereth growe platea sayth dioscorides also additioof rust brasse commeth bliew substance called verdigrese colour painter fretting poison vsed ointment festured sore electro chap electrum mettall hath name sunne beame shineth cleere gold siluer sunne beame electrum effectual mettal noble mettalls heer three manner kindes one runneth first tree fleeting thin gumme afterwarde heate colde made hard cleere stone wer christal manner kind called mettall founde earth price third manner made three part golde fourth siluer kinde electrum kinde twinckling light shineth cleere mettall warneth venim one deep therein maketh great chirking noise chaungeth oft diuers colour rainbow sodeinly huc vsque isi lib de metallis vlti et super eze mention shade electrum artificiall greg saith hard gold medled siluer filtier wiseth cleere gold tempered cloerenesse siluer looseth vertue wareth somewhat pale lesse faire medling siluer men cal glectru arpago heted finger draweth selfe leaues straw hem clothes magnis draweth yron isid saith li ca de rubiis gemis receiueth soone colour hiew manner man soone died rote auense couchinello eth echites chap echites stone inde persi found ye cliffes occean ye coast sea inde persy stone red colour sayd lapidario two sort hil sayth male female alwaye two found eagle neast eagle may breed without stone therfore ye eagle keepeth stone neast male thereof hard like gum called galle male somewhat blasing female soft stone bound woman trauaileth child maketh soone deliuered maketh sometime beare dead child bee long somewhat passeth priuy choice woman except stone soone taken trauaileth childe isi saith li cap also stone echites conteineth breedeth another stone within like woman child dioscorides saith lapidano said stone conteineth another stone woman childe vertue stone echites maketh man sober augmenteth increaseth rich doth loue helpeth greatly obteine conquere victory fauour letteth withstandeth falling haue falling euill man suspect fraude poisoning guiltie stoud put vnder meat suffer swalow meate stone withdrawen shall tarry swallow meat emachite chap emachites red stone reddie rustie sonne affrica iuda arabia hath name broken bloud tourveth anone colour bloud isido saith god fluxe bladder sore eien venim biting adder stancheth fluxe womb restraineth bleeding namelye bloud woman gum dioscorid saith plat sayd cold drie complection hath vertue stanch bloud hath name emachites emach bloud chites stint helpeth emoptoces men spue cast bloud speciall remedie bloudie flixe eliotropia chap eliotropia precious stone greene sprong red droppes veines coulour bloud hath name effect dooing put water sunne beames maketh water seeth vesell resolueth mist soone resolued rainy drop also seemeth stone may doe wonder put basen clere water changeth sunne beames rebounding aire seemeth shaddowe breedeth aire red sanguine coulour though sunne eclipse darked moone set betweene v sun darkned seemeth maye chaunge cleernesse sun called elitropia turning away sun isidore saith expresly dioscorides also lapidario meaning said manner ex nomen habens est elitropia gemma quae solis radijs aqua subiecta vacillo sanguineum reddit mutato lumine solem eclipsimque nouam terris effundere cogit isidore saith stone discouereth soily inchauntenes witch haue liking pride theyr owne wonder begnile men sight thinges worke foresayde stone doth hee setteth ensample thereof sayeth hearbe name certaine inchauntmentes beguile sight men looke thereon maketh man heareth bee seene many thing thie stone good commendable stauncheth bloud putteth awaye venimme hee beareth stone maye beguiled enidros chap enidros little stone droppeth alway melteth neuer lesse wise sayde lapidario enidros stone weepeth alwaye springing full well dropping teares welleth alway sayd hard tell cause doings drop substance ye stone stone lesse melteth awaye thing entereth stone thing entereth putteth againe thing yt goeth seemeth maye vertue stone maketh aire thicke nigh thereto turneth water seemeth commeth substaunce stone neuerthelesse commeth substance aire stone additionperpetui fletus lacrimis distillat enidros qui velut ex pleni fontis scaturigine manat dissoluing drop teares full oft enidros stone doth drop fountaine full doth alwaies runne neuer stop episte chap epistes litle stone bright reddie maketh man safe beareth hart side ceaseth guile decrites putteth long flyes barren foules mist haile fruit earth set sunne firie beames thereof thou doest stone seething water seething thereof ceaseth water cooleth soone isidore sayth dioscorides also excoliceros chap excoliceros little stone named distinguished diuersed fortie colour full little maketh men euen looke thereon quake found libia among treglodites yron chap yron called ferrum hath name isidore saith ferrendum smiting beateth smiteth hardnesse thereof ouer commeth kinde mettall though yron come earth yet hard sadde therefore beating smiting suppresseth dilateth mettal maketh stretch length breadth isidore saith hath name lande digged therefore diuers reason therof found harde soft ye minde aristotle yron gendered quicke siluer thicke cleane full earthie hoales brimstone great boistous pure composition yron foresayd brimstone quick siluer mastrie colde dry earthy matter yron dry cold ful well harde compact togethers part yron hath lesse airy watry moisture mettall therefore hard resolue make againe soft fire ric rufus saith manner temper yron ware oile least coldnesse water much hardned isid saith yron taketh soone rust touching bloud entreth substance thereof vnneth clensed isi saith rust vice fretting yron commeth therto either vncleannes substance touching earth nigh lieng therto else touching blood qualitie infected saith also yron man bloud spilt man bloud taketh wreake yron yron taketh rust nothing soone man bloud ointeb therewith yron hath agreement stone adamas stone adamas draweth yron selfe yron drawen meane siluer vessel brasse followeth ye stone subiect obedient therto yron well furnished annointed alam vinegre shall like brasse yron furbushed shall rust anointed sewet marrowe heart isidore saith firie hotte yron bee oft quenched wine milke maketh wine milke medicinable haue euill splene also sicke men constantine sayth also isidore sayth yron made firie hot corrupted hardned stroke yron redde fire profitable carue cutte till beginne waxe white use yron needfull men many thing vse golde though couetous men loue gold yron without yron comminaltie sure enimies without dread yron ye common right gouerned yron innocent men defended full hardinesse wicked men chastised dread yron well nigh handiworke wrought without yron field cared without yron neither tilling crafte vsed building builded without yron therefore isidore saith ye yron hath name ferrum therby farra corne seede tilled sowen without yron read wonne earth bread departed readye without yron couenably man vse also yron whet yron salomon sayth coge yron dulled blunted great froting oft made thinne sharpe couenable cut thing easily sinder called scoria saith yron cleansed therfrom fire hath name scotia see smitten departed yron violence fire isidore sayth ferrugine chap ferrugo pouder falleth yron filing squama thing leapeth away ye fire heating hath vertue make dry thin therefore good stopping splene neuerthelesse exciteth casting spuing dronken insomuch sometime bringeth death violence therof ceased pouder adamas stone water stone lyeth night also sayd pouder therof best remedy emoroides also stancheth flixe wombe said platea also filing pouder yro called rubigo also corrosio hath name corrudendo fretting gnawing properly called erugo hath ye name erodendo filing eramento isidore saith infecteth defileth hand toucheth maketh soule pure polished yron rather defiled rust worst clensed rust soone done awaye three manner burning fire fretting salue file froting hard stone scouring grauell sand pullishing rust hath propertie infection thereof commeth againe light occasion place first mored rooted gleba chap clot gathering together pouder clustre isidore sayeth libro capit primo earth bounde clonged togethers clotte broken departed powder earth hardned clot receiueth seed neither suffereth seed ther sowen growe spring clotte broken couereth nourisheth seed tempered raine gendereth manner fatnesse saith gelacia chap gelacia white precious stone shapen haile stone cold neuer heateth fire isidore saith dioscorides also geraticen cap geraticen blacke stone passeth ye colour vertue man wash cleane chap iacinctus bliew stone deale nigh coulour saphire hath name owne coulour isido saith stone iacinctus found ethiopia best cleere neither dim meane temperate betweene twaine shining isidore saith dioscorides sayeth stone iacinctus bliew nowe reddish nowe purple bright bliew thereof bee three manner kind citrine bliewe among manner stone bliew best stone wonderfull consumeth aire dimme weather dim dright weather bright stone hath singular vertue authours write giueth gladnesse contrarye melancholy quality hath vertue comfort isidore saith kind thereof iacirctus hath vertue comfort doth away eleignesse sorrowe also vaine suspition withstandeth diuers pestilence come ofte corrupt aire giueth strength vertue member life sinewes giueth good sauor sweete wholsome lyke saphire dioscorides saith men treate precious stone meane lyke iacinct saphire colour substaunce vertuous iacinctus withstandeth venim contrary poyson dioscorides saith also hearbe ye name like therto colour equall conglutination medling togethers water earth clay made yt meane betweene earth stone tourneth stone constraining fastening partes slimie claye meete transmutation fattie fall masterie drinesse containe holde together strong medling fastening humour earth tourneth kinde stone taketh diuers colour diuers qualitie earth also sometime stone gendred freesing water place water shedde ground turneth stone diuers coulours vertue oare place freeseth water matter stone aristotle saith stone bred fat claye vertue sunne maketh ye fenne priuely runne party cleaue fasten together stone bred water frosen vertue ore bringeth therein kinde shape stone matter stone soft feeble composition strong gendred swiftly slowly strongly might quality worke lesse quality let withstande lesse strong quality medled substance stone stone diuers vertue kinde influence heuenly vertue commeth place putteth therein effect therof findeth matter able obedient working noble impression printeth therein therefore precious stone follow vertues kinde planet effect working fareth topasius followeth ne said ambrose basilius isidore dioscorides tell shall knowen heereafter knowen property stone generally stone colde drye sad fast hard heuie moueth downward heauinesse waight lyeth heauie earth ioyneth mineth together part earth shuld breake depart sunder therefore ambrose saieth stone bone earth stone doe diuers partes earth boanes doe bodye stone make earth sad sound holde part togethers helpeth falleth departeth asunder ouermuch drinesse thereof stone made softe lauing washing water neuerthelesse bored made hollow dropping gutter gregory saith also fire hot stone que ched wine corrupt wine turne vinegere isidore sayth also stone generally needeth purenes matter vertue precious colour diuers lapidario pof plumbo cap lead called plumbum hath name isid saith de mettal lib first balles lead men assaye deepnesse saith lead two manner kindes white black white better first found ilands sea athlant old time found many place fraunce lusitania manner blacke earth full grauell small stone washt blowen matter commeth substaunce lead also golde quarryes matter golde small stoanes found gathered golde afterward departed golde blowen themselues tourneth lead therefore golde heauye lead isid saith black lead double kinde black lead commeth alone veyne gendred siluer medled veynes blowen blowing first commeth tinne siluer remaineth blowen turned blacke lead isi saith inde neither brasse lead found inde rewarded margarites precious stone isido saith blacke lead best trauellous workes pipe plate spaniard briton haue prooued huc v que isid quarto li metheo arist saith brimstone boistous swiftly pured troubly thicke quicke siluer substaunce lead gendred gendered minerall place vncleannesse vnpure brimstone lead hath manner softnesse smoocheth hand toucheth wiping cleansing vncleannesse lead may taken away time neuer alway man may wipe vncleannesse alwaye lead though seeme siluer strange quality haue mastry therin beguile men maketh erre therein men take sal armoniacum aristotle saith assigneth cause vncleannesse saith voystous lead euill quicke siluer heanie sennye also brimstone thereof euill vapour stinking therefore freeseth well full li alchimie hermes saith thou hang lead ouer vineger hurteth vineger shall pearce substaunce thereof turne pouder white colour floure lead thou powrest vineger thervpon commeth white destroieth might vineger burnt lead breedeth red colour dim fire strong turneth citrine thereafter stirring dryeng tempring vineger tourneth white colour floure lead makest strong fire tourneth first matter lead made earth said also lead medled mettall gathereth togethers kinde part mettall departeth cleanseth away part therefore lead put siluer furnaice siluer may sooner cleansed lead saueth siluer part wasting lead wasted burnt cleanseth siluer ier saith glosa super ca fere ibi consumptum est plumbum c also hermes saith lead boyling vndoeth hardnesse sadde hard body also stone adamant li meth arist speaketh lead saith lead without doubt molten quick siluer melteth without heate molten seemeth red wonder though lead pale brown yet burning resudation vineger ofte gendreth seemly colour faire tawnie red therewith woman paint themselues seeme faire coulour lead good medicine leade colde moyst second degree constant saith helpeth wonderfully agaynst burning fire hot postumes stauncheth bleeding wound stauncheth abateth running eyen swageth smiting scorpion dragon letteth seruice venus plate lead laid reynes hath medicinable reason looke thereof innermore de coloribus colour called stibium cerusa also called floure lead pof puluere chap pouder called puluis hath name puf e winde isi saith lightnesse therof ye winde taketh vp bloweth abroad contrary windes commeth pouder beareth maketh ye whirle winde beda sayth powder beaten sheweth kinde thing commeth sauour colour odour smell therefore pouder made spicerie inner vertue thereof may shew selfe medlyng oning partes maye receiue larger vertue may giue foorth fragrant smell cause sweeter taste may effectually dry clense putrified wound eate fret awaye dead flesh grow pouder burnt lead dryeth cleanseth away superfluitie wound gendreth saueth quicke flesh const saith therefore pouder plaisters made confection called thimiamata diuers medicine oyntments pouder made thus mirrhe burning pouder beast offred lord god also pouder made noble electuaries helpeth healeth body aliue also pouder oyntment made keepeth saueth dead body rot fall pouder also sen made medling pouder moisture turneth clot working drinesse isid saith also pouder defileth face grieueth eyen many manner wormes breede pouder sed therewith pouder bread serpent esa saith li pouder body soule haue beginning endeth tourneth commeth saide man pouder thou art pouder thou shalt tourne also pouder infecteth aire letteth ofte eye may see cleernesse sunne pouder medled moist aire oft myst gendred betweene v sunne whose comming hideth ye sunne cleerly seene also moies sunne beame commeth pouder pouder seene sunne beame commeth window pof quirin cap qvirin stone founde lapwing neasts dioscorides sayth stone bewrayeth discouereth sleepe counsayle priuitie stone laid set vnder man head sleepeth maketh tell thinketh sleeping multiplieth wonderfully fantasy therefore witch loue stone worke witchcraft therewith quandros cap qvandros stone vile coulour great vertue diose saith found head vulture helpeth euill cause filleth teates full milke pof rabri cap rabri stone hath another common name called bolus armenicus stone veyne earth colde dry kinde hath red colour found armenia hath vertue constraine make harde wombe staunch bloud place body runneth ruby chapter addedthe ruby place found east inde accounted best namelye haue pouder golde medled therein saphire stone thick passing bright isi saith stone praised lapid noble excellent called gemma gemmarum chiefe precious stone lighteneth bodie keepeth saueth lims whole sound hath bright starre brightnesse starre vertue knowen another manner saphire called sirtites found fast place called sirtes among ye grauel sea libicum diosc saith also found veines mine lasurium also found veynes saphire middle wombe certaine kinde carbuncle found therefore manye men deeme saphire carbuncle mother manye men meane carbuncle gendred ye saphires veynes many men meane carbuncle deale beshadowed certaine blewe sparcle kinde saphire diosc saith diosc saith yt saphire hath vertue rule accord yt strife helpeth much make peace accord also hath vertue abate vnkind heat therfore lapid said ye saphire cooleth heate ye body within saphire cooleth much heat burning feuers hanged nigh pulse veines heart therefore hee saith helpeth much feauers haue time chaging accesse time also hath vertue cofort glad hart therfore said yt helpeth cardiacle melancholik passion therfore stancheth running sweat yt cometh anguish sweat also said lap stauncheth sweat runneth swift c diosc saith hath vertue staunch bloud saphire east stancheth bleeding ye nose laid ye temple also hath singular vertue swage blowing certeine yt saphire abateth swageth swelling postumes soone laid therto beginning noiful drawing also ye saphire helpeth euill postume yt called antrax putteth might ventosity mallice postume ouercommeth putteth woodnesse thereof suffereth smoak therof come heart malice therof infect spirit dioscri saith vertue contrary venim quencheth euerye deale thou put spider boxe hold saphire inde ye mouth ye bore vertue thereof spider ouercome dieth sodeinly diosc saith haue seene proued oft many diuers place vertue keepeth saueth sight cleanseth eien filth without greefe therfore written lapid taketh away filth eien ach forhead also vertue healeth bile botch dioscor saith stone beaten pouder medled milk healeth wound also hath ben proued wound experience also stone great authoritie olde time men held worthy stone god singularly hallowed apollo natios asked cousel appollo time sacrifice hoped certified haue aunswere sooner saphire stone present dioscorides saith touched lapidario vse nigromancie meane yt haue answere god therby precious stone also witch loue well stone ween yt may work certain wonder vertue stone also touched lapid sayd stone bringeth men prison bond vndoeth gate bond toucheth authours write doings many singular vertue saphire al author accord point say yt saphire precious stone loueth chastity therfore least ye effect thereof let wise vncleannesse yt beareth needeth beareth liue chast story meaneth beareth commaunded chast also lapidario said stone doth alwaye enuy putteth dread feare maketh man bold hardy master victor maketh heart stedfast goodnesse maketh meeke mild goodly weene saide disposition effect sufficeth time additioin iland zeylam found best true saphires hard fine coulour azure bliew ther diuers sort saphires found calicut smaragdo cap smaragdus al greene precious stone chiefe isidore sayth men olde time gaue thereto thirde dignitye margarites vnions smaragdus hath name greene colour said sayde greene thing bitter hearbes precious stone greennesse stone smaragdus passeth hearbes grasse twig braunches infecteth aire passing greene colour greene coulour abateth sunne manner wise nothing comforteth eien grauers stane bodie thereof straight cleansed polished image bee seene therein mirrour cesar nero vsed see fighting sword player stone isidore saith therof manner kindes noble found scithia bactria holdeth second place smaragdis found among vnder stone chinnes thereof northerne winde bloweth earth vncouered smaragdis shineth among stone winde grauell sand moued aegyptians haue third found metall oare brasse gleyming haue speckle like brasse lead salt though smaragdus greene kinde yet medled wine oyle greene colour increaseth maner smaragdus goeth kinde though greene somewhat vnseemly beines brasse called calcesmaragdus hue v que isid li ca de viridibus gemmis stone taken griphons plentie smaragdus may found great griphons let comming men way goeth thereto isid saith li cap stone multiplieth greene colour commeth beame dieth aire maketh greene body thereof cleere glassie kinde sheweth figure image shape thing nigh thereto hath gifte kinde goodnesse vertue heale diuers sickness euills dioscorides saith increaseth rich maketh men haue good word faire euidence caose plea stone hanged necke helpeth falling euill saueth comforteth feeble sight represseth wanton motion lechery maketh good minde helpeth also al fantasy iapes fiend ceaseth tempest stauncheth bloud saide helpeth vse diuine gesse shall befall sayd lapid additio smaragdes grow ye countrey babylon indian call ye sea diegn n grow stone red colour red earth hath name first found sardis isid saith glose sup apoc though stone precious faire yet many account least value precious stone meane except shining profit therwith onely stone onix maye grieue presence sayd onichinus hath euill property may shewe deede presence stone sardius dioscorides saith ouer vertue sardius hath many vertues sardius fiue manner kindes best commeth sardis good increaseth ioyes putteth away dread maketh men bold hardy sharpeth wit presence onix may grieue also saith sardius red saueth bearer inchantment witchcraft pof sardonice chap sardonix hath name company two stone sardius onix isi saith three colour blacke lowest white middle redde vermilion highest stone taketh nothing substaunce waxe printed therein found arabia inde heereof fiue manner kindes hath coulours diuided thickest best said putteth lecherie maketh men meeke chast pof solis gemma cap sunne stone called solis gemma white shining hath name shineth beames sunne doth shine world isidore saith de candidis gemmis pof silenite cap silenites stone persia green grasse colour like ye stone iaspis sayd lapidario shineth white specke though brightnesse contained shape moone stone silenites followeth moone wexeth waneth moone doth isi sayth diosco also vertue reconcileth loue accord supposed helpeth tisike sicke men pof stanno chap tinne called stannum mettall hath name etimologic greeke isid saith tin departeth fire departeth mettalls diuers kinde departeth lead brasse gold siluer defendeth mettall hot fire though brasse yron hard kinde yet strong fire without tin burne wast awaye brasen vessells tinned tinne abateth venim rust amendeth fauour also mirrours tempred tinne white colour cerusa made tinne made lead huc vsque isidorus li cap de metallis lib metheororum aristotle sayeth tinne compouned good quicke siluer euill brimstone twaine well medled small part compounded therefore tinne hath colour siluer sadnes thereof li alchemie hermes saith tin breaketh mettalls body medled greate drinesse tin destroieth mettall kinde obedient hammer worke thou medlest quicke siluer therwith withstandeth crashing thereof maketh white afterwarde maketh blacke defileth also said burnt tin gendereth redde coulour lead doth fire bee strong first matter tinne commeth soone againe also though tin soft siluer hard lead yet lead may soone soudred lead brasse yron without tin neither may soudered without greace talow rosen sulphure cap brimstone veine earth hath much aire fire composition therefore called sulphure solum vrens burning grounde fire called vr firye vertue brimstone known feruent water water runneth passeth vein brimstone taketh whitenesse heate thereof fauorinesse effect smell heereof commeth hot wels springing ye earth bring therewith ye quality veines brimstone nothing soone set fire brimstone breedeth hotte iland eloijs betweene cicilia italy men meane ilands burne brimstone found digged place isidorus sayth brimstone foure kindes one called viuum digged shineth flourisheth onely among kindes thereof phisitions vse isidore saith another called gleba serueth fuller third called liquor good profitable cast sparple wooll therewith make soft white fourth serueth light lanternes isidor saith sayth thereto ye vertue brimstone great ye certaine sickness perceiued brightnes thereof flame therof co meth straight ma face breedeth foule euill palenesse sight looke theron likenesse dead men isid saith li cap auicen pla meane brimstone hot drye fourth degree turned kind brimstone part water earth fire brimstone sometime great boistous full drosse somtime pure white cleere subtill sometime meane betweene diuers disposition diuerse mettall gendered brimstone quicke siluer saide metheororum shewed brimstone quicke siluer matter mettalls brimstone called quicke brimstone taken earth dead brimstone quenched made craft put pottes vessells medicine best quick heat bright shining white greene without stone maketh greene colour bee put fire hath vertue tempering departing consuming wasting making subtill thin restoring therefore letteth cough helpeth yt haue falling euil cleanseth scab withstandeth venim awaketh men haue sleeping euill helpeth gowtes podagre palsie remedie thereof vsed due manner medicinable auicen dioscorides platearius author say sale chap salt called sal hath name saliendo leaping leapeth fire flieth fire though firie kinde isidore sayeth men meane hath name sal sale sole sea ye sun gendered sea water working sunne sea abideth cliffes dried sunne sometime drawne salt pit sodde till water turne hardnesse salt fleeting made hard thicke heat somtime gathered among grauell sande waring moone night oft cerenia salt founde vnder grauell sand also place rockes salt therof stone hewen yron turneth afterwarde kinde salt fareth arabia pannonia also stone harde make house common salt craketh sparketh fire leapeth thereof sal agrigentinum cicilia suffereth fire melteth fire kind starteth leapeth water salt diuers colour sal memphiticum red coutry cicllia wher mout etna pure salt ye cicilia pathmos bright cleere salt ye image seene therein meate wearish vnsauory salt maketh potage meate sauorie exciteth good appetite meate salt al meat made sauory liking men weene hath name salt sun nothing profitable sunne salt see diuerse beast come pasture liking salt also milke theese abundant goodnesse salte also salte hardneth drieth thing keepeth saueth dead body rotting huc vsque isidorus libr cap also plat auicen tell salt hath generally colour yt followeth iacinctus smaragdus precious stone colour brightnesse also pliant taketh anone diuers contrary shape blast glasier sometime beaten sometime grauen siluer isid saith matter apt make mirrours glasse receiue painting workmanship white glasse yt next christal colour often chosen siluer golde drinke isi saith also saith yt stone obseanus reckoned among kind glasse stone somtime greene sometime blacke cleere bright called specularis fatly sight stone many men make precious stone isidore sayth maner glasse hath property pliant melting hot softe brittle colde hard broken may amended without melting againe long time passed one made glasse pliant might amended wrought hammer isidore saith brought uiole made glasse tiberius emperour threwe downe ground broken bended folded saith glasse cleane pure specially bright cleere image shadowes seene therein pliaunt melting hotte brittle colde harde receiueth colour followeth precious stone coulour value cleanseth away zimiech stone veine earth whereof lapis lazurij made salde lapidarie lyker stone coulour heauen better hath small peeces golde medled thereon whitest earthie therefore precious may long kepte without corruption help many euils sounding commeth melancholike fumositie giuen due manner ye patient shal neuer giuen without ground ful final oft washed ful cleane signe perfect washing thereof water washed bee little naught died stone cleanseth looseth wonderfully quarteine shal giuen decostion shuld fall bottome whey dioseoriders saith said plat cerusa made plate yron lazurum made plate siluer thing grow vpon earth helpe god ye property tree hearbs fruit seed more rootes first shall speake onelye tree hearbs mention made name holy writ text glose forme b c tree chap tree called arbor hath name arui fieldes cleaueth earth root fast therein hearbe doth isidor sayth li ca tree hearb commeth foorth one manner one way one commeth thou sowest seede tree first sheweth wringeth forth hearbe confect riseth tourneth kinde tree space short time ye seemed hearb turneth tender young tree called arbusta shafte tree place wherein tree grow called arbustum willowes growe called salictum isidore saythof ye refreshing cause yt tree drie fruit libro de vegitabilibus arist setteth propertyes tree plant sayth tree plant lyfe vertue lyke beast diuerslye plantes life hidden beastes openly knowne perfect complete tree mooue place place beastes doe chaunge appetite liking seeieth sorrowe though philosopher meane trise aagoras aristotle reprooueth plant life vegitatiue thereby humour drawne saue ad tree plant therin soule feeling sorroweth bewen cut hath seeling nourished fed waketh sleepeth breedeth hath condition belong soule feeling tree gendereth gendered medling male female tree hath vertue selfe seeding maye thereby bring forth another like selfe kinde might vertue worketh deede outward help help time ye yere winter needeth gather together ye seminal humour springing time needeth bring humour great colde freesing thrusting outward neither strong heat burning ye seed corrupting also sun needeth resolue temper part therof congealed cold heat cometh departeth ye humour seminal ye humour yt nourisheth scedeth also earth needfull tree hearbs thing ye gender yt well feeding tree earth sun well generation therof cause worketh therfore li de plantis aristotle sayth earth mother sun father tree hearbes earth fredeth mother sunne worketh father tree plantes men take beede generation feeding nourishing increasing rootes yearelye renouation seene purgation vrine dirt suppose therefore tree bee perfect beast aristotle reprooueth saith tree bound earth hath moouing selfe whole partes thereof neither hath determinate shape partes thereof partes thereof diuerse ordeined diuerse office dooing diuerse formes shape eie beast see care heare hath perfect soule part parte soule soule vegitatiue beast hath mo working noble plant tree diuers substance vertue working aristotle saith lib de vegitabilibus cap tree haue gum rosen cause passing much humour defied heate neither tou neth feeding tree put outwarde cooled cold aire thereabout also tree haue knot meanes partes gendered bound togethers also haue veines chinkes kinde moisture kepte passeth thereby earth partes haue also pith humour sodde defiaed passe substaunce leaues fruite boughes twigges saith hath rindes without defend tree within skinne doth body beast rinde doth body tree isidore saith also generally aristotle saith tree taketh soone fire light hath name lignum isid saith taketh soone fire light called lychius weeke giueth light present also shafte tree stretcheth roote vp toppe properly called lignum hath somewhat within pith thereof kinde hath succone moysture feeding nourishing fayleth without fareth feeding beast feeding nourishing faileth member kinde hath succour bloud veines sayth expresly auicen isidore also also tree hath somewhat belongeth thereto outwarde rinde boughes leaues twigges blossomes flowres fruite toppe aboue aristotle sayth tree hath rinde saue keepe within boughes twig spread vp leaues saue defend fruite tender harme griefes hath fruite saue multiplye kinde hath round toppe complement thereof hath figure shape piller commonly rounde albumasar saith euen spreading humour partes euen working heate maketh digestion partes yet euery tree plant hath roote root many manner knot string roote steede mouth roote humour drawen feed tree knot string steede sinewes binde together part conteined also tree hath super fluitie part kinde partes office needfull tree partes tree haire nayles body therefore leaues fruit tall tree reason withdrawing humour haire falleth beast humour feeding scarce kinde withdraweth ye part needfull faile partes bee needfull therefore generally leaues fall tree winter time yet neuerthelesse abide tree bore eyther plenty humour gleaminesse humour sadnesse soundnes tree tree thinne substaunce harde full hoales pore loose liues namely humour feeding thinne scarce also tree diuers multitude part greatnesse smalnesse strength feeblenesse cause great tree humour milkie fareth figge tree humour able spread himselfe length breadth tree humour gleamie may spread himselfe partes cleene together fareth pech tree cause witnesse scarcitie part tree hearbes grasse gleaming cause feeblenesse tree hearbes grasse ye humour scarce heate vnsufficient vnperfect also tree humour sharpe hot drye complection yt strength might hot thing lyght subtill chirleth therefore humour spredeth tree th great quantity also partes tree men take hee coutinesse quantity lykenesse qualitie lykenesse shape commeth plein matter euennesse heare ye worketh ye contrary cause wise men take hee tree softnesse adnesse softnes commeth head yt sufficient make humour hard sadde also tree hearbes grasse bee aduerse manner fruit bering tree aristotle saith ware fruit aboue ye leaues yt strength fruite needeth heat sunne make digestion ye humour therof beare fruit vnder leaues feeblenesse fruite least fruite bee corrupt greate heate colde fruite hangeth stalke cause thereof reason vnmightye humour lmightie heate yt maye holde fruit outwarde generally euerye tree hath moyst roote yt meane betweene tree earth earth tree hath feeding nourishing therefore greekes call roote life tree bringeth lyfe thereto hath stocke shafte yt stretcheth vpwarde helpe roote yt needfull albumasar sayth susteine body thereof therefore lykened stature bodie beast beareth limmes member stocke steadfast foundament tree holdeth vp boughes fruites thereof also harde tree softe pith aristotle sayeth men call pith mother tree therein seminall humour tree fed childe mother men cast gut tree saw therein pured feeding departed vnpure fruit old young almonde tree beareth double fruite sweete bitter said plat sweete almond good meate bitter almond medicine bee hot dryhot drye dioscorides saith sweete almond helpeth stomack eaten new skinne grieueth ye head norisheth dimnes kindleth seruice venus breedeth sleepe latteth dronkennesse also saith foxe eateth almond shall dyealmonds doth kill foxe ofte ye thing wholesome good men poyson beast againward also saith nigh tree beareth bitter almond medicinable roote thereof sod brayed cleanseth face doth awaye speckle abateth head ach layd forhead cleanseth helpeth rotted wound called abies hath name eundo going passing passeth farther stretcheth high tree isid saith lib kinde thereof hath earthly humour therefore able light timber thing made tree called abiegna maketh thing thereof called abietarius isi saith arist saith firre tree yt stretcheth length vpward hath much rarenesse substaunce small thin moysture therefore kind heate thereof helpe heate sun reareth beareth vpwarde moysture turneth substaunce tree maketh tree growe full high tree wonderfull high little nought crooked vertue heate euennesse humor obedient working heat therefore stretcheth vpright without crookednesse though tree gendered commeth lyght humour subtill yet kinde dryueth superfluitie humour outwarde bringeth betweene tree rinde heate sunne made clammye turned kinde sweet smelling rosen also gleamie fatnesse yt incorporate tree tree abies kindleth full soone burneth light also tree abies helpeth diuers manner building namely euennesse length shape steeple wise smal vpward downward therof good ship timber made shapen additio abies firre tree whose fruit smaller longer pine tree timber made mast ship boordes rest timber reserued many v wood tight well smelling olde firre tree papias sayeth tree sweete smell sometime parte thereof set fire alter steed insence hath name therefore supposed tree aloe sayde platearius hot tree drye founde greate riuer babylon ioyneth riuer paradise therfore many men suppose foresaide tree groweth among tree paradise commeth paradise hap drifte riuer inde men dwell riuer take tree water net keepe vse medicine good medicinall tree three manner kind tree aloe const saith lib gradioni first full heauie knot good smell deale bitter sauour browne red coulor letteth chewing saith chewed anone good sauour goeth braine filleth somedeale second lesse heauie smelleth well neither bitter third kinde deale white full light hath sauour smell little except arayed thing tree aloe fained tree like thereto waight knot deale smell men account tree aloe siluestris wilde tree tree froted lead chaunge ye colour eare waxe put thereto make deale bitter red put licour best aloe sod muste make haue good smell made vnneth knowen best yet knowen full hard maye wise chewed while men champ thereon bitter sauour within felt tree aloe comforteth stomacke maketh good digestion helpeth feeblenesse heart braine sownding namely cardiacle passion aloe sod wine helpeth euills passion heart feeblenesse heart yt commeth colde maketh wine bitter doe little therin delicate men temper wine rose water wine may kept long time much amended ye tree smoake thereof taken nose heateth braine cold comforteth feeble conclude praising thereof short word helpeth introureth feeblenesse bodie one ran vse due manner huc vsque platea three sortes tree aloe forth chapt l vertomannus nauigations shall vnderstandaddition great plentie true aloe luserpitium brought vnto v brought higher farthest partes world understand furthermore three kindes sort aloe greatly differing goodnesse first call calampat growes ile sumatra brought citie sarnau another kind aloe named iuba luba third kinde named bochor prouided none aloe calampat brought vnto v commeth kingdomes cathay chini macyni sarnau granay countreyes much richer haue much greater abundance golde king greater power rich also said king take great pleasure kinde sweete sauours vse much prince doe meanes true kinde aloe worth citie sarnau ten crownes pound waight pof aloe chap aloe fruite certaine hearb called aloe addition aloe lowe tree whose gum seldome commeth anye part world hearbe found india persia many place iuyce thereof wrong sod fire afterward dried sun platea sayth also aloe three kindes citrinum epaticum caballinum plat sayth three maner kindes diuers goodnesse caballinum good epaticum better citrinum best knowen citrine colour deale reddish namely broken pouder thereof seemeth pouder saffron substaunce thereof cleere broken little peeces broken little peeces lesse stinking lesse bitter aloe yt called epaticum like lyuer colour browne reddish lyuer hath hole mouthes veynes dimme cleere bitter citrinum aloe called caballinu blacke dimme drastie bitter sauour horrible smell aloe caballinum distinguished pouder saffron vineger ten time plunged therein dryed taketh new disposition changeth color smell seemeth epaticum citrinum yet knowen broken froted finger anon found stinking bitter fareth epaticum citrinum manner aloe lesse stinking lesse bitter better though aloe bitter kind yet wonderful profitable wholesome purgeth fleumie cholar melancholy comforteth sinewy member clenseth purgeth stomack gleymie humor noyfull releeueth head ache fumositie ye stomacke greeueth ye head maketh ake aloe cleanseth sight vnstoppeth splene lyuer prouoketh menstruall bloud maketh good colour bodye discouloured keepeth dropsie ureth dropsie beginning powder thereof taken hony slayeth long wormes wombe maketh haue abide fall helpeth goutie men healeth botch priuie member easeth itching eyen cleanseth rotting matter gum mouth healeth soudreth clenseth drieth greene wound bitter ye mouth sweete ye stomack coforteth ye cold stomack feeble helpeth digestion al taken diosc plat auice additio aloe iuice hearbe coniealed like gum vsed commonly purgatiue medicine co fortable stomacke pof reede chap reede called arundo meane betweene tree hearbe brittle feeble tree hard boystous hearb smooth without hollow norished marreys waggeth winde hurteth ye hande soone splinter isid li speaketh reede saith called arundo hath name aresco drieng drieth soone pondes inde groweth reede root thereof wring full sweete sauour licour drinke therefore varro saith yt reed inde groweth small tree humor wrong roote thereof sweete hony may striue wose lycour additiothere diuers sort kind reede long poale reede cane ilands canare people vse staues speares theyr straigth hardnesse also sugar reede verye long within groweth iuice whereof commeth sugar common great reed grow marish ground ye small made quilles weauers fishing rod c pof amomo cap amomum hath name smelleth cannell doeth called cinamom isidore saith libr amomum groweth siria armenia tree thereof seedeth cluster cleauing togethers hath white flower like violet leaues like brione maketh sweete sleepes good smell thereof amomum hearbe good sauour dioscorides sayeth deale redde leaues ioyned much seede white flower uyolet amomum three maner kind one armenia called armenicum best reddish best smell vertue valew another kinde groweth moyst place watrye softe handling hath good sauour third called ponticum red long best new white full seed spred vppon red braunches sauouring heauie waight biteth tongue manner sharpnesse chewed hath colour diuers auicen sayth dioscorides also author meane manner amomum hath vertue heate drye heale smiting scorpion water sod comforteth eyen releeueth sore ache amomum hath vertue asswage wombe ache destroy ventositie excite menstruall bloud lycour sod helpeth succoureth frentike men epatike sicke liuer haue podagre also also good receipt medicine amomum oft put though men vse ofte take steede another hearbe called amonides like thereto colour hiew vnlike thereto vertue smell auicen saith additio amomum little shrub growing armania round together like cluster grape hauing flower lyke white uiolet leaues lyke wythwinde white uine ignoraunt apothecary vse petroselium macedonicum call amomum verye true parseley macedonye whereas groweth plentifullye rembert dodoneus fo pof aneto cap anetum hearbe seed may kept three yeare great vertue discorides saith better renewed euery yeare roote thereof somwhat worth greene valewe drye sayth hath vertue heate temper hard matter make softe open diuide depart destroy ventositie swellyng abate ache gnawing gut wombe breake stone excite menstruall bloud open vrine veynes abate yere commeth fulnesse make one sleepe well temper hard gathring body sod oyle layd thereto plaister wise flower thereof sodde wine doeth away head ache head baulmed therewith ash thereof layd dropping priuie chose woman drieth stauncheth dropping anetum sod oyle releaseth shrinking stonieng sinewes helpeth many passion affirmeth saith additio anetum hot dry ye thirde degree cureth bloudie flixe mixed cup akornes dronk ale wine waight halfe ounce halfe pint called dill pof aniso cap anise hath vertue anetum hath menstruall bloud open amend inner wayes though seed small quantitie yet full good profitable vertue full healthfull wholsome additio anisum anise seed ye vitall aqua vitae good ye pouder dronk wine poyson pof allio chap garlike called allium hath name olendo smelling smelleth strongly isid saith li smell thereof strong yt passeth ouercommeth strong smell therefore men yt must need passe stinking place make cleane vncleanly rotten place arme defend themselues strong sauce garlike diosco saith garlike hath many vertues property good euill compouned diuers vertues saith garlike disturbeth wombe stomacke breedeth thirst breedeth whelkes wound body layd thereto cholaricke men eate much thereof maketh body hot breedeth lepra cause madnes frensie grieueth sight maketh dimme therefore noyeth cholaricke men kinde breedeth red cholar increaseth burnt cholar helpeth well steumaticke men colde garlike double maner kinde wilde tame wilde called scordeon among phisitions floure therof shall gathered put medicine worketh violentlye tame garlike doth tame garlike vse head kinde thereof many manner vertues found therin vertue dissolue temper consume waste put venyme venimous thing therefore without cause called triacle churles among authours old time diosc saith helpeth best biting venime mad dogge eaten salt nut rew stampe foure togethers giue ofte thereof patient quantitie great nut wine laye confection sore without helpeth wound draweth venime wasteth keepeth saueth deliuereth perill effectually triacle garlike hath vertue open temper diuide depart cut wast great humour thicke therfore helpeth haue stone may well pisse exciteth menstruall bloud cleanseth wombe slayeth long wormes wormes wombe taken sauce pepper iuice mint vineger garlike abateth ache gut reynes also garlicke sodde well water doth away sore ach place swelling also needeth beware taken meates grieueth eyen meane verse allia vina venus pulius ventus faba fumus garlike almost hot dry ye forth degree ista nocent oculis sed vigilare magi meaning garlike wine venus pouder winde beanes smoke grieue eyen waking doth lib de plant arist sayth garlike like lily accordeth therwith disposition head cloues hath vertue seminall cloues ye roote greines top stalke ye cloue nether head garlike commeth plant garlyke doth like wise seede groweth ye top stalke cloue ouer head commeth also plant seede therefore cloue garlike set earth bringeth forth plant likewise doth seede hath manye pilles leaues steeple wise hollow poorie stalke also garlike lily first hath seede stalke greines clustered together within small thin leafe onyon doeth cluster greynes together norisheth sendeth small feete garlike hath hairie rootes lyke lily saffron root garlike lily differ roote garlike spreadeth boughes lily doth garlike reneweth leaues reneweth rootes seedeth second yeare sowen therefore garlike hath many cloues spreading cloues may feeding nourishing second rootes second leaues stalk thereof seconde leaues grow stalk cloues therof vanisheth away earth fareth onion garlike onion diuers euery cloue garlike set commeth plant fareth lily cloue planted earth sendeth stalk commeth euerie cloue lily garlike seminall vertue fareth onion commeth euery cloue onion onion though set whole head springeth plant set seminall vertue euery cloue onion whole head garlike lily diuers stalke ye spire garlike called ramsons pof wormwood chap abseynthium wormwood full sharpe hearbe hot drye full sowrish bitter dioscorides saith ther two manner kindes one greene colour sower bitter sauour deale hoarishe lesse bitter lesse vertuous gathered end springing time dried shadow kept yeare great might vertue hath contrary vertues plate saith laxeth bindeth bindeth thicke substaunce sowrnes laxeth heate bitternes taken body find thick matter hard sowrenes thicknesse substance maketh thicke hard cause binding matter able digested tempreth softneth heate beareth downe sowrenesse putteth body sirop made wormwood helpeth lyuer comforteth stomacke exciteth appetite withstandeth dronkennesse healeth iaundes amendeth chaungeth colour iuice thereof pouder sod vnstoppeth splene solueth abateth ache stomacke wombe ache commeth ventositie iuyce thereof dropped ye eares drieth vp moysture runneth eares wormewood stamped bull lyuer put eares distroyeth tincklyng ringing therein comforteth amendeth hearing iuyce thereof swageth head ache commeth fumositie ye stomacke wormwood pouder commin hony doth away mole speckle ache commeth smiting layd thereto playster wise iuice thereof slayeth long wormes wombe wormes eares dropped therein iuice thereof dronke cleereth sight doth away rednesse web eyen ofte put therein wormwood keepeth saueth bookes cloathes fretting mouse wormes layd therewith chestes coffer macrobius saith helpeth biting wesells dragon healeth dronke licour sodde swageth ventositie swelling wombe dronke diosc saith hath ouer vertues condition property bee full good infecteth tast sowrenesse bitternesse grieueth smel strong odour maketh milke wine bitter al sweet thing medled therefore bee yt vse floure wormewoode make hony bitter diosco sayth plinius saith wormwood shal giuen haue feauers wormwood letteth wambling ye sea first dronke exciteth sleepe laid vnwittingly vnder head withstandeth mothes wormes layd among clothes maketh blacke haire ye haire anoynted oyntment made iuice thereof oyle rose additiothere three sort wormewood first absynthium latifolium common wormwood second seriphium sea wormwood third ponticum wormwood gentle romane said dodoneus sixe kindes inke made iuice wormwood keepeth writing long fro eaten mouse rat pof apio chap merch called apium common hearb known nigh men hath name somtime victor garland isid saith libro sayth apium grieueth noyeth haue falling euill dissolueth softeneth matter moueth vpward grieueth child also much moisture feeblenesse vertue straightnesse member way age disposed euill therfore hotte drye roote medicinable leaues shall gathered haruest kept two yeare hath vertue dissolue put wast venyme maketh good breath softeneth hard splene openeth stopping thereof doth away ache wombe agnus castus hearbe hot drie hath vertue keeepe men woman chast plin saith therefore woman rome vsed beare fruite hearbe dirige seruice dead men must needes lyue chast common honestie hearbe alway greene dioscor saith plat also flower thereof called agnus castus smell vse thereof maketh men chast lambe diosc sayth plat also maketh chast opening poores drawing wasting humour moysture seminall hee saith broath thereof helpeth colde white dropsie bee sod fenel seede lyttle esula sayd broth hearbe foredrieth superfluityes mother maketh mouth therof narrow straight exciteth menstruall bloud doth away litargia sleeping euill sod salt water apium sage hinder part ye head strongly washed therwith dioscor saith additio agnus castus singular remedie would lyue chast withstandeth vncleannesse filthie desire lecherie consumeth drieth vp ye seede generation whatsoeuer taken whether pouder decoction leaues alone leade bed sleepe vppon therefore called castus saye chast cleane pure pof artemisia chap artemisia artemisia mugwort poutevveede damasomum called mother hearbe sometime hallowed men nation goddesse diana called arthemis greeke isi saith li hot hearb dry rootes leaues thereof accord medicine good namely barrennesse commeth moysture nought worthie hot cause dry diosco saith exciteth menstraull bloud cleanseth comforteth mother abateth head ache bee sod wine water bringeth dead childe bagge breaketh stone ye reynes bladder driueth awaye fiend plin sayeth withstandeth euill thought abateth feete ach commeth trauell going thereof many manner kinde said goddesse diana founde vertues thereof taught mankinde plinius saith dioscorides also auicen telleth vertues thereof additiothis hearbe called mater herbarum mugwort whereof foure kindes especially idle huswife brawling wife proud dame dishonest woman pof oates chap avena oate hearbe seede thereof accordeth profite men horse hath name auena commeth groweth soone sowen isidore saith hath vertue relaxe swelling relaxe noyfull hardnesse cleanse vncleannesse face sayde platearius additio spire oate rare secret put water turneth straungely vnderstoode manner setting oat bread agreeable mankinde balsamo chap balsamum tree shrub neuer groweth passing height quantitie two cubites isido sayth lyke vine lyke leaues rue leaues bee white chaunge alway fall neuer tree called balsamum stocke orilo balsamum fruit seede carpobalsamum iuyce opobalsamum rinde stocke smitten yron comb droppeth thereof noble opobalsamum iuyce thereof droppeth hoales rinde den denne english greeke called opo faineth droppes meddeling cypre honie feined honie knowen drop therof put milke renneth cruddes meddeled water fleeteth aboue water oile yt feined oile feined put fresh water anon sinketh ye ground defileth cleane cloth toucheth pure balme balsamum may bee suffered ye hand sunne commeth thereto huc vsque isidorus plinius libr cap saieth manner balsamum set smell sometime graunted one lande among land wit iudea found two gardeins king greater gardein twentye dayes earth earing afterwarde romanes lordes field balsamum spred many mountaines hilles tree lyke vine mircus filleth mountain spreadeth uine without railing vndersetting boughes boughes thereof beareth themselues height thereof within two cubites needeth beware tree bee cut within yron needeth caruing yron passe rind inwarde tree tree hurt within lost tree medicinable chiefe grace thereof first iuyce second seede third rinde last stock best sweetest smell greatest seede heauie biting tast feruent mouth redde coulour huc vsque plinius lib cap diolcorides sayeth manner kinde balsamum groweth babylonia seauen well bee manner balsamum set another place beareth neither flowre fruit summer time boughes bee softly cut knife boane sheeres sharpe least tree hurt within perish rinde thirled bee set violls glasse gather therein ye drop fall one drop done roufe mouth heateth braine seemeth fire hath vertue dissolue temper consume wast keepe saue dead body without rotting forasmuch dissolueth wasteth saide plateario exciteth menstruall bloud bringeth dead childe wombe mola mother wombe breaketh stone ye bladder reines doth awaye illiaca passion euills head taken due manner helpeth feauers quotidian quartane withstandeth venimous biting hath vertues many noble vertues yt full long recken heere arow shall suffice time additiobalsamita hearbe length bignesse lilly lease lyke rue growing onelye iudea aegypt whose iuyce commeth precious balme oyntment bidellio chap plinius saith lib capitulo bidellium tree named couth blacke tree lyke oliue leaues might gumme thereof found vse medicine gum thereof bright bitter tast wel smelling smelleth wet wine also glose super genesis sayd bidellium found stone omchenus groweth plinius saith ye country east arabia india chaldea libr isidore sayth bidellium tree inde arabia gunune tree arabia best smelleth well bright somewhat white light heauie fat lyke ware soone made softe bitter good sauour meddeled tree earth gum tree foule blacke counterfeited gumme bitter tast whence euer commeth substaunce thereof gleamie stoppeth draweth therfore diocorides sayth plat also contrary bloudie fluxe commeth sharpe matter good haue fluxe ingendered commeth strong drougs also good postumes within without anointed duely therwith breaketh stone abateth cough withstandeth venim creeping wormes beast easeth ath gut platea sayth bealeth best bee limme broiten gu falleth bagge genitours soudreth well inner partes gumme bidellio accordeth vetnix called bernix also yt called maner gum men saye gum tree hauing vertue souder clarifie saue therefore painter occupye bindeth bidellium doth another kinde cold dry seconde degree bidellium hot moist said platearios edellium pli tree growing arabia also gum tree lyke waxe sweet sauour tast bitter copper buxo chap boxe called buxus name greeke somwhat corrupt among latines isidore saith lib among greek called pixos tree alway greene smoothnesse matter able receiue writing letter figure made table bore wel planed receiueth white colour thervpon diuerse letter diuerse figure shape written made afterward maye put away easily soone isidore sayth vtter tree called hec buxus inner stock hoc buxum therefore one said manner hec buxus crescit hoc buxum crescere nescit appeareth woulde meane tree called buxus groweth called buxum groweth tree sad matter fast nutrimentall humour thereof full gleamie cleauing togethers albumasar sayeth lib vegil therefore stocke therof hard sad heauie sinketh water hebenus doth sadnesse fastnesse stock hath pore aire might enter entering might fleete aboue water albumasar sayeth therefore leaues therof long greeue fall soone one falleth another commeth steed hath many smal leaues thicke little fruit none shauing boxe colde drie stauncheth fluxe sod pit water dioscorides saith dyeth haire yt oft washed broth therof sauour therof bitter plinius saith lib cap smell heauie though grieue tast sauour yet comforteth sight alway greene namely summer winter ye leaues therof waxe deale pale fall albumasar saieth cause gleamy humour therein much fleeting moysture roote therefore leaues fall heat commeth humour drawen outward working heat leaues greene colde commeth humour suittest inward great drinosses coulour yeolow pale boxe groweth hot place stony therefore hard sadly warred tree within smooth couenable bee planed holdeth long time shape figure made therein thereof bee made fayre image long also bore bore ordeined made keepe muske manner spicery good many manner v necessity ouer noyous greath letting time rehearse heereall arowe wee haue rehearsed bee sufficient slute additiothe lennes boxe hot dry vsed medicine verye hurtfull braine balauftias chap balaustia flowre falleth pomegranard tree shal beare fruit flower cleaue togethers cluster fall tree sometime aud phisitions take occupye vsage medicine may kept preserued great vertue winter long dioscorides sayth flowre balaustia colde drye hath vertue binde fordrie humour therefore helpeth medicinable bloudy fluxe helpeth also menstruall bloud hath also vertue staunch spuing admiting bee sodden uine get layde sunng breast pit also pouder thereof healeth closeth sendreth wounde pouder thereof healeth game cleanseth date away rotting therof fastneth maketh stedfast root saith also healeth welks ye lip pisidra rind tree doth thing namely fruit apple tree apple shall taken ripe additio balaustium flowre pomegranard africtiue binding beta chap beta comon hearb gardeins diosc saith therof double kind blacke white either iuyce dropped ye nosethrils purgeth head abateth ach eares amendeth doth away nit vncleannesse ye head speckle mole face restoreth saueth haire leaues therof shoare laid quencheth ye euill called sacerignis holy fire swageth greene wound nourisheth euill humour oft vsed diosc saith aristotle speaketh beta sayeth men may graffe bete stocke men doth caustocke ye bete stock taketh strength turneth tree saide de natura plantarum additio beta candida beta nigra beta nigra romana beetes hot drie abstertiue especially white beete yt cleansing nature ceder chap cedrus tree greekes call cedros ceomones dri sticon vnderstand humour burning tree leaues therof answereth lykenesse cipressus isidore sayth li sayth ther cedery tree merrye smell indureth abideth long time neuer destroyed mought neyther terredo tree worme ceder indureth alwaye thereof bee rastees timber made belonging place king temple also gumme tree called cedrina necessarye keepeth saueth bookes bookes bee vermissed gumme bee fret wormes neither age time tree groweth affrica siria namely mount libany ceder tree high tree lady queene tree rabanus sayth super psalt fayre sight alway greene good smell smell driueth away serpent al manner veniuous wormes saith sweete fruite apple ceder great long bee eitrine else yeolowe coulour wonderfull smell pleasaunt sauour hath three manner sauores middle graines apple chrine sowre without sweete rinde meane betweene sweet sowre pith fruit within ceder many diuerse great dooing vertues also full medicinable wholsome gum therof shaped manner lyke top sharp seruent burneth drieth dioscorides saith wipeth cleanseth away dimnesse eien slaieth destroieth ye wormes eares helpeth agaynst ach feeth helpeth biting serpent also doth awaye tingling ringing eares iuyce hisop swageth abateth swelling iawes healeth certaine wound lung keepeth laueth soft flesh rotting ceder tree anointed owne gumme keepeth saueth dead bodyes rosting saide therein also seede ceder abateth cough exciteth menstruall bloud bringeth secundinas bagges child bee wrapped mother wombe cleanseth purgeth mother softeneth slaketh sinewes bee shrunke crampe maketh one pisse cleanseth awaie grauell reines bladder dioscoride setteth many vertues ceder iuyce fruit thereof plinius speaketh maner ceder wise certaine tree called modica first brought ye lande medes greekes call tree agedia cedronilla hath ye name seemeth apple thereof follow vertue ceder sauour also isidore saith lib apple tree contrary venim plinius sayth sayth tree full fruite nigh alwayes fruit thereof ripe greene sowre blossome seldome seene tree many men call tree assyria sayth additiothere two fort ceder great small small fruit also two fortes one sharp prickly leaues like ioniper prickly ceder hot dry third degree read dodoneus cipresso cap cipressus called ciparistus greeke isidorus saith lib head thereof ariseth round sharpe vpwarde toppe pineapple point vpward point called conon another roundnesse fruite thereof manner disposition hath name therefore called conus cipresses name called consete foresaid cipres tree hath vertue much lyke vnto ceder tree formable necessarye edisteng building towres temple greate pompeous coifices may efayleth neuer abideth duteth lasteth alwayes first estate condition hath right good sauour sweetest smelling therfore olde time men vsed make fire fume braunches twigges thereof destroye put awaye stench loathsome sauoure dead carrion daungerous conlagious ayres huc vsque isidorus cipres tree hot first degree also drie seconde degree apple ye sayd tree ye stocke leaues according right necessary medicine platearius sayeth sowre healing sendereth fasteneth therefore helpe ye flures wombe commeth defalt vertue retenlers made pouder receiued meat drink medicinable helpeth sicknesse passion illiaca helpeth disease ach loynes prepared fodde pit water wine watered foresaid water leaues cipres cleanseth purgeth putteth away corruption filth new woundes cureth healeth euill called sacer agni called english holy fire purgeth cleanseth sneeueling nosethrills doth alwaye stench stauncheth bleeding seed sayd cipres tree drie figges tempereth hardnesse reume stauncheth fluxe helpeth venimous deadly postume called antrax beareth downe mallice thereof letteth spreading thereof withstandeth venimous biting dioscorides rehearseth al vertues cypre many moe plinius lib cap sayeth cypre tree many bough hath voire knappes steede fruit hath bitter leaues violent smell gracious shadow cipres double manner kind male female female barren faire sight ye bough therof thicke top wound togethers bough male dee thin cut burgen gaine additiothe fruit cypre taken body stoppeth laske blondy flixe good spitting blond decoction made water hath vertue cipio cap ciprus written cipricum nardo c li ca plinius saith yt cipre tree aegypt lyke oliue leaues leaues bee greene fatte blacke flowres white seede sweete smelling seede sod confect oile therof wrong ointment king smelleth wel delicious called ciprus also isidore lib glose super plinius meaneth best kinde tree groweth aegypt vpon riuer nilus region canopia second alcalone third ciprus thereof smell wonderfully sweete sayeth tree another tree like called aspalatos lyke rose flowre root flowre thereof made notable ointment also saith euery schrub rainebowe shineth straight thereon sweetnesse sauour smell bowe shineth bowe shineth tree maketh smell fairenesse increase man tell like white thorne hauing colour fire redde smelleth deale castorium men call elizeus scyepter hee saith heereto diosc saith ciprus medicinable tree couenable giuing vertue leaues thereof shewed abateth swelling mouth broth thereof flaieth wormes head infedeth haire bee washed flowre thereof sod vineger doth away head ach saith ciprus tree yt called lentiscus another name looke vertue thereof littera l additio cuparisos sorth lentiske tree commeth excellent gum roseu called masticke smal grain big wheat cornes brought ye ile cyo fayre cleere white brittle sweet sauour cinamonio chap canel called cinamum thereof written ecc exod glose saith shrubbe groweth inde aethiopia passeth two cubit quatity called cinamum hath small stalkes bended coulour ash blacke colour broke commeth breath seene subtill small canell deere greate lesse worth held lib isido meaneld canell hath name cinamoro rinde thereof small round cane groweth shore stocke small braunches broke thereof commeth breath mist smelling weetly super ecc cap glose sayth ye cauell short tree good smell sweete coulour ash twice good medicine pipe also lib ca plinius speaketh canell sayth canel cassia men tolde fable olde time found bird neaste specially phoenix neast may founde falleth owne weight smitten downe lead arrowes men doe segine make thing deere greate price truth meaneth canell groweth among troglodites lydela aethiopia commeth long space sea ship hauen gellenites short tree two enbites long span long least hath stocke foure sixe inch greate smelleth dryeth drynesse lyking thereto fructuous winter contrary kinde tree groweth among brier thick bush therefore gathered without great trauel difficultie man hath leaue gather thereof ye sunrising sun going downe gathered priest measure dealeth braunches taketh thereof parte space time merchaunts buye deale chiefe goodnesse thereof thickest smallest braunch middle flocke little dame nothing lyttle rinde rinde vertue grace canell therfore top ouer partes best goodnesse much rinde tree within little naught worth comparison rinde huc vsque plinlus li dioscorides pla meane canell hee third degree dry second degree canell double manner kind yt wit smal great great lesse worth small leaue vornitiue medicine small better needfull vadirines best shinne small sharpe biting sauour medled sweetnesse deale red coulour much good smell canell deale white lesse worth good smell canel hath vertue comfort braine hath vermedy softnesse part souder fasten canell hath manye manner vertues dioscori sayth abateth cough commeth thicke moisture pouder thereof medled vineger doth away scab dryeth moisture ein meddled colirium ointment eien swageth swelling reines eureth dropsie healeth biting creeping wormes comforteth appetite exciteth menstruall bloud openeth stopping defieth meale drinke dissolueth vndeeth destroyeth postumes canell dronke wine bringeth secundinas bagges child bee mother wombe wipeth away dimnese eyen succoureth helpeth sounding cardiacle passion additiothe tree cinamon much vnlyke bay tree especially leaues beareth barrie doth baye tree lesse white doubtlesse therefore home barke tree gathered manner euery third yeare cut branch tree great plentie iland zaylon first gathered yet sweete moneth waxeth drie barke onelye spice wood lyke firre tree light casia chap casia mention made exod certeine kinde spicery good smell molde groweth arabia isidore saleth rod strong rinde red purple leaues rind pepper lyke canell vertue mighty effect deed therof medicine double weight taken steed canell isidore sayth glose super exod meaneth casia breedeth watrye place groweth strongly giueth good smell leb ca plinius speaketh casia sayth tree casia groweth fast cinamum field three cubites long braunch greatet braunch canell hath three colour first white redde blacke parte best white lesse worth soone eaten wormes holed soft subtaunce lesse bitternesse vertue rinde casia proued new smelling sauour coulour noble casia deale sweete biting sharpe sauour sweete merrye smell brown pepper coulour heauye weight casia best breaketh soone bendeth foldeth another manner kinde ca lyke balsamus saba smell bitter therefore first blacke deale sweete biting sauour good smell praysed among phisitions huc vseq plinius ibidem platea dioscorides meane speake two manner casia one called casia sestula casia lienea rinde lyttle tree groweth nigh march babylonia threof diuerse manner kinde one like canell deale redde round sadds substaunce foldeth broken beaten standeth hath sharpe sauour deale sweete vnneth phisitions vse manner kinde manner kind deale bitter deale diuerse colour phisitions vse manner kinde best breaketh seene bendeth foldeth hath sharpe sauour meddeled sweetnesse good smell hath broken somwhat white coulours distinguished within withred medled among sometime teined medling rinde capar knowen deale bitter sauour hath vertue diuisitiue subtil substance also casia hath vertue temper diuide depart hath owne quality vertue consume wast hath good smell vertue comforte cureth rumes colde cause helpeth haue falling euill comforteth braine purgeth reines bladder ripeth healeth postumes vnstoppeth liuer splerie remes hideth doth awaye stinke mouth chewed exciteth menstruall bloud comforteth helpeth fowning failing heart stroppe bee made pouder thereof rose boane hart huc vsque dioscorides plat additio casia sweete shrob hearbe bearing spice like cynamon casia fistula cap gasia fistula
