coulour commeth smiting otherwise bee layde ofte therto oft vse thereof face shall discouloured huc vsque dioscorides plat plinius sayeth nigh libro capitulo hee sayeth comin tame wilde hee sayth accordeth many medicine remedyes namely stomacke doth away swelling blowing thereof destroyeth ach gnawing guttes roayes additio cumminum called seseli dioscorides writeth three sort first called seseli masilience seconde seseli aethiopium third seseli peloponnense seede roote hot drye second degree seede dronke wine comforteth heart helpeth digestion driueth awaye gnawing griping bellye prouoketh vrine expulseth dead childe setteleth matrixe sayde bee good curing falling euill disease haue continued long coriandro chap coriander mention made exodus verse smelling seed greekes call corlon isidore sayth libro seede thereof taken sweete milke maketh men prest serue venus yet needeth beware without doubt men take much thereof breedeth woodnesse leesing wit venimous hearbe boundes slayeth eate thereof isidore sayeth papias sayeth furthermore coriander taken meate heateth constraineth hardneth breedeth sleepe author meane hath compounded vertue hearb coriander macer saith booke thus frigida vi herbe coriandri dicitur esse austeraeque simul quiddam virtutis habere say hearbe coriander colde hath somewhat cruell vertue galen sayth hearbe oft men destroy moughts putteth long wormes wombe bee ground dronke wine medled vineger hearbe hath good smell selfe whole sounde stinketh froted handes seede thereof white small additiothis hearbe called caliander colde drye daungerous seede eaten rawe vnprepared killeth bodie coloquintida chap coloquintida mention made regum quarto maner hearb bitter called cucurbita agrestis manner wilde weede spraye thereof breedeth grounde like common gourde hath round fruite hearb stretcheth spreadeth hedge vine doeth hath much small fruite rounde isidorus sayeth libro dioscor sayeth coloquintida called cucurbita alexandrina sometime found alone deadly venemous hearbe called squilla id est cepamarina griueth thing much found many hath pith rinde seede pith best medicine seede secondarie rinde little nothing woorthe vertue pith white good seede well pight maketh much noyse smitten little force also fal soone pouder hath vertue dissolue wast bitternesse hath also vertue depart deale thirle subtiltie substaunce purgeth sleume melancholy said helpeth quotidian quartane scab giuen due manner patient healeth tooth ache bringeth wormes wombe pouder thereof staieth wormes eares openeth hardnesse splene liuer iuyce therof dronke fenell broathe thereof openeth emoroydes veynes bloud bringeth menstruall bloud hath vertues manye moe dioscorides sayeth pl tea plinius also additio coloquintida hot dry third degree without discreete vsage exceeding hurtfull heart stomacke lyuer coccus fruitefull tree calicut worlde coccus groweth west india addition whose fruitefulnesse sweetenesse passeth tree world beareth certaine fruites like vnto great date nuttes generally bringeth foorth ten commodity beareth wood apte kindle fire nuttes pleasaunt eaten also cordes rope maye well serue saylers likewise verye fine cloathe made kinde gosse lyke wooll couloured sheweth lyke silke woode best maye fonnde make coales yeeldeth saype wine oditerous water forth tree also kinde turpentine gumme proceedeth moysture lyquide oyle brittle iuyce sugar hardeneth verie pleasant one tree heareth manye fruites whereof greatest bigge man fist supposed nux indica cut braunches droppe uine pleasaunt drinke taking awaye first rinde barke put ye fire busneth quickly great flame seconde fruite vnder first rine rime much lyke vnto bombace silke vnlike beaten wrought flaxe flower make certaine kinde cloathe vnlyke silke course sowe refuse make cordes finer tacklyng shippes serueth cloath serueth cord within nut lycour sweete whitish fattie straunge tree beareth fruite continuallye greatly esteemed greatest discordes warre hand toucheth lyght sharp knowen olde wet sometime counterfaited thing called crocomagina increase waight foyle siluer ground espied slow grinding chaungeth owne smell sod crocomagina called superfluitie spicerie saffron oyntment made huc v que isid dioscorides meaneth speaketh two manner saffron one called hortensis hath name garden groweth therein called orientalis hath also name place groweth best shall put vomitiue medicine beareth purple flower head violet middle thereof three flower foure best thereof somwhat red red whitest shall forsaken saffron may kept ten yeare hot drye first degree temperate qualitie therefore comfortatiue helpeth much feeblenesse stomack fayling heart doth away rednesse eyen commeth bloud defflyng ground rose white egge laid eye dio saith pla also saffron hath another property greene winter long leaues winter neuer colde summer leaues falleth fadeth withereth altogether groweth againe middle haruest floures breaketh small stalkes arist sayth li vegita saffron much lyke onion ascolonia roote neuerthelesse diuers varieth either roote saffron continued body seedeth ascolonia doth seminall vertue ye roote cloues saffron leane cloues thereof springeth one side fareth ascolonia onion gardeines cloues saffron springeth place generation veynes cloues saffron hath propertie arist saith hath rootes cleaneth thereby earth sucketh nourishing feeding onion garlike head saffron great ripe beginneth departed dealed multiplyed manye heades theyr fell skin rootes euerye groweth plant thereby knowen head roote vertue seminall vertue multiplication preseruation kind therof plin li sayth saffron soone tempered honye sweete lycour tempred soonest wine water best medicine destroyeth swellyng boyling sore ache eyen namely medled wine best stomacke lyuer drinketh saffron first shall dronken garland thereof letteth dronkennes letteth man yt may dronken causeth sleepe moueth head exciteth venus flower thereof done euill called holy fire helpeth cureth saffron made oyntment citrine yeolow called clogomagon greeke helpeth running eyen best dieth teeth spettle pourgeth botch head abateth swelling cureth biting serpent spider hath ther vnder rootes though hayrie thereby great roote taketh nourishing feeding radicall humor sent hearbe ye first yere hearb profiteth roote second yeare solved seedeth commonly second yeare beareth seed one skin garlike doth top stalke seede springeth spreadeth small stalkes onion double kinde tame wilde aristotle calleth canina hound onion onion canina hath white flower towarde heauen somwhat greene toward earth onion helpeth postlimes tame onion hath hollow stalke without knot reneweth ioynts leaues aristo saith libr predicto dioscorides saith tame onion good profitable meate medicine gleymie colde kinde namelye ruen long red white drye new rawe sodde doth away griefes wombe abateth stinch mouth softneth wombe maketh meate sauourie iuyce thereof helpeth haue litargio sleeping euill abaseth ofte ache eares woman milke dropped therein eaten couenably forekerneth departeth gleymie humour openeth mouthes veynes exciteth vrine menstruall bloud bringeth venime quencheth biting mad dog helpeth venimes bitings clarifieth skinne openeth poores exciteth therefore sweate maketh break giueth ye body nourishing eaten rawe grieueth cholericke men accordeth fleamatike men breedeth thirst swelling noieth grieueth head sharpnesse eate much breedeth madnesse woodnes maketh dreadfull dreames namely men new recouered sicknesse eate much thereof onion yee eate maketh eien watrye grieueth light sauour huc vsque dioscorides additiothere diuers sort onion white red rounde great small one fauour propertie sauing one somewhat stronger working c sepe canino cap cepe caninum hound onion called squilla also found sea side therefore platear calleth sepe marina sea onion sometime found alone venimous eaten except venimme thereof quenched men vse depart manye partes plant white raw sod set sowen beareth seede second yeare sowen beareth seede head corrupt destroyed head commeth corruption seede sowen seeding corruption seede sowen seeding corruption head onion seede sowen land dolue cleansed rootes hearbes seede thereof cut gathered beginneth black ripe onion best kepte straw keep without rotting must washed luke warme hot salt water dure longer better eate set sowe better kept sack many men hang onion garlike smoke ouer kept spire grow ofte onion garlike spireth though earth let craft cunning also li ca saith yt wild onion full wholsome full good eate ful medicinable healeth dimnesse smell exciteth vnction healeth boiches cureth hound biting honie wine helpeth biting serpent healeth tingling eares deafnesse helpeth ach reines goose greace honie succoureth faint heartes smell leaues therof stamped medicinable biting hound seede thereof brused dronke sweete wine helpeth sore bladder lib cap plinius saith cucumer tame wilde roote therof white grose iuice thereof made electparie needfull manye medicine additiocucumbers colde moyst second degree pof cucurbita chap cvcurbita name greeke originall thereof vncertaine latines isi sayth li plin saith many kind therof cucurbita tame wilde tame spreadeth boughes braunches leaues uine doeth bindeth selfe certaine fastening binding vine doth beareth somewhat white flower spring thereof namely night bloometh beareth blossom without vndersetling fruite thereof fayleth rotteth without reared vp ground rayled log rod vine platea saith cucurbita colde moyst complection temperate quality found hot country land seede thereof sowen commeth hearbe thereof commeth white flower fruite last full seede pith rinde therof first soft hard tree ripe fruite thereof newe accordeth meate seede medicine seede thereof hath vertue depart shed hard matter substaunce thereof subtill helpeth therefore stopping liuer reynes bladder haue feauer ague meate medicine rosted fried purgeth matter vrine lareth abateth heate comforteth sicke seede thereof gathered ripe washed dried sun corrupt superfluitie moysture kept three yeare drie place huc v que plat plinlus saith iuyce hearbe helpeth euill called holy fire ye swelling eyen abateth ache eares milke hot put therein powder seede thereof filleth vp hollowe wound ash rinde helpeth burning li cap plin saith wilde cucurbita great finger groweth stonie place iuyce thereof helpeth much stomacke gut palsie loynes reynes pith thereof wormewood salt doth away tooth ache iuyce thereof heat vineger fasteneth teeth wag substaunce thereof without seede healeth postumes feete wine heat therewith doth away reeses eyen leaues thereof sod stamped helpeth wound seede therof dronk wine ouercommeth venime shall eaten breedeth swelling li isid saith wild cucurbita ye coloquintida maner withwinde well bitter hearb springeth braunches toward ground cucurbita doth hath great leaues heauie smell cucurbita hath isid saith looke de natura colloquintide seemeth first maner cucurbita beareth gourd worst maner cucumer bereth pinopins additiothe gourd colde moyst seconde degree whereof two kindes called pompeons pof celidonia cap celidonia hearbe yeolowe floures fruite staineth toucheth called celidonia springeth bloometh comming swallowes isid saith lib swallow called celidon greeke el isidore saith called celidonia helpeth swallowes birdes eyen hurt blind plinius rehearseth saith iuyce celidonia swallowes eye turneth againe first state hurt put hath vertues noble good dissolueth draweth wasieth dioscorides saith abateth ache purgeth head menstruall bloude cleanseth mother cure f ster canker mouth plinius saieth dioscorides platearius also additio selidoniae salendine called figwort marsh marigolde two selandines hot drie third degree marsh marigolde vsed phisicke pof centauria cap centauria right bitter hearbe hot drye third degree called therfore gall earth isidore sayeth one called acheronecentaurus found knewe first vertue thereof isidore sayth lib thereof two maner kind lesse first hath greater blossomes f te vertue lesse sayde platearius constant saith said roote hot drie second degree hath bitternesse sweetenesse hath fore vertue fastening together bitternesse hath vertue tempring dealing leaues floures haue vertue medicine thing thereof hearbe abateth wombe ache cleereth sight vnstoppeth splene reines cureth pally slaieth wormes wombe medled hony roote thereof closeth helpeth wound plinius saith dioscorides platearius also additio centorie hearbe bitter two kind greate hot drie third degree lesse hot drie second daphni cap laurel tree called daphnis greeke laurus latine isidore saith li hath name laurus lau praising great worship praising conqueror sometime crowned garlandes boughes laurell tree old time called laudea afterward changed r tree called laurus sometime ye vndertide called medidies isi saith ye greekes call tree daphne alway greene winter sumer therfore ctors dissolue temper drawe wast venime venemous biting dronk laid wound dioscorides saith platea also sayd hath vertue riacle many thing thing put thereto exciteth menstruall bloud bringeth secundine bag ye childe ye mother womb bringeth dead childe ye mother womb helpeth haue falling euill palsie iuyce rewe saith pli li ca said hinde taught first vertue diptannus eateth hearb may calue easelyer sooner hurte arrow seeketh hearbe cateth putteth yron wound basilius saith exameron ambrosius expositor super ca speaketh hinde calues isidore saith hearb groweth manye place groweth fat field little worth groweth drie place stonie best little thereof tasted heateth mouth saith libr isidore saith manner diptannus mount creta called candie thereof hearbe diptannus hath name virgil sayth hinde wounded goeth landes seeketh hearbe diptannus hearb great vertue driueth putteth yron bedre therefore beast smitten arrowes eate thereof driue yron body hearbe hath maner might war driue arrowes dart hath lykenes adder dragon isi saith lib many men call hearbe serpentaria colubrina hath red floure departed shaped mouth serpent middle thereof springeth adder tongue sharpe blacke round middle floure thereof riseth head great seede round first greene red beginneth ripe hearbe hath great vertue might diosc saith roote thereof dried made pouder water rose anseth face maketh cleere good colour healeth fester french sope dryeth vp maketh mouth thereof wide bone within broken rotten may drawen taken full helpeth canker vineger hot lime leaues thereof sod wine ripeth postumes botch iuyce thereof helpeth hearing hurt grieued cold cleereth sight exciteth menstruall bloud destroyeth emoroides drieth nether veynes run full bloud iuice thereof dronke maketh woman haue childe hir time common beane sometime called fresa men gren oft grind breake saith dios saith yt beanes bee sowen garden fieldes stalke therof ariseth edge corner great hollow knot leafe leaues euery knop leaues broad plaine sound narrow endes beanes beare white flowres red black speck aboue end good smell bee haunt much flowres beanes stalke bee many coddes think long distinguished many den chamber beanes set theyr place departed coddes first greene without white within softe hardneth little little heate sunne blacke last token ripenesse dioscorides platearius meane beane colde dry except greene moyst first degree nourisheth lyttle eaten greene breedeth thick humour swelling ouer parte wombe greeneth therefore stomacke breedeth thicke bloud melancholike also thick smoak greeueth braine therwith beanes cause vaine dreaines dreadfull seething roasting thereof swelling ventositye abated destroied ye eateth beanes continually ach gnawing guttes roapes beanes stop splene make harde wombe beanes eaten hulles harde defie breed much swelling cleane beane hull away cleanseth cleansing therof purgeth face cleanseth lung dronke bealeth postumes teates pappes doth away wormes blearinesse eien smiteth swellinges gathering postumes bee sodde uineger layde thereto beginning libro cap plinius speaketh property kind beane sayth among poulse groweth roddes beanes called best many meddle beanes bread corne make ye bread yt heauie beanes bee dampned pithagoras sentence sayd oft vse therof wit dulled cause many dreames else men meane dead men soules therein therefore vatro sayeth bishoppe shoulde eate beanes among corne onely beane springeth leaues full wathing moone sod sea water salt water sowen going downe seauen star called pliades ripe gathered winter loueth water blometh drought blossomed amendeth land yt groweth steed doung therefore thessalia field ye beanes grow eared beanes bloome many place beanes growe without trauaile tilling namely mauritonia landes north occean hard vnneth may sod beanes growe aegypt sharpe prickes therfore crocodile flye dreade least eyen bee hurt sharp prickes beane x cubites long head popie therein beanes closed head red rose beanes growe power binde wild field beane serueth vse man wholesome scarce good prouender horse except wheate bran well baked hard frumento chap wheate called frumentum hath name fruendo vsing eating thereof corne hath name fruges isidore sayth ouer part roote called frumen sauour meate principallye knowen propertie wheate haue eyles high eare graines corne hollowe hoales manner wheate stalke springeth roote eare stalke inuironed small hole graines corne bee closed eare groweth small cyles sharpe dartes thereof eare hath name spica dartes bee called spiculum eyles defend eare dartes small bird shoulde bite eare take awaie graines wheate small beast stalke compassed leaues bulles succoured therewith bend grounde weight heauinesse corne eare stalke called stipula vstipula hath name vsto burnt gathered strawe burnt helpe amende lande kepte fodder beast called palea first meate yt laid beast namely countreies tuscan kinde thereof colde suffereth snowe falleth shodde hot compelleth apple ripe huc vsque isidorus lib many manner corne called fenmencum isidore sayth pli also lib wheate barly rye meale whome shall spoken afterward owne place corne called frumentum generally men shall take heed ground sowen qualitie grounde corne thriueth one ground faileth another fordryeth plinius sayeth vnderstoode corne lande also manner time sowing must regarded corne soone sowen late winter seede soone sowen summer seede late sowen sowen vnder sorrow aboue wheat sowen certaine manner time certaine barly manner time meale commin hieronimus saieth expresly super esay man take heede couenable time sowing gathering corne plinius sayth libro done better one time another corne gathered full moone saued corruption also fayre weather time sowe serere latine commeth sereno coelo isidore sayeth serenum coelum cleere skye manner speach men shall sowe greate raine stormes virgil sayeth plinius sayeth cap winde bee strong corne apayred three time state corne corne bloometh blossome falleth ripeth anye euill blast eare fadeth destroyed looseth fruit corne also much raine greeueth lost colde humour else turneth vnkindly hearbs superfluitie leaues also sodeine immoderate heate greeueth closed clowde humour drawen inner part roote strong heat hot humour gleamie wormes breede roote fretting gnawing wormes substance corne wasted also corne graines wormes breed jeaues destroye graines corne eares rainye weather passing heate bee corrupt rotten also passing drinesse corne lacketh humour lost default nourishing feeding else greene flyes breede therein called cantharides cantharides log fly yt variable coloured venimous operatio also sting fret thrift corne sometime many long fly lesse breed therein destroy euery deale also seede corne needeth cleannesse purenesse plinius saith ther cap seed touched lallowe grease spilte lost also corne groweth needeth busily husbandrie needeth ye corne cleane weeded cleansed superfluitie euill weed saith among best wheat sometime growe euill weed venimous carle rey commeth corruption mallice humour drawen might heate worketh sufficiently matter also said corrupt dewe cleaueth leaues commeth corruption corne maketh werred rustie among manner corne wheat beareth price mankinde nothing friendly nothing nourishing heer seeke littera seeke de messe segete additiothe first best kinde wheate opinion columella redde wheat second spi e wheate third called ye pound wheat su mer wheat rawe wheat chewed mouth good laid biting mad dog wheat norishing seede man farie cap far manner corne hath name sometime broken morter men vse craft mill commeth farrago isidore sayth hearbe barly kind yet greene fruit therof breaketh ripping additio zea far spelt two sortes one hath commonly two cornes seede ioyned togethers whereof graine owne skinne chaffe couering single hath one graine spelt nature lyke wheat somewhat colder drawing neere nature barly somewhat dryeng bread thereof much inferiour made wheate nourisheth lesse graine none vsed england almaine germanie fol turner farina chap meale called farina matter bread hath name farina far far corne broken betweene mill stone commeth meale else name commeth farciendo filling whe meale made bread filleth ye womb else meale properly called farina corne well ground betweene mill stone flowre bran meddeled departed stowre meale boulted departed bran called simila similago also hath another name called pollen pollis thereof commeth haec polenta hoc pulmentum commeth pultes isidore sayth libr cap men meane polenta manner potage made best pured stowrethickned milke called pap young child hath name pollenta polline delicate meale flyeth mill stone ye mill called amolum another name throwne ye mill stone lightnesse therof stowre called simila smal without greatnesse weight polenta hath signification said glosa super iosue shall eate polenta yeare haec polenta corne sod pilled hulled shalled froting handes though pilled hulled shalled beating stamping morier called polenta pilenta pilled shalled morter name euer hath meale good meate medicine thereof bread made meddeling water baking fire sometime thereof meate made seruaunts called cibarius full delicate meate sometime sowre bread medled sowre dough bake vnder ash baked turned wend fire called focacius cake baked duen called clibanarius manner wise many baking crafte bread made meale isidore sayth li manner bread comforteth nourisheth pleaseth man heart restoreth lost giueth vertue strength trauaile passing fresh bread cleane made wheat friend accor ine kinde constantine sayeth dietis meale ground mill sisted siue medled hot water sowre dough haue ye better sauour knead mould shape loues baked afterwarde last many trauailes man lyfe fedde susteined therewith also meale good medicine medled e manner thing according meale meddeled hony healeth cleanseth face scab whelltes dioscorides sayeth also meale wheate rie sodde wine grease laid breast teat healeth softneth hardnesse commeth tunning milke saith ripeth postumes gathering euill humour slaketh sinewes ouercome spilt crampe shranke sayth additiomany wayes serueth vse flowre wafer eggpies flawnes custard summerset shiere whitpot kentish pudding pancake friters dainfye fartes portingale suger plate biskets comfit carawes last euilly bestowed making starch vlase ruffes fondling flie withall many wayes besides serueth vse flowre needefull profitable fermento cap sowre dough called fermentum maketh paast feruent maketh also arise isidore sayth libro cap sowre dough compounded diuerse vertues hath substaunce vertue lyke therefore hath vertue heaue paast bread change amende sauour thereof turne lykenesse matter meddeled hath vertue drawe soone euill humour bodie dioscorides sayth ripe open postumes botch meddeled salt openeth pore body subtilty dissolueth tempereth humour called fermentum latine zima greek paast made onely meale water called asima sima without sowre dough sima sowre dough reareth paast bread meddeled therewith chaungeth sauour thirleth distributeth partes thereof sayde super epistolam cor additiowith gran also called curgings dragges ale made famous potage deuensheere called drouson fumo terre cap fvmus tarre hearbe hot dry first degree hath name springeth groweth earth great quantitie smoak doth fumositie commeth earth sayd placeari greene hearbe better vertue dry hearb horrible sauour heauy smel neuerthelesse vertue cleanseth purgeth melancholia sleme cholera helpeth ye scab dropsie commeth colde cause helpeth haue podagre stopping liuer splene hearbe hath vice breedeth swelling ventositie therfore ventositie thereof shall bee abated fenell breede sretting gnawing platearius sayeth additio capnos fumoria fumeterre two sortes common sort called fenistorye hot dry almost second degree feniculo cap fenel common hearb great vertue might hot drie seconde degree hath vertue temper shed open carue cut subtill cause quality thereof said pla seede roote leaues thereof accorde medicine therof isidore speaketh lib cap vlt sayth latines call fenell feniculum iuyce stalk roote thereof sharpeth sight said serpent tast thereof doth away age yeares ye greek cal hearbe maratrum isidore taketh certeine speech plinius li cap serpent saith maketh fenell noble away age tast thereof restore sight maketh sharpe iuyce thereof sayth vnderstanding inwit arraied therwith dimnesse put iuyce thereof full good collirium made agaynst dimnesse eyen fenell double manner kinde wilde tame seede therof dronke wine helpeth biting serpent stinging scorpion iuyce thereof dropped eares slayeth wormes iuyce thereof comforteth strengthneth hardneth stomack abateth wambeling breketh stone multiplieth milke brest roote thereof purgeth reines helpeth dropsie sodde wine healeth pennie weight roote thereof dronk two cyates wine helpeth biting serpent iuyce thereof dronke ye quantitie beane sayeth wombe greene pith thereof doth away silth fare seede thereof dronken wine stauncheth bloud helpeth haue falling euill iuyce thereof helpeth cleerenesse eyen huc vsque plateanus additioof ferula read dodoneus bo cap fol feno chap geye called fenum hath name fedde nourished glose super esay speaketh heye sayeth growing hey greene faire heareth flowres afterwarde dryed heate dunne brought pouder last lykewise man looseth fairnesse passing drawing toward age draweth death tourneth last pouder heye greene springeth clotheth maketh faire downes medowes maketh men beast haue liking looke thereon comforteth eien greene grasie hearbes flower tender substance therof moysture iusquiamo cap ivsquiamus greeke english called henbanehenbane canicularis latine hath name canicularis either side stalke thereof groweth crab head fa eth pomegranards isidore saith li mouthes thereof departed clouen haue diuers seedes lyke poppie seede hearbe called na mad vse thereof perillous eate dronke breedeth madnesse slow lykenesse sleepe therefore hearb called commonly mirilidium taketh awaye wit reason isidore sayth venemous hearbe hath blacke seede red white linius saith dioscorides blacke worst venemous red lesse euill white least euill therefore vse thereof accordeth medicine hath vertue constraine binde also breed sleepe haue blacke seede haue blacke leaues rough hard purple floures hard leaues thicke sad haue reddest seed haue white floures also butter floures leaues abateth hot reume huc v que diosc plinius aristotle libro vegitabilium speaketh henbane seede sayeth seede henbane poyson slayeth among parthian eaten ierusalem good ground euill groweth mallice tree full profitable stocke thereof good building fuell rinde leaues medicine though fruite ye tree hid vile rinde rough harde yet taken thereof found sweete namely sod rosted isaac dietis saith fruit hot middle first degree drye second sweete heate sourish drinesse casteynes breede swelling men eate many thereof breedeth also head ach fumositie closed therein purge cleanse fruite must rosted sod water earthy matter may wasted fire fruite made lesse harde lesse fast el maye tempered softnesse moystnesse fresh water nourisheth well breedeth good humour tempreth drinesse body breast namely eaten dipped butter nourish best pof lauro chap laurell tree called laurus tree victoryand worthy praised many maner wise singular excellencie grace vertue sometime conquerours crowned garland laurel tree name glose saieth super dan iuyce leaues thereof healeth lyps chinnes whelkes sayde called lentiscus pricke thereof blunt softe folding vse call thing softe plyant lentus isidore saith lib fruit tree commeth oyle rinde commeth resina called masticke best breedeth iland chio isidore saith lib dioscorides platea plinius meane leaues tree full hot drye tree haue vertue binde fasten comfort helpeth therefore spewing manner running bloud humour thereof say mistix hath lyke vertues gumme hath name mist gand wing chewing made tough cleansing harde waxe among ye feeth chewed cleanseth purgeth gum rotted humour fasteneth wagging rocking teeth maketh white cleane strengtheneth comforteth rootes thereof cleanseth amendeth euill breath masticke gathered wise ende springing time rindes tree tenultus cut flie ground made cleane cloathes spred ther least lycour falleth shuld fall ground lycor faire cleere cleane best dim medled earth nought worth mastike cleanseth purgeth brain causeth spit much comforted vertue digestion destroyeth ventositie windes sowdreth ioyneth together wonderfull manner broken thing precious stone thing broken molten hot tile flate plinius dioscor meane lenti ca tree wt many prick deepe roote grounde clouen diuided many part fruite thereof lyke myrtus greynes lesse reared within ripe within manner rough wooll iuyce wooll stauntheth running dropping woman additioof masticke tree commeth gumme masticke cleere small greynes quantitie wheat cornes pof lilio chap lily hearbe white flower though leaues floure white yet within shineth likenesse golde dioscorides plat speake lily say hot moyst lily wilde beareth purple floure yeolowe beareth white pure mightie working vertue lily ripeth dotches sore therefore helpeth pastumes botch bee stamped auxungia grece also vertue thereof tempereth fasteneth matter therefore helpeth hardnesse splene place ye splene side splene annoynted iuyce lilyes well meddeled incorporate olde oyle vertue thereof cleanseth purgeth ponder thereof medled rose face washed therewith vertue thereof easeth sore therefore leaues sod layd sore burnt healeth sore roote therof doth brused oyle layd therto vertue thereof tempreth softeneth hard matter therefore bringeth menstruall purga vertue thereof abateth swellyng helpeth postumes come swellyng ventositie roote thereof stamped oyle ofte said thereto huc vsque dioscorides plin saith lily roote maketh floure therof worthie noble many manner wise roote thereof dronke wine heateth biting serpent helpeth ye mallice venime frog roote sod wine medled oyle helpeth podagre knot feete maketh hayre growe place sealded burnt also roote sod wine medled honie helpeth veynes cut leaues thereof sod wine healeth sore wound seede thereof brayed layd holy fire floures leaues heale sore hotches huc v que plin li ca item cod lib cap lily next rose worthines noblenes certayne gathering oyntment thereof made noble oyntment oyle called oleum liliorum oleum rosaceum ofte made rose root therof springeth stalke three cubit long top stalke hangeth floure downward narrow stalk wexeth bredth wider wider shapen bell floure hath small threddes containe seede middle standeth chiues saffro nothing gracious lily fairnes cosent sweetnesse smell effect working vertue coulour thereof treble white redde purple huc vsque plinius libro capitulo roofe lilye hath manye cloues roote garlike arist sayth lib vegitab euery cloue vertue feminall springeth plant set alone seeke heereof de allio litera heereto arist saith stalke lily hath many knot stalke bended layd downe couered earth roote grounde ere seed bread vnclose within dayes thou shalt finde euerye knot small cloue sprong roote wonder also said lily floures first greene afterward white stalke cut roote kinde humor stalke closed pith kind heate pith tourneth ouer part stalke maketh digestion matter floure floure spreadeth white humour full digested therefore sayd uersifiers likened lily wan wit busie last thing euer shall last sayd lily hath vertue seminall seed roote lily diuers varieth leekes garlik haue seminal vertue diuers place heereof loke chapter garlike onion litera c also lily stalk floures new cut put clodde claye keepeth floures fresh long time lilye flower smelleth full sweete white whole broken stinketh full sowle broken froted handes lily hath onely flower seede sleepe fruite vertue lily hath stalk roote shewed head flower seede higher floure stalke head bendeth downward flower thereof plaine smooth softe touch handle ound shape liking sight goldish greynes contained within ye martagon amatilis hispanorum read mattheolus c pof lactuca ca lectuce called lactuca hath name plentie humour isido saith el maketh ofte milke woman nourish feede child men heard ye withstandeth mouing venus thereof double kinde wilde tame wilde call seralia backe thereof hath sharpe prickes seeth sawe lyke isid speaketh seuenteenth booke last chapter isaac dietis speketh hearb saith hearbe wild lettuce lyke shape tame hath longer braunches smaller sharper lesse greene scarsitie moysture therefore much bitter drier therefore many men meane exciteth menstruall bloud putteth rawe humoures dioscorides saith tame lettuce cold moyst temperate passeth measure neither qualytie therefore vse thereof accordeth meate medicine subtill substance namely fresh therfore soone digested abateth gnawing burning commeth cholera rubea cooleth heate boyling bloud exciteth sleepe healeth head ach commeth cholaricke humour sumositie multiplyeth milke woman semen men reason good bloud breedeth perfect quantitie qualitie olde hard moysture thereof wihtdraweth hearbe bitter vse thereof breedeth bloud worst appaireth sight maketh fayle slayeth feelyng stiffeleth naturall feeling sowrenesse thereof lettuce grieuous get childre runneth consealeth seminall matter namely seede thereof ofte taken meate drinke huc v que isa dietis lib cap plinius speaketh lettuce sayeth manner kinde lettuce groweth selfe without tillyng manner lettuce called caprina throwen sea flayeth fish nigh thereabout milke thereof vineger water wine healeth dropsie hearbe leaues stamped sprong salt healeth sinewes forecut another manner lettuce groweth field leaues therof stamped healeth botch laid medle among ye greekes maner lettuce called isopum esoperum third manner lettuce groweth woodes called stancio leaues thereof grounde meale floure healeth wound stauncheth bloud healeth rotted wound roote leaues abateth euill called holy life another manner lettuce round leaues shorte called heracia among many men hawkes scrape hearbe take iuyce thereof touche heale theyr eyen therewith doe away dimnesse blindnesse olde iuyce healeth euills eyen namelye woman milke medled therewith healeth biting serpent stinging scorpion iuyce thereof dronk wine leaues stamped layed wounde plaister wise swageth healeth manner swellyng also seede manner lettuce wilde tame chasteth sleepe dreames lecherie suffereth body polluted neither desiled oft taken meate ofte vse thereof much thereof eaten grieueth ye cleernesse eyen plinius thereto giueth many praisings chapter shall suffice time pof lappa chap lappa cle philantropos among greekes rough cleaueth man clothes groweth olde wall called philantropos louing mankinde cleaueth man clothes maner affection loue seemeth thereof double kinde sharp round disposed lykenesse horse foote therefore many men call vngula cabalina horse hoofe either hath leaues heauie mightie sauour smell dioscorides saith li cap plinius saieth name lappa name manye manner hearbes wonderfully wralled lapped cleauing togethers short caulstock knotty without full pith within hearb accordeth meate medicine thereof good meate made may kept long time busily compounded sod vineger smapie seed hony meat commonly called compositum hath singular vertue withstand dronkennesse plinius saith lib eaten meat kapeth dronkennesse taken meate dronkennesse maketh passe away doctrine teaching rasis meaneth yt nothing better broken bone good ye stomack sinewes therefore commandeth biddeth hearb giuen haue quaking pa ste spit bloud child breedeth plenty milke iuyce therof helpeth venim smiting serpent namely seed thereof helpeth biting hound isid saith lib legumine cap legumina codware yt serueth potage hath name legumina legendo choosing chose men old time chose best codware made meat therof graines deale greater thicker graines wheale baily properly called legumina gendered hull wheat code closed therin fareth pesen fetch bean legumina codware diuers quantitie colour figure shape sauour among codware lupine beanes greatest pesen fetch meane fille vaches smallest quantity diuerse coulour white blacke red meddeled diuers coulours shape bee diuers round bee euenlong three cornered plaine sauour differ bee sowre hard made soft good eating seething bee bitter themselues lupine bee made sweet sauoury good watring codware shall gathered begin ripe fall soone coddes well seene shed areth lupine plinius sayth libro codware substance thicke fast colde drye harde defie hard seething fast hard substaunce may well sod pitte water seeth codware well needeth running water well streame oft codware boystous meat made accordeth strong men complection kinde codware selfe hard digest nourisheth much comforteth digested breedeth swelling ventositie ventositie abated thereof medling thing destroy ventositie comin anete dioscorides saith affirmeth additio codware breedeth swelling vsed keepe good dyet beanes pea sortes doe breede winde c pof lente cap lens lentis manner codware seruisable potage isido saith lib hath name moyst softe namely grasse lens lentis commeth lencicula diminutiue thereof writ c difference lens lendis nit little head worme writ genitiue case except nomnatiue case therof one speaketh manner lens lendis capiti lens lentis conuenit say lens lendis nit head lens lentis titl accordeth mouth till colde drye compowned contrary isaac saith one vertue thereof rinde another pith meale hath rinde manner sharpnesse lareth wombe pith meale sowrish comforteth stomacke constraineth bindeth gendreth thicke melancholike bloud filleth brain thicke smoke therfore cause horrible dreadfull dreames grieueth stomacke ventositie swelling stoppeth passage veynes bodye dryeth substaunce sinewes skinnes braine grieuous skin eyen distempereth hot moyst helpeth haue dropsie bee eaten without skin gendreth much swelling stretching gut skin till great fresh easie seething best meate medicine malice till tempered skinne put away pith sod fresh selfe best dropping commeth chin slit bee made therein accounted lesse worth mirhre precious gumme arabian make fire shredding thereof thereof full grieuous smoake withstood smell storaye el smoake men take vncurable sicknesse euills best mirra pure gathered among troglodites arabia isi saith plinius li cap saide mirra tree fiue cubites high groweth woodes arabia leaues thereof bee lyke leaues oliue bee cripse haue prickes like boughes iuniperus boughes thereof carued cut slit two time droppeth slit dropping called stacten best manner mirra called mirra electa mirre chosen mirra seuen ye sore cutting heereof two manner kindes one female lyke leaues letuse beareth apple male hath leaues lyke beete isidore sayeth libro diosco saith mandragora sleeping hearbe leaues thereof spread grounde hath two rootes three cleauing togethers blacke without white within thick skinne male hath white leaues thinne roote like apple grow ye leaues gall grow oken leaues yeolow sweet smell manner heauinesse fresh fauour accord therefore meat onely medicine rindes thereof sod wine cause sleepe abateth maner sorenesse time man feeleth vnneth though bee cut yet mandragora must warily vsed flayeth men take much therof sayth plat said cooleth deale slayeth maketh sleepe stronglye therefore iuyce thereof woman milke laide temple maketh sleepe yea though hot ague hearbe colde substance sayd fruit thereof quencheth euill called holy fire abateth reese cholera fluxe wombe huc vsque plat sayde kinde shape man woman roote thereof rather feined churles witch sayd maketh woman conceiue seemeth saint conceiue mandragora colde dry said platearius disposition letteth woman kindly colde dry disposition mandragora hath many vertues smiteth destroieth swelling bodye dioscorides saith withstandeth long stalk knottie reed seede thereof full small colde dry isaac saith dietis witnesseth lightnesse hollownesse thereof absence gleaminesse vnctdositie nourisheth little comforteth stomacke drynesse thereof bindeth wombe dioscorides sayeth diuritike assate swageth ach helly gendereth good bloud leth dryeth stomacke said dietis menta chap menta hearbe good smell hot drye comforteth stomacke thereof double kind wilde tame one groweth garden woodes mountaines heateth first hearbe called colocasia greeke nepta calamentum latine isidore sayth libro cap penul hearbe full medicinable manner mintes grow moore medes mightie vertue heate haue heauie smell sauour mint garden hearbe multiplyeth selfe springeth soone ground stalke therof bended downe ground heeled earth turneth roote bringeth forth anon new mint mint gardeines full vertuous greene drye dissolueth tempereth wasteth proper qualyties thereof comforteth exciteth appetite odour good smell sharpnesse therof sod vinegar away stinch mouth cleanseth purgeth corrupt rotted gum abateth vineger perbraking casting commeth feeblenesse vertue retentiue helpeth sauour smell sownding feeblenesse spirites comforteth cleanseth superfluitie mother abateth sodde wine ach gut reines sod wine oyle laid cureth healeth hardnesse breast teates come running crudding milke iuyce thereof withstandeth venim slayeth dronken wormes wombe care also mint sodde wine oyle dissolueth healeth colde postumes healeth cough huc vsque dioscorides pla also isaac sayth libro dietes taketh away abhomination wambling abateth yoring cleanseth smootheth tongue froted therewith exciteth venus additiothere sixe kindes mintes curd mint crispe mint baliac spere mint hart mint horse mint water mint read dodo fol malua cap malua hocke soft hearb hath name malua molliendo aluum softning wombe isidore saith libr saith plinius also balmed iuyce thereof meddeled oyle may greeued stinging bee also member balmed iuyce hockes bee bitten spider stong scorpion plinius sayeth hocke double kinde lesse called altea eyther hearbe moist temperate betweene hot colde sayd dietis knowen vertue working thereof tempereth ripeth postumes namely roote seed thereof broath thereof helpeth flure bloud hath somewhat gleaminesse tempereth thicke humour reines dronke wine breaketh stone softneth hardnesse splene broath therof maketh sleep face washed therewith vtter part body broth seede thereof helpeth tisicke men helpeth cough seed therof sod oile tempereth hardnesse softneth cleanseth ripeth sayde plateario additiothe holy hocke gardeine mallow also wild mallow small mallowe also althea ye marsh mallow property reade matheolus turnar dodoneus nuce chap nut tree called nux called nut also hath name nux dropping leaues thereof greeueth noieth tree nigh thereto many latines call tree iouelans another name tree somtime hallowed iupiter fruit thereof hath greate vertue put among frogge stooles venumous meates spilleth destroieth quencheth al venim therein isidore sayeth libro fruit thereof hath harde rinde without bitter sweete kernell within manner apple closed hard skinne rind shale called nut pince castanie auellane saith nut tree high long large bough knot broad leaues sinewy euen long sharp end euill smell sauour shadow therof grieueth sleepe vnder breedeth diuerse sickness euills fruite thereof leaues rinde accorde medicine dioscorides saith iuyce ye roote rinde nut tree dronke quantitie one oxagum helpeth difficultye pissing contrarie feauers come shiuering colde bee dronke vineger sayth also furthermore dieth cleanseth haire letteth falling thereof hath many vertues might fruit thereof accordeth meate medicine many manner nut speake touching meate medicine nut french nut lesse auelanes common nut called gallica pinus sharpnesse leaues old time men called pinus sharpe tree called picea thereof sweateth woseth pitch isidore sayeth libro ilandes germania ye pine apple tree commeth dropping wosing made harde coldnesse heate tourneth precious stone called electrum isidore sayeth electrum hath another name called succus iuyce tree named called pinus also tree good thing kept continued therevnder figge tree greeueth noyeth thing therevnder isidore sayeth pine tree high tree euen light many small hoales right strong therein many knot pine apple tree right strong oftentimes thereof mastes made ship right good timber edifieng buylding tree taketh right soone fire burneth commeth nigh fire plenteous fatnesse therin thereof commeth pitche rinde tree hard rough humour within fat gleymie humour drawen summer heate sunne chaungeth tourneth rosin rosin first white right blacke sodde pitch made thereof sauoureth full well doth smoake thereof also great seething sauour thereof abateth tree beareth many leaues small sharpe tree greene colour winter also summer though tree fattest yet groweth mountaines right drye place also stony though tree great springing yet pared shred towarde grounde springeth spreadeth vpward toward heauen groweth slowly gleimie humuor thicke soone deffed digested tree spoyled ye rind dry better betweene rinde tree wormes breede tree beginneth drie wormes fret gnaw tree therfore saue tree keepe accounted chiefe medicine takeoff rinde wormes breed corrupt humo rinde betweene tree rinde also lib plinius saith ye pine tree alloren tree healed earth orye vnder ground dure last long time pipe conduiles made pine tree laid deepe vnder earth dure many yeares rotteth corrupteth soone lye aboue earth moyst place altogether hid vnder grounde running water runneth thereon wexeth hard dureth house long time rotteth soone neither worme eaten corrupt dropping raine deepe vnder earth cureth abideth full long time safe sound without corruption contrarye ver rotteth anone vnder earth dureth best within house kept drye plin saith li ca additioof pine tree ther fiue kind appeareth dudoneus herball beareth kinde wooden apple within rosen serue diuers purpose folio pine cap pinea pine apple fruite pine tree plini sayth great round stalke sharp ende first greene full ripe coulour colour castane pine apple greatest nut conceiueth selfe steede fruite many kernells closed full hard shale ioyned together certaine order neuertheles none shuld touch distinguished departed asunder skin shale certaine wall wonderful craft kinde ordained ye greater kernel shuld occupy larger place ye lesse yt lesser place set best wise lesse lesse place vnder waight kernells greater end pine apple hangeth aboue fast tree stalke sharpe ende hangeth somdeale downward toward earth platearius meane pine apple kernell shall vsed needeth heate easely pine apple vpon coales double rinde thereof taken away inner vtter kernells full medicinable plaine smooth moisteth deale openeth cleanseth spirituall member easeth cough helpeth haue tisike consumed increaseth bloud rindes thereof medicinable sowrenesse thereof stauncheth bloud namely menstruall bindeth stauncheth bloudie flixe chin crasing ship stopped therewith keepe water come ye ship pitch molten called pitch liquida either kinde pitch hot dry hard pitch compouned one maner fleeting softe another maner many call fleeting pitch colophora pix greca pitch greece greece much thereof found either manner pitch medicinable dissolueth consumeth wasteth helpeth stopping euill splene put many medicine playsters dioscorides saith pitche helpeth venime venemous biting stamped salte pitch maketh fire burne lightly defileth smorcheth hand cleauing toucheth namely molten defileth white coulour white cloathes cleane defiling vnneth taken away cloathes touching colour sauour pof pyro chap pirus peare tree beareth fruite hath name fruite thereof shaped flame fire fruite thereof great hard broad one ende narow straight ye flame fire isidore saith libro tree called pirus fruite thereof called pirum peare saith peares weigh heauier many apple beast back saith isa diet saith peares double maner kind wilde tame either kinde boughes braunches sower stopping biting fruite full diuers wilde peares sower earthy colde drye tame vnsauourie hard tast generally vndigest accordeth therefore meate onely medicine bindeth stoppeth strogly fluxe wombe stauncheth cholaricke spewing sad running water laid stomack tame peares grene ripe sower great harde vnsauourie euill meate seething fresh water honny sweete thing earthinesse roughnesse thereof may somwhat tempered yet according meate medicine tame peares ripe colde drye sower substaunce thereof medled watry sweetnesse therefore according meate medicine better according meate medicine meate meate laxe beare downe meate place digestion comforteth sinewes mouth ye stomacke many peares eaten fasting breedeth wormes wombe colliea sio incurable sweete peares temperate co plection lesse cold accordeth therefore better colde drye peares haue propertie sod toad stooles take away griefe mallice namely wilde peares ful sower isaac saith powder ash wilde yeares dronke helpeth fronges tead stooles sayth alwaye eating peares wine shall bee dronke one saith without wine peares venime additiothe drint mellower peares wholsomer ill colde stomacke baked daye hot tree droppeth commeth glowe fast gum phisitions say ints profitable medicine make inke writer vse isid saith fruite plum tree called prynum white blacke red ye blacke plum somwhat hard dry sower good substantiall matter ye root matter somtime thin somtime thick somtime mene al saith comento super li de plantis matter watry thin strong heat roote euenlong sharpe shape ye moisture nourishing bee roote gendered humour earth working heate heate heauen entereth commeth therein vertue therof agreeable feeding nourishing drawen incorporate thereto also place disposition ground root taketh disposition complection groweth sweet ground meanly drye bee nourished raine water better nourished soft land marreys standing rotten water whereof draw nourishing reason malignitye corruption water worse least wholsome meate medicine isaac saith root hid vnder ground sight sheweth vertue thereof working flowres fruit bough roote lyeth hid vnder ground liueth profiteth better better fayleth drawen grounde dryeth fordryeth tree hearbe root part counted lesse price neuerthelesse root mother well hearbe tree either nourisher needfull susteiner deepe roote put grounde steadfast foundation hearbs tree though root soft substance therof yet vertue subtiltie kinde heat pearceth betweene hard stone commeth innermost part therof winter time kinde heate slieth colde aire gathereth selfe innermost root multiplyed temperatnesse nourishing selfe winter time root conceiueth taketh water humour drawen sendeth forth nourish breede braunches flowres springing time ye spring time tree hearbs dry dead winter time humoure commeth vp ouer partes quicken springing time also qualitie good euill root commeth vp bough twig oft shewed fruit flower vertue vice ye root oft sowrenesse bitternesse humour roote defied benefice aire heate heauen purifieth matter oft falleth bitter roote commeth sweete fruite flower fareth roote vine nut tree oliue huc vsque isaac dietis vniuersalibus also aristotle saith tree stay beare fruites wont remedied roote roote slit stone put slit thicke humour corrupt passeth seething cleane humour pure new aire drawen commeth root tree renued healed also isaac galen saye muscus atheniense sayd hearb root much nourishing hath seed nourishing fareth pasnepis rapis colevvortes carreis againward seed hearb nourisheth ye roote nourisheth certaine hearbe approprieth name root hot dry like raphane vertue hath vertue temper depart dissolue consume wast open poores helpeth scauers come colde openeth stopping splene tempereth hardnesse thereof succoureth dropsie hath harde sauour sowre accordeth medicine meate raye againeward accordeth meate medicine hot moist nourisheth hearbs root isaac sayth dietis maketh soft flesh sweete ventositie bolning thereof therfore nourisheth better well sodde hard defie bee rawe euill sod stoppeth pore ye veine also good way medicine ye iuyce good podagre feete goutie place bee aswaged sorenesse ache seede rape heate winde brought set fire burning sometime wood groanes nigh wonderfully light set fire plinius li cap speaketh cambmoke sayth among kindes tree cambmoke pricking shrubbe hath boughes leaues sharpe profitable medicine iuyce rootes stalk decoction made medicine phisitions call licium men call lucidus maketh cleere eien doth away webbes wormes eien helpeth blearednesse eyen euils liddes eyen also itching eyen healeth cureth rotted gummes spitting bloud good running menstruall bloud woman haue much superfluitie humour mother closeth mother best wise also wasteth humour plinius sayeth healeth whelk pimple lip healeth chipperings tongue sayth additiothe cammocke rest harrow pety whyn ground furze barke root taken honny prouoketh vrine breaketh stone resina cap resine isid saith libr dropping commeth issueth sweting tree ye tree balsamus ferule pine lentiscus tree shrub sweateth woseth liccur rein greeke much say english sweate wose well smelling tree east landes country dropping balsamus ferula dropping whereof hardeneth chaungeth precious stone electrum first chiefe resina therabinthina chiefe better commeth arabia iudea siria cipresse affrica ye ilande sea second lentiscina called mastix commeth iland hedechio ye third resine pinealis soft hard huc vsque isidorus onely gumme hard soft called resin resin softe fleeting resin balsamus tirebinthina harde mastix thus mirra resin first soft fleeting gleamie first wosing tree abideth alway soft fleeting waxeth harde heat colde resin good profitable medicine therefore resin put noble ointmentes medicine looke kinde vertues resin owne place additio resine pituinae pitch resina rosen resina pini resina colophonia drie pitch resina arida dried rosen c rubo cap bra blea bush called rubus thicknesse thornes bryers shrubbes prickes groweth place together isi saith rubetum rubus name propried shrub beareth wilde beryes heards eate hunger fruit thereof first red spreadeth long braunches small round deale thicke growing sharp prick branch pliaunt springing bending selfe leaues thereof short clouen side deale sharp smal prick without crooked lightly pricking thus rubus full prick fro roote vp toppe prickes therof deale crooked downward towarde earth sharpe teeth fruit thereof first greene hard full sowre red somewhat sowre blacke sweet last ripe full ilyce thereof red painteth dieth bloud fruite without compassed full thin wearish skinne departed asunder diuided small den valleyes manner roundnesse deale vpright ful moist meat within ful graines medicinable tree fruit thereof tree rubus cold dry platearius sayth constant sayth saith crop thereof deale sowrish helpeth hot postumes burning rednesse eien croppes powned white egge layde therto also iuyce stalk crop therof medled water barly helpeth bloudy flixe huc vsque platearius goodnesse fruit therof looke littera de moris agrestibus tree groweth barren land best close garden vineardes thicknesse multitude prick letteth holdeth men beast passseth forth entering receiueth hare small beast defendeth foules make theyr neasts therein ye intent kind giueth prick therto defend therwith swoords therefore grieueth hurteth pricketh hand gather fruit thereof suffereth aduersaries come within rubus also darke shadowie reason thicknesse letteth passing sun beame thicknesse thereof therfore friend adder creeping wormes therfore rubus bush rubeta hath name venimous frog dwelleth bush therefore safetie sleepe rest nigh bush venimous wormes master sayth historie super libr exodum additioof bramble three sort great brier euerye hedge beareth black berry long ground bryer wheron groweth bigger bery black called dew berye good coole hot stomack smal scratch brierthese brier medinable leafe fruite rubus idaeis called framboys raspis withstandeth mightelye venim biting venimous beast stamped salt garlike nut healeth wonderfullye biting eare nose iuyce oft dropped purgeth head fleame helpeth haue falling euill broath thereof helpeth releeueth tooth ache bringeth paralitike oft feeling openeth poores closed destroieth mightely ventosity wind gut abateth sore ach within rew eaten medled water rose comin cleanseth healeth medicinable hearbes woodes founde summer wood beautified bough braunches hearbes grasse wood place deceit hunting therein wilde beast hunted watch deceites ordeined set hound hunter place hiding lurking oft wood theeues hid oft awayts deceit passing men commeth spoiled robbed oft slain many diuerse wayes vncerteine strange men oft erre go way take vncerteine way waye shal vnknowen way knowen come oft place theeues lye awaite without perill therfore oft knot made tree bush boughes braunches tree token marke high way shew certeine sure way waifaring men oft ye theeues turning meeting way change knottes signes beguyle many men bring right way false token signes bird foules bee flye wood birdes make neasts bee gather honnie bird keepe themselues fowler bee hide themselues make honnie diuerse country land departeth asunder weuing casting together tree often men keepe defende themselues enimyes additio saltus forrest lawne parke forresta wood wherein deere beast feed shadow speaketh wilow saith wilowes diuerse kinde beareth long roddes high siers waxeth great thereof pearches made raise vine rindes thereof long thicke strong white within greene without thereof bee made bondes hoopes though wilowes bee strong yet bee plyaunt lesse therefore breake sooner wouen bended make withye bond wilows bee lesse smal plyaunt passing plyaunt bee pliaunt beare made stronger weauing tourning threed twining therewith men binde wine pipe tunnes wine thirde kinde wilowes meane betweene two first plyauntnesse quantitye plyaunt stiffe lesse boughes bee white rinde away plaine smooth handling thereof made diuerse needefull thinges householde stooles seates paniers kippes thicker boughes braunches plashing shredding paring though euery wilowe bee barren fruite yet neuerthelesse beare well barren bough braunches namelye bee shredde pared due time march aprill sayth hee sayth libro cap among tree set planted wilowes beare price cut two foote grounde growe n high venime scorpion abateth tooth ach passeth braine comforteth wonderfully breaketh stone commaundeth menstruall bloud exciteth appetite helpeth haue falling euill healeth dropsie helpeth haue litargie sleeping euill helpeth full greatly cleanseth haire letteth falling thereof doth away tinkling ringing eare wipeth away dimnesse eyen smootheth roughnesse lippes helpeth paralitik men openeth pore tempereth consumeth wasteth humour laxeth smiteth sinewes togethers taketh awaie palsie plinius rehearseth praising many saith vertue thereof seed seede lesse quantitie might vertue seede heateth openeth consumeth wasteth multiplieth selfe one little graine commeth right great plant springeth spreadeth greatly branch flower seed seed thereof groweth certaine small cod euenlong round kept defense cod vntill ripe flowres thereof full yeolow good smell though hearbe substance kene feruent yet bee loue best flower haunt plinius sayth neuerthelesse bee touch neuer flower oliue plinius appropriation isidore sayeth sementes seede corne sowing time called manye men goddesse lady sowing seminarium beginning euerye thing vessell seede put sowe sementum profite winning commeth seede hugo sayth heereof bee vearses difference grecismo meane seminall humour beast called semen grain corne bee sowen fielde called sementis properly sementinum seminum well beginning thing plinius libro cap sayeth seede good kepte one yeare two three little woorth kepte longer time grain lowest threshing floure best seed best seed heauyest best heauie white within qualytie land seede shall sowen thicke thinne soone late must sowen soone moyst lande least seede rosteth raine late drye lande raine come soone thereafter least seede lye long drye vanish bee lost lesse seede shall bee sowen fat land leane land fat land groweth full fast destroyed selfe one seede ouersetteth another last greate multiplication selfe seede sowen soone shall waxe thicker seede late sowen late seede shall thinne least dry thicknesse cunning sow euen lyke thicke hand shall accorde stepping passe away foorth right foote seede shall bee chaunged colde place hot neither againewarde nothing shall bee commanded contrary seede sowen leane land commeth thin strawe small eares somtime voide fat field one roote seed commeth cluster stalk haruest day night bee lyke long time contrarye seede time also springing time men shall sow full hoare frost sooth winter seede sowen hoare frost breaketh springeth seauenth day frost vneth springeth within day huc vsque plinius ca seede small graine rounde hath selfe vertue multiply saue kinde therof sowen swelleth humour earth closed within yt tempereth maketh subtill humour earth bringeth draweth temperatnesse ye grain graine waxeth soft great small skin seed cleaueth burgening springeth lyttle lyttle rootes pight downward ground rootes burgening seede draweth awaye selfe feeding nourishing openeth last priuelye earth thereof springeth stalkes twigges flower fruit seede though seede yt sowen right little yet therof commeth right great thing huge fooles account seede lost sowen neuerthelesse better wise kept sowing also seede vertue seminall kinde heat worketh therein humour nourishing feeding drawne thereto vertue heate feeding growing seed commeth stalk stalke commeth eare called spica hath name spiculo dart eile isidore sayeth libro eares groweth many eiles sharpe dartes kinde maketh eyles corne eares succour armour sodeine reeses biting small bird wormes isidore sayth diuerse kindes seed eare diuerse figure shape sometime eare broad fareth barlye saith stipo beset compasse stipula properly strawe leaues hofen left fielde repers haue reped corne hook gathered home many men gather stubble apt many diuers v men thetch house therewith feedeth beareth seed void like huskes voide coddes wilde men wood forrestes vseth seede steade bread tree hath much sowre iny e somewhat biting men vse therefore springing time haruest stirte rindes gather therewith chin cliftes ship stopped porred therefore aray craft make ready thereto called stipulateres isido sayth libr vbi agit de lanis stripper hempe much braking heckling rubbing hardes departed substance hempe flexe great departed knottie short rough therefore full able spun threed thereof made neuerthelesse thereof threed spun full great vneuen full knovbes thereof made bondes binding match candle full drie taketh soone fire burneth kindled falleth sodainly ash thereof commeth quenched bitter smoake grieueth eyen nose good profitable medicine well wrought purged stalkes good dry heale woundes ease burning scalding abate swelling eyen plinius sayeth lib cap pof taxu cap ewe tree called taxus tree venime poyson strong tree high great boughes piyant long parthes make bowes isid saith li doet speaketh thereof sayeth tree burnt bowes made thereof shadowe thereof grieuous slayeth sleepe thervnder iuyce thereof laxatiue substaunce thereof keepeth euill called ignis grecus shall quench boord called tabula hath name teneo holde tabula one signification meat boord namely rich men wer tenebula bolding morsells holde morsells vessell set vpon areared set vpon feete compassed lyst another manner tabula plaieng boord men play dice game maner table double arayed diuers colour third manner thin planke plaine therein letter writ colour sometime small shingle plained made deale holow either side craftely ioyned togethers filled full waxe blacke greene red write therein table called tabulae hold letter writen therin plaine ye tree made hard smooth better table another manner name tabula commeth tegendo wer heling couering long shingle broad cloue axe sawe boorde needefull couering house boords table made building craftely arayed disposed sometime fighting many manner crafte wonderfullingines many maner casting hewing denting plaining table boords may euen well ioyned boords table garnish house neuerthelesse bee set soler floresplanckes serue men beast therein troden men beast come therein haue gyests beames lyke farre asunder fastened thereto defended therewith bende crooke soone ouerset pressed stone heauye thing laid dressed hewed plained made couenable vse ship bridge bulk coffer many needfull thing buylding also shippes mariner flye boord ofte saued perill pof trabe cap beame also gyest called trabes tree stretcheth thwart ouer house toucheth wall either ende holdeth vp fall great highnes neither leuieng declined haec trabs vel trabes hath name traho drawe reach reach one wal another ioyned sticked therein hugo saith needeth gyest beame long strong great namely middle lest bend crooked small middle dread bending crooking ofte needeth vnderset post pillers thwarte ouer tree set wise needeth bee vnderset succour maye bee better held vp beare heauy thing laid therevpon pof terebinto chap terebinthus isid saith li tree sweateth rosin better rosin thereof called terebintina right medicinable dios saith ye leaues thereof fruite rindes seede sowrish gathered busilye ash thereof contrary venemous biting good rosin thereof cleane bright cleere good sauor red colour hath vertue temper moyst laxe ripe therefore good hard postumes gathering bee head member plin lib cap speaketh tree terebintus saith siria terebintus thereof double kind male without fruite female double one hath red fruite greatnesse fetche hath pale fruite greatnesse beane fruite hath merry smell fat handling touching much rosin siria great tree matter thereof right soft durable wexe blacke shine age leaues thicke haue manner cod therof commeth certaine beastes gnat gnawe pearceth rindes rinde pearced thereof woseth springeth drop rosin also lib cap plinius saith roote tree terebintus leaues sodden wine comforteth stomacke helpeth head ache terebintina smelleth best pleseth siria cipresse pure bright whitish manner rednesse thicke groweth mountaynes pourgeth healeth woundes better groweth fieldes additiothe turpentine tree groweth syria dounged groweth fat ranke wheate heauie weight also nutritiue nourishing wheate groweth leane land also dry goodnesse wheate knowen goodnesse ground land groweth againward also wheate taketh diuersitie diuersitie tune wheate groweth moderate time perfect qualytie quantitie full meale doure right little bran nourisheth best wheate springeth immoderate vneasie weather time vnperfect also gleimie earth moist gleimy fast hard defie breedeth swelling ventositie hurling kurling wombe wheate meane betweene new olde betweene moyst drye temperate therefore better nourisheth accidentall moysture wasted heat ayre tempereth somewhat ye substaunciall moysture therefore wheate better nourisheth better well digested leeseth gleiminesse thicknesse earth isaac saith wheate hot temperate betweene moyst dry bread therof hot heat fire baking kinde heate thereof strengthened accidentall heate fire also wheate hath propertie nourisheth better greines likenesse man complection saieth also wheate drinesse cleanseth wasteth therefore iuyce meale therof cleanseth pourgeth breast lunge doth tisanum made wheate tisanum made barly clenseth tisanum made barly helpeth cough bloudye flixe also wheate sodde oyle laide vpon hard postume dissolueth also wheate soo iuyce rue dissolueth softneth running kurding milke breast teafes balmed therewith also wheate tempered iuyce henbane layed sinewes letteth euill humour shal fall downward also grems wheate chewed helpeth biting wood hound draweth venime saith also wheat made oyle helpeth manie thing namely itching seads wet drye shingle welt froted rough cloath done vertue oyle shoulde better enter also bran wheate dryeth cleanseth doth meale thereof bran norisheth little el right nought also sayth wheate fresh new nourisheth little little quench heat harden binde wombe vino cap wine called vinum wer growing vine else hath name vena veine drink wine filleth soone veines full bloud isidore sayth libro treateth drinke strong wine called temetum holdeth wit maketh oft amisse wine called merum pure medled water called bacchus hath name liber pater called bacchus also sayde bacchus found first wine el wine hath name bacchus working strength selfe maketh drink therof madde wit eese madly men worthynesse praising wine might bacchus himselfe describe full though aliue among lycours iuyce tree wine beareth price passing licours wine moderatly monkes comforteth body gladdeth healeth saueth wound thereof speaketh isaac dietis sayeth wine giueth good nourishing body restoreth health sweep comforteth increaseth kinde heate passing meate drinke likenesse companye wine hath kinde wine breedeth pure bloud pursueth cleanseth traubly thicke bloud openeth cleanseth smuth veines commeth inward subtiltie cleanse purge inner partes lyghtneth driueth away darke uma ie breedeth gendereth cleingnesse discomfort strengtheneth member body giueth might strength deede working soule sheweth declareth goodnesse wine wine breedeth soule forgetting auguish sorrowe oo suffereth soule feele anguish woe wine sharpneth wit maketh cunning inquire thinges harde subtill maketh soule bolde hardye passing nobilitie wine knowen vse wine accordeth men age time countryes bee taken due manner disposition asketh drinketh also wine accordeth olde men heat wine contrary coldnesse also wine accordeth young men meate kinde wine like kinde age young men meate medicine younglings child nourisheth helpeth heate yet vnperfect consumeth wasteth dryeth superfluitye moysture child strong wine cleane pure accordeth colde co winter summer hot countryes small wine well medled good profitable moistneth cooleth body medling matter sayde commeth full soone innermost member subtilty wine therefore men olde time called wine greate triacle found wine helpeth ries heateth colde body hot body moisteth dry body h teth dryeth moyst bodye also heate drynesse thereof ly moisture colde thereof accidentall subtiltie thereof beareth water member needeth cooled moysted sayth wine take heed thing licour coulour sauour smell bee substaunce lycour wine subtiltie cleernesse knowen earthynesse thicknesse ly wine subtilt cleere thinne white cleere accordeth stomack soone defied areeth thirleth commeth veines purreth norgrieuesh wit neither grieueth sinewes neither braine great wine earth contrary subtilt wine grieueth ye stomacke pearceth slowly colour wine bee foure manner white blacke u ane red white black bee lesse hot wine white wine moist black cleerenesse watrynesse hath mastrye therin blacke wine drye thickenesse earthinesse hath substantial ye mastrye therein wine meane colour hotter wine citrine golden coulour red wine h te white wine blacke farther white blacke farther white wine blacke neerer coulour white black lesse hotter vino rubeo cap red wine full redde bloud strong ic eth much head noteth wit maketh strong drunkennesse needeth therefore right well watred watred nedeth dronken needeth watred accordeth seemely age time country vsage full good dissolueth tempereth thicke humour cleanseth wayes veines matter rottennesse puristeth bloud namely purenesse cleannesse accordeth therefore olde men comforteth heartes dissolueth tempereth many colde humour gathered body old men red wine needeth haue biting sauour sweete needeth licour meane betweene thin thicke odour smell meane betweene strong softs wine temperate nourishing seeding turneth soone bloud lykenesse hath bloud licour sauour coulour sweete wine full red helpeth right necessary cleanse purge disease breast likewise lung tempereth full lightly cleanseth wipeth putteth away vncleannesse gleanious humour aud take deede dilligently good odour smelling wine manifesteth sheweth openly betokeneth licour cleere temperate cleane filth maketh best digestion gendereth therfore cleane bloud cleere comforteth gladdeth heart putteth thicke smoak darke troubly ipocra saith wine good smell subtill cleere light sooner defied nourisheth better kinde sheweth betokeneth working therein compleate profitable wine without good smell sheweth venteous thicke therefore lesse worth nourishing clarifieth bloud comfortheth breedeth gendereth great humoures thicken troubly imbake darke aud wine strong odour smell sowre sauour grieneth body gendereth worst bloud giueth body noyful nourishing namely wine full blacke perteineth belongeth thicknesse licour heauynesse smell sowrenesse sauour also wine temperate ye foresaid quality dronke temperatly one manner helpeth kind gendereth good bloud maketh sauour meate drinke exciteth desire appetite comforteth vertue life kinde helpeth stomacke haue appetite haue make good digestion exciseth vertue putting poure drasts quencheth thirst chaungeth passion soule thought euill good tourneth soule cruelnesse mildnes couetousnesse largenesse pride meekenesse dread boldnesse shortly speak wine dronke measurably health body soule huc v que isaac dietis plinius li ca said kind wine drinking clawes steede sword beast default superfluitie small beast lacke sharpe teeth clawes horne defended ablenesse member swiftnesse fligh faceth hare fawnes also euery beast ye gendreth another beast hath hole poores bee flyes beast glide ground euerye foure footed beast hath bloud hath marrow namely man hath much marrow co parison body needfull man many diuers workes dooings euery beast yt hath horn
