horne except harte unicorne euery horned beast foure footed material hard horne except manner serpent region aegypt found horned many call serpent serastes heere speak beast haue horne kinde bone snayles haue certaine horne softe gleymie properly horne thing giuen snayles helpe succour snailes feeble sight grope seeke wayes horn snayle meeteth hard thing anone draweth horne additioat ende horne appeareth blacke like sight eye wherewithall seemeth haue sight closeth himselfe within shelles hee vseth shelles steede house castle also beast haue teeth either iaw haue onely nether iaw haue teeth ouer iaw horned matter passeth turneth horne beast hath crooked feeth tuskes ye bore hath horne matter passeth turneth turkes tuskes horne accord beast beast praye haue teeth departed sharpe may better enter come praye bite thereof gobbet peeces wolues lyon tame beast cowe beast made tame elephant camell haue teeth lyke high nigh togethers one bone may better eate grasse hearbes bite euen nigh ground beast hath rowes teethe mouth twayne except certaine fish haue great teeth iawes set farre asunder teeth sawe haue also teeth set within inner gather holde meate least water shoulde wash soone mouthes fareth water wolues luties manye aristotle sayth sayd inde beast wonderfully shapen lyke beare body hairethe beast called hanthi looke letter h following beast discription man face hath right red head full great mouth horrible either iawe three rowes teeth distinguished asunder vtter limmes thereof vtter syins lyon tayle lyke scorpion sting smiteth hard bristle prickes wilde swine hath horrible voyce voies trumpe runneth full swiftly eateth men among beast earth none found cruell wonderfully shapen auicen saith beast called baricus greeke saith also libro cap plinius saith writeth fareth among medes beast wicked euill tasteth hath three rowes teeth set rowe togethers lyke are face hath ye like lion scorpion tayle stingeth bristle prickes hath voyce lyke voyce man marrsingeth pipe trumpe seemeth beast voyce accordeth trumpe tune melodie beast auicen plinius speake also euerye beast gendreth getteth beast hath two reynes bladder beast lay egges haue neither bladder neither reynes bird soules superfluitie moysture passeth fethers clawes fish shelles scale therefore needeth instrument receiue superfluitie moysture also euery beast hath horne teeth aboue cheweth cudde hath many wombes full great another lesse one long another wide many manner digestion cause whereof beast hath manye wombes meate drye right well chewed beginning beast feedeth hast eating cause meate swallowed needeth chewed againe meate drawen ye wombe ye mouth beast doth chewe againe meate chewed sent second wombe maye digested chew called ruminate auicen saith ruminate chew cud also libro cap auicen sayth manner saye beast tallowe hath fatte braine beast hath tallowe hath vnctuous marrough euerye beast bretheth hath lung fish haue braunches whereby drawe put water ayre euery beast hath bloud hath hart liuer beast without bloud haue heart haue somewhat el seede heart feare well life also beastes gender haue gall preuely hid hart horse mule openly knowen seene onelye dolphin wanteth gall though gendreth bretheth beast lay egges haue gall great small fish serpent also saith euerye beast hath bloud hath semen euerie beast without bloud gendreth another hath fiue wit except mouse eyen healed couered hath blacke eye vnder skinne beast wayes wit feelyng bee preuye bee hidde eares nosethrills fish heare well knowen flye voyd flushing noyse smell well also el would come net milke flesh rosted flesh rosted crab come willowes pitch therefore aristotle saith auicen meaneth dolphin manner fish fall bottome sodainly epilencia heare sodaine thundering great mouing noyse taken dronke fish flyeth voydeth place washing slaughter fish bloud fish flye voyd also hoarie uncleane net come glably new beastes crimping body haue sharpe wit feeling though priuie hid bee ante heare smell farre haue liking certaine odor smell dye odour brimstone burnt leather burnt harfes horne bee abide place euill smell rest place good smell sweetnesse sayth also hee sayth beast diuers manner voyce crieng haue strong voyce sharpe feeble lowe lytle voyce none onely beast haue wosen voyce lung breath haue voyce breatheth maketh somtime noyse sometime hissing beastes haue voyce make tune melodie crye chitter sing namely time gendering loue knowe owne voyce call pray loue also saieth beast hath bloud goeth waketh sleepeth euerye beast hath eye lyddes closeth sleepeth euery beast layeth egges maketh small sleepe also euery beast needeth meate norishing according complection right needfull necessary sustenaunce wexing beast restoring thing lost kindly heate receiving taking meat drinke great difference going beastes complete euen lyppes drinketh sucking man horse cowe mule beastes vneuen lyppes neather lippe shorter ouer drinke lapping hound cat disposition eyennesse vneuennesse lippes beast drinking sucke lappe therefore kinde ordayneth wisely hound lapping beast tender tongue long plyaunt tongue able licke holde water bring mouth many foure footed beastes drinke seldome lonyes hare meate beast right moyst moisture sufficeth steede drinke bring meate member coole kinde heate beast full hot drye either complection accidentall heate drinesse vse drye meate hotte neede therefore drinke foresaid thing doings cause culuers bird rauenners drink eate corne graines meate fatte hot drye fowles bird prane vse moyst meate indeed drinke therefore seldome drink token sicknesse vnkind heat hath passing masterie auicen aristotle meane auicen meaneth beast little bodyes slye hardie wittie beastes great bodyes fareth spider bee ante workes slighe subtill man wit may comprise doe workes kinde rewardeth sleight wit seemeth withdrawen might strength saith also li de mirabilibus mundi circa finem solinus saith euery beast crooked teeth sawe glutton fighteth fareth hound panther lyon beares female beast bring forth youg vnperfect vncomplete bitche bringeth forth blinde whelpes female bear bringeth forth lumpe flesh deuided shape member keepeth lumpe hot vnder hir armes pit den sitteth hir egges female beare licketh lumpe flesh shapeth vntill receiue perfect figure shape beare also panther lion bringeth forth whelp complete perfectly shapen euery beast bringeth foorth many young loueth best first accounteth kindly hir owne therefore beast eate deuoure owne broode except first swine doe oftentimes also sayth beast bring young foorth vncomplete vnperfect cause gluttonie kinde would abide vntill complete perfect whelpes would slaye damme sucking immoderate ouer passing appetite therefore beast kinde swift bring foorth soone make soone dye least shoulde grieue damme sore beastes brought foorth manner fight meate food auicen saith hate therfore kinde hath ordayned remedie sane kinde beast ordaineth beastes may bring foorthe manye young happen many dead lost sighting kinde maye bee saued many therefore female wolfe whelpeth manye whelpes bitche doeth idder called vipera hath twentie young sayth increase vipera bet many aliue wombe desire nourishing sucke much drawe humour much damme sufficeth sustaine many hir wombe therefore sayleth dyeth ere may bring foorth hir kinde full also aristotle auicen say beast teeth ioyned togethers blunt haue increase beast teeth departed farre sunder sharpe set many chinnes haue many young much semen beast little body gender beast great bodyes beastes gender little haue kinde haue teates diuersly set diuers place therefore bitch hath many teates sowe also beast haue many young also beast vse superfluitie continuance seruice venus haue much shorter life beast serue venus temperately seldem therefore gelded men lyue longer sinewes cut semen shoulde come downward effect working generation also libro de spermate galen also constantine tell cause reason thereof auicen libro de animalibus affirmeth sayeth sperma gendered commeth good bloud ful digested bloud readie turne passe nourishing membes therefore man sheddeth humour seminall man greatly discoloured body feebled though bled fortie time much sperma thing able made readye passe nourishing member therefore sperma passeth bodie kinde feeding nourishing member taken withdrawen thereof great losse spirites vertue bodye beast immoderate ofte gendering cause spoyling vndoing body lyfe shortened therefore elephant lyueth longest fsor hee loueth chastitie vseth lecherie seldome huc vsque wilde beastes contrary man complection great heate adder tyrus serpent el great cold spider scorpion vnlyke man kinde contrary neither poyson irthins hare fore beast flesh heauie smell suche beastes commeth worst nourishing man body wilde beast hot drye leane tame beast continuall mouing heate ayre also drinesse meate nourishing therefore flesh hard harder digest knowen slaine theyr flesh rotteth soone flesh tame beast therefore flesh wilde beastes lesse sauoury norisheth lesse flesh tame beast except flesh wilde roe much sauorie better nourishing body made softe mouing humour made small thin pore opened humour cause heauie smell dissolued amended mouing trauaile accidentally made sauourie suche running mouing theyr kinde coldnesse tempered therefore wild beast run trauaile much heauie haue gleymie great flesh great eating corrupt meate therefore theyr flesh hard nourishing dissolueth slowly stomacke liuer hippocrates saieth know goodnesse kinde beastes touching nourishing feeding sooner digested great rest ease pore closed thicke humour tempered heat closed within flesh softeneth tendereth eate drinke much superfluitie humour increaseth soone fatnesse increased therefore bodyes beastes much nourishing sauoury passeth soone member veynes multitude gleaminesse moysture flesh rotteth soone gendereth superfluitie humour though feede kindly much yet passing moysture soone dissolued passeth member accidentally nourisheth body lesse flesh wilde beast though ye flesh wilde beast nourisheth little yet hard dissolue slow abideth longer member incorporate therefore men olde time sayd norisheth member accidentally also manner kinde beastes male hot lesse moist female therefore flesh male beast subtill better feeding flesh female except goat flesh better female male female passeth age sucking goodnesse milke female tempereth kinde drinesse therof gelded beastes meane betweene complection male female flesh gelded beast heateth lesse doth flesh male flesh female digested drye female much better male vnperfect age perfect age saith also goodnesse beastes varieth diuersitie age beast nigh age seeking great moysture gleyminesse also sledernesse therefore flesh gendreth substaunciall moysture full nigh wasted therefore flesh full hard good digest namely beast drye complection generall among beast fowles grow wexe theyr flesh better meate better feeding passeth letteth digestion fleeteth meate maketh meate swell softeneth roughnesse stomacke causeth stomacke bee sudder gleymie therefore great fatnes dissolueth moyst stomack reason failing vertue contentiue comfortatiue expulsiue kindleth heateth soone hot stomacke fire ofte kindeled without fatnesse therefore men olde time bad commaunded fat beast onely red flesh shuld eaten fatnesse done awaye leane beaste sinewie tough haue lyttle bloud lyttle moysture giueth therefore lyttle norishing mann bodye beastes meane betweene sat leane profitable haue much fatnesse kindle heate stomacke make roughnesse braine percase euery beast braine aristotle sayth openly libro de proprietatibus elementorum therefore many wex sicke one part month yeare ye another time knowen whole sound cleane sicknesse contrary time fareth lunaticke men mad men caduc men haue falling euill heereof seek cap de luna auicen speaketh ape saieth ape glad sory chaunging time namely course moone also season beast wex leane though haue neuer much meate wexe fat sleeping contrary time auicen saith sayth glyres manner kinde mouse moueth winter lye dead eateth wexe fat sleeping wake summer time moue themselues heate sunne telleth wonderfully swallowes foules found dead hollow tree winter time quickeneth waketh sleeping made strong shew themselues strong swifte summer time female beare hath conceiued hideth hir selfe long time therefore made flyes louse lyon tygers beares made man may first know owne infirmitie afeard second haue succour callyng god name also beast made releeue helpe neede many maner infirmityes mankinde ye flesh ye adder vipera make triacle gall bull beast fowles awaye dimnesse eyen adder skin sod oyle abateth ache eares wonderfull manner dioscorides sayth libro aesculapij de occultis membrorum virtutibus sayd hath emoroides sitteth lyon skinnes emoroydes shall passe away wolues flye annoynted lyon dirte also saith yt tayle old woolfe hanged cowes stall ye wolues come nigh also dioscorides saith beares eyen taken head bounde together vnder right arme man abateth feauer quartains also long teeth woolfe healeth lunaticke men hee saith sayth pythagoras plinius also telleth tame foure footed beast dread flye see wolues eye taken head libro viatico constantine saieth haire white hound without blacke speck helpeth haue falling euill keepeth falling haire hanged necke thing saith phythagoras lib romanorum saith ring made hoofe white asse hath blacke speckes hath falling euill beare weare ring ring keepeth falling also saith gall bull anoynted vnder nauell laxeth softeneth wombe also saith teeth serpent ought taken head serpent lyue hanged hath feuer quartane tooth destroyeth quartane thou besmoakest house lung asse thou cleansest house serpent creeping wormes plin saith vertues property many wonderfull hidde lims member beast shall saide heereafter kinde property perticular beast nothing body beast without medicine open hid skin haire horne naile clawes flesh bloud without remedie onely dirte pde animalibus spciali cap kindes property beast shewed generall helpe grace sent aboue following purpose shall intreate vertues propertyes beastes creeping wormes prince sheepe therefore kinde giueth great strength passing sheepe seemly ram duke defender sheepe strong mightie sheepe therefore isi saith ram called veruex hath name vires strength man male maister sheepe vertuous stronger isidore saith nowne veruex commeth vermis worme ramme hath worme head fretting worme itching ramme excited pusheth full strongly smiteth full harde meeteth therefore ram called aries also hath name are greek vnderstanding vertue flockes male called arietes vertuous mightie get gender lambes passe sheepe greatnes body might strength vertue also name aries commeth aris altar isidore saith beast first offred altar among nation ramme called aries slaine aaron altar moses law ramme principally cleane beast sacrifice meate offered couenably sinne people cloue footed cheweth cud eaten indifferently people isidore sayth libro sheepe called sometime bidentes among eight teethe commonly haue two teeth higher therefore natious offered principally sacrifice god sayth libro capitulo plinius speaketh singularlye ramme sayth kinde ramme iustines youth noye lambes followe eawes come farre tractiue profitable age neuerthelesse hee ceuell heart ewe cruelnesse abateth horne bee pearced igh eare righte gendring staue bound gendreth female lesse bounde hee gendreth male gendreth male northerne winde female southerne winde ram haue black veynes vnder tougs lambes gender colour veynes black vnder touge lambe shall blacke white lambes ere white speckeled th lambes arist auicen meaneth looke within de oue ram hath full harde forhead nigh horne feeble temple somewhat gristly therefore defence keeping feeble parte kinde giueth great horne right hard feeble place temple crooked bended round shell somwhat sharp endes insomuch maye defend head sharpnesse hardnesse horne withstand enimies fighteth sharpnesse horne saith seemly kinde leaue defendour flocke without weapon defence therefore kinde giueth two horne bent circle defend succour owne head feeble selfe bolde hardie aduersaries enimyes trust weapon hee strengthened defended therefore goeth boldly slocke beareth head pitcheth downe foote treadeth strongly ground cloue footed lee thicke long haire lock defendeth himselfe miuries hot aire colde strong thicke fell skinne therefore one side ram skinne reason strength thereof suffereth sustaineth violent craftes currier parchment maker passing fell skinnes sheepe able receiue hold printing painting diuers colour sayth time loue ram fighteth eawes reeseth horne aduersaries push enemie harder draweth backwarde reeseth leapeth vpward smiteth fiercenesse busheth kinde violence li auicen speaketh rammes saith ram goates buck goe much rain hide themselues winter colde goe sometime hot place colde raineth flye raine vntill dead ram kind follow goate buck rest till heard take one make goe follow soone dread kindly thunder sheepe sheepe lambe heareth thunder casteth hir lamb dread standeth feare sleepe sheepe midnight part chaunge turne side side sleeping springing time haruest sleepe one side vnto springing time sleepe side hold vp head sleepe except sicke chew cud sleeping doe waking happen stray go away come againe hearde bringeth againe isaac dietis saith ram youth bee lesse moyst gleymie sucking lambes age hath mastery ouer complection therefore theyr flesh better flesh lamb eawes gendereth better bloud namely gelded theyr heate tempered accidentall moisture flesh good sauour passe age full olde age fayle heate gelded gelded passe great age heate faileth double cause lacke gendring stone also age therefore body lambes yened springing time haruest time winter yened springing time huge great body strongger bodye yened haruest winter country land many men set winter lambes afore lambes springing time meane onely beast profitably yened winter time plin saith li ca ther said lambes conceiued northerne winde better conceiued southern wind male gendered conceiued lambes haue coulour flesh wooll ramme eaw haue colour veines ye tonge veynes white lambes white veynes blacke lambes blacke bee speckeled lambes speckeled sucking time lambe bendeth knee dam giue milke thrnsteth pusheth dder dam beseecheth dam bleating sawneth taile hath found dam beareth vp head sucketh neuer first areareth vp head hath small wooll crispe manye maner wise folded selfe cold grieueth lambes namely raine wether glad ioyfull company folke cleing forie dreadeth full sore alone lamb hoppeth leapeth flock plaieth dreadeth ful sore seeth woolfe flyeth sodainlye away anone astonied dread stinteth sodaynly dare flye farther prayeth spared bleating simple cheere taken enemie also butcher bind fast defendeth teeth neyther horne spoyled either fell skinne still innocent harmlesse beast whether lead pasture death hee grudgeth prauncheth obedient meeke plinius sayeth perill leaue lambes alone die soone ther fal strog thunder lambe hath kindly feeble head therefore remedy bring together leite goe together may bolder companye hardy agno anniculo ca agnus anniculus lambe full age one yeere within space one yere better ye farther fro sucking moisture complection increaseth weaning departing milke superfluitie moisture tempered namely yet gelded said openly dietis lamb twelue moneths olde found body cleane flesh able sacrifice meat though speckled flesh wooll speckle flesh reproueth lambe putteth sacrifice stinch corruption flesh skin within glose saith super exod super malac hierome saith super leuiti speck diuersitie speckled flesh letteth sacrifice bodie whole sound without scab skinne plinius saith libro cap lamb yeere old able according alters god vse flesh vse flesh lamb needfull mankind therfore body neat kept profit mankinde needeth haue businesse keeping lambes sheepe diosco saith lambe hath blacke durt shall dissolued tempered vineger made plaister cleanseth away blacke speckes red body helpeth euill men call fire helpeth saueth burning scalding meddeled waxe oyle agna chap female lambe called agna rammes daughter lesse bodye moyst male lambe female complection sayde dietis flesh thereof sucketh glemy supersluitie moystnre commeth age complection hath mastrye bodye therefore gendered flesh thereof fleamatike gleamie hard defie vnneth passing member dested glewie gleamie humour gendered thereof passeth soone downe stomacke slippernesse humour isaac sayth flesh thereof better rosted sod superfluitie thereof moisture consumed wasted strength vertue greate fire female lambes bee simple fearefull male female hath lesser kinde heate male bee cause without horne horne superfluitie female lamb defalt boldnesse hardynesse knowe doe therewith auicen sayth also libro aristotle sayeth lambes haue euill bee fat reines tallowe couereth reines dye tallowe increaseth good pasture therefore lambes put pasture lest waxe fat look within de oue additiosheepe lambes haue also disease ret happeneth change drie laire brought fennie marsh groundes subiect tike come want pasture cough maggets alce kinde deare called aethiopian bull report alce hath ioynts leggesaddition therefore doth neuer lye leane tree find report gesner truth conlour like fallow deare short broad horned beast right elcke whose hide best buffe made doublet breech translated bible english appeareth chapter deu among cleane beast elcke named chaimois camois hebrue called zamer muscouites call lozzos haue vsed one name another farther knowledge gesner folio breed hircania coutry asia apro chap bore chasit ye hebruethe boare called aper swine liueth woodes flelds cruell milde isidore sayth called aper affer fiercenesse body fierce cruell among ye greek boare commonly called fiagres vnderstand fierce cruell called among latines vetres hath greate might strength sayd plinius auicen meane boare fierce beast cruell vnneth hee tamed made milde though hee gelded though beast mild time gelded also bore fierce beast also cruell fiercenesse cruelnesse hee despiseth setteth naught death reeseth full pitcously point yt speare hunter though smitten sticked speare bodye yet great ire cruelnesse heart hee hath reeseth enimy taketh comfort heart strength worke himselfe aduersarye tuskes putteth himselfe perill death wonderous fiercenesse weapon enimy hath mouth two crooked tuskes right strong sharp breaketh renteth cruellye hee withstandeth vseth tuskes steed swoord hath hard sheld broad thicke right side putteth alway weapon pursueth vseth brawne steed sheeld defend himselfe spieth perill shoulde befall hee whetteth tusk froteth tree assaieth froting tree point tuskes blont feele blont seeketh hearb called origanum gnaweth cheweth cleanseth comforteth rootes teeth therewith vertue therof auicen saith li ca plinius sayeth vrine boare medicine euills ye eares meddeled oyle rose also gall helpeth stone sayde libro cap vrine heauye himselfe hee may arise hee pisse holden downe though hee dead sayde vrine burneth palso sayth gall boare exciteth gendring also saith lib field swine lencth well root wroteth diggeth earth wroteth vp rootes cutteth tusk waxeth fat hath rested seuen day namely drinke little boare fighteth woulfe hateth kinde ye woulfe lieth waite pig stealeth full oft therefore saith lib decimo quarto kind giueth boare tuskes desende female pigges female feeble themselues male worse complection male bolde mightye female female fierce whe wroth grieueth hurteth digging froting biting renting teeth tuskes boare hurteth tusk striking vpward yt cause may hurt lieth ground female grieueth little stand boare wroth fretteth soameth mouth doth gendereth female plinius rehearseth foresayd thing saith thereto lib cap sayth egedius sayeth boares swine bee farrowed toothed also boares sharpe fierce loue bite cruellye sowes dig cratch earth theyr clawes set vp bristle whet tuskes smite therewith shew woodnesse brest horrible groning grunting eate little goe runne female therfore right leane boares goe valley darke dwell woodes keepe theyr child liue rootes fruit wild tree espie saute hunter reeses wolues go young maye flye put perill theyr young harden theyr sheeldes froating tree shal fight wrap durt drie themselues sunne make durt hard fast among haire may surely beare susteine stroke enimies fighting libro aristotle sayeth female sowes boares haue farrowed bee full sharpe cruell rent come nigh young cruell biting huc vsque plinius isaac sayth boares flesh harde drye cold tame porke continuall moouing drye meate drye ayre hot ayre alwaye within grease fat harde flesh lyking eating therfore tame bore strongly chased tied also beaten slaine theyr flesh may tender sauoury strong moouing dioscorides speaketh boare sayth durt dronk wine water singular remedye cast bloud helpeth sore side medled vineger souoreth strengthneth broken bone looke within de porco asino chap asse called asinus hath name sedendo sitting beast sit vpon men sate rode vppon ass vsed horse ride vpon isidore saith libro simple beast slow therfore soone ouercome subiect man seruice else name asinus commeth hauing synos yt wit beast without wit asinus commeth asellus lyttle young asse fayre shape disposition young tender passe age elder asse fouler waxeth day daye hairie rough melancholyke beast cold drye therefore kindlye heauie slow vnlustie dull witlesse forgetfull neuerthelesse beareth burden may away trauaile thraldome vseth vile meat little gathereth meate among brier thornes thistle therefore auicen saith libro aristotle sayeth also small bird nestleth bush thornes brier hate asse therefore small sparrowes fighteth asse asse eateth thornes ye sparowes make theyr neasts also asse rubbeth froieth flesh thorn bird egges sparowes falleth ye neast ground asse reareth heaueth vp head strong blast thornes mooueth shaketh great noyse birdes afearde full sore falleth neast therfore breed bird suffereth leap face asse bite smite reese eyen billes asse haue wouude scab ridge side pricking thornes wise sparows leapeth asse pecketh bill wound sore asse passe fro neasts though sparow full lyttle yet vnneth may asse defend himselfe reese pricking biting aristotle sayeth doth auicen also ranen hateth full much asse therefore rauen flyeth aboue asse laboureth bill peck eyen deepnes eien helpeth asse thicknes hardnes skin therewith asse closeth eyen healeth sight defendeth reesing pricking foules also long eares moouing thereof helpeth therewith hee fearesh smal bird reese peck eyen also libro aristotle sayeth beare fighteth asse bull eateth rawe flesh cause fighteth desireth eate flesh libro cap vit plinius speaketh asse sayth smoak ass hoofe helpeth birth childe insomuch bringeth dead childe shall otherwise layde slayeth quicke childe bee oft layde lyeth long time new dirt beast stauncheth bloud wonderfullye lyuer holpeth falling euill child libro cap plinius sayeth ass milke ass bloud helpeth biting scorpion men saye yt man looketh ass eare smit scorpion anone mallice passeth also venimous thinges flieth smoake ass liuer also eodem cap said ass milk helpeth venimous plaister mallice seruse quicke siluer also li ass bone brused stamped sad helpeth agaynst venimme broath therof dronken vrine male asse nardus keepeth saueth maketh much haire libro cap plinius sayeth asse beast maye worst awaye colde breedeth therefore colde countryes land breedeth pontus therefore ari saith though asse full colde dry yet ful lecherous moued gendring ere moneths olde though due worke gendering yet gendereth broode ere hee full three yeere olde plinius sayth birth asse idlenesse moneths lawfull profitable three yeare also aristotle saith li plinius saith thereto asse foaleth selde two coltes female shall foale flyeth light seeketh darke place seene loueth foale much passeth fire come foale ye asse breadeth full sore passe ouer water scrapeth therein compelled must needes passe ouer water riuer wadeth therein pisseth therein asse passeth gladlye may see water plankes hath feeble braine soone grudged dreadeth therefore falleth chinnes bridge water seeth running vnder asse drinketh gladly small well vsed may come drie footed wonder tell yt though asse sore thirst water bee changed vnneth drinketh thereof like water wont drinke plinius li cap sayth female asse eateth barlye wet menstruall bloud manye graines shee eateth wet many yeres afterward shall conceiue mule gendered betweene asse mare gendering mare chosen passe age foure yeare ten yeare gender alwaye either beast two manner kind one gendered betweene horse asse betweene asse mare one kinde withdraweth ye fed together youth one manner milke therefore said heardes desire haue mule burdones gendered diuers kindes beast vse crafte bring forth young coltes mare set darkenesse teates ass feede ass milke horse colt age bee mooued time gendering gender ass also lykewise ass coltes set sucke teates mare fed mare milke colt gender mare age gendering betweene asse mare commeth beast called ninnulus olde time tall beast gendered burdus call beast gendered betweene asse mare mule libro aristotle sayeth asse gendereth mare full fat conception mare corrupted coldnesse semen asse semen asse cold kinde matter matter mare hot therfore whe hot meddeled colde meddeling tempered therof may come conception colt may saued yt gendered betweene horse female asse also likewise colt yt gendered betweene horse mare hee asse mare mule gendereth colde naturall complection horse asse hath mastrye mule therefore mule gendereth another beast hee saith also saith yt asse gendereth asse afterwarde hee maketh cast colt cause therof auicen saith coldnesse semen asse cometh corrupteth destroyeth temperatnesse first semen semen asse cold complection brought temperatnesse kind heat ye male horse semen female asse yt colde kind complection coldnes ye kinde female strength therofthe first temperatnesse commeth ye hot semen horse colde semen asse cause euery female mule barren auicen saith male asse yt father mule passing cold complection mare mother yt hot heat horse kind therfore though heat semen mother mare tempereth cold semen asse beast may bee gendered yet beast yt gendered coldnesse father mother abideth hath mastry therein disposeth kindly barrennesse manner asse called indicus asinus onager ye vnicorne writer assume hath horne middle ye forehead whole footed foure euerye beast hath two horne cloue footed therefore asse indicus hath horne cloue footed aristotle saith lib euerye cloaue footed beast hath horne againeward horned cloue footed fareth bul sheepe hart aristotle sayth libro aristotle sayth asse mule horse eateth fruit hearbes grasse fatted water loue thick water cleere cow loueth better cleere water thicke also lib codem aristotle sayth part ass waxe sick one manner sicknesse called milide sicknesse first head hot fleame runneth noseand falleth lung asse dieth beast flyeth colde beast found country north ioynts ridge boane strong asse stronger bound sinewes behind reines therfore ass beare heauy burthen behinde reines shoulder euennesse day night springing time asse mooued lethery roreth exciteth female loue dreadfull roring stron draweth breath winde bringeth odour smell female nose drawing thereof desire lerherye burneth plinius saith asse hath another wretched condition knowen nigh men put trauaile ouer night beaten staues sticked pricked prickes mouth wrong bernacle lead hether thether withdrawne leese pasture way oft refraining bernacle dyeth last vaine trauailes hath reward death seruice trauaile liuing much owne skinne left taken awaye carren throwen without sepulture burialls much carren eating deuouring somtime buried wombes houndes wolues angue chap kinde serpentes adder kinde may wrappe folde owne body called anguis hath name hath many corner angle folding goeth neuer straight isidore sayth libro anguis called serpens creepeth priuy pace creepeth wt smal pace yt hid folding sliding withdrawing scale accounted among creeping wormes additio whereof came prouerb anguis latit herba snake vnder leaues wrath ye hart creepeth brest womb isi saith li called also colluber either dwelleth shadowe glideth slipper bending wrinklings draught adder slideth held adder many manner kind many kind many manner venim many speces many manner malice many manner sore ache colour isid saith li adder diuerse quantitie diuers mallice venim adder great huge plin saith li cap magellenes writeth inde great adder yt swallow vp hart bull wholea dragon punico bello battell besides riuer bragada bragada riuer neere vtica afirike regulus cosul emperor regulus ye emperour slew adder wt arbalastes tormets yt adder hundred twentie foote long skin cheeke bone therof hang temple rome dured vntill battaile numantinum also claudeus caesar time italy serpent slaine wombe whole child found adder grieueth nowe biting blowing smiting ye taile stinging looking sight adder small bodye greate might grieuing serpent dipsas isidore saith little vneth seene men tread thereon venim thereof slaieth felt dieth venim feeleth sore poet lucan sayth signiferum iuuenem tureni sanguinis album torta caput retro dipsas calcata remordit vix dolor aut sensus dentis fuit c dispas serpent wrast owne white head backward bit young baneret turenis bloud vnneth felt biting sore sayth isidore also tirus least adder yet aristotle saith lib vnneth remedie found biting also serpentes adder diuerse disposition figure shape haue two head adder amphisibena isidore speaketh libro sayth amphisibena hath name hath two head one one ende another ende runneth glideth wrigleth wrinkle corcels draught body either head among serpent onelye serpent putteth himselfe cold putteth himselfe goeth also lib cap plinius sayth sayth amphisibena hath double head though one mouth little cast venimme also serpent haue many head doubled trebled quatrebled isidore sayth idra serpent many head one seene marreys prouince archadia sayde one head smit three growe againebut fable perfectly knowen idra place casted vp water wasted destroyed citie nigh idra head ye streame stopped many head streames break hercules seeing burned ye place stopped wayes water therefore said hercules kill idra serpent fiue heades isidore sayth libro also serpent varie diuerse coulours blacke redde serpent tyrus bee worst speckled serpent scytale shineth diuersitie speckle looketh thereon wonder speckle hath lyking looke thereon slow creeping wonder diuersitie speckle catcheth yt maye followe going creeping diuers coulours speckle worse venime venime accounted sharpe hot serpent hot feruent winter time skinnes hath chaunged feruent hot bee body heereof lucanus speaketh sayth et scytale sparsis etiam nunc sola pruinis exuujas positura suas frost nigh serpent changeth skinne isid saith c also ophites serpent painted diuers speckle hath many manner wise noy greene hath diuerse colour distinct heereof speaketh lucanus saith manner serpent ophites hath many manner burning greeuings hath speckle coulours painted burning speckle also serpent diuerse diuersitie steede place lurke den earth sicketh pouder dust sucketh humour ground plinius saith water adder dwell brimmes water serpent enidris water adder smitten adder hee swelleth dropsie many men call boua durt ore remedy therefore isido sayth lib also natrix adder hath name infecteth venim well commeth nigh lucanus sayth saith natrix insecteth water isidore sayth libro serpent dwell wood den shadowye plate hunt small birdes beastes sucke moisture thereof aristotle sayth libro serpent adder lye awaite sleepe find mouth open beast creepe loue heate humour finde adder little beast fighteth called saura litle euete men meane lyzard beast saura ware serpent present leapeth vpon face ye sleepeth cratcheth foot wake warne serpent auicen saieth little beast saura isidore saith libr eute waxeth olde eien waxeth blind hee goeth hole wall east openeth eyen afterwarde sun risen eien heateth taketh light manner serpent dwell fire fareth salamandra yt isidore plinius account among venimous beastes salamandra hath name isidore saith libro strong mightie burning among venimous beast might venime venimous beast n yeth one one noyeth slayeth many creepe tree infecteth ye apple slayeth eate therof falleth pit slayeth drinke water venim beast contrary burning among beast onely beast quencheth fire lieth burning fire wtout consumption wasting also smarting ach burneth fire abateth swageth burning thereof isidore sayth plinius accordeth therewith point libro cap saith salamandra like ewte shape neuer seene much raine falleth faire wether touch colde quencheth fire ise doth casteth mouth white matter touching wherof man body leeseth haire touched therewith chaungeth tourneth foulest coulour also bee diuerse manner going passing creep glide awaye wiggeling crookedly alway stretch goe forth right isidore sayth libro bee sayth cenchris serpent bendeth neither wiggeleth holdeth alway right foorth lucanus sayeth serpent eateth gladlye flesh sucketh gladly moisture therof spinner sucketh flyes serpent swalloweth egges bird bird liue haue swallowed bring hinder end putteth suffereth abide wombe also libro aristotle sayeth gut serpent lyke gut foure footed beastes laye egges haue gendering stone haue wayes fish haue mother long diuided theyr bowelles gut bee long length body tongue serpent blacke long thin clouen twaine sharpe moue farre therefore moue easily wombe serpent long straight lyke large gut gut lykened hoands gut hath womb lyttle gut stretcheth vnto passing superfluitie hath lyttle heart nigh vnto neck like kidney sight heart lung subtill partes sinewie krindled hangeth downward heart long liuer long straight therevpon gall flesh lesse gall vppon gut serpent splene little rounde teeth deale sharpe crooked ioyned together bee departed teeth sawe serpent hath thirtie ribbes number dayes moneth sayd yt serpent fare swallowes birdes eyen bee put yet sight commeth againe taile serpent groweth againe bee cut taile ewt also serpent haue egges first within layeth afterwarde one one egges beastes gendered except serpent called tyrus vipera also arist saith li tyrus serpent gendereth beastes within shee hath first egges within egges beast bred within therefore said yt mother serpent long making body mother beginneth ye nether part passeth vp either side ridge boane diuided two partes hath wall interclose betweene two partes therefore two egges set arowe mother serpent layeth egges also lib aristotle saith yt tune gendering serpent wrappeth clippeth themselues together seeme one body two head knowen haue seene also libr aristotle sayeth serpent namelye tyrus swalloweth birde ought else first areareth himselfe afterward restrayneth himselfe vntil thing swalloweth passe inward stomacke little smal serpent may liue long without meate knowen serpent kept sell also aristotle lib telleth weesell sighteth serpent armeth himselfe eating rewe fighteth namely serpent yt eate micea snake weesell hunteth eateth mouse also li saithno difference heere betvveene snake c adder ye serpentes lone well wine bee therefore hunted wine also serpent loueth passing well milke followeth sauour thereof therfore serpent crept mannes wombe may drawen odour smell milke saith dioscorides also libro aristotle sayth serpent haue propertye may moue head backwarde resting bodye cause therof ioynts ridge boane gristle therefore full plyaunt needfull serpent may bende head backward see long body small else might rule body holpe rearing head rule wisely body also serpent swimme water wiggeling folding bodye creepe ground kinde giueth serpentes goe vppon feete sinnes swimme cause therof great length page missing body many foot shuld moue full euill foot also many finnes set nigh together shuld moue heuily wer set far sunder wer sufficient susteine beare vp ye deale body yt long pliant therefore fish doe haue fin drawing clitching fin foules bird clitching spreading wing serpent bending weigling pliantnes body fish like serpent length cause haue fewe fin swimmeth euenly pliantnesse ye body lampraies conger eles mannee fish like serpent making haue onely two fin vse onely pliantnesse body steede fin wing creepe therefore vpon grounde liueth long time without water serpent doe without meat also idem eodem serpent haue wayes gut somtime superfluitie passeth body beast haue ye gender haue way vrine without bladder item eodem serpent found wrapped together come together loue haue yarde gendering stone bee without yard gendring stone semen coole tarrieng passing seede according generation item idem generation serpent falleth errour wonderfull shape ye kinde seld shape mother long strict strait egges serpent bee disposed set arow length mother property adder serpent many property kindes ariristotle rehearseth long rehearse make processe arow generall sufficient time common property knowen nigh men shall treated spoken heere following present chapter littera aspide cap aspis adder worst wicked venime biting hath name aspis aspergendo springing casteth slaieng venime spitteth springeth venime bitings greekes call venim yos isidore sayth libro capit followeth adder called aspis bee diuers manner kind haue diuerse effect dooings noy grieue wit dipsas called scytula latine biteth slayeth thirst ipalis manner adder slayeth sleepe manner adder cleopatra layde passed lyfe death sleepe also nemorrhois manner adder hath name hee sucketh bloud smiteth veines smitten adder openeth breaketh bleedeth death bloud ralled emath greeke also prester horrible adder alwaye open mouth casting shedding venim hee goeth lucanus speaketh saith oraque distendens auidus spumantia prester adder glutton sheddeth smoking venim open mouth hee yt smitten rented slaine horrible infection body sayth also ceps adder slayeth maketh man madde hath bitten man anone destroyeth wasteth serpent mouth man melteth altogether serpent destroieth renteth onely bodye also destroyeth venim wasteth bone sinewes poet sheweth manner ossaque dissoluens cum corpore tabificus sep ceps slaieth vndoeth destroyeth body bone ther many adder venim strong yt slay venim yt toucheth speare auicen sayth de venenis also isidor li speaketh manner adderpsa yt called aspis generall saith said ye adder aspis charmed ye inchaunter come denne charmes comurations hath come laieth one eare ye ground stoppeth ye taile heareth voice charming commeth ye charmeth obedient saieng huc vsque isidorus plinius libro capitulo speaketh adder aspis sayth member bee smit adder swell vnneth remedie found heale biting without cutting partes bee touched flyeng adder venimous hath wit loue affection loueth make loue wedlocke liueth well without companye therefore one slaine pursueth flewe busie wreake vengeaunce passeth thinking knoweth slaier reefeth neuer great company men people busieth slay passeth difficulty space wayes wreake sayd death make let put swift flight water riuers mallice kind giueth remedye medicine kinde giueth right dimme sight eyen set side head set forehead therefore may see aduersarye foorth right aside therefore hee maye follow enimy sight followeth hearing smell two wit strong mightie sayth also marcianus saith adder aspis grieueth men affrica moore take childre yt haue suspect put adder child kind adder aspis grieueth kinde anone dyeth venim adder plinius sayth expresly lib cap vltimo saith sometime beast grieueth men land slaieth straungers men land serpent spare wonderfully men yt borne land serpent anguis riuer euphrates greeueth hurteth men lande noyeth sleepe lande paine slay busily men nation nation euery also plinius saith aristotle sayth certaine mountaine scorpion grieue stranger sting slay men countrey additio aspis little serpent affrike whose sting curable onelye water stone washed take sepulchre auncient king c cooper aranea chap venimous spinner called aranea worme hath name feeding nourishing aire isidore sayth li spinneth long thrids short time alway busie weauing ceaseth neuer trauaile hath oft harme worke oft web worke broken blast wind el dropping tame looseth trauaile auicen sayth spinner little creeping beast many foot hath sixe feete eight hath alwaye feete euen odde verye needfull going possing alway euen charge burthen generall haue two feete moe haue feete longer shorter diuerse workes make feete make thridde small drawe long knit thrids together right amende thrids hooue web among beast rounde bodyes spinner hath best feeling touch hoouing middle webbe hee feeleth sodeynly flye farthest parte thereof reeseth sodeinly flie enimye hee haue mastrye flye hee win beth wrappeth flily among threds web escape falleth first head sucketh moysture thereof lyueth hunting fly humour flyes lyking taste honnie lyking taste baes sayth aristotle also also kinde spinner diuersity male female aristotle saieth lib female bodye male hath longer feete plyant able mouing weauing time gendring loue female draweth hir male threds web thereafter male draweth female drawing ceaseth vntill bee ioyned togethers male set vpon wombe female manner needefull roundnesse wombe ioyning togethers ende springing time beginning summer sometime haruest beginning winter spinner grieuous theyr biting venemous also libro aristotle saith spinner many kindes small diuers colour sharp swifte moaing blacke coulour theyr hinder leg long slowe mouing onely goe worke generation ofte blacke spinner inhabite ground among hole dennes abide web vntill little beast fall therein flye taketh sucketh moysture thereof hungred putteth flye certaine place keepeth vntill hungred againe hath sucked moysture throweth awaye deale surneth againe hunting hunteth ere haue amended breath webbe one breake webbe beginneth amend going downe sunne rising sun trauaileth many lyttle wormes fall web female bringeth forth hir brood male hunteth helpeth hir hideth hir selfe vnder web seene small wormes namely great hir greatnesse worketh easely female layeth first egs thereof afterward shapen small spinner mother setteth weane anone hatcht moue anon dispese themselues therto weaue haue learned weaue hunt mother wombe young spinner arayeth anon net according pray manner kinde spinner hunteth little ewte finde begin weane vppon binde strongly mouth leap vpon sting till dyeth item eodem saith spinner founde bee hiues spinner corrupt honie sucke lycour make webbes honnie combes corrupte auicen sayth plinius also de generatione araneae libro capit kinde spinner worthye chiefe wondering manye manner kindes among certaine manner kind called spalangio phalangium bodye thereof little speckeled diuers colour sting swifte leaping grieuous biting another spinner bodyatocius blacke coulour long legges weaueth dennes ground thirde kinde cunning working weaueth full subtyll webbes greate wonder howe matter thriddes come wombe spinner may indure greate worke weauing greate webbe drawen men thinke spinner wombe yet vnneth founde voyde seemeth bee true democritus sayd much corruption wombe spinner dirte much matter thred might therefore arist reproueth democritus lib saith said true poynt reason seemeth spinner round beast little meates default bloud beate saith spinner taketh much meate without comparison cometh weaue web superfluity dirte meate foode taketh superfluitie dirte needfull digestion due keeping sauing beast aristotle saith also plinius saith sayth spin threds rounde long moderate feete clawes stretch warpe wonderfull craft neather side ouer drawe bring againe thred thwart ouer point poynt straight draughtes small space ye threds couple knit threds middle lyke farre middle poynt worke drawen layd beginneth middle poynt goeth round ofe maketh knottes hole like farre asunder hole space wonderfull crafte ye knot made foure cornerd euenlong round neerer bee middle narrow bee straight farther middle large wide sight seeth vnneth iudgement reson perceiueth wherby spinner reyneth thred thred knitteth fast knot knot reareth himselfe wonderfull lyghtnes owne threds small vnneth seene man eyen yet passeth web swiftlye though flew hether thether place place also saith long vtter threds web dure hap web broken maner wise spinner beginneth middle amend broken though would holde nothing whole sound webbe middle sure also saith spinner token diuination knowing wether shall fall ofte weather shal fal spin weue higher lower also saith ye multitude spinner token much raine also li cap de lesione ficuum saith somtime spinner weaue make web aboute burgening bud vine also flower blossomes tree compassing cobweb tree vine lost burgen bloome biting spinner called spalangio venemous slaieth except remedie succour sooner vertue plantaine slayeth venyme thereof laid thereto due manner therefore wormes eutes frog dread stinging spinner defende themselues iuyce plantaine plinius saieth dioscorides auicen capitulo de venenis c macer saith aristotle plinius meane web spinner come gut manner cratte kinde web wouen subtill working wonderfully knit net wise made smallest threds seene flyes wormes laied seene threds great cobweb made trauayle businesse wonderfully soone destroyed vndone may sustaine fire spinner dread winde blaste winde cobweb soone broken vnknit though spinner venemousspiders doe care ovvne kinde haue seene one spider fight kill another yet web commeth ye gut thereof venemous accounted full good profitable vse medicine dioscorides saith cobweb white cleane defiled filth powder hath vertue constraine ioyne restrayne therefore stauncheth bloud runneth wound keepeth matter rotting healeth new wound layd therto withstandeth swelling ye tarieth heting wound maner spinner called spalana pli saith li cap spinner lyke ant much bodye hath red head deale body black sprong white speck smiting bitter sore biting serpent vipera spinner liueth nigh furnace ouens milles remedie biting smiting shewe bitten smitten another spinner kinde therefore kept found dead skinne thereof stamped dronke medicine biting wesell also another spinner rough great head sorenesse ache stinging ache sorenesse scorpion biting knee shake fayleth also biting commeth blyndnes spewing another manner spinner called mirmicaleon mirmiceon called another name formicaleon like ante white head aud hath blacke bodye white speckes biting paineth aketh stinging waspes called formicaleon hunteth ant sucketh moysture sparrowes foules deuoure ant biting spinner remedie braine capon dronke sweete wine little peppernote congealing lambe wine healeth biting spinner doth ash ram cloe honie also flyes stamped laid biting draweth venimme abateth ache sore ther remedyes reckoneth sufficient time libro eodem capitulo sayeth long spinner white small feete beeing stamped olde ple doeth awaye white pearle eye sayd additiobesides large discourse spider hath bene reported ireland many spider verye great eaten irishman haue performed shewe venime may greater poyson subduath losse pof ape chap bee called apis little short incecti many feete among flyes round bodyes shapen beareth price manye thing plinius sayth libro cap hugenesse wit rewardeth littlenesse body though might accounted among flyeng flyes yet vseth feete goeth vpon may rightfully accounted among beastes goe grounde ouer property sit libro litera property shall set heere property plinius rehearseth li cap saith manner among wonder wit sleight bee wonderfull wit gather honnie make honnie combes sweetest iuyce subtill wholesome worke make waxe full good profitable vse lyfe mankinde lurke hidden winter haue might strength withstand frost snow blast northen wind springing time go blooming beanes worke trauaile none haue leaue idle yt time first ordeine hony combes make waxe house cell breed young make hony therafter bring together perget roofe hiues woose gum iuyce tree haue vertue gumme strength hiues well may agaynst greedines reeses small birdes durte breake casteth ef farre awaye washe hiues foresayd woose iuyce first foundation work lay set certaine peece bitter sauour manye men call comosim make another peece sweete beginning ware many men call dulices third time set greater matter thicke stablishment fastening hony comb many men call matter propolim three manner wise strengthen succour defend honie combes colde wrong bee sit fruite flower withered fresh new gather matter make honie wexe flower nigh vnto wasted spent sende spyes espie meate farther place night falleth vpon iourney lye vpright defend wing rayne deaw may morrow tide flye swifter worke theyr drye wing able flye ordayne watch manner castle rest night vntill daye till one bee wake twice buzzing thrice manner trumping flye daye faire morrowe diuine ware rayne winde holde theyr house know ware hand faire weather passe foorth theyr worke swarme companye gather flower feete water theyr mouthes beare drop together roughnes body younger goeth worke beginneth thinges elder worketh home flower bring first charge fore feete afterward hinder foot vntil turne home againe mouth full fully charged receiue charged manner three foure dischargeth ordayned home theyr office diuers make house cleanse make fayre hiue dresse meate brought home eate asunder least vncleannesse meate worke among make combes ordinately lyne hang aboue certaine thing holdeth vndersetteth shall fall putteth lyttle honnye first rowe ofte filleth laste full bee bringeth beareth needfull dread blastes winde flyeth therefore lowe ground charged least letted manner blast chargeth themselues somtime grauell small stone may stedfast blastes winde heauinesse stone among wonderfull obseruaunce discipline lore one marketh taketh heed worke chastiseth anone slaieth worke among wonderfull great cleannesse suffer filthe among theyr workes bee gather one place dirte bee worke shoulde goe farre work throw durt euen goeth house bide still vntill bee hath watched flye call rest holde peace stil sodeinlye item eodem cap bee doe equitie right smite distroubleth peace desire destroy honnie bee haue king armed sting lordshippe magestie sayth cap haue string kinde denieth vse thereof kind wil yt bee cruell intent hee shoulde hastie take wreake therefore taketh away speare leaueth vnarmed truth ye emperour vseth sting obedience bee wonderfull aboute king passeth foorth swarm one cluster passeth compassed ye swarm hoast knight vnneth seene time multitude followeth serueth swarm bee trauell within gouernour goeth comfort worke onely bound trauayle certain bee sting wer champion continuall warden king body passeth seldome swarme shall go going knowen certaine day voyce hoast araieng selfe passe ye king chaunce ye king bee wing cat time swarme shoulde passe hiue passeth hiue bee profereth king seruice labour bee next beareth king sholders weary ouercome trauayle bee wearie faileth erreth goeth hoast follow smell king euer king commaundeth boast pitcheth tent hoast comforted hearted see king loose king swarme breaketh commeth vnto another king may without king bee hiues commeth certaine false bee called fucus ye plurall numberdrones haue great wombe eate deuoure hony true bee slayeth false bee take therewith springing time wet moist brood bee multiplyed meate fayleth bee hiues reese assaile neighbor take honie spoyle lead hoast haue king bee side fauoureth ye rise assaileth bee assaile spareth fauour smite take companye defendeth many cause hoasts contrarye ordayne two emperours great strife fighting battaile destroyed disperpled throwing pouder dirt item eod ca bee fled bee woode bee fowle sight wrathfull trauayld better may better away therewith tame bee short diuers round long waspes worse trauayle better may better awaye therewith rough bee white gender honie make neostes among corne woode bee gender honye among tree somtime den earth kinde giueth sting yt sticketh ther smiteth one stroke great wrath desire wreake stingeth deepe gutte followeth sodainly speare suche dye soone loose speare liue afterward maye make honie vertue taken away lyue doe profite noye bee hate stinking euill smels namely smoke flye glad merry thing good smell comforted smell crab sod nigh theyr king dead woe sorrowe doe wer seruice dead swarme maketh great sorow dole king dead pestilence beare meate togethers passe sorrowfull mone gathered heap bodie abate sorrow woe dye hunger wo except body taken away helth bee knowen mirth cleernesse also sayth bee fall manie sickness said cap wer sicke brood faileth also sound reboundeth noyse enemy maketh full sore afraid sodaine noyse also corrupt myst corrupteth flower eate enemie also spinner enimies come hiue make web grieue also flye like butter flye flieth candlesthe long taper gnat enemie butter flye eateth wexe leaueth dirt dirt commeth caterpillers wormes loue well war passing thing also great desire meate grieueth eate much flower hapneth namely springing time dye oyle round beast doe namely head noynted beast set sunne quickneth againe besprong vineger also somtime take sicknesse cause sicknesse euer greedelye eating feele theyr honnie withdrawen taken away huc vsque plinius auicen lib cap rehearseth noble property worthy bee saith bee fed hony lyttle eate thereof eate honie sicke go house find cleane hiues make therin house chamber waxe sire manner caste whe ye mouth ye hiue large make lesse manner glewie matter blacke sharpe odor smell first build king house house lyke hoale vauted afterward buyld house diuersitie maisters lesse onely male builde theyr house afterwarde working eate make hony first bee dwell honie combes passe time flye vpwarde top wise come againe eate honnie king passeth neuer without hoast male haue sting except desire sting may bee haue two maner king one red blacke coale twice much bee maketh honnie male bee female lesse bee round diuers colour best bee fed mountaines garden meade small good make honnie like part light bee good maketh honnie euen lyke part bee cleaueth alway hole honie maketh best honie el yt honnie soone corrupt spinner gender therein destroye hony bee make hony vse sting double cause defence firie vertue sting therefore worketh greatly wast superfluitie moisture amend keepe saue honie also ofte hiues come certaine euill flyes breede small flyes grieuous called gusanes pearceth winges bee pursue flyes fight suffer fal vpon house bee make hony slayeth male grieue euill king rule right onely eate much hony doe namelye honye scarfe small bee fight long bee worke trauel busie put hiues putting hony better quantitie manner kinde bee called labion slaye bee make hony destroy house wakefull come theyr hiues pitche themselues honie eating stick fast therein may escape bee slayeth anone two dayes king passeth bee skilfullye warned haue knowledge king shall doe may obedient readie king ye king made hath one company companie haue none first choose anye king king companye slay young bee come forth bee fow abide companye another swarme passeth forth surely young bee begin flye euen lyke hast worke help olde worke creature wreakful feruet take wreak bee wrath therfore multitude hoast bee throw downe great hedge compelled withstande destroye theyr honny passing thing bee hate dirte smoake labour delyuer owne dirt flye dirte stinketh full fowle clense therfore house owne dirt young virgin bee work better make better hony olde smite much theyr smiting grieueth sore doth smiting olde bee drinke onely cleere water whether farre nigh drinketh purge first owne dirte bee maketh honnie haruest springing time best new floures great purenes bee pleased harmony melodie sound song flapping hand beating basons therfore beating basons tinging tinckling timbrells comforted called hiues much hony lefte theyr hiues wexe slow worke lesse therefore needeth leaue hiue honnye meanly much little huc vsque auicen li writeth many property accordeth aristotle libro also plin libro looke lib litera ye maye finde manye property aristotle seneca authours write sufficeth time pof boue cap oxe called bos called boetes greeke sometime tero latine treadeth earth dew lappe fresh lap hangeth downe vnder throte stretcheth legges called palliaria hath name pelle skinne pelliaria hanging skinne dagge token gentlenesse nobilytie oxe isidore sayth li sayth ox full mild among fellowes one seeketh another vsed draw neck plough ofte lowing proueth affection loue may soone finde fellow lib cap plinius speaketh ox sayth findeth written ox inde high camelles horne foure foote long ther followeth among beastes goe backward onely ox fed foder foode sayd fat washing hot water ox maye better trauaile yoaked horn yoked necke syria ox haue dew lap tresh lap vnder throte bunch backes ox straight horne accompted excellent worke blacke ox lyttle horne accounted lesse profitable working oxen horne thicker bulles horne gelding oxe increseth body horn might vertue strength hee bold hardie hand tame softe milde may better away trauaile slowe heauie going also plin speaketh kinde ox saith three year oxe lesse fierce within yeres young cow oxe may well coupled together haue oxe fellow trauel tillyng land beast worthy accounted olde time men would harte oxe slewe oxe without cause sore punished though slaine fellowe earth tillyng saith oxe mild beast cleane onely vse man also offer altar god ox best offering sacrifice made offering sacrifice god best pleased oxe openeth land carueth culture share tilleth field maketh able good beare good corne fruite oxe feedeth flesh nourisheth skin hide accordeth many manner vse dirte fatteth lande horne heated sotten softe stretched made right euen made diuers vessells tooles instrument oxe horne made tapping nockes bowes arbalasters arrowes shoote enemy breast plate armour vnstrong place man bodye warded defended shot smiting enimies oxe horne lanternes made put darknesse combes right cleause heades filth also hunter vse oxe horne feare wilde keasts comfort hounes pursue beast taketh flight also writer painter vse horne keepe diuers colour best also warriours life horne blow therewith co forteth fellow fight flye call boast blowing horne also keeper warden beast castels waite vseth horne comforteth wake blowing horne oxe horne bee needfull manner vse also oxe needfull diuers vse also durt good profitable plinius sayth libro cap sayth oxe durt helpeth ach ioyntes singular remedy dropsie patient therewith annointed sun consumeth wasteth humour betweene skinne flesh swageth abateth holning swelling dropsie also li ca plinius saith yt little beast like ecarabeus called bupestris bupestris beguileth betrayeth oxe grasse sayde oxe treadeth himbupestris flie like blacke betle hauing longer leg lyeth grasse killeth beast eate bupestris lyeth among hearbs grasse oxe loueth hideth therein oxe gathereth meate swalloweth beast bupestris beast bupestris swallowed hee chafeth sodeinely lieur oxe maketh break great paine sorrow heerof papias speaketh saith necke oxe wrong grieued charge yoake oxe grieued ache pricke hee pricked oxe dyeth woe sorrowe commeth venimme beast bupestris hee commeth oxe wombe amongst meate bubulco cap oex heard called bubulcus ordeined office keepe ox hee feedeth nourisheth ox bringeth leese home againe bindeth foot langhalds spanells neigheth cloggeth pasture leese yoaketh maketh drawe plough pricketh flowe gad maketh drawe euen pleaseth whistling song make beare yoak better lyking melodye voice ox harte loue melody kinde auicen saith hearb driueth ruleth draw euen leatheth make euen sorrowes compelleth eare also tread thresh lead vpon corn break straw threshing treading floure trauaile done vnyoke bring statl tie stall feedeth thereat bubalo cap bugle called bubalus nound u diminitiue bos bouis bugle called bubalus lyke oxe fierce beast gladly tamed taketh gladly yoake necke affrica bugle germania wilde ox long horn ye king boord serued drink thereof holdeth much isi saith beast great strength may tained yron ring put nosethrill ring led black red thin haired horne forhead beclypped full strong horne flesh good onely meate also medicine plin saith lib cap bugle flesh sod rosted healeth man biting marrow taken right legdoth away haire eye lyds medicine euills eyen bloude taken vineger healeth wonderfully cast bloud hoofe mirra fastneth wagging teeth bugle milke helpeth fretting gnawing guttes softeneth easeth fatnesse helpeth bloudye flure full good smiting serpent scorpion venimme creket worme called cicada vvorm lyke iourney length forty day iourney caesar writeth pomponeus mela affirmeth fortie dayes iourney length also bull hate thing redde therfore hunter cloath redde make bulles pursue hunter seeth yt beast nigh starteth behinde strong tree bull wrath reeseth horne strongly pitcheth horne tree helde tree horn destroyed throwen downe hunter dartes also another beast lyke wylde bull great hee hath full great horne sharp throweth downe bush tree throweth strong dakes downe ground last gather meate putteth head among shrub long roddes small tough compasse wind horne beast beast tyed held striueth praunceth long therewith striueth winding fastening roddes faster faster bound holden hath long striuen yet maye delyuer himselfe bondes alway faster faster bound indignation loweth full loud hunter heareth great voyce knoweth beast snarled fast helde commeth vpon beast boldly sharp mighty slaieth toole weapon durst aduenture vpon great woodes fieldes dare stay held among small rod phisiologus calleth beast aptaleon word may beleeuedthe later writer report suche name seemeth wonder strong fierce beast draweth horne shrubbes roddes small horne hee mightelye breaketh great tree strong rore softer horse haire shorter haired continually vnto eyen deale redde citrine voyce lyke voyce bull horne deale redde citrine deale crooked eyther horne maye halfe measure called bos hath teeth aboue toothlesse aboue bull legges full hairy lyke speare clouen footed two clees one foote tayle short comparison bodye diggeth earth teareth digging bull doth hath harde skinne suffereth well stroke flesh full sweet therefore hunted beaten flyeth resteth hunted throweth dirte foure pace doth dread houndes run smell dirte hound occupied smelling beast dyeth runneth passeth farre away also libro aristotle speaketh wilde cowe sayth hir time caluing commeth manye come hir make dirte wall maner beast hath much dirte aristotle sayth auicen also pof basilisco cap cockatrice called basiliscus greeke regulus latine hath name regulus litle king king serpent afeard flye see slayeth smell breathe slayeth also thing hath lyfe breathe sight sight fowle birde passeth harmelesse though farre foule yet burnt deuoured mouth ouercome wesel men bring wesell cockatrice denne wherin hee lurketh hidde father maker thing lefte nothing without remedy cockatrice flieth seeth wesell wesell pursueth slayeth cockatrice halfe foote long hath white speckes cockatrice slayeth commeth nigh scorpion water hee toucheth maketh dropsie venemous deadly men call coackatrice sibilus hissing slayeth ere biteth stingeth huc vsque isidorus lib capitulo plinius also sayth libro capitulo among hisperies aethyopes well many men suppose head nylus beside wilde beast called catobletas hath lyttle body nice al member great head hanging alway toward earth el great noyeng mankinde see eyen dye anone kinde hath cockatrice serpent bred prouince syrena hath bodye length breadth cockatrice tayle twelue inch long hath specke head precious stone feareth away serpent hissing presseth bodye much bowing course way forth right goeth meane dryeth burneth leaues hearbes onely touche also hissing blast rotteth corrupteth thing aboute great venime perillous slayeth wasteth yt commeth nigh length speare without tarrieng yet wesell taketh ouercommeth pleaseth god kindly thing without peere biting wesell death ye cockatrice neuerthelesse biting cockatrice death wesell yt sure except ye wesel eat rew venime aristotle sayth auicen first wesell eateth hearb row though bitter vertue iuyce hearb goeth boldly obey commeth enemie though cockatrice venomous without remedy alway yet leeseth mall ce burnt ash ash accounted good profitable workeing alkamie namely turning changing mettall additiothe basiliske lande plinius saith lib cap sayde chaungeth skinne age eateth alway certaine hearbes keepeth holdeth alway venime sighteth common spinner spinner called spalangio ouercommeth venime biting benefise plantaine venime accounted cold stonieth therefore member toucheth maketh lesse feeling froze venemous beast comforteth therefore himselfe touching touched swelleth manye speekes hath vnder wombe many manner wise venimme accompted grieuous hath eyen though site shining worse burning sight though hath cleere eyen yet haleth ye light sunne seeketh darke place flyeth dennes sunne riseth beames shineth vpon earth froggs loueth sweete hearbs eateth rootes eating infecteth corrupteth rootes hearbes therefore ofte gardene rew set venime enemye eoades venemous wormes vertue rew chased away may come hearbes rootes growe therein toade loueth stinking place dir ie hateth place good smell odour sayd flyeth vineyard vine begin bloome maye suffer sustaine theyr good odour smell libro tricesimo
