bounches backe camell another lande hath one bounche backe isidore saith eodem libro capitulo plinius saieth manner cast feedeth camells among tame beastes camells two manner kindes bactria arabia camell arabia hath two bounches backe camell bactria hath one backe beareth burthen another breast leaneth thereon camells soothlesse aboue ox chew cudde ox sheepe isidore sayth libro cloue footed shall sayde heereafter full swifte plinius sayth therefore good battayle warre beare charge cariage camell goeth daye wont doe taketh burthen wont beare camell hateth horse kinde suffreth thirst foure dayes stirreth water feete drinketh el drink doth good camell liueth fiftie yeare hundred yeare wereth mad sometime camells gelded ordained battaile warre stronger put worke generation huc vsque plinius auicen speketh camel maner camel saith moueth first ye right soote lyon doth onelye camell hath hunch backe choi footed hath fell clifts fareth goose foote cleft fleshly ye rielies bear e foot therefore men maketh shooes least foot hurt bee tender beneath sometime camelles heart bone found heart hart camell hath foure teates two vaders ye row hath female camell boweth selfe goeth knee shee wilt coupled male talent desire strong feruent time loue eateth little desireth alway bee assayled male nigh place shee first assailed arist saith li one propertie camells solitary alone mountain time loue man may come nigh yt time heard alone camells yard sinewy full hard therefore men make bow string yardes item ibidem eodem camells haue certaine time ordeined worke generation female nourisheth colt wombe moneths ingender three yeere olde rest yeere louing also sayth libro certaine manner camells bee gelded able flie saith camells swifter horse large pase wide heereof look within de dromedatio aristotle sayth lib cap camell doth woorke generation owne mother certaine citie camell heeled mantell owne sonne leape falling cloth couered hee knew owne mother though hee deede hee leaped downe slew man beguiled aristotle setteth ensample like horse certaine king also libr cap plinius speaketh camells saieth among foure footed beast camells ware bald men estridge certeine beast among foules also saith among beast without horne camelles bee toothlesse ouer iawe accord therfore teeth beast yt chew cud disposition wombe horn ari li sayth yt beast eateth thorny matter hath yt wombe camell hard horned beast hath u teeth either iaw therefore camell hath teeth either iaw onely beneath though hornelesse needeth camel wombe disposition like womb beastes toothlesse ouer iawe making teeth like making teeth horned beastes followeth camells meate thorny hard needeth tongue fleshie hardnesse palat therefore kinde vset palat earthy part teeth therfore camell cheweth cud horned beast wound like wombe horned beast hee taketh meate first wombe vndigest second wombe meat beginneth defie better defied third womb fourth wombe full digestion compleate diuersitie wombes needful hardnesse meat grindeth cheweth meate little teeth li aristotle sayth yt camell hath gall distinguished vpon yt liuer elephant hath matter liuer full whole sound bloud kindlye sweete beastes gall found found full small veines therefore olde men sayde anaxagoras sayth camells beast long lyfe gallesse beastes lyttle gall liue longer beast much gall therefore anaxagoras sayde gall cause sharpe sickness gall multiplyed vnto lung shedde partes bodye aristotle sayth false many beast gall found haue ryght sharpe sicknesse sometime euills slaye fareth camelles haue podagre phrensie podagree foot strained euil slaieth sometime bee neuerthelesse without gall vt dicit ibidem huc v que aristoti also dietis vniuersalibus constant speaketh camell sayth yt camell hottest beast kind therefore leane kinde heat draweth fatnesse bloud therefore camell leane camells milke thin milke beast lesse vnctuous lesse nourishing heating opening departing milke nought else bloud oft sodde therefore camelles milke fall sauour sharpe tempereth therefore humour maketh thin cow milke contrarye thereto thicke vnctuous nourisheth much looke property within de dro nedatio cameleoperdo cap cameleoperdus called cameleoperdalis also beast aethiopia isidore sayth libro plinius libro cap hath head camell necke horse legges foot bull speck perde beast befprong white speckes distinguished bright colour cleere called cameleoperdalis hath head camell speckes perde plinius sayth beast worth sight fiercenesse milde soft almost name sheepe sayth beast clene meat moses lawe sacrifice cloue footed bul cheweth cudde camell therefor lawfull eate thereof written deut c additiothe aethiopians call beast nabis necke lyke horse feete lyke oxe head lyke camel spotted redde loftie low behinde camelion cap camelion lyttle beast diuerse coulours bodye chaungeth full soone diuerse coulours hee sayth also another beast founde taketh also chaunging contrarye coulours isidore sayth auicen meaneth camelion stellio lusard one shineth starre chaungeth coulours fearefull beast lyttle bloud chaungeth therefore coulours foure manner diuers hath face ewte sharpe clawes crooked bodye sharpe harde skinne crocodile libro secundo aristotle sayth camelion beast lyke ewte body side bee euenlong neather partes wombe fish ridge boanes bounch vpwarde fish face beast compowned swine ape tayle full long small end feete crooked little ewte foot departed twaine comparison one foot another comparison thombe man deale hand two partes diuided finger clawes like claw bird bodye rough sharpe bodye bardan eyen bee deepe great round conteined skinne lyke skinne body skinne couereth eyen turneth casteth oft eien hether thether chaungeth coulour skinne blowen colour somewhat blacke black speckle therin diuersitie al bodie namely eyen also tayle full heauie moouing foule colour death body little flesh hath little bloud head ende taile hath little bloud also heart veines come therefrom also hath bloud eien though right little braine nighe eyen bodye bee departed two abideth working spirite thereof lyttle moouing abideth bodye splenenesse dwelleth dennes ewte huc vsque aristotle libro vicesimo octauo plinius sayth camelion beast like crocodile varyeth therefrom onely crookednesse back longnesse tayle beast accounted fearefull camelion changeth therfore colour might strength kinde goshaukes hee draweth flie taketh wilfully beast deuoured democritus sayth head throate set fire oaken woode maketh raine thunder plinius scorneth saieng beast euer accounted among clene beast super leui isichius saith sicknesse feyneth himselfe soft milde though cruell said camelion liueth onely aire mole earth hearring water cricket fire vearses meane quatuor ex puris vitam ducunt elementis camelion talpa mari halec salamandra terra cibat talpam flammae pascunt salamandram vnda fit halecis cibus aer cameleonti additiothe chamelion feedeth fly taketh sodaine slipping forth tongue long rounde may kept aboue fourteene dayes without putting forth aire caprea cap wilde goate called caprea hath name carpendo gathering thereof isidore speaketh libro saith called capri capree gather braunches twig men meane haue ye name climbe vpon hard crag meane haue name noyse make legges wilde goates called caprie see sharplye greekes call dorko dwell high mountaines see hunter come farre called ibex coe vpward high place birdes high vnneth seene mannes eien isidore sayth libro sayeth beastes dwell high rockes cragges perceiue sometime bee pursued men wilde beastes fall downe headlong high cragges saue themselues harmelesse theyr owne horne called also dame damule papias sayth looke within litrea de damula also beast caprea wild goate swifte running light leaping sharpe sight sweete tast tender wholsome meat busie gather meat goat knoweth diuersity hearbs tree twig braunches spray eate feede themselues sight tast smell also plin saith leopard drinketh milke wilde goat voideth sorrow woe capriolo cap capriolus auicen sayth lyke hynnulus hinde calfe beast chaungeth teeth one may perceiue hath greate teeth token long life also long continuance beast capriolus hath right fayre pleasaunt eyen also sharpe also libro aristotle affirmeth saith beast caprioli haue wit wounded seeke hearbe pulegium cerinum pennie royall ease thereof drawe arrowes theyr bodye sticke therein businesse running swiftnesse mouing flesh discharged superfluitie moisture flesh made tender better defie better sauour smell heuie sauour thereof taken away constant sayth get meate capriolus climbeth vp high place high place knoweth smel betweene wholsome hearbs vnwholesome cheweth cud cloue footed defendeth himselfe wood land hunter houndes clawes horne teeth onelye swiftnesse flight pursued valley fieldes hee taketh course flyeth high place mountaines mountaynes iude bee caprioli cateth hearbes good smell sauour theyr feete certaine hollownesse certayne humour bee gathered breedeth postumes postumes first riped broken moouing froting throwe body small hairye leaues substauite conteined within skinne best smelling precious among spicerye profitable vertuous medicine dioscorides sayth platearius also call commonly moricum capra cap goat called capra hath name carpendo gathering caprea hath name gathereth ouermost end branch leaues eateth isidore sayth plinius li ca speaket goat saith goat eyneth many kid selde foure goeth kid fiue moneths ewe doth also goat ware barren fatnesse three yeare gender lesse profitably age foure yeare conceiueth nouember eyneth march aprill tree braunches spring haue horne haue growing knot token yeeres ar l claus meaneth goat breath eares nose bee seld without feauer therefore goates sheepe feruent hot working generation sayth meane goates see lesse night day goat hath vnder chin beard called armitum man drawe one flocke beard astonied beholde also happeneth one biteth certaine hearbe hiting destruction oliue lyking make oliue baren cause offered goddesse minerua sunne draweth glade goates eate pasture together turne away face fro lye downe time yt turned fro eat together pasture tourne face huc vsque plinius aristotle lib sayth manye landes goates haue milke without conceiuing take nettle froat vdders therwith commeth first bloud matter good milke last worse milk eineth also libro goates liue ten yeere xi vse work gendering vntil last age sometime goate hath two kiddes haue couenable meat namely goate bucke bee well fedde shee conceiue afore northen winde shee eyneth male conceiue afore southern wind shee eyneth female telleth turne ye face northward shall gender also li sayth goat sheepe eate hearbs sheep bite hearbs vnto root stedfast pasture goates passe soone place place take onely ouermost end hearbes grasse conceiue better drinke salte water goat moued ye vnder time drinke water eate salt drinke shall much milke drop theyr teates also libro cap goates sheepe lyttle wit insomuch vnneth goe fielde leese come againe lead brought againe man take goate reare vp sodeinelye reare also beholde sadlye vse goate sheepe needfull mankinde feede hungry milk flesh cloath naked fell wooll amende lande vrine durt nothing goates body good profitable vse meate cloathing else needfull vse medicine plinius saith libro cap serpentes bee chosed driuen away ash goates horne wooll burnt remedy goates horne diuerse manner kinde venim ouercome superfluitie dead flesh fretted freshe flesh new gendered passing running humour staunched helpe rotted woundes fretting gnawing haue remedy though cankered festered new goat skinnes wound holpe healed goat bloud medled mery sod excludeth poyson venimme biting creeping wormes smiting scorpion saued healed hot lung goat laid venimous biting draweth venimme abateth ach sorenesse gal putteth away dimnesse eyen fresteth webbes pearles sharpneth sight cleereth eyen goat liuer roasted helpeth lepra oft taken meatrand dirt helpeth many sickness euills sayth goates durt helpeth haue podagre tallow goat buck medled ye iuyce iute goates vrine heated dropped luke warme eares healeth eares ake setteth property many medicinable property plinius setteth thousand remedyes heereby may bee shewed meaning one sayd manner wonder sayde healeth feauers heereto aristotle sayth certaine beast sucketh goates milke vdder feat milke destroyed wasted goate wareth blinde thereby goate looke within litte hiron additio de commended nonrishing meat heere noted beastes younger quarter yeare age vntill yeere halfe flesh nourishing onely pi ge ueale one three weekes moneth sixe week olde time wholsome cane cap hounde called canis tooke name greeke isido saith hound called cenos greek men meane hath yt name canis loude barking saith nothing busier wittier hound hath wit beast houndes knowe theyr owne name loue master defend house master put themselues wilfully perill death master run take prayes master forsake dead body master hound pursue ye foote pray smell bloud loue company men may without men isi saith said oft hound gender wolues gendering commeth cruel hound men call licisci also oft indian teach bitch lenne woodes night tygres line gender come sharpe hound swift strong throw downe cruell beast lion huc vsque isid li cap secundo libro cap plinius speaketh hound sayth among beastes dwell v houndes horse gratious wee haue knowen yt hound fought lord agaynst theenes sore wounded kept away beast foules master bodyes dead ye hound compelled slaier master barking biting knowledge trespasse fault also reade garamantus king came exiling brought two hundered houndes fought agaynst enimies wonderfull hardynesse also iasons hounde cilicie would take meate lorde slaine hee dyed greate hunger sorrowe also read ye celius senator placencia defended hound yt ouerset men armes wounded till hound slayne sabinus hound forsooke neither prison death abode dead bodye dolefull sorrowfull noyse howling man gaue hound meate hounde tooke meat would haue put mouth dead dead bodye throwne tyber hounde leaped swam riuer holde vp dead body ther came much people see behold kindnesse true beast houndes haue mind full long wayes leese master goe far space land country master house cruelnesse hound abateth meeke man hound great wit businesse hunting winde smelling also water pursue followe beast run flye findeth theyr sorrow den warneth thereof sute barking tygres hound commeth strong houndes ouercome lyon elephauntes greate alexander made proofe hounde king alania send first presence ouercame lyon elephaunt brought hounde sawe cruell beast haire stoode vp bodye barked fiercely first reesed craftely fought long elephant drewe downe grounde age yeare hounde gendereth bitche goeth whelpe wombe foure score dayes whelpeth blinde whelpes plentye haue milke later take theyr light also neuer take theyr sight xxi day ye seuenth day saye one whelped alone ninth daye seeth twaine tenth day three thirteenth day mo whelped number moe dayes theyr sight tarryed whelpe best hath last sight mother beareth first couch huc vsque plinius libro cap ther reckoneth many thing aristotle libro secundo sayeth houndes chaunge teeth bee chaunce two lesse bee whiter teeth haue sharpe thereby men haue knowledge betweene young hound olde olde hound haue black teeth blunt young houndes contrarye also libro sayth male houndes rather mooued worke generation female grey houndes gender rather hound hee saith li female goeth sometime whelp wombe sixt part yere day whelp blinde day male commeth sixt moneth whelping grey bitch goe whelpes theyr wombe day nigh sixt part yeare whelpes blind day sooner whelp bee made perfect mother wombe sooner haue sight whelped come worlde male sooner mooued woorke generation begin heaue vp legge pisse moneths ware strong greye houndes haue propertie yt may gender trauaile rest female may liue ten yeare male liueth shorter time female trauaile male fareth male liueth longer female saith ther houds warden house city liue longer liue sometime yeeres sometime homerus saith also li hound sicke eat roote certaine hearbe casteth taketh medicine wise also lib plinius sayth hounde hath filled euil meat eateth hearbe perbraking casting purgeth additiothe wonderfull operation nature among brute beastes declareth rare effect kind especially sort themselues contrary mastiue bitch dogge woulfe bitch beare lyke many yeeres past place good roole parrisse garden bitch yt lind male beare brought forth mixed kinde betwixt fierce stomacke strong vntill cut game peece meale coulde made vnfasten biting olde time stable fayrest shee loueth best giueth first sucke stretcheth teate aristotle sayth libro time generation conception seuen day bitch del ue eth vncleare matter waxeth sicke mother appayreth hath worke generation flyeth ayda h purgation shee kindeleth better whelpeth liuelye whelping shee casteth much fleamatik humour thicke therefore bodye cleane hee sayth also bitch milke founde many dayes whelping sooner greye bitch first milke thicke thinne afterward good conuenient whelping commonly bitch liue lyttle time great trauaile running bitch desireth pisse reareth vp legge male doeth bendeth downewarde behinde sitting bitch lesser bodye male smaller feeble might strength best nourish bring vppe whelp soft mild heart excepte bee shee nourisheth whelpes able bee taught male nimble bodye roughe hairie shoulde hot course running hee fleshie hee shoulde ouerset flesh run worse tail long downe legges let greatly course running also hanging downe taile hee accounted fearefull hardye also gentle houndes cruell fierce pursuing taking wilde beastesthe gray hound blud hound beacle bee full milde softe men tame beastes happen sometime reeseth straunge men anone hee ceaseth withdraweth another de alijs proprietatibus canum chap goundes haue propertyes full good hound haue continuall bolisme immederate appetite sometime punished hunger waxe rabbish mad houndes haue sicknesse euilles baldnesse squinatye madnesse astotle sayth libro beastes bitten mad hound waxe madde except men alone scape sometime helpe medicine constan sayth viatico li viti hound kindly cold dry blacke cholera hath mastrie cholera much rotted corrupt maketh hound madde falleth haruest springing time hound flye voyde madde hound pestilence venim alway exi led outlawe goeth alone wagging rowling dronken beast runneth yaning tongue hangeth mouth driueleth foameth eyen v euertourned reared eares lie backward faile wrickled legges thighes though eyen bee open yet hee stumbleth spurneth thing barketh owne shadow houndes dreade flie barke hound come nigh bread wet bloud wounde biting bee bitten dreame theyr sleepe dreadfull dreames bee afearde sleeping commeth rottennesse corruption wroth astonied without cause looke beholde aboute though nothing grieueth eulil increase begin dreade haue abhomination drinke dread water barke houndes dread water fall dreade die sooner holpen medicine cure remedyes looke libro de morbis cap de veneno libro plinius sayth vnder houndes tongue lyeth worme maketh hounde madde worme bee taken tongue euill ceaseth also sayth violence biting madde hound much vrine grieueth man treadeth thereon namely hee haue botch wound also throweth owne vrine vpon vrine mad hound shall anone feele sore ach neather gut lends also hound wrathfull malicious awreak himselfe biteth oft stone throwen biteth stone great madnesse breaketh teeth grieueth stone owne teeth full sore also guidefull deceicable oft sickleth fawneth tayle men passeth waye though friend biteth sore take heede backewarde hounde hateth stone rod bolde hardye among hee knoweth busieth bite feare bold passeth among straungers also couetous gluttonous eateth therefore di rde greedely yt perbraketh tasteth vp afterward n hungred taketh yt cast vp foule manner also hound tous therefore auicen saith yt gathereth hearbs priuely purgeth himselfe perbraking casting hath anuye right forrys man knoweth vertue hearbes also euill apaide straunge houndes vnknowne come place hee dwelleth breadeth least face worse hound presence fighteth therefore also hee couetous scarse busie lay vp hide reliefe leaueth therefore communeth giueth flesh marrow boanes hee maye deuoure houndes layeth vp busily hideth vntil hungreth againe also vncleane lecherous li aristot saith hound male female vse lechery long aliue giue vncleannesse lechery yt take diuersitie betweene mother sister bitch touching deede lecherie therefore offering price hounde bitch accounted vncleane law moses offering ye price common woman wretched person serue al lechery hound doe also olde hound oft slowe heauy libr aristotle saith houndes age haue ye podagre scape euill therefore sleepe daytime vpon dunghill among flyes wormes fore grieued flyes theyr bleared eyen theyr scabbed eien though bite pearce somtime houndes eares yet slouth taketh comfort strength chase driue away vnneth flye agaynst face hee snatcheth mouth busieth bite teeth last scabbed hound violentlye drawen dunghill roape whippe bounde necke drowned riuer water hee endeth wretched lyfe skinne taken fleshe eaten buryed left finallye fly diuerse wormes catulis cap whelpes called catuli bee child hound catulus nowne diminitiue catellus also manner misse vse young beast called catuli isi sayeth li generally whelp bee whelped blinde touching perfect dooing sight hound whelp whelped sawing teeth though full small beast haue teeth like saw departed glutton fight hound woulfe lion yt panther beast gender vnperfect broodes said hand codem li de animalibus generali beastes bringeth forth vnperfect young cause gluttony shuld abide vntil ye whelp compleate perfect shoulde slay mother strong sucking therefore needeth kind hastie speedfull beastes looke eod lib solinus saith whelpes houndes worship among men old time plin saith li ca sucking whelp accounted pure good meat among men old time yt offred whelpes please god steede beastes nothing accounted better profitable poison venim yet day author commaund take whelpes wholsomely venimous bitings whelpes opened layd hot biting serpent draw venim abate age maketh ye sore member whole remedy laid therto telleth sayth whelpes sooner bee whelped later haue sight nobler milke nourished slower receiue perfect sight yet blinde loue mother know voice odour seeketh teates happen mother withholdeth milke bite teates sharpest teeth compell mother giue largelye milke hungred cry whine seeke dammes teates also sayd sucke manner order lay bitch whelpe best strongest mother taketh first sucking loueth best comforteth meate shall bee withdrawne warilye wisely hunting houndes least waxe fat much meate great fatnesse take slouth slower praye running though melancholyke beast qualitie complection yet bee nimble swifte disposition member bee gladde mery play much theyr age bee weaned milke able taught hunting also playeng keeping beast defend wolues houndes ordeyned keeping house shoulde bee closed bound darke place daye stronger night cruell agaynst theeues office houndes rest sleepe daye wake night goe courtes close agaynst theeues hound blamed waketh barketh goeth daye sleepeth hideth himselfe barketh night also hounde euill hound whether hee bee young olde keepeth wardeth sheepe defendeth wolues daye pasture strangleth biteth night folde castore cap beauer castor wonderous beast liueth goeth land among foure footed beast swimmeth vnder water dwelleth fish swimme therin hath name castor castrando gelding isidore sayeth libro gendering stone accorde medicine stone geld themselues ware hunter bite gendering stone hee sayth cicero speaketh sayth raunsome themselues parte bodye bee pursued iuuenal sayth geld themselues loose theyr stone desire scape castor called fiber also called sea hound pontus huc vsque isidor castoris plinius speaketh libro capitulo pontus hee sayth manner kinde beastes dwelleth lande water maketh house den arayed wonderfull craft brinkes riuers water beastes liue together flockes loue beastes kinde commeth together cutteth rod stickes theyr teeth bringeth hoame theyr den wonderfull wise laye one grounde vpryght steed slead dray leg feete reared vpward lay loade stickes wood betweene legges thighes draweth home den vnlade discarge make dwelling place ryght strong great subtiltye craft theyr house bee two chamber three distinguished three cellers dwell ouer place water ariseth neather water away hath certeine hole properly made celler hole putteth taile water taile fishy kind may without water long kept without corruption beast wonderfull wonderfully shaped taile onely fish deale bodye hath kinde foure footed beast shaped little hounde hinder feete bee feete hound therwith goeth principallye lande two fore feete goose foot therewith swimmeth principallye water skinne full precious hath teeth longer shorter hound swift moouing leg full short castor hath two gendering stone greate comparison little bodye call stone castorea stone plinius speaketh li ca sayth castor biteth gendring stone call castoria least taken hunter sextinus diligent sercher medicine denieth saith gendring stone cleaue nigh fast ridge bone yt may take beast life taken also also plat sayth dioscorides also beast wary witty could helpe himselfe yt manner known day castoris found diuers place isidore phisiologus tell gelding shall vnderstood co mon castoris beast yt like castores gendering stone castorium feined helpeth greatest euill bodye plinius saith namely ye stone castor young olde castoria stone chosen manner double hang one string coupled one sinew may soone feined many men take ye bladder beast fill full castoris bloud put thereto little ye castor haue smel little pepper haue sharp sauour bindeth necke bladder seeme sinew impossible yt two bladder shoulde hang one neck therefore ye castorium best yt double hangeth one sinew ye castorium best meanly sharp sauour sharpe earthie feined namely haue sinewes medled diosc saith good castorium meanely sharp sauour glewie without strong salt sauour sal aromaticum oft castorium feined pli saith ther feesh new castorium better vertuous medicine token feined stone haue certeine skin yt cleaue essentially thereto full vnctuous fatnesse may kept seuen yeares greate vertue shall put medicine without vtter skin shal weighed due manner hath vertue dissolue temper consume wast abate euill humour namely comfort sinewy member castorium helpeth many sickness euills accordeth yt haue falling euill helpeth colde euills head doth awaye sodeine palsie tongue restoreth ye speech onely tempered moysture vnder tongue helpeth vniuersall generall palsie body sod wine rew sage oft meat drinke exciteth moueth comforteth brain maketh sneese therfore litargike man yt hath sleeping euill awaked therwith prouoketh causeth sleepe head anointed therwith oleum rosaceum helpeth strong venim venim scorpion serpent cerastes serpent prester plinius saith libr cap also vrine helpeth foresaid thing saith exciteth menstruall bloud helpeth conception many dooings grease effectuall vertuous ointment additiothe beuer greate deuourer fish otter ceruo cap hart called ceruus hath ye name cereston greeke yt horne isi saith li sayth hart enimies serpent feele themselues grieued sicknesse draw breath nosethrills theyr den mallice ye venim ouercome repaired feeding taught first vertue hearb diptannum eat thereof cast arrow arrow headsdiptanie dipta whe wounded hunter wonder noise pipe haue liking accord melodye heare well areare vp eares beare downe eares swim passe riuers great water swimming stronger swim feebles lay head vpon loines stronger swim may better indure trauaile huc v que isid plinius saith wordes lib cap sayth moreouer ye hart pleasing beast tunneth wilfully flieth man ouer set houndes hinde shall calue shunneth lesse wayes pathes bee troden wilde beast whether common priuy way rising starre arturus hinde conceiueth goeth calfe eight moneths calueth somtime two time conception female depart goe awaye male male leaue raging lecherie waxe cruell digge vp clot stone foot theyr snout black vntill washed raine caluing female purged vse certain hearbs ye calfe better held within wombe easilier deliuered calueth caluing ye female eateth two manner hearbes camum sisolis meaneth camamell spearwort name barbarous commeth againe calfe hath taken ye iuyce ye hearbe giueth calfe sucke maketh calfe vse run make ready flie leadeth high place teacheth leape male deliuered desire lechery eateth busilyealso vvild commin hee feeleth himselfe fat hee seeketh dennes lurking place dreadeth domage harme heauinesse body hart runne flie continue course look anon backward men come nigh seeke succour running flight heare cry hound eares reared vp flye fast perceiue perill eares hang downeward simple wonder thing bee astonied new sightes horse bugle come themward beholde earnestly take heede man commeth shoote swim ouer sea heards passe foorth euen order help come land sight smel hart horned beast among beastes hart hath propertie hee chaungeth horne euerye yeare springing time hee armourlesse seeketh day priuy place hideth vntill newe horne grow againe vntill hath horne armour casteth ryght horne enuie hee hideth sorrye anye man haue medicine thereof age harte knowen auntlers tine horne euerye yeare increaseth tine vntill seauen yeare tine groweth alike age may knowen thereby age knowen onely teeth hart hath teeth none hath tine neathermost parte horne forehead stande lesse tinescalled ye brovve antlets gelded afore haue horne afterward groweth horne gelded horne growen loose neuer theyr horne hee hornelesse hee goeth meate night daye putteth horne heate sun make sadde harde froateth afterwarde agaynst tree softly assay strength doth awaye itching feeleth therein hardnesse rinde feeleth horne strong goeth openlye meate leese sometime hee froateth tree compassed iuie weathwinde horne snarled fastened sometime taken hart contrary serpentes insomuch serpent flye voyde odour smell burning harte horne ruenning good agaynst biting serpentes hart liueth ryght long time passing hundered yeares knowen harte liued alexander time taken hundered yeares death alexander time marked cheines golde hart feeleth euill feauers hee succoured medicine agaynst euill huc vsque plinius libro capitulo aristotle auicen meane hart beast without gall onelye guttes hath therefore bitter gut stinking therefore hound eate guttes bee passing sore hungred also libro aristotle saith men think harte gall loungs false auicen saith hath maner moisture like moysture gall also sayth hart bloud hare bloud coniealeth neuer alway thin fleeting kind beast beast chaungeth horne ceruus alone heere seemeth calleth ceruus hart bucke hart horne sound within therefore heauye changeth heauines hath foure great teeth one side foure grindeth therewith meate two great teeth tuskes male hath greater female bendeth downward auicen saith also libro octauo aristo saith men suppose hart hee among foure footed beastes vsing wood ready wise hinde calueth nigh waye beast spareth comming men flyeth light sunne hir calfe seeketh thicke place darke den caues stone haue one entering maye fight beast hee saith hart fight strong fighting ouercome right obedient victor dread voyce foxe hound sometime hart hideth himselfe least hunter finde slay fatnesse sayth hart hunted manner hunter whisteleth singeth harte hath liking therein another hunter tolleth inward shooteth slayeth hart areared flyeth riuer pond maye swim ouer water taketh comfort strength coldnes water scapeth hunter hart roareth cryeth weepeth taken also hound followe findeth double wayes runneth foorthright hether thether leapeth thwart ouer wayes aside halfe purposeth take mightie large pace starteth contrary leaping starting harder houndes finde followe chase odour smel also saith ye hinde hath great trauayle payne calueth knowen bending crooking body ruthfull crieng therefore eateth hearbe dragantea delyuered hir calfe easelytarrago hath calued eateth sodaynly secundina bagge calfe ye mother ere fall ground secundina accounted venime sayeth aristotle libro rehearseth property harte plinius rehearseth also li pli saith hinde feeleth heauinesse swalloweth stone holp vertue stone stone sometime found hir entrayles dead accounted stone helpeth wonderfully woman goe childe doth boane found hir hart saith bone fonnde heart hart passing profitable many euils body medled noble confection dioscorides saieth constantine also additiothe pisell hart dryed pouder dronke good collicke stopping water giue boane hart heart ground barren woman drinke thou shalt see glory god gesner foorth galen stone great valew poyson called beswar stone gesner writeth hart sicke hath eaten manye serpent recouerie brought great heate hasteth water couereth body vnto eares eye time distilleth many teares sayd stone gendred c pof ceraste cap cerastes horned serpent isidore telleth li hath horne either side head crooked wrinkled horne ramme hydeth body grauell sand onelye leaueth horne vncouered foules see think wormes lyght vpon intend feede themselues therewith false guylefull serpent taketh sodainly fowles ere bee ware also serpent lyeth waight wayes priuie place sueth men horse passe vnwarely wayes slayeth priuie biting glose super pen cap gines sayth seemeth cerostes manner kinde serpent malitious venemous onely venime toucheth horse hoose slayeth horse man therefore wher haue fiat dan sicut colubet via cerastes semita ye lether hath fiat sicut coluber via sicut regulus locato men meane cerastes manner serpent venemous malytious looke litera de aspide mention made cerastes additio cerastes serpent verye lyttle bodie horne crooked lyke ramine pof cornu cap cornu horne arist saith lib kind bone softer boane harde gristells hooues clawes beast may bathed made softe fire sayeth colour horne sol beast colour haire body beast skinne blacke haire also horne blacke colour horne giuen beastes defend steed armour weapon therefore set ye ouermost part head may alway ready withstand wrong enemyes horne voyde hollow within except hart horne hard sound within haue many tyndes auntiers beast chaungeth horne hart alone seemeth ceruus name hart bucke roe bucke hart changeth horn yeare hideth one vimeth may found therefore sayd prouer go ye hart casteth horne libro sayde horne faster ioyned skinne boane therefore arist saith beast moue horne well eares ye countrey called aufrage auicen saith aristotle sayth lande called matter matter horne hooues smoake passeth vapour resolued heate heart matter hooues horne const saith therefore beast hauing much aboundaunce smoke resolued departed right strong seruent heate hearte conuayed brought vnto vttermost partes bodye vertue heate suche beast haue great horne strong namelye smoakie matter subtill tourneth haire thicke earthy tourneth teeth tuskes therefore aristotle saith best libro tercio capitulo de dentibus beast teeth tuskes either iawe haue horn fareth elephant bore also foure footed beast teeth either iawe alone cloue fooled haue horne chewe cudde haue two wombes haue moe wombes sayde hande pluralitie horne follow clefte foote therefore asse inde called asinus indicus hath horne alone foure footed ari saith auicen also great affinitie betweene houes clees horne aristotle commaundeth annoynt oyle medicine betweene horne cow hath sore ache clees feete profit goodnesse horne treated litera b de boue additioin olde time made horne beaten flat armour men diuers strange fashion shield target endes manye weapon armed therewith horne applyed many good v cunneyes generall newly added small beast breeding warren parkes closure among v according soyle breed goodnesse flesh skinnes good furre especially blacke mixed white haires called siluer haires brought forth turkey cunnies called porcello indico haire short pigges haire reddish lyke rat indie connyes peter martyr description new ilandes writeth three sortes cunnyes whereof suppose best pof crocodilo ca crocodilus hath name yelow colourcrocodilus isido sayth foure footed beast isidore sayth libro capit de piscibus dwelleth water lande nigh twentye cubites long armed great teeth clawes skinne harde ye regardeth though strongly beaten backe stone resteth water night day land layeth egges lande greater goose egges male female keepeth time houres certaine fish hauing creast lyke sawe renteth tender womb slayeth sayd among beast onely crocodile moueth ouer iawe isidore sayth plinius libro ca sayth maner crocodile beast dwelleth riuer nilus among beast land tonguelesse onelye ouer iawe moueth biting venimous teeth horrible strongly shapen combe saw bore tuske beast commeth lyttle beginning wexeth great crocodile beast nourished great gluttenie cateth right much full lyeth brinke cliffe bloweth fulnesse commeth little bird called cuschillus among called king foules among italian bird flyeth mouth sometime putteth bird last openeth mouth birde suffereth enter bird claweth first clawes softly maketh haue manner lyking clawing falleth anone asleepe bird cuschillos knoweth perceiueth beast sleepeth anone hee descendeth wombe foorthwith sticketh wer dart biteth full grieuouslye full sore crocodile right softe full tender wombe cause soone ouercoe fish haue sharpe prickes creastes growing backes high cause plinius sayth grim horrible beast followeth pursueth flye dreadfull flieth serpentes hath dimme eyen water seeth sharply water hideth winter namely foure month commeth springing time groweth still time alyue sayde huc vsque plin lib cap phisiologus saith crocodile findeth man brim water cliffe slayeth may weepeth vpon swalloweth last plinius sayth dirte made oyntment oyntment woman annoynt owne face olde woman riueled seeme young wench time crocodile eateth gladlye good hearbes grasseenhydris vvater snake adder among lurketh litle serpent called enidros enemy crocodile hideth priuely grasse wrappeth himselfe therein crocodile eateth grasse swalloweth serpent serpent entreth wombe renteth gut slayeth commeth harmles also isidore saith libro sayth worme lyeth awayte crocodile sleepeth wrappeth himselfe fen entreth betweene teeth commeth body heereto solinus saith crocodile lyeth awayte certaine small birdes yt breed among grasse riuer nilus birdes flye womb crocodile heate sunne eateth wormes wombe fierce beast cleansed purified wormes skin harde vnneth may pearced sword dwelleth lande day water night water hotter night daye water holdeth sunne beames moued water hotte beast hath tongue stretching outwarde make voice therewith hath lyttle tongue within fish haue tast sauour solinus sayeth aristotle auicen also additiothe crocodill ill beast bred aegypt lyuing partly water land fashion lyke dragon small eye long teeth sharpe moueth onely vpper iawe hath great strong nayles clawes skinne vnpearceable scalye browne coloured deuoureth man beast comming nilus hath bene seene twentie foote long cubites late yeares hath bene brought england case skinnes crocodile seene much money giuen sight thereof policy stranger laugh folly either wealthy else know bestow money pof colubro cap adder called coluber wer colens vmbras dwelling shaddowes el hath ye name coluber slydeth wiggeleth slipperye draught wrinckles slimie passing slydeth helde called lubricum papias saieth adder coluber flyeth ye hind slayeth lyon isidore sayth eateth rew chaungeth skin loueth hollownesse woode tree drinketh milke busely hurteth grieueth teeeth tayle sheddeth venm lyeth sun vnder hedge sucketh bitch eateth flyes lycketh pouder looke de angue plinius lib ca saith greace water adder coluber helpeth biting crocodile man haue gall adder crocodil shal grieue noy ieoperdous fearfull beast dare maye doe manner wise dommage griefe beareth gall sayd adder additiothe adder much vnlike water snake onely head flatter like newte skinne browne tayle hard tippe lyke spur young cocke verye venemous pof damula cap damula dama also wilde goate papias saith libro isid saith wild goate called damula fearfull beast dare fight cannot defend flight steede armour wepon wilde goate hath ablenesse lightnesse runne fly marcianus sayth dente tuetur aper defendunt cornu ceruum imbelles damae quid nisi praeda sumus bore defendeth tuskes hart horne wilde goates fight pray wilde goate loueth mountaines woodes eateth medicinall hearbes grasse good smell gathereth biteth crop stalkes twig branch wounded eateth dragantea taketh arrow bodietaragon bloude thereof medicinall plin sayth libr softneth sinew shronk doth away ache ioynts smiteth putteth venime serpent hate flye wilde goate may suffer breath hee saith goate sharpe sight swifte course running looke eodem de caprea agrosti pof dromedario cap dromedarin heard keeper dromedes dromedus manner kind camell isid sayth lib saith dromedus maner kinde camell lesse stature camell much swifter course running hath therefore name dromedus swift running called drombs greeke dromedus goeth hundred mile twentie ane daye beast cheweth oxe camell dromedarri master dromedis properly speake papias saith glose super f saith dromedarius dromis accounted beast lesse camell much swifte mudian epha countreys beyond arabia therin many dromedary ge th youth runne auicen saith lest letted running desire liking female swifle reason long pa haue large p ce aristotle saith auicen plinith also great heate hottest beast kinde complection strong heat consumeth land wastreth ventositie fastnesse suffereth ouercharged much flesh fatnesse also ablenesse member legges long small full sinnewes therefore lyght able mouing strong continue course running light beast scarcitie meate beast much meate sufficed lyttle meate scarcely eateth heye rindes loueth well stoanes date content euen right long iourneyes plinius saith bloud full hot sharpe thin therefore milke dromedary full thin fleeting milk beast constantine sayth lesse nourishing heating departing thicke humoures looke de camelo hath nigh verye propertyes beast hath pof dipsade cap dipsas dipsades feminine gender serpent called situla latine hath name sytula biteth dyeth thirst isidore saith libro adder subtill small vnneth seene men tread venim slayeth felt vneth feeleth sorenesse shall dye manner kinde serpent sayde de aspide looke dracone cap dragon called draco greatest serpent isidore saith lib greekes call draconia ofte drawen den reeseth vp aire aire moued also sea swelleth venime hath creast lyttle mouth draweth breath small pipe straight reareth tongue hath teeth lyke saw hath strength teeth also tayle grieueth biting stinging hath serpent ende slay thing venime needfull findeth slayeth elephant greatnesse body lurketh waye elephant goeth bindeth spanneth leg strangleth slateth dragon breedeth de aethiopia great burning continuall heat isidore saith li plin li ca speaketh dragon saieth dragon xx cubites great breedeth among aethiopes ofte foure fiue fasten theyr tayles togethers teareth vp head sayle ouer sea ouer riuers get good meate also cap besayeth betweene elephant dragon euerlasting fighting dragon tayle bindeth spanneth elaphaunt elephaunt foote nose throweth downe dragon dragon tayle bindeth spanneth elephant legges maketh fall dragon buyeth full sore slayeth elephant elephant falleth vppon slayeth irem ca elephant seeing dragon vpon tree busieth break tree suite dragon dragon leapeth vpon elephant busieth bite betweene nosethrile assayleth elephant eyen maketh blynde time leapeth vppon time behinde byteth sucketh bloude last long fighting elephant wexeth feeble great blindnesse insomuch falleth vpon dragon slayeth dieng dragon slayeth cause dragon desireth bloud coldnes elephant bloud dragon desireth coole himselfe isi saith super illum locum leuitic attraxerunt ventum sicut dracones drew winde dragon ierome sayth dragon full thirstie beast insomuch vnueth may haue water inough quench great thirst openeth mouth therefore winde quench burning thirste wise therfore seeth ship sayle sea great winde flieth saile take ther cold wind ouerthroweth ship somtime greatnesse body strong reese saile shipmen see dragon come nigh knowe comming water swelleth strike sayle anone scape wise also solinus saith aethiopians vse dragon bloude burning heate eate flesh diuers euills depart venimme flesh hath venim tongue gall therfore cut tongue throw away gall venime receiued venim taken away vse deale bodie meate medicine seemeth dauid toucheth sayth dedisti eum efcam populis aethiopium thou gauest meate people aethiopia also plin saith might venime tongue alway areared somtime setteth ayre fire heate venime seemeth bloweth casteth fire mouth sometime bloweth outragious blastes thereby aire corrupted infected thereof commeth pestilent euilles dwell somtime sea sometime swine riuers lurke sometime caues den sleepe seldome wake nigh alway deuour beast sowles haue right sharp sight see therefore pray farre mountaines fight biting stroke stinging setteth eyen nose beast fighteth therefore plin saith li hee grieueth elephant eyen mouth maketh ofte blinde sometime elaphaunt maye eate dyeth therefore wise also dragon arist speaketh lib sayth dragon biting cateth venemous beastes perillous dragon biting eateth scorpion biting vnneth remedy medicine founde also lib plinius sayth venemous beast flye voyd greace fatnesse dragon greace medled honnie cureth healeth dimnesse eyen also libr aristot saith fish dye bitten dragon additioof wonderfull greatnesse dragon manye sortes hath bene mischiefes haue done read chronicle doome pof equo chap horse called equi haue name ioyned coupled carte chariot euen odde also coupled shape course also horse called caballus hath name hollow feete maketh therewith caue pit ground goeth beast haue suche feete isidore saith lib among many men horse called sonipes foundeth feete horse ioyfull field smell battayles comforted noyse trumpet battaile fighting excited runne noyse know sorie ouercome glad haue masterie feeleth knoweth theyr enemy battaile farre foorth arise enimies biting smiting also know theyr owne lord forgetteth mildnesse lord ouercome horse suffereth man ride backe onely owne lord manye horse weepe lord dead sayd horse weepe sorrow right man doth ye kind horse man medled centaures beastes also ofte men sight take euidence diuine gesse shall befall sorrowe ioye horse maketh horse persia cicilia liue long time fiftie yeare horse gallia inde spaine line lesse time heereto isidore saith old men meane gentle horse noble men take heede foure thing shape fairenesse wilfulnesse colour shape strong sadde body according strength might height length breadth side long deale small loynes great thigh round large broad breasted body full sad full brawne foote drye hoofe hollow sad fairnesse knowen lytle head skinne cleauing nigh ye bone eares little sharpe eyen great nosethrills large beareth vp head maane thicke tayle long hoofe well pight round wilfulnesse knowen bold hart swifte feete ye member quake token strength soone areared riseth soone great rest el soone stinted swifte course running colour knowen coulour nowe red blacke nowe white nowe graye diuers speckeled diuers colour beautifieth much disfigureth horse token know strength horse pursue order make processe orderly long huc vsque isidorus libro libro capitulo plinius speaketh horse saith horse scythia fight lordes eschewe ingender owne damme manner knowledge kinred aristotle speaketh heereof libro sayth king north hadde fayre mare foaled faire horse king would haue colte gotten horse owne damme couered hir face mare head vncouered anone horse knew hir fled fell downe high place dyed sorrowe also company mare horse goeth gladly mare colt damme glad noyse simphonie trumpet starteth reeseth enemy bodeth warre fighting weepeth friend lordes horse accounted best warre battaile thrust head deepest water drink meaneth horse bee let running heauinesse vrine also libr cap sayth gall horse accounted among venim therefore lawfull idolatrous priestes touche horse fresh bloud raw venemous bloud bull horse foame dronke ass milke slayeth venemous wormes also aristotle auicen meane ye horse casteth teeth elder whiter teeth also libro aristotle saith male horse lyueth xxv yere gendereth three yeare xxv mare liueth longer gendereth xl yeare horse beginneth gender voyce greater fareth mare also loue worke generation beast sayth libro also lib saith sometime horse haue podagre loose soales theyr feete groweth new signe heereof quaking right gendring stone horse fed house haue euill called illiaca passio token therof hinder member crimpleth togethers constrayned horse tyed meate let bloud shall holpe also horse hath shrinking sinewes token therof veynes straight vppon head necke grieueth goe also horse gather venimme haue another euill mouth called forem token euil matter falleth roofe mouthe breath hot euill without remedy except heale himselfe somtime horse mad token token thereof eares bend toward necke euill hath medicine horse hath sickenesse bladder token thereof may pisse also draweth loynes sol also horse bitten grieuously flye called mugelis biting flyeasilus horse flye grieueth full sore horse mule maketh rise theron blain whelkeshirudo ye brent flye leache oftentimes horse dye venime thereof horse knoweth neighing fight hath lyking stand medes swim water drinke troublous thicke water water cleere horse stampeth stirreth foot make thick huc vsque arist lib pof equa cap mare called equa name commeth name equus li arist saith mare foale smelleth snuffe candle casteth hir foale item idem mare go leese together one dye leaue hir colte aliue another mare feedeth nourisheth kind mare loueth beast ye kinde also libro cap plin saith mare foaleth standing loueth hir coltes passing beastes colte leeseth damme another mare feedeth nourisheth loueth hir owne also sayth forehead colte breeddeth blacke skinne quantitie sedge mare lycketh hir tongue taketh away receiueth neuer colt suck hir teat except first taken away plyn calleth skinne veneficium amoris woman witch vse skinne charmings excite man loue also aristotle sayth mare proude hath ioye hir mane sory shorne hir maane short hir lyking lechery quenched though vertue loue wer maane also lib arist saith birde called ibis fighteth horse horse driueth hir hir pasture leese ibis feeble sight hath voyce horse flyeth aboue horse stonieth maketh flye slayeth somtime additiothat fable birde bignesse snype filthy stinking bird pof poledro ca colte called poledrus pullus equinus also mare sonne hath name sucketh li arist saith forhead foaled found iconemor called also amoris veneficium mare licketh hir tongue taketh away hydeth eateth woman witch haue prouerbes thereof saith also li sayth hinder part colte former part colte wexeth former part wexeth vpward therefore manye horse former part higher hinder therfore colte maye touch head hinder foote maye age colte loueth damme wonderfull great affection followeth hir whereeuer goeth happeneth leeseth hir presently neigheth colte lyttered strawe curried horse combe arayed trapping gaye harnesse smitten spur sadled saddell tamed bridle followeth dam freely eateth grasse feete pearred nayles suffered runne hether thether freely last set worke trauayle helde tyed lead halter raynes taken damme may sucke dammes teates taught manye manner wise goe easely softe isi saith li set carte charyots chaires trauell bearing horseman chiualry silly horse colte foaled diuers happes fortune isi saith eod libro horse sometime hallowed diuers vsage god chariot horse ordayned hallowed sunne foure chaunges sunne one yeare springing time summer haruest winter time chaungeth vertue sunne carte horse hallowed ye moone seene double time night daye therefore worship ye moone couple alway two horse white blacke three horse drew one carte hallowed god hel fiend draw men three age childhood youth age men coupled togethers horse diuers color durst well couple togethers past seauen horse lykened number seauen starres mouing seauen starres supposed generally world ruled el number seauen dayes passing seauen circle saye lyfe passeth endeth describeth therefore wonderfully colour horse isid sayth hallowed red horse firered white brovvne baye pale mouse dunne sunne white aire browne earth blew water sea rode red horse summer thing heateth white horse winter thing whiteth colde frost graye springing time thing wexeth greene browne blacke haruest thing dryeth fayleth first fairnesse also ther saith ye halowed red horse mar named god battayle warre banner romanes wer dragon enemy spanneth slaieth goeth foale two yeares gendereth lyueth three hundred yeare isid saith li lib ca pli saith among beast ye elephant vertue ye vneth among men great redines sound telleth ye new moone come together great company bath wash riuer come together new ye moone lot turne againe owne place make young go turning againe keepeth busily teach wise sicke gather good hearbs ere vse said elephant see man comming way wildernes wold afray draw themselues somewhat way stint passe little little teach way dragon come fight ye dragon defend ye man put forth defend man strongly mightely doe namely haue young foales dred yt man seeketh foales therfore purpose first deliuer ye man yt may safely feed youg keep ye warely also li ca alway goe together eldest leadeth ye company next age helpeth shal passe ouer riuer water send ye youg lest ye foord let coming ye elephant might passe conueniently also among strange shamefastnes one ouercome ye ouercome flyeth voice ye victor doe ye deedes generation priuy place ye male fiue yeres old female x yere two yeare telleth two yeare onely fiue day seldome sixt day saith full perillous time generation namely wilde elephant throw downe house stable indian therefore indian hide season tame female elephats elephant bee best chiualrie tame beare tower tree throw scaffold ouerturne men armes wonderful dread men armes ranged battayle dread flye voyce least sounde swine also cap forhead snowte throweth high palmes eateth fruite thereof also betweene elephant dragon perpetuall wrath strife one hath enuie great might strength quantitie body dragon loueth drinke elephauntes bloude coole burning heate bloud colde sayde booke wher intreateth dragon looke pde naso elephantis chap aristotle lib auicen meane elephant nose long strong bolning harde horne vseth nose steed hand thereby taketh meate drinke putteth mouth elephant hath two pappes breast strong tuskes mouth tongue full lyttle comparison bodye seene within seldome seene without lycketh lyppes meate drinke found one gut folden wrapped manye manner wise gut steede stomacke therafter one dirte passeth hath great lyuer foure time greate lyuer oxe hath lytle mylte splene comparison body auicen sayeth melancholia humor passeth nourishing also li arist saith gendred teeth gendered snowte nose hee wrooteth vp tree breatheth therewith swimmeth casteth water harde snowte calceus made hard gristle elephant sitteth bendeth foot may bend foure heuinesse waight body hee leaneth right side lefte side sleepeth standing bendeth hinder leg right man also libro male gendereth fifthe yeare female tenth vnto fortie yeares resteth hath foaled three yeares hath conceiued toucheth male gorth fole hir wombe two yeares foale foaled lyke calfe two three month olde also lib elephaunt hath sicknesse commeth ventositie winde sicknesse may pisse shite eateth earth dyeth vsed therto somtime swalloweth stone hath also ache ioyntes thereagainst helpeth drink colde water grasse hearbs plunged honie two thing letteth fluxe womb ache sore may sleep sholders must balmed oyle hot water thereby holpe doth swine flesh rosted laied bound shoulder aketh hath yron bodye oyle giuen drinke yron drawen oute drinking oyle may drinke oyle medicine sodden oyle giuen eate also libro saith male body bolde hardie female male tamed beating beaten obedient hunter sitteth vpon hunter lighteth downe fore feete bee bound vntill tame booke littera f followeth able tamed obedient wilde beastes hath wit feeleth colde winter colde winde beast vseth much water riuers dwelleth beside riuers wadeth water vnto chinne swimmeth may dure long swimming heuinesse bodye elephauntes bee without gall aristotle sayeth libro accidentallye cruell fierce bee soone angred wine dronken make sharpe fight battaile also li aristo saith beast lyueth long elephant complection lyke ayre dwelleth needeth goe foale two yeares greatnesse foale may perfectly complete shapen lesse time additiothe elephant foure footed beast next vnto man perseueraunce indian bring warres put great packsaddle backes italy vse great mule girde two chaynes yron steede girts upon saddle place little turret cage made woode euery turret containeth three men betweene turret sitteth indian backe beast speaketh language elephant vnderstandeth obayeth seauen men placed vpon one elephant goe warres armed coates elephant solinus speaketh sayth keepeth course order starres elephant wexing moone goe riuers besprong lycour salute welcome rising sunne certaine mouings may tourne againe woodes landes youthe knowen whitenesse teethe teeth one alway working spared least hee shoulde wexe dull continuall smiting rubbing pursued hunter smite togethers breake longer pursued ye teeth appayred defiled know theyr teethe cause theyr perill gender seldome wash themselues ofte running water tourne againe flock washing bathing fight neuer female knowe spouse breache fight case sull busie helpe hurte wounded middle among defend themselues taken made tame mild barley caue ditche made vnder earth pitfall elephaunts waye vnwares falleth therein one hunter commeth beateth smiteth pricketh full sore another hunter commeth smiteth first hunter doth away defendeth elephaunt giueth barley eate hath eaten thrice foure time loueth defended afterwarde milde obedient happeneth swalloweth worme called camelion taketh eateth wilde olyue tree holpe agaynst venimme wombe softe ridge harde therefore fighteth unicorne putteth foorth backe least sticke horne softe bellye hath lyttle hayre bristelles large eares long thinne hanging downewarde hee reeseth smiteth therewith full sore wrath dragon hee hateth full sore wonder dragon desireth drinke bloud may dragon assaileth neuer elephant full drinke may take plenty weary elephant bloud full moisture within huc v que solo setteth many propertyes plinius rehearseth eodem cap haue read yt phisiologus booke elephant beast passeth foure footed beast quantitie wit minde among doings elephant lie neuer downe sleeping wearye leane tree rest somewhat men lye waite aspy resting place priuely cut tree side elephaunt commeth ware fraud leaneth tree breaketh weight body falleth downe breaking lyeth hee seeth may help himselfe falling cryeth roareth wonderful manner noyse crieng commeth sodeinly many young elephant reare vp olde little little strength might areare wonderfull affection loue bend themselues al might strength elephaunts hate worke lechery onely gender springing sayde vertue loue pricketh elephant inde female goeth eastward male followeth vntill come priuie place female wise gotteth mandragora eateth first fruit therof male eateth oft gendereth shee conceiueth sayd greatnesse foale female beareth long time foale wombe time foaling feedeth nourisheth foale water ilands dread dragon least swallow tender foale lead awaye dam trauaileth foaling male defendeth strength might also said elephauntes bone burnt chase driue away serpent venimous beast also ther another thing sayde full wonderfull sayth among aethiopians country elephantes hunted wise go desart two maydens naked bare open haire head one beareth vessell swoorde maiden beginne sing alone beast hath liking heareth song commeth licketh theyr breast falleth sleepe anone liking song one maide sticketh throate side swoord taketh bloud vessel bloud people countrie dye cloth doe came empire chaunged dauid presbiter iohn without doubte bee reckoned among greatest monarchy age whose dominion stretcheth betweene tropikes red sea almost aethiopike occean describe somewhat dilygently limit empire north side hath aegypt neighbor vnder turkes ye east side stretcheth red sea part gulfe barbary south fenced nature mountain moone ye west limited kingdome manegogue kingdome nubea riuer nilus written limit seemeth comprehend aethiop auncients surnamed vnder aegypt countryes trogloditica cinamoniphera parte innermost affrica region day distinguished many diuerse name table doth shew inhabitauntes call themselues abissmi browne colour christian appeareth letter foresayd dauid written clement seauenth whose manner kinde lyfe religion haue gathered fewe line iourneye booke fraunces aluaretius imprinted italian tongue countrye greate number monestaryes kindes monestaryes men entereth woman liuing creature feminine kinde monkes parte doe fast bread water fiftye dayes among greate scarcitie fish namelye innermost partes lande although riuers full fish yet giue themselues fishing time theyr fast doe scarcelye tast bread onelye liue hearbes among time theyr fast sleepe sitting water vp chin say masse goe procession cross sencers romish apostate doe monkes weare long haire priestes none weare shooes anye shooes laye men canne goe shooes church keepe saturne day sol day holy dayes bee circumcised yea woman lykewise baptised name father sonne holy ghost vntill bee fortie dayes olde liue long dye without baptisme baptised doe receiue present holy eucarist hauing much colde water cast vpon mouth child may easilyer swallow downe name giuen significant saye turned christian religion queene candace whome mention made act apostle assembled together hierusalem content whereof doe studeouslye obserue commen people doe commonly keepe two three wiues without breach lawe according wealth haue keepe church men driue temple also lawefull make diuorce gentleman doe make greate daintie rawe cowes flesh dipped bloud anye broath potage kingdome presbiter iohn vse copper coyne steed thereof way pure vnwrought golde moreouer salt vse onely countryes also almost affrica serueth waye bartering exchaunge presbiter iohn place doth pullishe yron forme pellettes pepper great price amonge whatsoeuer man buy may easilye redeeme countryes haue well neere kinde beastes birdes elephant lyon tygres lynx badger ape parrets hart contrary opinion auncyents denieth affrica breedeth beast namely elephaunt space sixe yeeres yt aluaretius made abode quarter writeth sawe neither beare connie godlefinche cuckoe locustes peculyar mischieuous plague quarter whose number sometimes groweth greate seeme darken skye spoyling nowe prouince manner enimyes deuoute theyr corne haruest feede vpon leaues barkes tree spoyle fieldes oftentimes inhabitant compelled leaue olde dwelling want foode goe place countrye citye called gassumo sometimes seate specified cronicles queene saba saye called maqueda saye moreouer shee sonne king salomon named meilech perswaded citie inhabited queene candaca best reader desirous thing reade fraunces alueretius hath diligentlye set forth thing hee obserued embassage let read also little booke damian agoes touching matter aethiopia hedo cap kidde called hedus hath name edendo eating lyttle fatte flesh good sauoure isidore sayeth libro kindlye drynesse tempered moysture age isaac sayeth dietis kidde better according digestion namelye male flesh nourisheth well breedeth good bloud hath strong heat benefite age therefore kid flesh temperatnesse thereof good wholesome recouereth sicknesse according man kinde namelye liue delicately case rest wooll long rough lambes wooll flesh better obedient digestion temperatenesse thereof moysture heate kidde hath full sharpe sight simple looking looketh aside knoweth seeketh damme bleating plinius sayeth libro capitulo primo sayde lycour eaten helpeth healeth dimnesse eyen called noctilupi also libro cap hee sayth skinnes kiddes healeth venimous bilings bee layde thereto hotte kidde wooll burnt driueth awaye serpentes smell thereof skinnes kiddes bee vsed heale woundes bloud helpeth agaynst venunme ruenning helpeth venimous glew dronke eaten also bloud bull helpeth bee dronke huc vsque plinius mild beast myeth fighteth cheweth cudde cleane ordeined sacrifice olde time skippeth leapeth ful swift fat within fleshie tough leane without eateth gnaweth stalkes twigges braunches loueth specially leaues iuie shrub additiothey bee pastured orchard garden fedde among coppises frith spoyle young springes kill stockes voyde barren soyles best additioto make pomatum mixe goates fat soft fiue apple striped rose sweet water cloues sticked apple put therto camfiri make ointment annoint thy face maketh face faire smooth without spot also cure stopping bloud ye commeth stomacke drinke goat bloud ge fol eruca cap eruca malshrag worme many feetcaterpiller sometime take canker vvorme hath also many feete breedeth cole leaues vine leaues fretteth gnaweth twigges branch fruit flower hath name eruca erodendo gnawing hee gnaweth leaues tree hearbescalled also palmer isidore sayth libro thereof plautus maketh mention sayeth euill beast wicked enimye vine leafe wrappeth himselfe vine leafe cleaueth thereto flieth away hether thether flie doth halfe fedde leaueth leaues malshragge abideth vppon twigges leaues wasteth gnawing biting slow creeping huc vsque isidorus li libro plinius sayeth malshragge rough hairie crop tree hee hath gnawen branch destroyed greines therof weaueth certeine web owne gut spinner doth wrappeth himselfe webbes keepeth shrewd semen winter long hee layeth certeine egges commeth broode kinde springing time tree bourgen multitude tree grieued lose fruit doth iuie tender hearbes malshrag soft worme full matter distinguished diuerse coulours shining starre night hath many coulours foule shaped day without pestilentiall venime creepeth vppon hotte member man hee scaldeth skinne maketh whelkes arise chaungeth shapethe silke vvorme bombax doeth maketh silke eruca loueth shape flyeng worme hee taketh thin wing broade flyeth vp hether thether freely aire many coulours first body many diuersities sheweth priuie winges flieng worme called papilio isidore sayth libro papiliones bee called small fowles bee fruit apple breedeth therein wormes come stinking filth isidore sayeth malshrags commeth breedeth butterflyes durt butterflyes left vppon leaues breedeth commeth againe malshrgges doth lesse harme gnawing fretting flyeth creepeth papias sayth butterflyes bee small flyeng flyes come night lyght kindeled candlesthe flie called miller thombe gnat whereof diuers sort labour quench lyght candle burnt fire candle sometime labor destroy light beast punished hurt bodyes de faunis satiris ca certeine beastes bee called fauni satiri also meruaylous beast wonderouslye shapen hauing lykenesse also shape mankinde bee full perfect reason mankinde indued perfectly natural wit taught speake craft kinde haue beastiall wit stubburne cruell beastiall appetite beast full lecherous insomuch slay woman deede lecherie take walking wood called satiri may haue inough lechery isid saith though beast vse reason mankinde yet bee like mankinde voice manye deed isi saith li de protentis sayth satiri somewhat like men haue crooked nose horne forehead like goat feete saint anthony saw one wildernesse said ked answered anthonie said deadly one dwelleth wildernesse misbeleeued nation deceiued diuers error worship beast bee called fauni satiri incubus satyri called fauni fatui also thinke wilde men isidore sayeth eodem cap wonderfull beast diuerse called cenophali haue head hound seeme working beast rather men called ciclopes haue name one hath one eie middle forehead headlesse noselesse eien shoulder haue plaine face without nosethrilles neather lippes stretch heele therewith face heate sun haue closed mouth breast onely one hole breath sucke pipe veines accounted tonguelesse vse signes beck steed speaking also scithia bee great large eares spreade theyr eares couer bodyes called panchios pan greeke vnderstande eare called ochi greeke aethiopia goe stouping looking ground warde beast may reare themselues vpright called arabice aethiopia haue onely one foote great large yt shadow themselues foote lye gaping ye grounde strong heat sun yet swift yt likned hound swiftnesse running therfore among greek called synodopes also haue sol theyr foot turned backward behinde legges foot toe goe stare desarts libia also scithia bee beast shape men foot horse wonderfull beast called lamine among many men paschasius sayth super trenos isidore reckoneth many beast wonderfully shapen lib hee gathereth taketh plinius libro also solinus additio fauni named poet rusticall god monstrous beast lyke vnto men fanesij people north part world whose eares great couer theyr body femina cap female called femina hath name femur vnderstand thigh part betweene thighes distinction great diuersitie betweene male also female also name commeth fo firie female hath firye vertue whereby vehemently moued loue kinde beast female feruently desirous loue male isidore sayth libro aristotle telleth generall propertyes female libro saith female feeble male except beare leoparde female hardy strong male female light learne taught ye male busie brood young mild looke heereof libr cap de puella thou shalt finde much matter generally female wrathfull male fighteth therfore soone male li aristotle setteth ensample foca beast dwelleth bideth alway one place male striueth female vntill one slaieth female lesse steadfast lesse true owne male otherwise aristotle setteth ensample sepia female smitten male helpeth succoureth male smitten female chaseth also libro aristotle sayeth gendering broode female matter male forme shape commeth semen medling thereof commeth creature therefore say male female bee principall generation male forme shape female matter therfore giuen graunted ye male get gender another female gendereth conceiueth another selfe also generally ye female vnstedfast kinde changeable male commeth feeble heat strong cold humour plenty female male therefore woman also foure footed beast menstrual superfluity hee saith one kinde beast female hath euill much oft woman condition female good euil looke li woman weak yet iracundeus cold yet lecherous men strog lesse vicious hot neere phrensie betwixt greater amitye wanteth superfluitie vesper defence nature generatio fetante cap kinde beast gender go brood called fetans parentes fetans fetantis pecus dis haue one manner meaning sayd holy writ de post fetantes accipit cum fetans hath proper member conceiueth nourisheth beareth brood yt called fetus bringeth forth world dispose bring forth ye brood reuolutions going ye ouer circle heauen influence star worketh helpeth arist sayth lib fine kindly sayth tearme time generation compleat shal reuolutions passing star proces matter looke libro cap de muliere parente c fetu cap fruit brood birth wombe woman female beast called fetus declined fetus tus tui properlye called fetus wombe susteined nourished brought perfect shape lims lyfe isidore sayth libro called fetus yet nourished succoured wombe bagge childe mother commeth childe borne conteyneth called secundina hath name second mother mother childe therein followeth child borne mother dyeth happen anye wise bagge secundina abideth within cometh child fetus female conceiue vse boare child broode haue name called fetose oft ful fetus going child broode isid sayth wombe fetus diuerse namelye sexus diuersitie male female kind goeth kinde hermophroditus one found sexus kindes one male female anye sexe male female alwaye vnperfect isidore saith li fetus broode looke lib treated de homnibus generatione ficario cap one signification ficarius gathereth selleth figges another signification ficarius taken wild man yt liueth figges taken ier said maner dragon shal dwell nice ficarijs glose saith yt bee vnderstood mad men yet another signification fatui ficarij called fauni satiri dwell betweene wilde figge tree tree bee hairy men called onocentauri beast wonderfully shapen isaac speaketh li isidore speaketh li cap de protentis looke booke de faunis called nice figge gatherer beastly madde men though wonderfully shapen yet accord thing shape mankind thing beast passe shape mankind beast called fatui ficarij fareth apis lamijs sirenis meremaidens ficarij haue liuing fruit wild men hath neuertheles fooles lack vse reson therefore letter old booke allowed yt sayth manner cum satuis sicarijs sicarij certain guilfull theeues slew men vnware short swoords aioth slew eglon king fatte short swoorde hung right side swoorde called sica sayde iudicum theeues babylon destroyed place men dwel beast wonderfully shapen hierome sayth super esay might said ficarij additioa chapter small substance de formica cap ant called formica hath name bearing crums graines corne heere ouid speaketh sayth grande opus exiguo formica ore gerentes great worke see ante beare great graines little mouth else hath ye name formica bearing crums graines corne gather biteth ende graines grow sleight businesse much make prouision gather store agaynst time commeth summer gather store may liue winter isidore saith libro gather wheat way barly wheate wet gather heape ant doe wheat sun may dried againe sayde aethiopia ant greatnesse bigge dog shape dogges diggeth vp golden grauell feete keepe taken away pursueth anone death take away isidor sayth li cap de minimis animalibus also solinus speaketh ant sayth ante bee full lyttle bee neuertheles slie busie many great beast make purueyaunce wisely themselues whereby maye lyue time come afterward lyue company make heapes hill inhabit themselues gather greene busily properly put inner closet full waxilye taken away foules spilt shed winde weather maketh priuy wayes euen straight house dwell wiser ant stand way vnwiser goe waye bee ouerset theyr house taken shed venimous water vppon menthey haue sting ye bee smal vvherewith sting therefore commonly sayd yt hee pisieth water burneth hand toucheth breedeth therin itching smarting haue water steed weapon armour huc vsque solinus libr capitulo plinius sayeth ante communeth trauaile seeke gather theyr owne meate bee bee better ante bee make good meate profitable gather doe together ant gather great burthen greater theyr owne bodyes recouer reward littlenesse bodye greatnesse vertue beare theyr charge burthen biting great may beare mouth tourneth busieth drawe forth hinder feete take greate charge common profite haue therefore season winde shale graines togethers shuld growe agayne waxe greene corne gather busily graines shed bee lost entering breake greater grain maye easilye bring place purueyaunce worke night full moone cease worke chaunge moone bring fetch theyr meate diuerse place haue certaine time giuen knowledge gathering meeting among meete manner treating talking busie king spyeng come agayne wayes treade choose wayes yt bee among stone ante small straight wombe though girde middle growe haue winges last flyes chaunge tourne small volatile dy ng wonnes also capitulo sayde indie bee right great ante horne keepe golde precious fiercenesse loue gold aristotle libro speaketh ante sayth ante wit smelling right bee ant hateth stinking thing man besmoketh house ant brimstone wilde origanum harte horne burnt ante forsake leaue maketh purueyaunce time comming much thou art made image god called see blisse art holpen great mystery hast lorde duke leader therefore thou shouldest heere gather fruit thou mightest liue afterwarde
