beckes signes hinde idore sayth libro feeble beast loth fight mula hee sharpe sight swifte course running hinde hideth caues den place bee shadowye teacheth start leape ouer brier thorn bush plinius sayeth libro cap de ceruis looke littera c flesh tender good defie hee oft moouing stirring aboute constantine sayth isaac dietis gelded ere horne grow flesh better temperate drinesse heat saith gelded hath horn chaungeth neuer horne aristotle sayth libro plinius also hart calfe contrary serpent wonderfull wise yt anointed sewet wt bloud shall touched serpent day plinius sayth lib ruening chiefe medicine venims sayth de hirco cap goat bucke called hircus lecherous beast alwaye seruent deede lechery isid saith libr eyen looke thwart ouer lechery ward hath name therefore hirci corner eien sayeth kinde hot insomuch hot bloud softeneth carueth harde adamant stone neyther fire yron may ouercome said goate bucke called also caper hath name capio take bee laboureth take croppes tree goate bucke beginneth bee mooued gender one yeare aristotle sayth li male first gendered great fat bee gendered afterward also libro sayth goate buck haue notable hugenesse eares rammes haue theyr tailes haue bredth breadth hound goate bucke hath long beard small taile long downe earth many strong great horne rough wooll hard stinking smell hath much fatnesse namelye within reines dyeth lightly excepte fatnesse bee withdrawen fat lesse semen hee hath gendereth lesse hee sayth lib hee doeth deede generation seldome therefore wise heardes slayeth ere doe deede generation else suffer bee leane maketh bee leane though hee seeme leane without yet sometime full fat within oft happeneth goat bucke wonderfullye shapen aristotle sayeth libro sometime happened goate bucke seene horne legges wonderfull see among flesh beast flesh goate buckes worst hardest worst defie isaac sayeth dietis namely goat buck right olde skinne olde goat bucke better stronger young odour smell flesh worst hee bee gelded fleshe moyst tender lesse harde defie lesse euill eaten also libro plinius sayth democritus sayeth goate bucke neuer without feauers bloud goat buck sedde iuie breaketh wonderfully stone bledder reines saith horne burnt feareth chaseth away serpent healeth feauers canker fretteth awaye cleanseth polipus superfluitye flesh nose liuer goat bucke helpeth agaynst biting madde houndes gall cleereth sight fretteth awaye webbes cyen vrine meddeled gal helpeth leprous men doth awaye seales scab additiodiuerse author affirme hot bloud goat bucke dissolueth flintstone softnesse de hiena cap hiena cruell beast lyke woulfe deuouring gluttony reeseth dead men taketh sarcasse earth deuoureth therfore hath ye name hiena niando desire reeseth praye open mouth voyce kinde chaunge sexus nowe found male female therfore vncleane beast isidore sayth commeth house night seineth mannes voyce hee maye men thinke man libro cap plinius speaketh beast sayth hiena eyther kinde sayd one yeere mal e another yeere female bringeth furthher broode without male common people suppose aristotle denieth hath necke adder vipera ridge elephaunt may bend beare body heards tel among stable seyneth speach mankinde calleth man owne name renteth hath without feineth oft name man make bound run may take eat beast hath endlesse many manner diuerse colour eyen full moueable eyen vnstedfast shadowe maketh houndes leaue backing still come neere beast hiena goeth thrice anye beast beast shall stint within step beast gendereth lyonesse aethiopia gendereth beast cruell followeth voice men tame beast hath many rowes teeth euery side mouth affrica many hienas manye wilde ass fibre many beast wonderfully shapen plinius sayth beast hiena breedeth stone called hiena man beareth vnder tongue shal vertue stone deuine tell shall befall solynus saythwhen get ye stone also libr plinius sayth hiena hateth pantera sayd theyr skinnes bee hanged togethers haire pantheres skinne shall fall awaye beast hyena flyeth hunter draweth towarde right side occupy trace man goeth hee commeth telleth goeth wit el man falleth horse turne hiena ye beast soone taken magitians tell also sayth beast gall full medicinall helpeth dimnesse eien also witch vse heart beast licour many witchcraft sayd aristo li sayth quantity hiena quantity wolfe neck haire necke horse hath haire vpon length ridge bequileth deceiueth men rauisheth stealeth taketh houndes deuoureth gladly men diggeth burialls graues eateth flesh dead bodyes additioof hyena plinie maketh mention booke chap beast lyke woulfe mane like horse comming night vnto shepheards house counterfeit mannes voyce harkning learne one name call forth end deuoure gesner doubtfull whether beast yet hath set downe author hiricio cap irchin called hiricus hedghoy beast couered prick hard sharpe skinne cloased pike prickes hee cloaseth himselfe therwith defendeth himselfe therewith anone knoweth feeleth anye thing commeth areareth vp prick wrappeth therein clew within armour beast purueyaunce climbeth vpon vine apple tree shaketh downe grape apple bee feld walloweth sticketh prick aud beareth meat young manner wise isi saith li roughnesse sharpnesse prick pike called hirenacius hiricius hath aristotle saith li pike steed haire pi heeleth haire beast weapon armour stingeth pricketh hurteth taketh toucheth also li aristotle saith yt irchins dwell wood place land water lay many egs eaten irchins haue lyttle flesh propertye hee hath beneath head mouth outpassing superfluitye aboue hee taketh meate beaneth hath therefore hoale side superfluity ridge aboue irchin hath fiue teeth within mouth hath amonge teeth fleshy part steed tongue wombe departed fiue part therin much superfluitie manner kind irchins white shell white pike layeth many egges also irchin hath feeble hearing feeble beast hard shell goe foure feete also libro wilde irchins gender standing back turned backe part yt superfluitie passeth touch themselues generation also li said yt often seemeth irchins wit knowing coming wind north south maketh den ground ware windes come sometime one constantinople yt irchin knew warned therby windes shoulde come side none neighbour wist whereby knowledge warning also li sayth irchin hath also many wombes teeth wombes breedeth fiue egges better egges bee much greate lesse bee better seething defieng also li irchins haue little body many pike occupye place bodye cause many great prickes littlenesse body feeding bodye passeth nourishing growing pike scarcity heat meat well defied therfore bodye breedeth much superfluity superfluity passeth nourishing feeding prickes huc vsque arist additio histrix porcapine like vnto hedghog stronger armed prickes bigger bodyed herinacio cap common hedghog herinacius cirogrillus little beast prickes dwelleth den lyke irchin accounted lib cap plinius speaketh sayth hee walloweth vppon apple irchin doeth sticke thereon prickes beareth hallownesse tree beside apple beareth backe alway beareth one mouth hunted cloaseth rounde hall nothing touch pike prickes trusteth scape hee casteth pissing venimous pisse grieueth himselfe first cometh wise back prick moisture pisse back smarteth grieueth also prickes backe fall away therfore knoweth yt thereby sooner taken hee casteth grieue therefore craft hunt little beast vrine spent wasted backe hurt broken prick pike loose fall may flie knoweth smell kindlye vrine strength venim hid spareth therfore vrine doth away sheddeth venim ere last neede taking copell thereto though beast little yet dreadeth constraineth himselfe fast vnneth may opened streighted sauing skinne therofore put hot water openeth himselfe sodeinly hee seeleth heate bounte hanged vp hinder feete hanged slayne hunger otherwise hee maye slaine good manner haue good profite feeble skinne though little body beast full necessary vse mankinde yet skin yt picked needfull men pike prick softnesse flesh beast idle mankinde beast skinnes clothes cleansed picked said beast herinacius hath property yt charged grape apple apple grape fall pike maner wise indignation throweth away backe deale oft turneth agayne tree charge agayne new charge pof iuuenca cap ivuenca iuuencus young steere bullocke able yoaked draw plough isido saith el hath name iuuencus old time young steere offered iupiter bull sayth lecherous beast youth therefore ouerset strong yoke make easie tame pricked pricke compelled follow euen foreright step fore dren iuuenca young steere ofte able coupling ioyning bulles age steere ioyned bull drawe young cowe made fat leese pasture bee slayne batcher diuers vse mankinde hir flesh drye sad ye flesh sucking calues loger without feeding milk tender hot moyst flesh olde oxe olde cow yet neerer age sucking age sayd dietis pof leone cap leon greeke called leo latine king english called leo king king prince beast isid sayth li lion short crispe haire maane lion fight lion haue simple haire mane lion haue sharp fierce hart forheads tailes vertue known best stedfastnes ye head beset hunter beholde earth dread lesse hunter gin beset dredeth noyse rushing wheeles dreadeth fire much sleepe eyen open go forth heale bide fore step hunter finde supposed lion whelpe whelped sleepeth three dayes three night sayd place ye couch trembleth shaketh roring father waketh whelpe sleepeth kinde lion wroth man grieued hurt also mercie known many oft ensamples spare lye ground suffer passe homeward prisoner come thraldome eate man slaye great hunger huc v que isid li li ca plin speaketh lion saith lion gentlenesse nobilite necke shoulder healed haire maane gendered parde lacketh nobilitie lion knoweth smell parde gendreth lionnesse reeseth lionnesse breaketh spousehood punisheth hir full sore except wash hir riuer knowen lion lionnesse whelpeth hir wombe rent clawes hir whelpes whelpeth therfore oft arist saith plin saith lionesse whelpeth first fiue whelp afterward foure yeare lesse one mereth barren whelpeth one last whelpeth whelpes euill shapen small quantitie wesell ye beginning saith also ye whelp vi monthes maye vneth whelped whelp moth may vneth moue lion heaueth leg pisseth houd doth vrine pisseth stinketh right foule ea eth inough afterward meatlesse dayes needeth flye ful casteth vp meate mouth draweth clawes wise light runne flye lion liueth long knowen working wasting teeth age reeseth man vertue might faileth pursue great beast wilde besiegeth city ransack take men lyon taken hanged lyon dread maner paine olde lyon reeseth woodly men onely grunteth woman reeseth seldome child great hu ger tayle boldnesse heart lyon knowen horse knowen eares lion wroth first beateth carthe tayle afterwarde wrath increaseth smiteth beateth owne backe eache wounde lyon maketh clawe teeth runneth sharp sower bloud isido saith also perrill lyon gentle noble pursued houndes hunter lyon lurketh hideth himselfe sitteth fieldes may seene arayeth himselfe defence runneth wood couert swifte running course though would account vile shame lurke hide himselfe hideth himselfe dread hath dreadeth himselfe somtime onely would dread pursueth man beast land leapeth reeseth pursueth man beast vseth leape doeth voydeth flyeth wounded taketh wonderfull heed knoweth smiteth first reeseth smiter though neuer great multitude man shoote lyon chaseth throweth downe woundeth burieth lyon dyeth biteth earth teares fall eyen sicke healed holpe bloude ape dreadeth greatlye crowing combe cocke right kinde beast knoweth loueth doth good sayde ensamples plinius setteth huc vsque plin li ca li arist speaketh lyon saith auicen saith also ye lion hath necke vnmoueable full grimme hath entrailes bowells hound moueth alway first right foote afterward lefte foote camell doth hath lyttle marrow bone bone hard smiting togethers sire springeth thereof also li lyon hath many cleftes feete gendereth therefore blinde whelpes hound doth woolfe also hath sawie teeth gendereth therefore vnperfect whelpes hee sayth solinus also saith lyon dredeth seeth heareth whelpe beaten whelpes borne blinde ye whelpes beast haue feete departed whelped vnperfect gluttonie hideth himselfe high mountaines espieth thence pray seeth pray roareth full lowde voyce beast dred stint sodainly maketh circle taile beast dread passe ouer line circle beast stand astonyed afeard abiding ye hest commaundement theyr king lyon passeth rough place hard clyncheth clawes draweth toward foote vseth steede sword hideth therefore within softe place fleshie hurte made blunt ashamed eate alone pray taketh therefore grace free hart leaueth pray beastes follow farre saith hot complection hath alway feauer quartane hath kindly euill abate fiercenesse flesh passeth heate therefore grieuous eating saieth plin libro flesh good medicine many manner wise greace contrarie venimme anoynted therewith shall dread time biting serpent creeping wormes also greace medled oleo rosaceo keepeth saueth ye skin face wennes vice keepeth whitenes healeth burning swageth swellyng eyen gall medled water sharpeneth cleereth sight helpeth infecting euills falling euills heart taken meate destroyeth feauer quartane huc v que plin li cap lion hunted wise one double caue made one fast seconde caue set whitche cloaseth full soone touched first den caue lambe set lyon leapeth therein hungred take lambe seeeth may breake ye den ashamed beguiled would enter second den lurk falleth cloaseth anone letteth passe thereof keepeth fast therin vntill taken bound chaines till tame toucheth ier super ezech cap super illum locum miserunt cum caueam c additiothe lion among hebrewes sayeth dauid kimht hath diuers name according degree age first name gur second kephir thirde arieth fourth labi last laisch gur signifieth whelp euery beast yet commonly excellency sake put lion whelpe stymnos amog ye greek kephir little elder arieth second chapter naum prophet lyon labi lionesse cepharim young lyon gur lyon whelpe contained one period lion drinketh seldome lyttle lyon sayd watching shut eye sleeping openeth heere vpon auncients paint vpon temple gate lion badge signe one sit vpon lion skinne emeroydes goe pde leena cap lionesse called leena right lecherous beast loueth alwaye deede lecherie therefore cruell lyon namely hath whelpes putteth hir selfe perill death hir whelpes defence shee dredeth spareth shot hunter whelpeth moe whelp first whelping doeth afterward sharpnesse clawes hir whelpes hir mother grieued hurt yeare yeare shee wexeth barren aristotle saith plinius sayeth wise isidore saith lib beast sharp clawes may ofte whelpe ye mother grieued hurt within moouing whelpes therefore lionesse may abide whelping vntill perfect complishment hir young delyuereth hir hir whelpes whelpeth ere hir young perfect complete compelled thereto great ache sorenesse feruent lecherie lyonesse meddeleth lecherie parde deed lechery ye parde dredeth lion ye lyon knoweth fowle medlyng odor smell lyonesse washed spouse breaking riuer ere come lyon plinius saith knoweth guiltie punisheth hir anone therefore flyeth anone commeth hir make first washed lyttle beast lion lionesse dreadeth wonderfully beast called leonzeufones beast beareth certain venime slaieth lion lionesse therefore sayd beast taken afterward burnt flesh sprong ash layd set meeting wayes shall slay destroy lion eate thereof isid sayth lib cap auicen saith lyon beast great gluttonie coueteth desireth much meate deuourer meate therefore without chewing casteth vp therefore meate eateth eateth afterwarde eateth right much heauie meate fasteth afterward space two day two nightes voydeth dirte two day three dirte drye without moysture stinketh right fowle doeth vrine also wombe issueth commeth euill smell cut opened breath stinketh right infectious contagious infecteth thing biting deadly venemous namely woode lyon wexeth wood hound doth arist sayth auicen also cruell wood wroth biteth grieueth selfe indignation wroth gnasheth teeth namely hungreth spieth lyeth awayle take beast passe waye hideth himselfe preuie caues reeseth beast vnware slayeth teeth clawes breaketh member eateth peece meale see come take away pray beclippeth pray grunteth smiteth earth tayle commeth nigh lepeth ouercommeth turneth pray first drinketh licketh bloud beast slaieth renteth haleth deale lim meale deuoureth swaloweth pde leopardo ca leopardus beast cruell gendered perde lyonesse isi saith li plin saieth lion gendreth perdus perde lionnesse gendering commeth vnkinde perdes horse asse mare male asse gendered mule isi saith leopardis full reesing beast head strong thirsteth bloud female cruell male arist saith hath diuers colour parde hath pursueth pray starting leaping running taketh praye third leape fourth stinteth indignatio goeth backward though wer ouer come lyke lyon bodye tayle feete shape head lyke parde lesse body lyon therefore dreadeth lyon maketh caue vnder earth double entering one goeth another goeth caue full wide large either entring narrow straight middle lyon commeth flyeth falleth sodainlye caue lyon pursueth great reese entereth also caue thinketh haue masterie leopard greatnesse body may passe freely middle den full straight leopard knoweth ye lyon let helde ye straight place goeth den forward commeth againe denne side behinde lion reeseth behinde biting clawes leopard hath ofte ye wise masterie lyon crafte strength lesse beast hath ofte masterie strong beast deceipt guyle denne dare reese openly fielde homer saith libro de pugms astucijs bestiarum lib arist speaketh beast called ferculio auicen calleth beast leopardus beast sayth ari called ferculio eateth somtime venemous thing lecketh man dirte eateth therefore hunter hangeth suche dirte uessell tree leoparde commeth tree leapeth vp take dirte hunter slaye meane time thereabout panther doth perdus also sayd ther also plinius speaketh leopard saith somtime leopard sicke drinketh wilde goates bloud scapeth sicknesse wise pde lepore ca hare called lepus leuipes light foote hee runneth swiftly called lago greeke swiftnesse running li isidore sayth euery swifte beast fearefull fighteth hath manner kinde armour wepon onely lightnesse member lims feeble sight beast close eye lid sleeping better hearing sight namely reareth vp eares eares full long pliant needefull defend eyen open defended couering heling keep fro gnat flyes great small noyfull thing kinde giueth remedy creature auicen saieth therefore kinde giueth hare lightnesse pliantnesse limmes swiftnesse course running keep houndes beast pursue kind giueth long eares gnat flyes grieue oft busiy feeble eyen saith kinde giueth much haire vnder feete haire feete maye defende flesh thereof hurting running lyghtnesse thereof wise let feete running therfore arist saith li hare feete hairie beneath seldome seene beast hinder leg loger former needfull reare body flyeth runeth hil harder take runneth downward toward valley shortnes fore leg lownesse fore part body hee falleth soone runneth downe hill may continue euenly course running seeth shall fall runneth flyeth downe hill runneth therefore aside aslont hill side reareth former leg may towarde highnesse hill side ofte beguileth hound pursueth scapeth wise li ca plini speaketh hare sayth many kindes hare quantitie great haire rough swifte course running called cuniculi heere name lepus name hare cony cony called parui lepores small hare feeble dig earth clawes make bower den vnder earth dwell therein bring foorth many rabets multiply right much woodes spain many conic somtime wast destroy corne fielde cause hunger countrey lande rabets loued iland balearitis yt rabets taken eaten men countrie though gut vnneth cleansed followeth ye archelaus author saith manye den increasing cony many yeres haue age bodye many hoales cony haue yeresnot therefore said gender without male haue sex male female therefore many men suppose conie gendereth gendered without male sayth cony plenteous bring forth much breede bring forth one rabet moe anone hath another hir wombe profitable beast meate clothing many maner medicine ruenning helpeth agaynst venime stancheth flixe wombe bloud abateth ache smarting eyen plinius sayth dioscorides also beast teeth either iawe ruenning found hare arist saith elder ruenning better plinius saith additiohare conie maketh grose bloud dryeth stoppeth conie maketh better pure nourishing sooner digested hare well proued ther meat wholsome cleane firmelye temperatelye nourisheth rabets pde lince cap linx lincis beast hath name accounted among kinde wolues beast like woolfe backe diuersly spekled parde vrine changeth tourneth precious stone called ligurius precious stone also called linx lincis beast linx hath enuie sorie tourne vse mankinde hideth vrine vnder ground hee pisseth sooner hard turneth stone plin saith li ca isid pde limace cap limax worme slyme hath name limax breedeth slime slime therefore alway foule vncleane isid saith lib verye slowe worme moouing beareth harde shell backe closeth therein horned worme hath two small horn mouth feeleth grieuous thing draweth horn anone shell closeth himselfe shell within house wormes gendered principally corrupt aire raine hee creepeth though slow pace commeth vp top tree biteth gnaweth bud fruite thereof euer creepeth slydeth leueth glemy froth strake vncleannesse additioin italy vse eate snailes custome vsed england phisitions haue made many beleeue well cleansed salt vineger sallet restoratiue snake good whence one custome eaten pde lupo cap woolfe called lupus hath name isid sayth leopos hath vertue feete lyon hath treadeth feete liueth rauenous beast desireth coueteth bloud slayeth may finde woodes rauine husbandman speake say man leeseth voyce woolfe seeth first therefore man sodainly still leaueth speake sayd lupus est fabula woolfe tale certainly know seene first leeseth boldnesse hardinesse fiercenesse yeare wolues deed generation xii day may dure hunger long time deuoureth much long fasting aethiopia wolues haire maanes necke speckeled haue manye diuers colour lacke manner colour telleth huc vsque isid li cap plin saith saith also wolues affrica slender lyttle bred colde country landes lesse body sharpe fierce libro secundo arist saith indie woolfe hath three rowes teeth aboue hath feete like lyon face man tayle scorpion voyce wer man voyce dreadfull trumpe beast swifte harte right fierce cruell eateth men also libr aristo saith time generation wolues full cruell fierce worse haue whelpes female hound also lib wolues haue sawie teeth eate flesh grasse sicke eate grasse hearb medicine woolfe feeleth himselfe full seeketh certaine hearbe eateth maye cast vp hath eaten also li flye beare whelpes eate origanum hearb margeru chew go den whet sharpe teeth therwith also saith woolfe full euill beast eateth resteth much hath hunger full hardie loueth well playe childe maye take slayeth afterward eateth ye last homer saith wolfe full wakefull beast flyeth sight fire said woolfe stoned taketh heed throweth first stone stone grieueth pursue hurt grieueth may take throweth stone doeth much harme harme doth wrath leueth last elder wolues worse greue men may hunt beast olde reason vange teeth weked liue long time age woolfe perceiued teeth constrained age ther saith double manner kinde wolues wer round long rough haire thicke bolde hardie hart entrailes wolues right feeble take soone corruption wounded deale bodie suffereth many stroke hath great strengthe necke head also woundes theyr biting euill venimme commeth wound heled biting mad hound aristo saith also lib saith yt woolfes mouth openeth wide hath stregth mouth beast great glutton deuoureth much also li auicen speaketh woolfe saith woolfe desireth kindlye eate fish eateth fish fisher throw net hee findeth nothing eate fisher leaue goeth net breaketh renteth phisiologus speaketh wolues saith vertue strength breast clawes mouth lest hinder part woolfe may bend neck backward month yere maye alone thundereth hath cruell warinesse hee taketh pray meate nigh ye place nourisheth whelpes hunteth place far thence goeth night folde take pray goeth winde hound smel hapneth wise foote maketh noyse treading vppon thing chasteth foote hard biting eyen shine night lanternes solinus saith beareth taile locke haire exciteth loue doth away teeth dreadeth taken woolfe dreadeth greatly stone man take two stone smite togethers woolfe looseth boldnes hardinesse flyeth away noyse stone commeth hearing woolfe whelpeth blinde whelp loueth nourisheth full tenderly eateth earth sore hungred findeth none praye hideth grasse bush shrub leaues rauish take goates gather leaues crop tree deceiueth sheepe guile wrench might strength hath mastery suffered biteth slayeth flocke part may deuoure burieth hideth vnder earth diggeth taketh vp part agayne hungred infecteth wool sheepe slaieth maketh cloth lowsie made wooll isidore saith also arist saith kinde wolues contrarie aduersarie kinde sheepe haue read booke string made wolues gutproued rare vvonderful secret put among harp string made gut sheepe destroyeth corrupteth eagle fethers put among culuers pilleth gnaweth lefte together long one place saith looke de aquila de mulo cap mule called mulus hath name molendo grinding vnder yoke baker draweth milstones isid saith libro iewes tell ana esau nephew made first ass mare haue first kinde kinde mule bred gendred saith therefore mule followeth kind mare asse fairer swifter slow fouler lesse horse mule barren beast neuerthelesse noble beast trauaile plinius saith lib ca beast mare asse desire neuer gender together except together youth sucke togethers coltes therefore heards put set coltes sucke ass asse colt sucke mare haue beast gendered betweene beast diuers kinde saith also saith wine drinking forbidden ye mule wilde ass mare swifte mule gendred hard feete able runne haue great riuells body wilde heart neuerthelesse gentle gendered betweene wild asse mare passe libro septimo aristotle speaketh mule saieth water mule drinketh good meate doth also li mule hath gall openlye seene vpon liuer also lib saith mule gendered betweene asse mare gendereth kinde either asse mare colde coldnesse sire dam hath masterie mule gendered therefore mule barren nothing gendred seede reason passing colde hath mastrie also sayd hapneth body mule great huge menstruall superfluitie passeth nourishing feeding body bloud needeth kinde passeth vrine therefore ye male mule smell vrin ye female mule beast haue houes deale superfluitie passeth increasing greatnesse body therefore female mule conceiueth hap full selde male mule hot male kind gendreth somtime country land hap gendereth straunge occasion yt gendred betweene horse asse worthye one barren gendered kind huc v que arist li isaac dietis saith mule flesh worse nourishing defieng ass flesh dirt stamped burnt stauncheth bloud tempered vineger dioscorides saith dirte helpeth stinging scorpion saith additio musmoue kinde great sheepe white somtime bred north iles scotland hector boetius affirmeth bignesse bucke horned round bending forme betweene sheepe goate strong swifte read gesner addition fol de mure cap mouse called mu little beast isido sayeth hath name humus earth breadeth gendered humor earth earth called mu humus also lyuer beast wexeth full moone lyke certaine fish sea increaseth waneth againe waning moone mouse called sorices also fret gnaw thing saw huc vsque isid lib libro septimo arist saith mouse drinketh drinketh dyeth gluttonous beast therefore beguiled little meate smelleth taste thereof vrine stinketh biting venemons vrine contagious also taile venemous accounted also lib cap plinius speaketh mouse saieth mouse wittie gather meate dennes hide themselues dennes winter time palate perfect taste also nose smell haruest male female gather corne charge eyther vppon wombe male draweth female charged taile hir denne dischargeth hir layeth vp stuffe place denne goe againe trauaile gather eares corne male layeth himselfe owne backe female chargeth taketh taile hir mouth draweth home denne beare burthen charge chaunge course ste time also saith mouse diuers maner kind mouse liueth house field bank brim water depart yeare atwaine sleeping sleepe halfe yere glires doe certaine maner mouse plin saieth though mouse full grieuous noyfull beast yet many thing good profitable medicine plin saith lib cap ash mouse honye oyle dropped eares doth away ache griefe worme entreth commeth chiefe remedie gall mouse tempered wt wine dropped warme eares dioscorides sayth mouse durt brused vineger cleanseth euill allopicia keepeth sa falling haire also durt stamped wine taken drinke softneth wombe wonderfully skinne laid heele heleth saueth kybes wound therefrom additiomany kindes mouse gesnes depressed field mouse farie long snoute sleeper un coulour runne edge sword sleepe vpon payne de mustela cap wesell called mustela called long mouse isi saith li long called telon greek beast hath guileful wit nourisheth hir kittons house beareth place place chaungeth place dwelling hir neast found wesell pursueth chaseth serpent hateth eateth mouse wesels double manner kinde one dwelleth woodes greek call lo da goeth house opinion false mean wesells conceine mouth kitneth eare isid saith li wesell enemie sparowes lyeth awaite small birdes swalloweth vp egges wesels kitten fall hap chin pit hurt dead wesell heleth certain hearb reareth death life pli saieth eateth rewe bawmeth hir selfe iuyce thereof reeseth cockatrice assaileth slaieth without dred boldly pli saith li ca said vertue wesells death cockatrice god kinde nothing without help wesell knoweth soone cockatrice goeth den slaieth beast sleepeth much wexeth fat sleepe mouse doe called glires saith also li ca saith ye wesell double kind fame wilde either hath gall yt helpeth much adder preuie chose stinketh right foule stinking thing contrary adder serpent meane flesh helpeth venim wesel burnt ash helthfully done medicine helpeth litargie ye sleeping euill man fall litargy sleeping euill venimme adder ash wesel tempered drop water dissolueth destroyeth ye strength might ye sleepe saith ther said ye pouder helpeth fester kind yt mother gendreth nothing without great cause sayd li arist saith yt wesell fighteth serpent either eate mouse swift beast mouing pliant body full slipper vnstable wise smell hath red white wombe changeth coulour country somtime ye yeare skinne white except tayle biting malitious venemous sodeinelye settle vppon souldiers great vyolence neither driuen backe heat fire ouerthrow sayd straunge fierce beast souldiers slaine sauchenets sword time quite marred much adoe length beast deadly phisiologus speaketh saith daye march beast roareth twelue time day oft night roaring euennesse day night knowen among affrikes saith alwaye roareth manye time daye houres day also night woode men mountaines affrica bee many wild ass number roaring account diuersitye day night beast wise wittie enuious smelling feruent loue wolteth female hee goeth styeth vppon high rocke openeth nosethrillrs old age chosen sacrifice verily haue name two strouting teeth yaned li aristotle speaketh sheepe saith conceiue yane vntil yeare li sheepe conceiue toward northen wind conceiue male conceiue toward ye southern winde conceiue female veines bee vnder sheepes tongue colour lambe yaned look de agni ariete whe old sheep moued generation certeine time ordeined shepheards say good signe young sheep moued tell yt betokeneth pestilence among sheep yeere also libro aristotle sayth sheepe conceiue drinking water therefore heardes giue salte eate make drinke conceiue faster keepe safe whole without kind sicknesse also haruest giue cucurbita gourde hearbes salt make much milke teates sheepe conceiue tilles salt sheepe fast three day cate afterward ware soone fat colde water north good summer warme water ye south good haruest meat helpeth end daye night farre wayes long trauaile waxe leane heards know maye dure winter vpon found ise vppon ise founde bee seeble may shake ise sheepes flesh yt nourished watry place euill flesh foure footed beast bee nourished place right moyst watry haue long tailes maye worse away winter haue broade tailes haue litte wooll crispe may worst away winter wooll sheepe wolfe eateth infected cloth made thereof lousie also libro saith sheep lesse wit vnderstanding another foure footed beast thunder greeueth one abide alone euentide may happen shall cast lambe dread also li ca plinius sayth thundering maketh solitary sheep cast lamb remedy helpe thereof gather bring together one flocke looke booke littera treateth de ariete agno additioof sheepe wooll singular benefit common wealth especially cotsell wooll finenesse bartholmes time staple wooll well husbanded hath bene since increase pasture sheepe hath much decreased tillage corne vntill restored againe wil grow poore common wealth sheepe deerer wooll flesh fell moe sheepe deerer corne graine beside beefe butter egges cheese pasture consumes tillage want tillage breedes beggar decayes village hamlet vpland townes better want wooll corne sheepe men excesse prodigalitie cannot away measure hath brought england great penurie espyed wanteth wanting espied much lesse regarded de panthera cap panthera isidore sayth libro hath name hee friende beastes saue dragon hee hateth full sore hath ioye lyking beastes owne kinde maketh hee taketh one lykenesse panthera greeke vnderstande beast painted small rounde speckle skinne without seemeth full eyen diuersitie speckle blacke white red sayeth isidore saith beast whelpeth cause thereof openly knowen whelpes waxe strong dammes wombe strong come world hate damme rent wombe claw ye womb letted whelping comming worlde therefore damme letteth passe whelpeth constrayned compelled sore greeuance wombe therefore plinius sayth beastes sharpe clawes maye oft whelpe whelpes mooue within hurt damme huc v que isidore libro phisiologus speaketh panther sayeth hateth dragon dragon flieth hath eaten inough full hideth denne sleepeth continuallye nigh three day riseth three dayes crieth mouth commeth right good aire sauour passing measure sweete sweetnesse beast follow dragon feard heareth voyce flyeth den may suffer smell thereof faileth himselfe looseth comfort thinketh smell verye venime libro cap plinius speaketh panthera sayth panthera tigre bee dressed diuers speckle diuers coulours beastes ioye theyr owne coulours lyon siria blacke white speck like panther foure footed beast haue liking beholde diuerse coulours panthera tygres fearde horriblenesse theyr head therfore hide head toll beastes fayrenesse deale body take come tolled eate though right cruel beast yet vnkind helpe succour anye wise plinius setteth ensample one delyuered holpe vppe panther whelp fallen ditch panther lead wildernesse glad assemblance fawned thanked right busily seemed de perdo cap perde called perdus isidore sayth swift beast many diuers coulours rounde speckes panther reeseth blend dyeth leaping varyeth panther panther hath moe white speckes sayth plinius libro also libro aristotle sayth perde sicke eateth mannes durt medicine hunter hang durt tree goeth vp hunter slay lecherous gendereth lyonesse bastard generation commeth leopardus looke de leena perde cruell whelp stolen glose saith super ose de pilosis cap pilosi glose meaneth super esay beast wonderfully shapen lykenesse men called wilde men lib cap isidore sayth pilosi called pauide greeke incubus latine inuij ineundo man going sometime beast haue name incubus incumbendo dooing deede generation oft couet woman ouer measure deede lecherye men call deniones galliducij manner fiend oft doe vncleannesse one called iucubouis romanes call one faunum ficarium also papias sayth pilosi called panites greeke incubus latine shape beginneth men likenesse endeth lykenesse beastes vtter parte glose sayth super esay another glose saith pilosus ape beast wonderfully shapen rough hairie shapen man many pointes looke heereafter de simia de pigargo cap pygargus roe buckepigargus cleane beast meate said deutro horned beast goat bucke lesse hart greater goat bucke like beast yt called hircoceruus much lesse looke wtin de tragelapho hircum siluestre cheweth cud goat buck cloue footed hart wilde beast great switnesse dwelleth wood desart hugution saith pigargus little lowe bird name commeth pige lownes deut taken foure footed beast yt like beast called hircocemus glose meaneth name pigargus hath aspiratio first silable shall written h men write phigargus doe amisse knowen bookes dilligently corrected de pigmeis cap pigmei little men cubite long greekes call pigmeos dwell mountaines inde sea occean nigh papias sayth austen sayth wisethe cubit day yt least tvvo foote pigmei bee vnneth cuibite long bee perfect age thirde yeare waxe old seauenth yere said fight crane lib ca plinius speaketh pigmeis sayth pigmei armed yron ouercome crane passe theyr bound dwell temperate land vnder merrye parte heauen mountain north side ye fame crane pursue pigmei armed ride goat buck arowes springing time gather hoast come sea destroye egs bird might strength doe voyage three moneths except crane increase many pigmei shuld withstand make house dwell feather pen crane shell egges sayth saith also aristotle meaneth pigmei lyue dennes additioall later writer affirme true vttermost mountaines indie de porco cap swine called porcus spurcus vile defiled isid saith li sroteth walloweth durt fen diueth slime fouleth himselfe therewith resteth stinking place horatius sayth sowe friend fen myrye place therfore swine accounted foule vncleanly call bristice swine seta latine shoomakers call bristle sow therewith saith swine tame wild among tame male called boares barowes called verres latine haue great might strength female called sowes sue latine digge wrote seeke meate vnder earth wild male swine bee called bore apri latine fierce isidor saith lib cap plinius speaketh swine sayeth farrowed toothed male gender passing three yeere swine dieth leeseth eie swine may liue yeares yeres swine haue many sickness hold head aside sicke wallowe fenne puddle lye right side lefte side waxe fat fortye dayes fat sooner suffer hunger three day beginning feeding swine loue knowe others voice therefore crie cry labour helpe might tame swine knowe owne house home learne come therto without guide loadsman hee sayth grunt going lieng sleeping namely right fat swine sleepe faster may othertimes yere commeth fumosity stoppeth braine time summer though great resolution humour greate wasting thereof drieng passing heat summer great generation fumositie yt cause sleepe therefore sleepe summer doe springing time auicen sayth haruest winter humour sad fastened togethers coldnesse aire compasseeth without therfore fumosities resolued time passing cold fastneth humour body hee sayth libro secundo aristotle sayeth swine swine chaunge theyr teeth male hath teeth female also libro aristotle sayth boare leapeth sow eight moneths sowe farroweth one yeare boare gendereth within first yeare full feeble also boare hath vsage gendereth first one sow pigges second sowe fewer number lesse body young sow farroweth first pig shall haue small bodyes sow bee right fat milke scarce farrowing pigges bee farrowed winter best bee farrowed summer worst gendered youth bee better gendered age boare fat may gender euerye time day night namelye earely morow tide libro sow farroweth shee giueth first pigge first teate desireth deede lecherie suffereth male leap vppon vntill eares hang downeward barly full good meate swine shall gender namely sodden also lib swine haue three manner euillsthe dizei ill one called brancos postume eare iawe oft foot lousie mad flesh place corrupt corruption passeth flesh nigh thereto vntill come lung stuffeth spirit swine dieth euill increaseth sodeinly swine heards know first euil cutteth member yt euill may healed without cutting swine haue another euill ach heauinesse head euill part swine die another disease haue fluxe wombe hath vnneth remedy slaieth three day swine great doth good eate beryes also bathing hot water delighteth let bloud veine vnder tongue also diuers meat fatteth swine meate maketh swell gendereth flesh greace fatnesse hog male female haue liking eate akornes tempereth flesh sowes eate much thereof maketh cast theyr pigges maketh sheepe cast theyr lamb many thing aristotle telleth looke de apro looke de sue additiothe flesh wilde swine much better wholsomer stirring fro flesh tame swine de pediculo cap lowee called pediculus worme skinne hath name pedibus feete isido sayth lib grieueth skinne feete creeping hee doth biting gendered right corrupt aire vaporous sweate betweene skinne fleshe pore constantine sayth viatico oft sayth louse nit gender head skinne come purgation kinde casteth maketh fast betweene flesh skinne vpon place expositours say louse gender sanguine humour red great fleumatike humour softe white cholarike humour citrine long swifte sharpe melancholike humour bee couloured ash bee leane slow moouing great multitude louse bodye right full corrupt oft token general corruption morphea lepra hee sayeth grieuing louse oft slowe fayleth colde time summer time wereth nimble swift though bee accounted among beast gendred knowen among beastes medling male female yet multiplyeth owne kinde breeding neetes breede certeine neets themselues commixion comming neets many flea come one flea flea bred white chaungeth sodeinelye blacke coulour desireth bloud biteth pearceth therefore stingeth flesh hee sitteth sucketh unicorne layeth thereon head leaueth fiercenesse sleepeth wise taken beast without weapon slaine dart hunter huc vsque isidorus libro rinocerot one vnicorne gregory super iob moralibus saieth heereto name noise crieng voice cryeth greedely maketh much noyse marreys bred isidore sayth libro cap tercio de piscibus frog water frogges bee moore marreys bee called rubete spoken littera byde buphone called calamite dwell among reed called calamus among shrub reedie place little greene dumbe without voice called agredule small frog dwell lande water haue therefore name agredule ther manner frog maketh hound still dombe commeth mouth many men deny isidore sayeth libro libro quarto aristotle saith frogge hath owne tongue part tongue ioyneth mouth though bound thereto vtter part tongue fish though hinder part inner tongue bee loose slacke toward wosen therefore frog hath owne voice voyce called coax maketh voice onely water properly male time loue crieth female euery beast hath voyce crieth time loue frogge multiplyeth voyce doth neather iawe deale water striketh vpper iawe strength stretching two iawes eyen shineth candle namelye night gendereth night day fish nourisheth feedeth brood except frogge saith li first shapen water frogge seemeth head manner string hanging wer taile afterward spread abroad manner womb taile away groweth feete shapen turned foure footed beast al frog except toad rubeta moue passe leaping going olde rubeta leapeth seld frogge watry moorish crieng slimie great womb speckled vnder venimous abhominable therefore men hated water land liueth de salamandra ca salamandra isidore sayth libr cap like ewt shape neuer seene great raine fayleth faire wether song crieng quencheth fire hee toucheth ise doth water frore mouth commeth white matter matter touch man body haire shall fall toucheth corrupt infected tourneth foule coulour also salamandra manner kind ewt lisard pestilent beast venimous plinius sayeth libro cap salamandra infecteth fruit tree corrupteth water eateth drinketh thereof slayne anone spittle touch foot infecteth corrupteth man body though venimous yet beast eate steed meate beast onely salamandra liueth fire saith quencheth fire certain kind salamandra hath rough skinne hairy skin sea sele skinne bee sometime girdle made vse king girdle full olde throwne fire harmelesse without went purged renued skinne tongue bond made lampes lanternes neuer corrupt burning fire looke de anguium diuersitate thou shalt finde worme additiosalamander beast figure like lisard full spottes fire quencheth burned de sanguisuga ca water leeche called sanguisuga water worme hath name loueth sucketh bloud lieth wait vpon drink falleth iaws cleaueth place sucketh drinketh bloud hath dronke ouermuch casteth againe sucketh newe bloud yet againe isidore sayth lib worme part browne colour distinguished deale red strake soft body euenlong plyaunt mouth three cornered mouth pipe sucketh bloud sitteth vppon venimous thing therefore shall bee set member medicine first shal wrapped nettle salt thereby compelled cast body haue tasted venimous thing warme water hot time applieth setteth himselfe soone member sucke horse leech de stellione cap lisard called stellio hath ye name owne colour litle beast painted back shining speck star ouid speketh saith yt hath name according colour hee hath diuerse shining speck body shine star isidore sayth lib saith lisard contrarye scorpion scorpion dread leese comfort see lisarde li plin saith lisarde liueth dew though fayre beast faire painted yet right venimous plinius sayth shadowye looketh aside forthright stingeth also aside teeth dented inwarde crooked bendeth smiteth serpent hideth lepra eaten heale euill yt knowne vseth turne wind te tongue moueth alway stregth taketh againe venim hee casteth de simea cap ape called simea greeke hath name flat nose call ape simie bee flat nose foule riueled face call simeas giue name lykenesse reason many thing counterfeiteth deed men false isi saith li sayth ape haue knowledge element sory full moone merie glad new moone ye ape hath two whelp beareth yt loueth best hir armes shoulder beset must need flie may beare whelp compelled throw away yt bare armes charged sitteth shoulder slow run flye therfore ye sooner taken ye hunter ape manner kind saith haue tailes ther ape tailea munky babicu marme se ape called cluna amog men called cenophe like hound face body like ape also called spinge rough hairie strouting pap teat forgetteth soone wildnesse sati pleasing face merrye mouings playengs resteth little bee called calatrices vnlike ye nigh manner point face long beard haue broad taile isidore saith plin saith li cap saith yt kinde ape next man shape diuerse distinguished tailes labour wanderfully busily thing see oft sh themselues shooes hunter leaue certeine place slily taken sooner would fasten thong shooe wold put ye shooe feete see ye hunter doe bee oft taken hunter ere may vnloose shooes deliuered also plinius saith ther kind ape loue wel whelp tame ape house sheweth whelpes whelpeth men therein haue liking stroked knoweth comforteth pleaseth maketh good cheere huc v que plinius eod li cap saith indie bee ape white ye body ape hunted taken beares inde aud li auicen saith ape accordeth shape man haire wolfe ape haue euil maners tatches teeth hound teeth haue malitious biting namely haue tailes rough hairie except face haue teeth man haue thing man reddish eyen sharpe pap teat breast handes feete finger toe may goe steppe two feete haue sol theyr foot man hath hath beast except man namelye foure footed beast aristotle saith ye female ape like woman priuye chose male yarde like hound yarde entrailes like man entrailes huc vsque auicenne aristotle saith yt foure footed beast commeth man kinde ape rehearseth ye foresaid likenesse ape beast wonderfully shapen hath likenes mankind learned taught taught leape play diuers manner wise vntamed beast malitious kinde tamed chastised violence wt beating cheines refrained clogge may runne freely owne abate fiercenesse outrage ape safeth manner meat vncleane thing therefore seeketh looketh wormes men head throweth mouth eateth lion loueth ape flesh eating therof recouereth said sore sicke isido plinius meaneth looke de leone littera l de sirena cap mermaid called sirena hec siren sirenis sea beast wonderfully shapen draweth shipmen peril sweetnes song noune sirena commeth iren yt vnderstand draught drawing hugue saith glose saith super esa g sirene serpentes creastssirene svvift course water yt vvhatsoeuer commeth vvithin ye violence carryed avvay men say fish sea likenesse woman papias sayth sirene great dragon flieng creasts men suppose isidore saith li hee breateth wonder wise men feine yt ther three sirenes sou de maiden deale fowles claw wing one geth voy another pipethose harpie feyned third harpe please shipmen song drawe perill shipwracke truth strong whoores ye drewe men passed pouertie mischiefe feined brought shipwracke isidore lib saith arabia serpent wing called sirene run swiftly horse doe flye also sayd flye wing theyr venimme strong death self sooner ach sore phisiologus speaketh sirena sayth beast sea wonderfully shapen maid nauell vpward fish nauell downeward wonderfull beast gladde merie tempest sadde heauie fayre weather sweetnesse song beast maketh wherein kinde resemblaunce fa e proportion de scorpione cap scorpion isidore sayth libro lande wo crooked thing tayle hath name scorpio greeke stingeth tayle sheddeth venimme wound propertie euer h neuer palme hand sayth maner scorpion commeth sco te sweet feine feineth pleasance likenesse worme scorpion bush thornes brier knotted braunches roddes called stinging also signe heauen called scorpio sunne signe wee feele first stinging colde therefore horace sayth maturina parum tunc cautos frigora ledunt morow cold grieueth litle also arow venimed called scorpio commeth bow vnto man hitteth sheddeth venim cause hath name scorpio al said vearse following scorpius est signum vemusque sagitta flagellum effect vearse saith plin li ca speketh scorpion saith bring forth small wormes shapen egges breedeth feruent right pestelentiall venim serpent venim scorpion noieth greeueth three dayes full sore afterward flaseth soft death holpen succoured sooner ye scorpion smiteth maiden death stroke smiteth stingeth woman also smiteth men soone grieueth noieth morow tide yt finde theyr wayes coeout den happeneth yt shed venim smiting scorpion taile alway redy smite sting ceaseth momet greeuing noieng haue occassion cause hee stingeth smiteth slon sheddeth smiting white venim apoderus author describeth many maner greeuous scorpio double colour haue sting among scorpion male bee grieuous namely time loue scorpion smaller longer venim greeuous little midst daye great feruent heate sun also thirst haue certeine knot riuells taile mo haue venim worse haue sometime knot sixe seuen apolodius meaneth yt affrica scorpion haue feather bee full greeuous winning inchanters gathereth venime diuers land labour beare winged scorpion italy may liue vnder heuen within country italy scorpion bee sometime seene italy greeuous scithia smite blacke swine die soone bath water afterward man smitten ye scorpion ash scorpion burnt dronke wine remedy also scorpion drowned oile helpeth succoureth beast bee strong scorpion scorpion hurteth beast hath bloud scorpion breed bring forth leauen young scorpion sayd scorpion eateth sometime one flie leapeth thigh scorpionesse sitteth safe sure stinging taile biting mouth slaieth hee worketh death young kinde ordeineth prouision pestilentiall kinde multiply much huc vsque plinius libro aristotle lib sayth scorpion doe eate venimous thinges haue worse venime dragon doe eate scorpion bee worst stinging scorpion bee manye remedyes sayde libro de venenis perfectly treated additioin italy manye scorpion much lyke cricket browner venimous hanteth clifts post bed quicke running de sue cap sow called sus hath ye name subigendo vnder wroting digging routeth diggeth earth get meate foode ouerturneth wrouteth shee may come teeth moore root plinius saith li cap young sow conceiueth euennesse day night springing time sarroweth sometime pig may reare bring vp eateth sometime except first loueth best cometh first wombe kindlye shee giueth alwaye first seat plinius sayth solinus aristotle li meane sow vncleane beast right greate glutton eateth deuoureth gluttonously manner stinking thing vncleane couereth desireth bath fennes puddle eth hir selfe therin waxeth fat aristotle saith lib waxeth fat namely resting seuenth part meat turneth haire bloud sow waxeth leane yt hath farrowed meat eateth turneth milke pig bee nourished fed sowe waxeth fierce cruell hath pigges fighteth putteth selfe peryll pigges agaynst woulfe looke property sayde beast littera p de porco booke littera de apro bee largely treated spoken diuerse thing de tauro cap bull called taurus neither roother gelded isid saith taurus nowne greeke bos also hee sayeth libro bulles indie red swifte cruell haire turned contrarywise bull bendeth necke owne putteth dartes shot hardnesse backe fierce ouercome tyed vnder figge tree hee looseth leaueth fiercenesse sodeinelye sober softe isidore sayth libro looke de ficu littera f proud beast headstrong strength necke horne powle plinius speaketh bull libro cap saith gentlenesse bull knowen sight sterne face ful eares horne shape disposed fighting al manace standeth forefoot diggeth earth throweth vp among beast vseth specially casting throwing earth comforteth therewith saith aristotle lib saith bull hath round liuer lyke man lyuer eateth alone time generation loue hee commeth company kine saith lib fighteth strongly also codem bull fatted grasse hearbes corne breedeth ventositie also fatted pesen beanes thou doest cut slit skinthat vvhen hee hidebound cloung areare somewhat flesh blowing pipe giuest afterwarde eate fatteth made fat sweet meat fig grape reysons also lib septimo bulles contrary manner horse couet drinke water colde cleere also libr sayde bulles doe fight theyr kine hath ye mastry victor leapeth female faint feeble much dooing deed generation yt ouercome commeth fighteth hath mastry leapeth female making ioy mastrie bull vse worke generation one yere perchance month kine looke within following booke de vacca littera v bull bee gelded fierce proude haue lost theyr gendring stone soft female mild fight waxe bodye fattenthen called ox made milde soft yoke plough look within littera v de vitulo castrato also lib fine saide bulles haue stronger sinew string brawnes ox gelding bers body soften therfore hart ye bul oftentimes bone foud heart hart also pli li cap saith bull wilde fierce sterne quatitie greatnesse bull swifter bulles red coulour bleew eies hauing theyr haire ouerturned groweth towards eye haue mouable horne moueth one another fighting haue ridge backes hard flint may wounded hunteth wild beast may taken deepe pit caues alway fierce bee taken destroy themselues die indignation de tragelapho cap tragelaphus called hircoceruus also hath name tragelaphus tragos yt goat bucke elephos hart isid saith lib called tragelaphi among ye greek kind hart haue rough eares goat buckes rough chin beard aristotle li speaketh sayth wild beast haue crooked horne hircoceruus yt called tragelaphus also hath sol foot body waxeth quantity hart beast beareth downeward face hath horne lyke vnto hart calfe additio tragelaphus whose name common like goate bearded horne bending compasse goat headed ram forehead ear white sheepe sauing brest blackish bending necke deere learned haue named beast tragelaphum beast wholsome eate ye hide horne sundrye purpose gesner supposeth kind deerein folio appendix addition remnant collection de talpa cap mole called talpa little beast somewhat like vnto mouse beast isidore speaketh libr saith damned euerlasting blindnesse darknesse without eyen hath snowte swine diggeth therewith earth casteth vp diggeth gnaweth eateth more rootes vnder earth hateth sunne flyeth lyght may liue aboue earth hath blacke skinne hairie softe smooth short legges broad footed deuided parted toe hound arist speaketh mole wise euery beast gendereth beast like himselfe hath eyen except mole hath eyen seene without slitteth skinne subtilly warely shall finde within fore eyen hidden men suppose skinne breaketh anguish sorow beginneth dye beginneth open eyen dieng cloased lyuing heereto plin saith lib cap mole heareth better healed earth thicke element deafe kinde heare man speake voydeth flyeth far awaye additiothe mole want hath eye small wherewith seeth end maye leaueth open earthing somtime come far thece taken recouer de taxo cap badger grayethe brocke called taxus melus also beast quantitie foxe skin full hairie rough called also melota glose saith vppon worde circuerunt melotis c ebre beast called taxus melota also plin lib cap saith beast wit slight holdeth breath blowing stretcheth skinne holding brethings hunted chased hunter dogges finde sleight maner strouting skin eschew put biting hound pursue follow noye also slay like wise put smiting ye hunter beast know tepest shall fal maketh therfore den vnder earth diuers entrings northerne winde bloweth stoppeth north entring rough taile letteth stande open south entring chaunging hoales winde altereth den make prouisions gather store meate winter somtime lacke meate take sleepe steede meate saith bee kinde beast hide themselues winter liue parte sleepe sayd mouse phisiologus saith maner kinde brockes gather meat female winter laieth vp den cold winter commeth male dreadeth least store meate faile refraineth ye female withdraweth hir meale suffereth hir eate hir fill shee faineth peace following male commeth side den openeth hir iawes eateth deuoureth wasteth meate gathered vnwitting male also saith yt beast hate foxe fight oft time foxe seeth yt may roughnes hardnes skin grieue faineth though sicke ouercome flieth away brocke goeth get pray fox commeth den defileth chamber vrin vncleannes brocke squemous foule thing forsaketh house defiled getteth needfully another dwelling place de tigride cap tigris swiftest beast flight arrow ye persian call arrow tigris beast spotted diuers speck wonderfull strong swifte riuer tigris hath name beast swiftest floudes hircania breedeth manie beast kinde huc v que isid haec tigris dis name riuer looke de fluminibus plinius speaketh tiger sayth beastes kinde come hircania beastes dreadfull swiftnesse namely knowen taken whelpe glemie sinewie hunter lieth awaite taketh away whelpes flyeth soone awaye swifte horse may haue wilde beast commeth findeth den bayd whelp away riseth headlong taketh sore footing beareth whelpes away followeth smell hunter heareth grutching beast runneth hee throweth downe one whelpes tiger bitch taketh whelpe hir mouth beareth hir den layeth therein runneth againe hunter meane time hunter taketh ship hath whelpes scapeth wise beguiled hir fiercenesse standeth steede plinius saieth lib cap male careth whelpes bear away whelp leaueth way great mirrours damme followeth findeth mirrours waye looketh seeth hir owne shaddowe image therein thinketh seeth hir young therein long occupied therefore deliuer hir whelpes glasse hunter hath time space scape beguiled hir owne shadow followeth farther hunter delyuer hir young de tinea cap moth called tinea worme clothes isid saith hath name holdeth cloth hee vntill within eateth gnaweth gendered corruption cloth cloath long presse thicke aire blowen winde neither vnfolded pure aire worme eateth ye vtter part cloath wasteth slily knowen ere harmed though sensible beast yet hideth himselfe within cloth vnneth seene mothes hate flye bitter thing bitter smell come lightly cloth yt sprong thing therefore leaues laurel tree ceders cipres put among cloathes hutch saueth clothes also book corruption eating mothes constantine saieth also manner scab head called tinea ye seuere scall holdeth cleaueth fast skinne thereof looke libr de capitis infirmitate de teredine cap many wormes called teredo greeke pearce eate tree isi saith li gendered corrupt humour abide tree vnder rinde sap pith gendred namely tree felled planted vndue time saieth namely full moone moysture much body vertue moone defied superfluitie thereof ruled kinde therefore superfluitie must need turne wormes corruption looke de effectu lunae libr worme teredo little worme tree softe substaunce fretleth gnaweth wasteth hard tree maketh thereof smaller powder anye fyle might make looke heereafter de vermiculo de testudine cap snayle called testudo worme hath name healed house chamber isid saith li foure maner snailes land snailes sea stronde snailes fennie snailes lye mareyes riuer snailes men suppose though beleeued ship goeth flower beareth right foote snaile isi sayeth lib de testudine autem quaere supra litera l de limace additiothe snaile hath foot meaneth sea tortuce carieth shell vpon backe de tortuca cap tortuse accounted among snailes closed hard shell closeth thing grieueth tortuca double kinde one dwelleth riuers lande tortuca riuers slaieth venemous lande tortuse dwelleth house woodes cleane good eating horrible foule sight layeth egges hen pale lesse quantitie foure footed beast foure small feete frogge little head serpent hath hard shell many foule specke flesh dwelleth woodes medicinable hath vertue restore helpeth therfore tisikes etikes consumpt arist lib speaketh sea tortuse sayth eateth thing mouth stronger tha waste mouth take stone mouth hee breaketh itit must soft stoe author mistoke tortuse lupus marinus commonly called fisherme cracke stone hath mouth rovves teeth tuskes vvith vvhich breaketh sunder biteth commeth water brinke eateth grasse hearbes tourneth againe water goeth vp swimmeth backe drye sunne easie bee deepe water also lib beast hath stales feather shell hath bladder scarcitie drinke superfluitie drinke passeth fethers thing except ye tortuse loung fleshie bloudy like l ng cowe lung wilde tortuse hee body contained thicke shell onely dissolued therefore flesh therefore tortuse bladder receiue superfluitie bladder full lyttle beast haue bloudie lung bladder therefore onely tortuse among beast hard shell hath bladder raines de vacca cap cowe called vacca hath name boacta isidore saith libro incresing beast aristotle saieth libro cowe moued deede kind one yeare perchaunce eight month cowe goeth calfe nine month calueth tenthe month range without heard wexe wilde heardes maye tame desire kine knowen swellyng twist continuall lowing kine lowe bulling leape buls follow stand also codem sayth ye end men meane cow goeth ten moneths calueth time calfe liueth clees full complete commonly calueth one calfe perchaunce twaine female lyueth commonly xv yeares male also bee gelded strong may liue xx yeare cowe hath good milke caluing milk haue milke litle worth nothing value cowes milke first crudded made tough falleth medled water yeareling cow commeth seldome bull kine toe often calue haue many calues token men meane winter shall much raine kine lyue companye ofte lost goe companye wilde beast eate also among beast male haue stronger greater voyce except kine haue greater voyce bull also saith ye cow hath stronger horne knottie male great heated maye bowed toward side haue sore feete medicine therefore annoynt betweene horne oyle pitch medicine also saith kine loue drink cleere water drinke vneth neuer troubly water thicke haue podagre die euill token thereof beare downe eares eate saith fat cowe shunneth yoake vsed beate last fat lyeth hir owne dirte wexeth fat forborne spared trauaile slow stong great fliethe bret sloute flyes reeseth vp hir taile wonderfull wise stertleth wer mad field plaines additiothe cowe hide good shooe soale leather oxe de vacca agresti cap sometime cowe wilde cowe auicen speaketh arist also say lande parthia cow hath haire hir necke horse quantitie hart therefore many men call cow equiceruus cow without horn dwelleth mountaines woodes hath faire eyen sharpe sight somtime cow hath horne litle horne hart calfe bend backward horn goat bucke hir heart bone found hart hart bone bloud warmeth tickeling moueth sinewes substaunce heart cause mouing beast ioye lyking suche tickeling areareth sodainly head leapeth swiftly startleth also li arist saith beast yt maye haue helpe horne haue maner helpe succour kind kind giueth switnesse hart wilde kine haue crooked horne may greatnesse defend bodye therefore kinde giueth another help wild cow helpeth hir greatly casting dirte shee noyeth hound come nigh hir also hound finde dirte occupie smell thereof vntill beast may fight fled scaped perill heereof looke littera b de boue bubalo yt wild beast de vitulo cap calfe called vitulus hath name virore aetatis springing age isi saith lib calued anone riseth vertue seeketh cowes vdder sucketh anone licked cowes tongue cleansed manner filth commeth hir wombe calfe calued hath certaine blacke specke forhead witch meane specke whelke exciteth loue cowe biteth away specke calues forhead receiueth hir teates ere foresayd venime taken done away ari saieth mare hir colte auicen also looke litera e de equa calfe loueth dam knoweth hir lowing followeth hir busheth forhead ye vdder sucketh getteth milke dam full hath wel sucked merie glad leapeth startleth leaping goeth dam foores also lib arist saith calues gelded one yeare gelded shall little body calfe gelded manner throwen downe ground skinne cut slit gendring stone cut string thereof areared vpwarde sinewes also caruing bound vntill bloud passe somtime gendereth postume place burne one gendring stone cut put pouder thereof vppon postume place saued also sea beast lyke calfe therefore called sea calfea seale beast calueth land gendreth hound calueth neuer twaine feedeth whelpes teates bringeth sea vntill eleuenth day teacheth swim euill slaye except hit head lowe calfethey snarle dogge lovve therefore called calues becke make signes men voyce semblaunce discipline beast sleepeth faster fin vse sea creepe lande steede feete haue rough skin hairie calues haue skinnes falue hold kinde sea haire thereof ariseth sea floweth right fin hath milde vertue gendereth sleepe laid vnder head huc v que plin li ca additiouery simply olde author write nature thing cause lacked varietie wordes expresse mindes de vrso cap beare called vrsus hath name mouth shapeth whelpe called vrsus orsus whelpeth hir time isido saith li auicen saieth beare bringeth forth peece flesh vnperfect euill shapen dam licketh lumpe shapeth member licking thereof written yog bear hath al foot hee lyeth round hedg hogge certaine dayes hic format lingua soctum quem protulit vrsa beare shapeth hir tongue broode breedeth bringeth forth vnripe whelping maketh gendereth thirtie daye thereof commeth hastie whelping euill shaps beares head feeble strength armes loynes therfore may stand three day isi saith li cap de bestijs el name vrsus commeth vrgendo thrust constraine thing taketh lib cap plin speaketh beares saith gendring beginning winter gender foure footed beastes doe gender lieng depart sunder goe den eyther themselues whelpeth therein xxx daye whelpes moe fiue white euill shapen whelpe piece flesh little mouse hauing neither eyen hairethat hauing claw deale bourging lumpe licketh shapeth whelpe licking men shall see beastes seldome gender whelp beares therefore male hide lurke fortie dayes female aray house foure month bough fruite braunches couereth keepe raine softe twig braunches first fortye dayes dayes sleepe fast may awaked wt woude time fast mightely greace beare helpeth falling haire dayes sitteth vp lyueth sucking hir feete imbraceth cold whelpes holdeth close hyr breast heateth comforteth lyeth groueling vpon bird doe wonder tell thing theophrastus saieth telleth beares flesh sod time vanisheth laide vp token meate found almerie little quantitie humour hath time small droppes bloud heart manner bloud deale body springing time male goe forth fat cause thereof vnknowen namely time fatted meate neither sleepe onely seauen dayes goeth hir den seeketh hearb eateth make soft hir womb hard boud hir eyen dimmed therfore namely labour get honnie combes mouth wounded stinging bee bleed releeue heauinesse sore ache eyen head full feeble strong lyon therefore somtime falleth downe headlong vpon rockes falleth vppon grauell dieth soone men saye beares braine venemous therfore slayne head burnt open place men shuld taste braine fall madnes beares fight buls take cruelly mouth hangeth feete horne draweth waight downe ground renteth slaieth biting beast hath great sleight doe euill deedes beare huc vsque plin libr cap arist speaketh beare lib saith beare eateth thing eateth fruite tree climeth vpon breaketh bee hiues eateth honie bee grieueth eyen stingeth tongue driueth chaseth awaye sometime eateth crab ante medicine eateth flesh great strength fighteth harte wilde swine hound buls throweth downe ye ground goeth vpright bull ofte holdeth horne fore feete ouercommeth vnpacient beast wrathfull aduenged yt toucheth another touch anone leaueth first reeseth seconde reeseth third taken made blinde bright basin bound chaynes compelled playe tamed beting vnstedfast beast vnstable uneasie goeth therfore daye stake strogly tied lycketh sucketh feete hath liking iuyce thereof wonderfullye climbe vppon tree vnto highest top ofte bee gather honie hollowe tree beare findeth honie smell goeth vp place honnye maketh waye tree clawes draweth honie eateth commeth ofte custome vnto place hungred hunter taketh heed thereof pitcheth full sharpe hooke stake foote tree hangeth craftely right heauie hammer wedge ye open way ye hony beare commeth hungred logge hangeth ther high letteth putteth awaye wedge violence remouing wedge falleth againe hitteth eare hath indignation thereof putteth away wedge fiercely wedge falleth smiteth harder striueth long wedge vntill feeble head doth fayle ofte smiting wedge falleth downe vpon prickes stake slayeth himselfe wise theophrastus telleth manner hunting beares learned hunter country germanie de vrsa cap female beare called vrsa beast cruell hir whelpes stolne right busie saue hir whelpes therefore licketh busilye giueth sucke nourisheth putteth hir selfe ofte foorth hir might would take away hir whelpes departeth male hath conceiued commeth company till ye whelp perfectly shapen saith shee hideth hir selfe time lechery ashamed seene time loue also male spareth female commeth hir till hath whelped ari plin auicen meane also lib beares licketh drinke beast doe sawie teeth sucketh neither swalloweth beast doe haue continuall teeth sheepe biteth ye water swaloweth de vulpe cap foxe called vulpes hath name wallowing feete aside goeth neuer forthright alway wayes fraud false beast deceiuable lacketh meate faineth himselfe dead fowles come carren anone catcheth one deuoureth isi saith lib foxe halteth alway ye right legges shorter lefte leg skinne hairy rough hot taile great rough hound weneth take taile taketh mouth full haire stoppeth foxe doth fight brocke den defileth brockes den vrine dirte hath mastrie ouer fraud deceipt strength foxe inhabiteth himselfe hole den vnder earth stealeth deuoureth tame beast wild arist saith li hart friend foxe fighteth therefore brock helpeth foxe betweene foxe brocke kindelye wrathand often foxe ouercommeth brock guile might strength right gluttonous beast deuoureth much gendreth blinde whelpes doth lyon woolfe arist saith libro solinus saith beast gender brood incomplete ye cause gluttonie kinde suffered abide vntill complete slay dam sucking therefore kinde maketh full complete least slay owne kinde gluttonie great desire meate foxe stinking beast corrupt doth corrupt ofte place dwell continually maketh barren wombe white necke vnder throate taile redde backe breth stinketh biting deale venemous plin sayeth hound pursue hee draweth taile betweene leg seeth may scape hee pisseth taile full hairie rough swappeth taile full pisse hound face yt pursue stench pisse full grieuous houndes therefore hound spare somwhat foxe faineth himselfe
