cleansed make full subtil cleere also cleane colour commeth kind made crafte heereof looke heereafter de coloribus aristotle li meth saith colour vttermost part cleere thing bodye determined vtter part bodely thing sight sheweth diuersitie colour taketh kinde medling mastrie element bodye compouned cleere thing bright medled actuall ioyning light shineth vpon vtter part cleere bodye bright colour sheweth presenteth vtter part sight therfore secundo de anima arist saith coulour chaungeth sight giueth therto likenesse working lyght light perfection cleere thing bright bringeth kinde coulour medled body kindly mastrie element chaunging deede perfection sight though colour essentially kindly medled body yet hath colour might shew himselfe light shineth actually therevpon alway shew himselfe colour needeth light light shew selfe needeth colour colour needeth light shineth deede print thereby qualytie coulour line sight therefore men meane reason thinges seene rooted shapen lyght expresseth beautie lyght light lacketh faulteth qualytie coulour seene deede colour darknesse commentour saith de anima treateth sheweth changing likenesse colour sight light maketh coulour coulour indeede masterie element body medledas lyght maketh colour color beeing nothing vvithout light light shineth without open colour space place colour disposeth place giueth shape maye receiue likenesse colour light disposeth likenesse space diuersitie colour commeth eye iudgement colour therefore deede colour abide darknessethey abide bee discerned vvhat commentour sayeth openly therefore author perspectiue saith li ca vltimo light needeth sight coulours one two cause without lyght shape likenesse coulour spreadeth aire though darknesse spredde aire yet worketh sight light needeth colour onely shewing thereof though coulour seene perceiued darkness yet neuerthelesse coulour idle darknes continually matter perfect within though colour seene perceiued darknesse ye shall vnderstande default colour default thing receiue take disposition lacketh needeth receiuing taking author tell place coulour deede without light shal vnderstood knowen deede sight light arayeth colour maketh first seene knowen theyr kinde maketh first thou vnderstand light shineth without vpon thing ye vertue lyght heauen commeth vnseene inner part thing gendreth color help foure quality element gendred kind commeth light maketh cleere noble sheweth sight eye de materia coloris cap cleere thing well termined matter colour onelye namely thing moyst drye earthie cleere insomuch drye fierie drought commeth downe sphere place fire found heere beneath among v onely forme fire gendered might element medled body shall made sayd li de generatione cleerenesse hath three materiall diuersities matter thin thicke meane meane much moisture water drines earth passing ye moisture aire failing ye airie moysture el airy much chaunged thing dry earthie yet passeth grosenes thin small moyst changeth matter aire el moyst airie changeth thicknesse drines earth passeth goeth beyond meannesse earth de generatione coloris chap matter cleere coulour drinesse hath masterie moysture hath masterie matter meanly drye moyst drinesse hath masterie matter ye working heate hath mastrie white colour gendered heate maketh matter thin spredeth departeth part thereof maketh subtill gendreth cleernesse brightnesse wise arist speaketh li de animalibus saith white coulour gendred scarsitie humour drie matter mastrie heat worketh maketh matter subtill small fareth member bone burnt colde hath masterie worketh dry matter blacke colour gendered cold gathereth constraineth part dry matter fasteneth togethers maketh sad dimme dimnesse onely priuation light also colour cleernesse diuersitie light colour cleerenesse certaine condition thing seene matter determined drye needeth generation white colour right blacke colour gendred matter moyst heate hath mastrie gendreth blacke coulour heate burneth also wasteth moyst partes altereth tourneth moysture passeth blacke smoke fareth wood greene moyst end thereof commeth blacke humour burned heerof aristo speaketh libro meth saith poores thing burneth feeble humour may withstand heate fire sodainly stuffed rather nourisheth feedeth fire sooth fire worketh principally moyst thing moyst thing cause black coulour working heate maketh subtil humour moisture water aire passe matter thus leaueth earthy matter thicke therefore needeth blacke colour gendered quarto li metheo arist saith subtill kinde earth cleernesse water kinde aire maketh whitenesse quicke siluer contrary heereof gendreth blacknesse drye matter leaueth working heate moist matter lib arist saith blacknes gendreth eye multitude moysture heate worketh kindlye moyst matter maketh therein digestion fastneth drieth leueth blacke last de generatione coloris albi ca cold hath mastry moist matter white colour gendered fareth snowe hoare frost hoarnes hair thing also fleumaticke humor though colde gathereth moist matter togethers yet drinesse gathereth moyst matter togethers moyst matter cleere ye able take noble colour therefore moyst matter pressed arayed made spreading separation part drye matter fareth therfore moist matter ready prest take cleerenesse drye matter although wringing pressing opening therfore cold may better ingender white colour moyst matter drie aristotle vnderstood libro sayth white coulour gendered aire watrie moysture working colde commentour sayth whitenes gendred cleere fire meddeled full cleere element sightie vnderstande cleerenes aristotle calleth whitenes passing manner speach manner speach sayde whitenes gendered clowdes shining beames clowds cleere thin flame fire seemeth white somtime aire cleere subtill burning fire shineth whitenes properly whitenes called passing manner speech may amplifie ye commentors worde yt saith yt fire cleere matter proper matter whitenes working thereof word sayth shal vnderstood fire matter coulour working wise vnderstande matter working making thereof ende wherefore made de colore mediorum generatione cap betweene whitenes blacknes many meane degree following mastrie qualyties actiue passiue working suffering strong feeble many degree mastrie drines hath difficultie made subtill thin bright harder make clere take white colour dry thing sadde thicke lesse mastrye drynesse hath mastry ye heat hath ye better taketh white colour sooner also drinesse stronger heat ye blacke colour bred cometh fatnesse part great dimnesse priuation cleernesse superfluitie fatnesse ye cleere matter fareth moist matter mastry moist matter yt proportionall burning heate hath mastry smoake dimnesse blacknesse mastry moisture yt mastry colde increase proportionallye whitenesse increaseth moysture hath great mastrye heate lyttle mastry blacke coulour shall abate also moisture hath great mastry drynesse heate lyttle mastrye whitenesse shall abate moysture hath mastry heat hath mastry may great blacknesse gendered sometime heat gendreth whitenesse moist matter fareth white egge yt sod sometime heat worketh greene wood moyst leaueth white ash ye burning ye colour whitenesse alway token euill termined matter wer ouermost cleere christall knowen ash separate departed though cleernesse stretch ye body actual cleernesse compleat verie whitenesse ye whitenesse leaueth therfore feeblenesse heat yt doth work kinde colde hath mastry within also white egge sod touched fire shell vessell betweene vessel betweene shoulde blacknes gendered matter also heat working moist matter gendereth first blacknesse smoake also mastry moisture gendereth drinesse matter yt worketh drines gendreth therein maketh new chaunging gendreth new coulour making dry matter subtill thin heate gathereth together thing one name one kinde maketh therfore thicke sad dimme yet drie matter hath propertye hee may make matter stretch spread though gather drawe togethers beginning mastry yet ye gathering maketh matter yt gendered subtill thin matter dry stable pight seene sometime drynesse worketh moist matter putteth draweth moisture cold ordeined make matter subtill thinne colde standeth deede making thicke principall working deede colde gathereth thinges one name kinde also thing diuerse name kinde hot colde cap heate worketh meanelye qualyties drye matter needely meane coulour gendered heate maketh subtill thinne gender whitenesse colde doth contrary gathereth matter maketh fast thicke gender blacknesse worke like euerye place pointe gendered whitenes blacknes two needes must one coulour bee compouned neither white blacke coulour hath blacke white drye matter lesse disposed white coulour blacke priuation cleerenes kinde dimnes disposed thicknes thinnes abide bee thicke thinne also worke namelye together moyst matter gender coulour yt hath white black matter yt moisture hath mastrye disposed white colour blacke yt cleernes disposed receiue ye working cold heat working moyst matter putteth wasteth ye moysture cold working therin keepeth onelye saueth owne kind way fastning partes together alwaye ye matter bee meane ye coulour alway meane ye working heat matter hath mastry gendered coulour hath blacke white moist matter chaungeth sooner blacke dry matter white fareth moist matter drye departed sunder heate gendereth sooner blacke coulour wet woode greene whitenesse lime stone colde worketh mastry meane matter colour must mene compounded white blacke moyst matter disposed whitenesse dry blacknesse anye coulour moysture matter cleerenesse proper matter coulour drye matter insomuch drye working namely one wise moist matter obedient qualitie yt worketh may wel priuation kind fastneth hardneth drye matter though drye matter disposed selfe fast hard yet well disposed fastned hardned matter yt moist fareth stone though matter fast hard yet take anone fastnesse hardnesse cause worketh see many thing yt cold breedeth soone white coulour snowe well seene ensample colde worketh dry matter worketh meanly together meane matter must coulour needlessely meane euen middle colour betweene vttermost colour bee white blacke mastrie bee onely one qualitie worketh onely matter colour compounded hath one lesse qualytyes worketh euen qualyties suffereth also coulour hath aire like much knowen foresayd meaning bee two vttermost coulours white black fiue meane coulours seemeth colour may distinguished diuers kindes declared difinition yt made contrary member without defaulte without superfluitie also aristotle beareth witnesse fiue meane coulours member thereof suffisaunce may taken foresayd matter also combination white blacke theyr generation coulours white blacke bee euen lyke much composition meane colour coulour euen middle coulour betweene white blacke euen lyke farre extremityes redde coulour betweene white redde may two coulours one neere redde neere white also betweene redde black two coulours one according redde blacke meane coulours maye betweene white blacke betweene white red may firme coulour chaungeable carnation coulour flesh coulour shadow either euen farnesse hath alwaye respect vttermost part colour haue three quarter white one black halfe red coulour one quarter white one quarter black wise betweene blacke red may none eue quantitie must haue three quarter black one white equall onelye somwhat seeming euen farnesse additiohe meaneth euery simple colour mixed doth lesse make light darken proper ground coulours generall chap aristotle rehearseth fiue meane coulours namethe shadovves coulours firie action vvhich vvho vnderstandeth shall simple painter vvorie limner calleth first yeolow second citrine third redde fourth purple fift greene betweene white red yeolow towarde white citrine toward red betweene blacke redde purple toward red greene towarde blacke name bee otherwise called greeke purple called kyanos greeke yeolowe called karapos name greeke charge take heed latine name cause foresayde coulours may knowen yeolowe hath white blacke redde coulours leaues fall winter haruest citrine purple compasseth redde coulour eyther hath redde white blacke citrine farther blacke purple aristotle meneth secundo de sompno vigilia wher speketh corruption coulours turning blacke sayeth citrine passeth purple blacke therefore purple must betweene redde blacke citrine betweene white blacke followeth ye greene must set toward black cause knowen ordinaunce fiue meane coulours aristotle meaneth opinion would haue light substance coulour cap coulours made apparant light therfore light called ye mother colourssome men deeme suppose light substaunce colour saye coulour cleane cleere matter cleerenesse hath diuersityes cleere matter cleane pure earthie vnpure earthie lyght diuided foure manner light cleere dimme lyttle much call lyght great much though shine greate place much vertuall light gathered lyttle place point called much lyght greate light hollow mirrour set sun beame light falleth mirrour reboundeth middle thereof gathering rebounding ye lyght ye mirrour betwixt cleerenesse glasse brightnesse sunne fire kindeled burneth full soone speedely flaxe drie matter put therein burneth sodeinly set fire much light cleane pure matter cleere albumasar sayeth light little dim cleere matter full cleere somedeale dim blacknesse must needes bee gendered expoundeth word aristotle auetrois meaneth blacknesse priuation cleernesse speake wise hee followeth seauen coulours stretch white toward blackeof seauen colour knowne three thinges maketh whitenesse brightnesse light plentye thereof purenesse cleere matter meane coulour maye abate wise generation three coulours one abideth alone two abate white commeth colour stretch white toward blacke also black white stretcheth consideratio colour two principallof colour mixt copoud blacke white meane stretch white toward blacke black toward white stretching first abate whitnes abate blacknes meeteth middle euery meane colour endles meane degree deep colour lyght farre white blacke nigh thereto know thou heereof coulour propertye qualitye lefte vttermost parte cleere body commeth kinde medling quality element medled together meddeled bodie light presented eye sight without meane light coulour chaungeth eye maketh therin likensse shape yet colour may seene selfe aristot saith de anima default coulour default vnmight eie coulour seene deede without light therefore pithagorici helde pythagoras teaching called coulour ephiphania ouerseeming imagined vtter parte cleere bodye teemyned else coulour vtter part therof properly sighty bodye taketh coulour hiewe letteth passage lyght sight heere called cleere body termined perspicuum terminatum letteth passage sight nothing seene boystrousnesse stone tree mettall thicke leather letteth deale passage sight fully wine lycour diuerse coulour seene within without kinde colour thing within without fareth white egge broken glasse couloured sayd libro de sensu sensato cap many thing bee one coulour without another coulour within fareth blacke pepper apple graines many thinges dyeth coloureth thing without within fareth painting also redde cloath dyeth vtter part water bee layed therevnder knowen coulour vttermost parte sight cleere thing bee sayde libro de sensu sensato also cleere body termined ayre presence lyght maketh white coulour absence maketh blacke coulour dimme somewhat lyght shineth therein bee lyghtlesse sayde libro de sensu sensato capit cleere body termined colour bodye termined verye colour coulour sayde booke also meane coulours bee gendered theyr owne diuersitie diuers proportion also one proportion conteyneth third parte halfe deale proportion bee porportion bee againe proportionall steadfastnesse abiding matter also cleerenesse matter fareth consonancijs sayde capitulo octauo b also bee gendered proportion consonancie accorde coulour coulours fayre lyking proportionall bee liking bee sayd men meane meane coulours gendered vnder setting laieng vttermost coulours white blacke sightlye coulour laide aboue lesse sightlye lesse sightly aboue sightlye fareth painting sunne seemeth white whe seene another coulour seene clowde sayde cap also coulours bee seene passing beames come eyen continuall multiplication coulour space place betweene thing seene eye spreading thereof eyen feeling made touch sayde capitulo octauo also coulours lyke farre sunder maye seeme meane coulours farre therefrom though bee meane coulours parte thing may seene vnder vttermost coulour fareth cloath diuers coulours sayde capitulo also meane coulours gendered lykenesse gendering meddeled bodyes meddeled simple bodyes meddeling couloues followeth meddeling elementes chaunging tourning forme shape meddeled bodye meane bodye gendered vttermost bodyes meane coulour gendred vttermost coulours sayde capitulo octauo also euery meane colour gendered white blacke seemeth priuation white coulour darknesse priuation lyght sayde libro methe cap b also needeth vnity kinde followeth vnity likenesse colour albumasar sayth differentia g also furthermore deede coulour print lykenesse sight working deede light light might coulour brought worke deede print lykenesse eye eye may take lykenesse deeme thing seene also meane colour well proportioned pleseth comforteth sight vttermost coulour feebleth grieueth sight aristotle sayth greate whitenesse ofte sheddeth spirite sight dissolueth eye maketh water great blacknesse gathering spirite making thicke rebounding sight maketh dim fareth bee long closed darke place see little right naught sodeinely brought light also coulour thing coloured sheweth complection therof kind whitenesse white colour body frore bee cold substance black colour againeward colde maketh moyst thinges white dry blacke heate maketh wet thing blacke drye whiteas snovv cole aristotle auicen meane therfore whitenesse daughter colde token mastry fleame colde moisting fleeting humour blacknesse token melancholike disposition dry humour hath mastry body somtime token great burning humour chaunging turning kinde melancholy shall sayde heereafter also vtter coulour inner quality thing bee knowen auicen saith colour qualitie made perfect lyght coulour might darke body passeth working deed light commeth therevpon without knowne wise euery medled body hath somewhat fire might hath fire somewhat light fire hath light kinde lyght hid darke part onely might heate brimstone pepper potenciall heate passeth working actuall heat deed vtter qualitie yt like inner qualitie potentiall lyght medled bodye darke passeth woorke deede comming outwarde light also coulour seene within declareth might feeblenesse fire hidde might meddeled bodye thereby vertue working thereof knowne proporcionally diuersity coulour exciteth kindlye sight looker looke wonder thereon plinius sayth libro octauo auicen also sayeth euery beast neuer fierce wondereth duersitie fairenesse coulour panther also euery man face made beautiful vnbeautifull coulour ordinate colour fayre complection fairenesse miswexeth duely making composition member limmes auicen sayth austen saith fairenesse seemly shape body wt pleasing colour againward vile coulour vnseemely right foule bodye also colour token accident passion ye soule sodeine palenesse discoulour token dread ye heat drawen inward part bodye face scarcitie bloud face discouloured also sodeine rednesse face token shame wrath heate commeth outwarde bloude maketh skinne redde without busieth put shame wronge also coulour termineth arayeth bodye excepte couloure bee bodye substance thereof knowne sight also couloure maketh fayre matter without hideth defaultes bee within compounded coulour meane betweene white blacke layed order kinde auicen sayeth without vppon bodye hideth couereth infirmitie matter accidentally eyther kinde auicen sayth also coulour accordeth agreeth lyght daughter mother followeth lyghte deede greate strength thereof leaueth red coulour fruite without last fruite compleat ripe sowre humour earthy defied burning commeth blacke colour fruit without heat hath mastry dissolueth doth seeth defieth commento coulour betokeneth themselues working kind cold oft gendered thing bee full hot commeth cause heat hath mastry within doth put earthy watry fumosities alphredus sayth super aristot de vegitabilis plantis also beast chaunging coulour skinne eyen eare nailes coulour ye skin gendred two manner sayde ioannico gendred commeth sometime humour inwarde sometime passion soule also chaunging coulour skin commeth inner thing sometime hot humour sometime cold happeneth hot humour compowned simple cooleth bee colde also colde humour cooled heateth according therevnto colour skinne wont varie colde humoures waxe hotte white colour turneth citrine red hot humour doth coole red coulour doth chaunge white pale vnderstoode also chaunging skin commeth passion soule red waxeth pale anguish dreade dreade heart closeth heate vtter partes draweth inward therefore vtter partes waxe pale also pale waxeth red wrath wrath heart openeth desireth wreake heat passeth sodeinly inner part vtter part bloud heateth betweene skin flesh red colour sodeinly gendered also men nation maures blacke coulour commeth inner part whitish colour almains dutchman ye countrye mauritania hottest country aethiopia ye country greate heate bloud burnt betweene skinne flesh maketh member black hee first dwelled aethiopia made black afterward continuall heat sunne blacknes sprang ofspring blacke father blacke mother commeth blacke child place onely father mother continually burnt heate sunne therefore temperate country land yt somwhat cold swart coloured men getteth child temperate coulour macrobius mirror colour changeth wan pale colour token diuers passion said tractatu de vnguibus coulours perticular chap followeth speake perticular colour first white chiefe fundament ground meane colour medling earthy draft dry moist cause working making white coulour cold heat drinesse hath mastry working therin white colour gendered thinning subtilling partes matter cleering vertue might heat fareth lime burnt bone matter moyst substance colde hath mastrye working therein white colour gendered fareth snow dew therfore white gendred aire deale watry aristotle sayth lib de animalibus working colde colde maketh moyst matter white drye matter blacke also white matter gendered chinning spreading ayre fareth skumme therfore hot water gendereth white haire hot braine cause baldnesse white commeth vapourable aire watry member white commeth hot ayre vapourable therfore beast white vnder wombe ari saith li de animalibus white hath vertue shed sight shed ye visible spirit white maketh eie watry drop ground coulours meane colour bee grounded coulour better white white ground faster coulour cleaueth abideth laied therevppon whether bee white black whitenesse belongeth apperteineth candor milkie colour karapos whitish palish diuers matter diuerse rotted thick thinne sayd libro de isaac theophile constantine egid de vrinis candor passing whitenesse hath selfe much light forme much purenesse cleerenesse matter blasing brightnesse ye dresseth matter without cleere pure printeth likenesse sight without greening eye comforteth sight behold theron manner liking whitenes called candor yt first seene whitnesse lyght without corruption sight called candor vttermost whitenesse seene eie voideth ye dome sight nothing may seene vnder vttermost coulour vttermost colour vnseene themselues cleerenesse thereof said li de sensu sensato cap octauo first seene whitenesse tearmed candor de colore glauco siue flauo cap salowe gendred whitenessalovve drawing deale toward red pallido colore cap palepale coulour gendered cause cold lesse strong whitenesse draweth towarde blacknesse gendred thick matter polence mene colour beginneth white passeth kind toward blacke also pale generation colour colour come togethers cleernesse matter firy light according meanes betweene white black firy light duo keth cleane part yt medled maketh thin subtill coulour accordeth blasing white black therfore deep red sheddeth sight cleere light doth gathereth sight blacke doth therefore draper yt sell cloth hang red cloth lightno policy plaine subtilty ye rednesse shuld dazell spirit sight men see clothes coulours shuld know worse colour red colour general token mastry heat medled body though hee bee somtime found without bodye kindly cold fareth red rose kindly colde drie rose full next red neerer blacke white aristotle saith secundo de sompuo et vigiliars sayth citrine passeth purpole blacke purple neerer red blacke sea citrine shell fish founde small little cut end commeth thereof redde droppes kept dropper purple dyed redde coulours mastred bloud gathered great quantitie kept vessells dyer done coulours therewith purple e dyed whi h wath wouen therby shewed wealth ioy king gregory saith super cant cap de colore viridi cap greene coulour gendered bred working heate meane matter moisture hath somwhat mastrie fareth leaues hearbes fruit also grasse therefore coulour gendered hath much blacke fully blacke medling light white yeolow much blacke moyst bodye without greene colour gendered heate worketh matter may burne moysture neyther seeth full turne fully blacke greene coulours grasse hearbes fruit signe token rawe humour vndigested knowen greene colour hearbs tree turneth yeolow haruest time leaues hearbs much moyst matter thicke wasted working heate without heat matter borne vp though cold hath mastry therefore tree bee greene springing time summer pale haruest winter heate springing time commeth beareth humour outward humour taketh heat made greene colde commeth smiteth humour inwarde much drynesse colour yeolow commentor sayth super li de plantis fine also greene meane coulour gendered betweene red blacke knowen passing red cholera vnkinde earth blacknesse nigh black gathereth meanly sight comforteth ye visible spirit therefore colour liking ye sight greene colour knowne smaragdus stone comforteth eyen ye graue mettall precious stone draweth outwarde fumositie thereof dyeth hearbs colour without blacke red greene blacke tempereth shedding blasenesse red cleerenesse incorporated ye black maketh meane temperate greene gendered colour gendered watrie earthy part haue mastry coulour gendered thinges haue colde humour thicke fareth lead certaine stone lead white kind though wan without lead white coulour made called cerusa commentor saith meth wan coulour token mastry cold therefore wan colour vrine token quenching kind heat death beast egidius saith sayth wan vrine betokeneth dead member humour many euills followeth euill paruusenut itheus medn falling euill also ashites sinochus breaking veines pose euill ye rib lung tisicke quencheth heate wan coulours de colore liuido malo cap wan coulour euill men beastsmixt betokeneth mastrie cold quencheth kindly heat beginneth slay kindly beat el betokeneth superfluitye melancholye bloud defileth skin without el betokeneth anguish passion heart draweth inwarde heate bloud fareth person bee enuious wrathfull else betokeneth sore falling smiting corrupteth increaseth bloud betweene skinne fleshthat blacke blievv appeareth yt bobbed beaten humour betweene skin flesh corrupt malice corrupteth infecteth skin expositor saith super ca li de isa vulnus liuore c betokeneth failing spirit kind heat scarsitie therof fareth person haue dropsie etike doe consume wast egidius sayth betokeneth also gowtes ioyntes gowte full sore tendernesse sinewes spirit humore doe gather place lesse hot place worse coloured expedient needfull worke rehearse cause wan colour make metion thing fore father haue treated full largely seld remember wan coulour betokeneth good greene blacke tourneth wan working kind wannesse red citrine betokeneth kinde hath mastrye infirmitie euil egidius meaneth first wan afterward red kind braine riseth strength recouered de colore indica ca coulour indicus venenus bliew colourindiae deepe blievv passeth wan coulour fairenesse brightnesse hath water aire medled ioyned earthy part hath wan coulour colour heauen mastry aire cleere body without fareth sapphire ye east land iacincts also coulour azure heereof look ye treatise gemmes precious stone stone lasurus additiothe indiae bee much counterfeit especiall grounde greene de nigro colore ca blacke priuation white cleere matterblacke son sable semy mixt bitter priuation sweet moyst matter seemeth white first well colour sweet first well sauours aristotle saith li de sensu sensato blacke coulour priuation cleernes blacknesse gendered scarce light incorporate cleere matter dim darkish vnpure therefore blacknesse gendereth ye spirit visible smiteth againe greeueth therfore sight maketh dim blacke blacke fareth yt long prison see litle naught come prison black sometime grounded moist substance hot heat yt hath mastry bloweth moist body fareth wet wood burneth somtime dry substance cold cold hath mastry blacketh dry substaunce whiteth moyst substaunce aui saith also sometime blacke commeth colde token death sometime heate token burning therfore blacke vrine may taken diuers disposition contrary egidius saith betokeneth somtime solution quartane betokeneth health betokeneth somtime burning death fareth feuer acot egidius saith blacke vrine betokeneth euill solution quartane death burning scarse humour black fat stinking betokeneth death colour accordeth ye worke painter thereof breedeth veynes earth sinopis rubrica melium auripigmentum made crafte de sinopi cap sinape laakes sinopis red coulour first founde ilande pontus besides citie sinopis hath therfore name isid saith lib heereof three manner kindes red lesse red meane betweene twaine hee saith called rubrica next red sanguine sayth breedeth many place best commeth ut pontus therefore called pontica de sirico pigmento cap golden colour paint vvith siricum pigmentum thereof made colour called pheniceus therewith chiefe principall letter bookes written founde cliffes red sea ye countrie called phenicus colour accounted among fained colour somtime made cinopis sandix gold yeolovv medled wrought craftely togethers isidore saith de minio colore cap vermilio minium redde coulour greekes found matter thereof ephesim spaine suche pigment landes isidore saieth de cinobrio cap cinobrium called cinabarin among greekesa colour made dragon bloud hath name draco barro dragon elephant auicen sayth dragon bloud dragon windeth wrappeth tayles among leg elephant un densts falleth ground dragon dye slaine wise bloud dragon bleedeth dyeth coloureth earth dyed pigmentum red pouder isidore saith additio canereus also ash colour blacke de prassino cap prassin greeke greene therof colour made greene leekethis greene grovveth rust siluer vvhich co meth brasse verdigrek best groweth libia cerenence isidore saith crisocania veyne prassm greene colour hath name crisocania gold found therwith sayde greene groweth armenia better groweth macedonia digged mined among mettall brasse defending therof token siluer golde veyne thereof hath companye kinde mettall de sandaracha cap sandarach groweth topasion ile red sea red coulour smelleth brimstone found among mettall gold siluer better redde smelleth brimstone though cerusa toasted ouen tourne sandarache coulour thereof red euen toasted medled rubrica tourneth sandix additioa bright redde coulour dsed painter found mynes golde siluer call redde arsenick another kinde made ceruse burned de arcenico cap aresticum called auripigmen colour golde gathe portus among golden master pure passeth golden colour haue small veyne pale accounted worst heereof tractatu de ven auripigmento de occa cap deth ilands topai de melino cap melinus white coulour matter thereof sounde iland melos one ciclades therefore colour called melinus isid saith great fatnesse ofte painter doth vse coulour isidore saith de stibio cap stibiuiu fained colour made cerus thing meddeled therewith woman paint face therewith additio f teth libro cap vsque ad pthe order colour limne accustomed skill latter time vnprofitable painter stainer newly added whereas late yeares two bookes concerning reuiuing ye arte lymning hath ben set forth iudge vnprofitable meat greeuous child young men much heate according full olde men cold wine hot meates huc vsque isidorus libro capitulo also honnie sweete lycour medicinall craft gendred pure matter heate bee gendereth honie medling hot thing honnie therein sharpnesse meddeled sweetnesse sweetnesse honnie hotte lesse moyst sweetnesse isaac sayeth honnie hath much heate ayre lesse earth water much drynesse fire sharpnes also lesse cold humor therefore honnie deemed hot drye end second degree substance therof nigh meane temperate honny cleanseth much washeth maketh subtill thin carueth heat thereof departeth thick humour body honny hot nigh sharpe pricketh therefore gut moueth put draft dirt also sweetnesse sweetnes hony much sharpnesse heat stoppeth waye splene lyuer much doth sweetenesse cleane pure without medling sauour isaac saith cap foure diuersities sweetnesse sauour also honny euen temperate honny much according friend kinde likeneth selfe much member stancheth thicknesse grieuous running straineth pore hole wide kepeth laueth well temperate kind letteth humour ready disposed ye flure neuerthelesse yet hony laxeth grieuous humore honny hath contrary disposition matter worketh hardneth matter soft losineth departeth matter harde isaac sayeth honnie keepeth saueth clenseth tempereth bitternesse therefore put conseruatiues clenseth medicine temper bitternesse spicery sayde antido n rawe honnie well clarified right venteous breedeth curling swelling wombe turneth soone euill humour stoppeth gleaming liuer splene kindleth cholera breedeth feauer called diuina stretcheth haleth body vnder small ribbes greeueth yt haue euills collica passio illiaca passio constantine sayth isaac dietis honnie hath diuers working honnie wholesome keepeth saueth health laxeth disposition breedeth euil humour venime red hot sharpe departeth thirleth cleanseth white lesse hot sharpe sweet pure good smel better additio plinie although booke naturall historie chap hee writeth yt honnie gathered flowres tree set plant except sorrell hearbe called chenepode call goosefoote yet hee affirmeth descendeth aire ye chap booke writeth thus commeth ye ayre ye rising certeine starres especially ye rising sirius rising vergiliar ye seauen starres called pleades ye spring ye day ye leaues found fat dew yt tasteth sweete clammie become corrupt c ye mill dewe bee take least gone ye heat ye sun euer bee flie abroad plinie heerein knew much thinges wise yt leane much vpon plinie better knowledge found sithence time elementall ayre proceedeth originall honnie gathered ye bee flowres hearbes trunke ye bee distilled ye moist licour vomited ye clamie substance gathered vpon ye smallest legges brought ye hiue wrought arte passeth euerye dreaming skill surmise hunnie hunny great quantitie north regionsad plinie writeth ye booke naturall historyes chap place germanie honnye found quantitye yt haue bene serue honnie combes eight foote long blacke hollowe part c honnie well meate drunke incomperable efficacie onely cleanseth altereth also long time preserueth ye vncorrupted put insomuch plinie sayth nature honnie yt suffereth bodyes puinsie affirmeth yt old see hippocentaure beast halfe man halfe horse brought honnye claudius ye emperour aegipt rome telleth also one pollio romulus aboue hundred yeares olde augustus ye emperour demaunded meanes hee liued long returned still ye vigour liuelynesse body minde pollio annswered yt hee inwarde mead drink made honie water outward wt oyle democritus also ye opinion great philosopher yeares olde prolonged lyfe certaine dayes wt euapouration honie arestoxeneus writeth excellent matter wonderfully wrought gathered little bee well ye pure dew heauen subtil humour sweete vertuous hearbes flowres made licours commodious mankinde mead matheglyn oximell mead made parte honnie foure time much pure water boiled vntill skimme doe remaine much commended galen drinke summer preseruing health cleanseth brest lung matheglin vsed wale reason hot hearbe boyled hony better mead comforteth cold stomacke perfectly made neyther new stale oximell one part usneges pu ouble much honnye foure time much water beeing succouring honnye medled waxe called fauus cell made waxe wonderfull craft skill bee gather honnye keepe succour lycour therewith honnie combe called fauus fouus fouens nourishing comforting dronke fagiu greeke vnderstand men doe cast fauus honny wrong ye waxe purged best tast eth much sweetnesse certain beast called melota hath name loueth desireth honnye name melus melota also commeth honnie lyke corruption wine flakets shall therefore taken time honnye good lyke golde sayth also hee sayth bee doe sit hiue sucke superfluitie honnie combes honnye bee corrupt combes spider gendered desposition shape matter treble isi saith waxe wike fire wike made hempe thrid ground fundament per waxe compasseth wike findeth nourisheth fire yt lyght end complement either worketh waxe wike waxeth thin afterward ari saith li fine cowe hath milke coluing hath good milke first tongeuled stone happeneth medled water saith also li saith child norished hot milke teeth springeth sooner cleansing woman milke multiplieth increaseth woman haue milke onely head teate place teate milke hath good digestion congealeth breast hardneth breast bee right soft haire cometh therin falleth great soone bloud therefore good nourishing bloud compowned three substaunces diuers vertue working one maketh thin cleanseth second thicke stoppeth thirde maketh soft thinne farthermore substaunce whey watrye maketh throne cheese cheese cold thicke stoppeth therefore creame vertuous soft milke watry substance thereof sharp tempereth softeneth thicke humour washeth biteth wombe gut laxeth putteth moisteth ye mebers butter beareth meat wt cheese mouth stomack ye ground thereof also milke commended nourisheth well body turneth likenesse bloud taken temperatly due time cleansing ye body taken good bloud much flesh moyst th body without maketh skin fayre tender saith also hee sayth accordeth ye drinke milke bee fasting eate milke hot new milked eate ere milk defied also needeth beware great trauaile moouing vntil milke come downe place digestion defied vnordinate mouing trauell commeth much heate sodeinelye gendered heat vnctuositye resolued turned euill fumositie greeuous thicke part cheese hot moist neere heat bloud turneth sooner vnto bloud men olde time tell thing ye turneth soonest bloud nourisheth soonest sayd ther yet fat milke nourisheth better fatnesse yt hot milke hath thin watry moisture softneth eatereth inner part body fatnesse selfe eeteth aboue ye ayre therin maketh running hardneth thicknesse substantiall moisture therfore cowes milke perceth thir eth watrinesse thereof commeth inner part maketh kind heat softnesse thereof greeueth much kind scarsitie chase helpeth susteineth saith milke vsed one manner nourishing vsed three substance together otherwise cleansing abate heat whey separated fro creme otherwise moist ye fatnesse butter vsed vse milke taken thinnesse thicknes meane betweene saith ther milk knowen substance working substance ye milke best yt next complection mankind woman milk ye neerer milked better effectual venim euille bledder reines greeuaunce lung aire cometh changeth ye vertue thereof milked milk working known creme lesse sharpe buttery nourisheth well therefore best agreeing stomacke comforteth cooleth heate lyuer stomacke maketh bodye fat huge healeth frettings gut mother better wholsome deale watrinesse temperate three substance therfore helpeth much wound euils lung bladder reines bee taken sugar whey departed cheese ye butter drieng cleansing abating cholera much goat milke dronk selfe runneth lacte ouino cap sheepes milke hot drye cowe milke lesse butter cheese nourisheth therefore lesse according body cow milk known heauie odour smel gal sayth sheepes milke hath heauye smell cowe milke curding running ioynese togethers partes cheese butter departeth therefrom ye whey thin watry effect doings thereof rehearsed hath also vertue cleanse wash away rotting matter washeth gut clenseth wound matter purgeth breast quencheth thirst abateth sharpnesse red cholora doeth awaye wet scabbes drye vnstoppeth liuer splene looke primo secundum isaac spoken de butiro cap butter called butirum hath name imbuendo moysting hamming hugution saith fatnesse thereof moysture butter moysteth body toucheth butter flower milke full hot moyst mastry aire therefore right fat butter kindly hot moyst gleyming fat nigh according complection mankinde isaac saith butter ofte eaten maysteth stomack laxeth wombe namely fresh new therefore men old time lykned butter oyle medled fatnesse sayd yt wold take would helpe spet cleanse breast lung namely ther postume therin ripeth tempereth cleanseth superfluity breast namely eaten wt sugar honie ripeth lesse helpeth recouering sayth saith ther butter contrarye venimme maketh member moyste washing thereof softneth roughnesse eyen purgeth cleanseth eyen ripeth breaketh postumes helpeth wonderfully wound lunge lykewise throate breast abateth fretting gut reynes softeneth slaketh sinnewes astonied shronke destroyed crampe saith auicen sayth butter taken body singular helpe venime poysoned melteth butter hot milke drinketh thereof great quantitie softnes ther stoppeth ye way yt venims thereof may sodainly come heart also butter draweth venimme selfe maketh cleane togethers bringeth body perbraking spewing hee sayeth butter made wise ye creame gathered cleane vessel long beaten instrument treein charne made therefore instrument round broad hole thereinin e beat ye creame payle vvith flat hand bring butter creame beaten stirred therewith stirring kinde heate excited comforted ye substaunce milke therby fatnesse gathered togethers fleeteth aboue whey thin watry ch sie part staketh downe ground giuing ouer place butter noble part worthye butter fleeteth aboue gathered kept cleane vessell diuers v needfull fresh new butter better sauery lyking tast fresh butter fleeting softe kinde heate hath masterie ouer moyst partes wasteth litle litle maketh butter deale harde butter feedeth well nourisheth well maketh potage fattie sauourie therefore ofte put therein steede greace oyle deale salted may better kept potentiall moysturs may tempered drinesse salte lyking taste meanly salt butter olde sauour thereof appaireth odour also turneth heauie sauor smell grieuous taste worthy make fat sauourye good diuers medicine oyntments often happeneth thing accordeth throate accordeth medicine additio butter also nourishing profiteth haue humour superfluous breast lung lacketh riping cleansing specially eaten sugar honie well salted heateth cleanseth de caseo cap cheese called caseus hath name isidore sayth carendo lacking without cheese wroong pressed cheese fat vntill wheye pressed departed watrie substaunce milke cheese called caseus wer carens lacking sometime cheese drye hauing lycour moysture sayeth hogution saieth nowne caseus commeth cadendo falling falleth passeth awaye flydeth finger drye wife cheese drastes milke isaac sayth cheese substaunce milke colde thicke hard defie right euill digestion also passeth slowly stomacke accordeth belongeth stopping laxing heauie ye stomacke lyuer riy t also ye splene namely thicke place disposed stopped furthermore cheese breedeth gendreth stone ye reine three euill accident constantine sayeth cheese vniuersally commonly euil softe least grieuous therefore isa maketh distinctio cheese saith yt fresh new olde meane betweene twaine new cheese fresh ingendereth euill humour hath yet therefore sweetnesse moysture milke therefore easie vest nourisheth better laxeth wombe namely salt saltnesse taketh away sourenes sweetnesse salt cheese dryeth soone grieueth stomacke saltlesse cheese nourishing moysteth bodye breedeth much flesh grieueth stomacke turneth fumositie stomacke hot tourneth sourenesse stomacke colde meanly salt better defie grieueth lesse stomacke sowreth soone without salt kindleth bloud de caseo veteri cap olde cheese sharp drye thick nourishing hard passe stomacke moysture milke away sharpnesse drynesse reuning hath mastry therein thicke fast therefore superfluitie body made subtill therewith thing subtill working grieueth bodye two manner wise corruption therof thicknesse working maketh superfloure thicke corrupteth grieueth stomacke sharpnesse renuing contrary thing helpe maner tourneth worse nourishing doth de thicke humore body gendereth breedeth stone bladder reynes vniteth humour hot thicke maketh full hard therefore old cheese eschewed forsaken helpeth feedeth obedient digestion neither gendereth breedeth good bloud moysteth ye body exciteth ne sor ry bindeth moysture doth also olde cheese harde drye many hole poores drinesse breaketh soone hath neither fatnesse moysture grieueth body cheese sad rosted euill cheese manye eyen hoales soundnesse substaunce token fatnesse moysture cheese many eyen hole ill new olde dio saith milkie cheese mo sheth ye womb old bindeth namely sod take water toasted namely meate taken stoppeth thicknesse way stomack suffereth meate passe gut cheese eaten meat thrusteth downwards meate persset shoueth ye place passage meane cheese eaten meate thrusteth downward meal betweene new old nourisheth much good sauour thickenesse thereof hardeneth swiftelye kinde heate masterye kinde heate hath strongly hardneth cleaneth faster member huc v que isaac dietis diosc arist li f ane yt much cheese milke meate diosc sayth cheese contrary venime stoppeth woyes veynes thicknesse moysture suffereth mallyce venime come heart fresh cheese layd hot thereto draweth venimous biting token heerof cheese layd biting mad dog serpent whitenesse cheese tourneth colour cheese helpeth also venemous postume called antrax lun v com venemous postumes eate layed without accordeth medicine many cause saith additio antrax also swelling riseth like byle called alder king hot corrupt de coagulo cap renning milke made thick mawes certaine beastsa fresh cheese vertue therof milke othe4r beast reemeth curueth butter cheese gathereth togethersand al cause thickneth wheye departed therefrom li f aristo sayth thicke milke cheese therein runneth sooner milke beast yt loothlesse aboue renneth milke beast teeth either lawe renneth greace also sayth milke renneth renning milke figgesof milke figges gathered wooll wooll wiped little milke milk put milke ye milke renneth also ther renning found wombes beast sucketh cheweth cuddes haue teeth aboue beneath renning found hare con elder rennings better helpeth flure wombe namely renning co e hare arist sayth also lib sayth milke runneth renning renning milke speciall heat helpeth therfore sustaineth milke semen male susteineth menstruall bloud female mother kinde milke bloud one sayth cap de caseo isaac speaketh renning sayth renneth vertue sharpnesse heate drinesse hath mastrie therein wasteth moysture thereof though renning cheese yet ye sauor thereof lesse felt new cheese greene much last moisture may renned substaunce renning vertue hidden hidden semen male aristotle auicen isaac doe meane shewing treating property cors layde shall suffice time additiocheese whole sentence al writer letteth digestion enemy vnto stomacke also ingendreth humour breedeth stone chesse doth least harme seeke cheese reasonably filled men doe suppose nourisheth much thomas vertues diuers thing humour licour chap humoures licoures thing certaine vertues shall set heere shortly diuers complections vertues yt haue mastry diuers thing diuers manner working found vertue opening ripping cleansing vertue opening worketh heate dryeth subtill substaunce fareth outons iuyce lickes allomne confection thereof openeth mouthe veynes exciteth emoroides co sayth vertue spreading worketh heate moysture heat thirleth commeth substaunce thing dissolueth moysture ut thereto maketh open spred fareth mockes elderne rindes war stretch spread sod oyle saith vertue stopping worketh colde moysture softe substaunce sad fareth dragantes white egge psillium poores cleaning fast substance straineth hindeth colde vertue maketh thick worketh colde moysture fareth mondragora maketh ye skin thick layd thereon sayth color thin partes moystures moyster commeth middle maketh ye substance last thick worketh heate moysture heat wasteth thin part earthy part thicke vertues maketh harde worke colde drines euery qualitee draweth toward middle maketh substaunce harde worketh somtime col e moisture burdeth moyst partes cold fareth frost sometime heate drinesse l ueth earthy art maketh hard manner wise fareth fr satie earth borne fyte vertue opening worketh heat drinesse thicke substaunce heat reth moneth subtill part outward thicke part drye commeth middle ye substaunce made vneuen vneuennesse cause roughnesse also colde maketh roughnesse moyst water binding drawing v ter partes middle letteth thin part spread themselues outward therefore partes tich colde hath domination mastr e doth rough sharpe without diuersitie matter receiueth impression working heate colde diuers condition property medling thing gendred kindly either happely knowen auicen constantine doth mean openly vertue ye tretise quality element vertue softnesse norisheth heat moisture also heat spreadeth moyst part departeh deuideth part dialtea doth dialtea moist somewhat hot openeth meanly heate thereof maketh humour softe fleeting passing moisture maketh softe yt wise thing softened heate hath mastry ouer watry part earthy turneth earthye part fareth earthy vapour watry drawen ye aire turneth softe drope colde rotteth slowly fareth ile ye christall stone feruent hot rotteth flowlye aristotle sayth heat maketh feruent strong heate ayre heat commeth side suffreth therefore selfe bee ouercome chaunging made thing feruent moueth rotteth slowly thing moueth arist eth mouing commeth heate th keepeth kinde heate also r nneth rotteth slowly yt shall runneth hee sayth accidentall heate commeth ayre contayneth feebler kind heat mouing running suffereth selfe soone rot also mightye body rotteth lesse slowly lyttle bodye hee sayth bodye hot therein kinde heate withstande cause rotting also body colde kinde coldnesse thereof withstandeth better accidentall heate cause rotting greate bodye lyttle body fareth sea aristotle sayth sea water departed rotteth soone rotteth uer wh e whole diuided lyke wise fareth water water departed great riuer rotteth anone therfore worm dried therein rotting cause kinde heate maketh departing therein departeth thin thick earthy part partes water aire feete length sixe score feete breadth many manner measure doe speake time vnderstand yt sta iall field containeth sixe score pace fiue foote eight maketh mile yt containeth whole feete isi saith centuria field two hundered iugerea name hunderes iugerea called olde time afterward doubled holdeth alway first name isid saith lib cap vit de mensuris measure wayes haue diuers name among men diuers tongue latines call miliria greekes stadium frenchman leucas aegyptions signes persian perasangas wonder euery space contained owne bond measure saith stadium mesure ground wher three sort one italy containing feete pace second olympicum feete pace third pithicum containing feete two hundred pace whereof happely maye rise difference betweene plinie diodorus siculus describing sicily stadium eight doe make italian mile containing thousand pace euery pace fiue foote maye call furlong mile containeth thousand pace fiue thousand foote leuca containeth thousand pace fiue hundred stadium eight part mile containeth sixe score pace fiue telleth hercules ordained name stadtom space ran farre breath stinted gaue name staduim isid saith way space carriage may goe hath name vra vehiculum thing beareth therein commeth meeteth cariages containeth breadth two actus going comming meeting carriage euery way common priuate common way common ground common people leadeth sea diuers townes way called stratum troden feete comminaltie lucanus speaketh thereof sayth strataque iam vulgi pedibus detrita viarum stratum way troden feete people way without obstacle clean sad paued couched harde stone euen peaceable common manner people free without stopping impediment grieuing hee sayeth priuate waye belongeth nigh towne short nigh ofte growen grasse seldome going beset tree either side agger heape stone token high waye historyes call way knight waye thereof sayd qualis sepe vie deprensus aggere serpens iter iteneris way man may goe whetherwarde hee iter another itiner iter easie passe itiner long hard passe semita middle way hath name semi halfe semita path men callis path beast wilde tame callis pathe beastes betweene mountaines streight harde troden beast hath therefore name callo tramites path field hath name lead ye euen way diuersum bending wayes leadeth diuers place diuerticulum benching besides waye bruium beginning wayes one lyeth ye right hand lefte hand ofte perillous place suspitious place ofte theeues lye wayte cominaltie oft robbed place doubtfull place men doubt often wayes shall take therfore time past cross set wayes men passing thereby might know wayes take compita place manye wayes meete three foure perillous place doubtfull bruium ambitus space betweene place house neighbour two foote broad halfe ordained waye neighbour place hath name ambiendo circumeundo going orbita forrowe wheele maketh deepe furrow winding trendlyng actus place wher beast oft driuen slipper sickle vestigium fore lefte ground going trendling hath name inuestigare beast leaue owne sore token ofte taken hound wilde beast lyon knoweth away therefore fore knowen followeth property diuersitie measure sufficient time sayd taken forth isid li cap vltimo weight cap needfull know manner weight manner measure isidore sayth might kinde giueth bodely thing theyr owne weight weight ruleth therefore waight hath name pondus ponendo setting weight setteth thing theyr owne place weight el receiuing thing toward place two thing maketh weight lightnesse heauinesse lightnes subtill matter maketh vpward resteth ere come owne place therefore fire moueth vpward resteth ere come owne place sphere contrary heauinesse heauines hath mastrie corpulent earthy matter moueth downward resteth ere finde middle mooueth towarde middle owne weight thin matter subtill hath double cause lightnesse part matter shire subtill moueth toward middle toward roundnesse resteth ere come therto also shir part many part manye poores vertue fire commeth therein dissolueth wasteth earthy part maketh body light beareth vpward heate chiefe cause lightnesse cold moueth roundnesse toward middle cause ning fastnesse part heauinesse sad body heauye shire thin light found though light heauy called weight inclination either toward owne place ordained thereto kind yet common speking weight heauinesse one thing moue ward called weighty heauinesse thing moue vpward called light thing light weight diuided contrary therefore li isidor sayth weight called pensum hanging hangeth ballaunce commonly weyed wise speake commonly thing ye thing wayed called weight somtime thing weyed somtime ie thing heuy heuines assaied called weight also instrument thing weighed haue diuers name trutina double weyght lanx hanging wey gret weight humorous talent small balance weye small thing lyttle money ballance called statera hath name stando standing hee standeth euen weyed thing yt beareth vp middle lance thin brasen bolles one weight thing weighed weight rightfull ye bols hang eue weight alyke high tongue followeth heauie boll called momentum statere h gles ye ballance hangeth heuinesse bols ayed called filum saith euery weight hath certaine maner proper name isi saith least parte weight thereof arrow called obolus greeke saith scrupulus weyeth sixe huoles called dragma greek name scrupus diminitiue little stone dragma eight part vncia weyeth three penny siluer scrupulus eighteenth nowe followeth opinion saint augustine cornelius agrippa peter martir lodowicke lioide gentleman first saint augustine ninth booke confession peter martyr noteth fifth chapter vppon booke iudges folio driue awaye time seemeth meanes sharpe persecution godlye scattered abroade hadde leasure scarcelye praye much lesse sing tyrannye theyr persecutor monstrous time nero sonne domitius beeing yeare christ vntyll time constantine greate ye yere christ sayde godlye emperour constantine gaue greate large giftes yeerelye reuenewes maintenance ye cleargy preacher gospell wherevpon bishoppes rome fathereth theyr foundation head constantine good pollycye claime antiquitie verylye eternitie could discerne truth thus strange opinion persecution space yeares neere abouts musick laide side although augustine repented sorrie sometime fallen giuing attentiue heed vnto ye measure cord musicke word vnder spoken thing heereby proueth st e measure singing wer brought word sake word musicke condempneth musicke abuse allowing church alexandria wherein little singing c cause say hee consented ye musicke bee retained church yet manner yt sayd ready change sentence better reason could assigned added doe sin deadly wont speak giue greater heede musicke vnto word god seemeth yt none sencelesse wil haue bene sort rauished ye onely melodie instrument haue excepted forgetting theyr principall vertue ye true worshipping god haue bene dampnation common drunkard adulterer idolater false speaker viurers wicked thinking drinke minde god according desire soule poisoned gift god abused musicke seemeth ray men manner wholye reason plaine certeine pleasure onely fill outward sences others also perteine mind reason musicke delectation put middest sweetnesse sound moueth sences artificialnesse number proportion delighteth reason selfe happeneth chiefly word added vnto whose sence excellent learned c peter martir discourse whether singing may receiued church sayth east part holy assembly euen beginning vsed singing read commentarie folio corneli agrippa sixt booke vanitie science cap setteth forth abuse musicke discord ye supposed rest condempned verse curiouslye vnder tearmes part musicke enharmonica chromatica diatonica others nomination name among lacedemonians itting armes cretensians repetition word seeme great collection little matter fable musition onely vertue dorian tune sayth graue man modest honest valiant euer professed eerin shewed sole conceil forgot done vsed holy writ altogether flourishing among poet giuing open contempt poet secretly scorned declaring onely abuse sayth aegyptians forbid young men learne musicke suppose musicke common england euery alehouse baudy corner principall musicke anaxilas sayth musicke euen lyke affrike yeerely bringeth forth musicke socrates aelianus agesilaus atchitas mightie hercules c though contemne musick diogenes say profitable mend manner learne musicke manner concord honest intentes onelye adorned nothing vertue taught lacedemonians sound messena etd therwithall terrifie courage enimies musicke dolefull pleasant full harmonie melodie musicke terrible fearefull life courage read old age autenticall prophane vsed instrumentes sound sundrye sortes among lesio pipe among ye cretensians instrumentes string kinde gi ornes among parthian ringing bell among aethiopians lowd song among assirians kinde skipping among cambrian little drum made leather stretched whoope broad narrow hauing kind hollownesse put dry beanes pea make ye instrument cattle many vnaccustomed manner absurdest thing passeth abuse
